food.recipe: here's no greater joy than a perfectly cooked steak on the barbie. That is, until you’ve tried Texas beef brisket with slaw or a plate of balsamic-glazed pork ribs. Check out our slideshow for some great American barbecue recipes.
food.step 1: Coat pork generously with mustard, be sure to get down into the cuts in the fat. You may need to deepen the cuts to do so.
food.step 2: Mix all dry ingredients together in a suitably sized bowl. Rub the mix all over the pork - be sure to get it down into the cuts.
food.step 3: Pre-heat hooded bbq to 180 degrees C. Prepare whatever smoking woods you prefer on your BBQ; add that to a metal smoker box lined with a few layers of foil if you have one. If you do not have one - just make up a heavy pouch from several layers of aluminium foil, then prick 2 x small holes in it. Add on top of the burner or over the coals.
food.step 4: Insert a probe thermometer into the core of the meat and place the meat into the BBQ. Cook for the first 60 mins at 180 degrees C, then turn down to 120 degrees C.
food.step 5: As a rule of thumb BBQ for 2.5 - 3 hours per kilogram of meat.
food.step6: Once internal temperature of pork reaches 74 degrees C it is cooked. Remove from bbq - wrap in several layers of foil, then newspaper and place into an insulated cooler type box for 30 mins. This step adds extra tenderness - but I was starving and could not wait!
food.ingredients: 2 kg pork shoulder or leg roast
food.description: The meat is pulled or chopped into moist strands, dressed with some remaining "mop" (the vinegar-and-red-pepper basting sauce), and mixed with cracklings.

food.recipe: Complete this American pork chop meal with baked potato or mashed potatoes and corn on the cob
food.step 1: Combine the brown sugar, salt, pepper, allspice and thyme leaves in a small bowl. Rub both sides of pork chops with herb mixture. Let stand 15 to 30 minutes. Discard any remaining herb mixture.
food.step 2: Prepare a medium-hot fire in grill. Pat pork chops dry while being careful not to remove the rub. Grill chops, over direct heat, turning once, to medium
food.step 3: rare doneness about 4-5 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees Fahrenheit, followed by a 3-minute rest time.
food.serving: Yield: 4 servings Serving Size: 1 pork chop
food.time: Prep Time: 45 minutes Cook Time: 40 minutes
food.description: This fantastic grilled pork chop recipe is courtesy of pork – be inspired.

food.recipe: There are times when ‘quick cooking’ is required, and for this you need to call on the best cuts of meat. This American steak and sweet potato chips recipe uses T-bone steaks for maximum flavour and impact.
food.step 1: Heat the oven to 220°C/fan200°C/gas 7. Combine all the marinade ingredients in a large dish. Add the steaks and mix to coat in the marinade. Season well and set aside to marinate for at least 20 minutes.
food.step 2: Place the sweet potatoes in a roasting tin and toss with the cayenne pepper and vegetable oil. Season with sea salt and black pepper and roast in the hot oven for 30 minutes until golden and crisp.
food.step 3: Just before the chips are ready, heat a griddle pan or heavy-based frying pan until very hot. Add 1 steak, and cook for 2-3 minutes each side for medium rare. Set aside on a warm plate to rest while you cook the remaining steak, then serve with the sweet potato chips.
food.ingredient 2: 2 large sweet potatoes, cut into chips
food.description: This American steak and sweet potato chips recipe uses T-bone steaks for maximum flavour and impact.

food.recipe: These days you'll see Italians across the country practicing the art of aperitivo and the cocktails served being both traditional and modern.
food.step 1: Add a few ice cubes to a wine glass
food.step 2: pour in the Prosecco or sparkling wine
food.step 3: add the Aperol and the orange slice. Pour in a splash of soda, give it a brief stir, and serve immediately.
food.description: Aperitivo is northern Italy's version of happy hour, only instead of half-priced beers and a sketchy taco bar, light drinks and small plates carry the day.

food.recipe: Fill a shaker with ice cubes. Add all ingredients. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino berry.
food.step 1: Fill a shaker with ice cubes
food.step 2: Add all ingredients
food.step 3: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
food.step 4: Garnish with a maraschino berry.
food.description: Barbican is a brand of non-alcoholic malt drinks distributed by the Aujan Coca-Cola Beverages Company.

food.recipe: Skewer spiedini as directed, without adding sage and onion. Freeze unbaked spiedini in a single layer on a waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Once frozen, transfer to a freezer container and freeze for up to 1 month. To use frozen spiedini, thread sage and onion as directed. Bake at 375° for 13-15 minutes or until beef reaches desired doneness, turning once.
food.step 1: Thinly slice steak widthwise into 5-in. strips. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the marinade ingredients. Add beef; seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally.
food.step 2: Combine the bread crumbs, cheese, parsley, salt, garlic powder and pepper. Transfer half of the mixture to a shallow bowl; set aside. For filling, add marinara sauce to the remaining crumb mixture and mix well. Spread 1 teaspoon filling over each beef strip and roll up into pinwheels. Coat with reserved crumb mixture.
food.step 3: Cut onion into 1-in. pieces and separate into layers. Thread a piece of onion, a sage leaf and a beef pinwheel onto a soaked wooden appetizer skewer; repeat. Drizzle lightly with oil and place on a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
food.step 4: Broil 3-4 in. from heat for 5-7 minutes or until beef reaches desired doneness, turning once.
food.ingredients: 1 beef top sirloin steak (1 inch thick and 1-1/2 pounds)
food.restaurants: ["seven kitchens","mirchi and mime","the bombay canteen","farzi cafe","the wine rack","barbeque nation"]
food.description: Beef Spiedini. An Italian favorite, spiedini are great for holidays and other special occasions. The hearty skewers hold marinated steak pinwheels stuffed with a marinara-and-crumb filling.

food.recipe: Make these easy beef burritos for a simple midweek supper. The meat filling is also great stuffed into a crispy taco, or as an easy chilli con carne with rice
food.step 1: Heat the oil in a large pan – a casserole is ideal. Fry the onions for 8 mins, then add the garlic, spices and oregano and cook for 1 min. Crumble over the mince and sizzle for 5 mins, stirring, until browned. Stir in the sugar and leave for a minute, then splash in the vinegar and pour in the tomatoes.
food.step 2: Simmer for 5 mins then tip in the beans and the water from the can. Season, stir and simmer everything for 20 mins until the beef is in a thick gravy. The sauce can be prepared up to 2 days ahead, chilled and reheated with a splash of water or frozen for 6 months.
food.step 3: To make the burritos, heat the tortillas following pack instructions. Pile some rice and beef sauce along each tortilla and scatter over your choice of topping. Fold over the ends and roll up to seal. Secure by wrapping with foil if you want. Eat immediately
food.ingredient 6: small pinch of cayenne pepper (more if you want it spicier)
food.ingredient 10: 1 tbsp wine vinegar or cider vinegar
food.ingredient 12: 400g can black beans or kidney beans, with the can water
food.ingredient 14: 500g cooked rice, or our Mexican tomato rice (see recipe below right)
food.description: A burrito is a dish in Mexican and Tex-Mex cuisine consisting of a flour tortilla wrapped into a sealed cylindrical shape around various ingredients. The tortilla is sometimes lightly grilled or steamed to soften it, make it more pliable, and allow it to adhere to itself when wrapped.

food.recipe: Butter Chicken is one of the most popular curries at any Indian restaurant around the world. Aromatic golden chicken pieces in an incredible creamy curry sauce, this Butter Chicken recipe is one of the best you will try! You will love how easy it is to make in the comfort of your own home
food.step 1: Marinate the chicken: Bring the chicken and the rest of the marinade ingredients together in a large bowl. Using your hands, massage the marinade into the chicken.
food.step 2: Soak cashews and almonds in water for at least an hour to (or up to overnight) before preparing the rest of the recipe.
food.step 3: Cook the chicken: Heat a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Drizzle a teaspoon of oil to the pan.
food.step 4: Working in batches, remove chicken from the marinade and grill them on the pan for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, until the chicken is cooked through (clear juice runs out of it when you cut into it). Do not crowd the pan.
food.step 5: Start making the sauce: Melt 1 1/2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium sized Dutch oven or a skillet on medium low heat. As soon as the butter melts, add the ginger garlic paste followed by sugar. Sauté for 1 to 2 minutes.
food.step6: Stir in the tomato and cook for 8 to 10 minutes on medium high heat, until all the extra liquid is cooked off. The sauce should be a loose, paste-like consistency.
food.step7: Add coriander, garam masala, Kashmiri Lal Mirch, and salt. Stir and cook on medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off the heat.
food.step8: Puree the sauce with the nuts: Transfer the paste to a blender or the bowl of a food processor. Add the soaked cashews and almonds. Blend into a smooth paste.
food.step9: Finish the dish: Return the paste to the cooking pan over medium heat. Add the water to the paste and stir to make a smooth sauce.
food.step10: Rest the butter chicken: Turn off the heat and uncover the pan. Stir in the remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter and the kasuri methi. Cover again, and let the dish rest for 8 to 10 minutes so the flavor of kasuri methi can marry into the butter chicken.
food.step11: Serve: Serve the butter with a side of steamed basmati rice, roti, or naan. Leftovers will keep refrigerated, covered, for five days.
food.ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into roughly 1-inch cubes
food.restaurants: ["Butter Chicken Factory","Pal's Fish Corner","Goila Butter Chicken"]
food.description: Butter chicken or makhan murg is a dish, originating in the Indian subcontinent, of chicken in a mildly spiced tomato sauce

food.recipe: A delicious homemade Crema Catalana recipe, topped with fresh fruit!
food.step 1: Put the milk on the stove in a small saucepan, along with the citrus peels and the cinnamon stick. Slowly bring to a boil
food.step 2: Dissolve the cornstarch in a splash of water and set aside.
food.step 3: While the milk is slowly heating, beat the egg yolks with the sugar, until the mixture turns pale yellow. Beat in the dissolved cornstarch and a spoonful of the hot milk.
food.step 4: Remove the citrus peels and cinnamon stick from the hot milk, and lower the heat.
food.step 5: Slowly add the egg yolk mixture to the milk, making sure to keep stirring so that the eggs don't scramble!
food.step6: Stir constantly over a low heat, until the mixture has thickened.
food.step7: Remove from the heat and pour the mixture into traditional clay dishes or ramekins.
food.step8: Allow the custard to cool, and then cover in plastic wrap and chill the crema catalanas for about four hours (preferably overnight).
food.step9: Before serving, I like to let mine come to room temperature (unless it's summer-- that would be too hot!). Then sprinkle a thin layer of sugar on top of each ramekin. Spread the sugar out by tilting the ramekins in all directions. Caramelize with a small kitchen blowtorch (though the truly authentic crema catalanas are made with a hot iron (see photo below).
food.ingredient 3: A big slice of peel from a lemon and an orange (note: not the zest, but rather big slices of the peel)
food.ingredient 5: ½ cup superfine sugar (if you can't find superfine, don't worry, it'll just be a bit more grainy)
food.ingredient 6: Additional sugar to caramelize on top
food.ingredient 7: Fresh fruit (like figs, raspberries or strawberries) to top
food.restaurants: ["Terttulia","smoke house deli","the fatty bao","1 bhk brew house kitchen","hakkasan","indigo delhicattesen"]
food.description: In Catalan cuisine, crema catalana or crema cremada, is a dish that is similar to a crème brûlée; the desserts have been called "virtually identical".

food.recipe: Many beginner bakers are SHOCKED at how easy creme brûlée is! Only 6 ingredients required and if you follow my success tips, you’ll be gifted with the smoothest, creamiest dessert ever.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C).
food.step 2: Whisk the egg yolks and 1/2 cup (100g) of granulated sugar together. Set aside. (At this point or before you temper the egg yolks in the next step, bring a small kettle or pot of water to a boil. You’ll need hot water to pour into the baking sheet for the water bath.)
food.step 3: Heat the heavy cream, espresso powder, and salt together in a medium saucepan over medium heat. As soon as it begins to simmer, remove from heat. Stir in the vanilla extract. Remove about 1/2 cup of warm heavy cream and, in a slow and steady stream, whisk into the egg yolks. Keep those egg yolks moving so they don’t scramble. In a slow and steady stream, pour and whisk the egg yolk mixture into the warm heavy cream.
food.step 4: Place ramekins in a large baking pan. Divide custard between each, filling to the top. Carefully fill the pan with about a 1/2 inch of the hot water. The baking pan will be hot so use an oven mitt to carefully transfer the pan to the oven.
food.step 5: Bake until the edges are set and centers are a little jiggly. The time depends on the depth of your ramekins. My ramekins are 1-inch and the custard takes 35 minutes. Begin checking them at 30 minutes. For a more accurate sign, they’re done when an instant read thermometer registers 170°F (77°C).
food.step6: Remove pan from the oven and, using an oven mitt, remove the ramekins from the pan. Place on a wire rack to cool for at least 1 hour. Place in the refrigerator, loosely covered, and chill for at least 4 hours and up to 2 days before topping.
food.step7: Using the remaining granulated sugar, sprinkle a thin layer all over the surface of the chilled custards. Caramelize the sugar with a kitchen torch and serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 1 hour before serving. (Caramelized topping is best enjoyed right away.)
food.ingredient 3: 3 cups (720ml) heavy cream or heavy whipping cream*
food.restaurants: ["Terttulia'","'Smoke House Deli'","'The Fatty Bao'","'1 BHK - Brew House Kitchen"]
food.description: Crème brûlée, also known as burnt cream, Trinity cream, or crema catalana, is a dessert consisting of a rich custard base topped with a texturally contrasting layer of hardened caramelized sugar.

food.recipe: Dorayaki is one of the most popular Japanese confectioneries.  It is Anko (sweet red bean paste) sandwiched between sweet pancakes.  It is a Japanese sweet beloved by the old and young
food.step 1: Mix flour and baking soda in a bowl.
food.step 2: In another bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, and honey together. Add milk and mix well.
food.step 3: Stir dry ingredients into egg mixture, and whisk until batter becomes smooth.
food.step 4: Heat non-stick frying pan with a small amount of oil and wipe excess oil well. At medium low heat, drop 1/8 of a cup of batter onto the pan, like a pancake. Cook about 2 minutes until the surface of the pancake has a lot of bubbles and the edges become dry. Flip over and cook 1 more minute.
food.step 5: Transfer to a plate and cover with a wet paper towel.
food.step6: Take one cake and place a heaping tablespoon of Anko and cover with another cake. Wrap it with plastic and press with hands. Pinch to seal the edges of the pancakes together.
food.description: A traditional dim sum brunch includes various types of steamed buns such as cha siu bao (a steamed bun filled with barbecue pork), rice or wheat dumplings and rice noodle rolls, which contain a range of ingredients, including beef, chicken, pork, prawns, and vegetarian options.

food.recipe: Good tasting, simple recipe for New England's favorite dish fish and chips. Serve with malt vinegar, lemon, or tartar sauce.
food.step 1: Place potatoes in a medium-size bowl of cold water. In a separate medium-size mixing bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Stir in the milk and egg; stir until the mixture is smooth. Let mixture stand for 20 minutes.
food.step 2: Preheat the oil in a large pot or electric skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
food.step 3: Fry the potatoes in the hot oil until they are tender. Drain them on paper towels.
food.step 4: Dredge the fish in the batter, one piece at a time, and place them in the hot oil. Fry until the fish is golden brown. If necessary, increase the heat to maintain the 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) temperature. Drain well on paper towels.
food.step 5: Fry the potatoes again for 1 to 2 minutes for added crispness
food.ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into strips
food.description: Fish and chips is a hot dish consisting of fried fish in batter served with chips. The dish originated in England and is an example of culinary fusion of its two main ingredients, each brought by immigrants.

food.food_item: Grilled Sweet Potatoes with Gorgonzola Spread
food.recipe: Grilled Sweet Potatoes with Gorgonzola Spread Recipe photo by Taste of Home
food.step 1: Scrub and pierce sweet potatoes with a fork; place on a microwave-safe plate. Microwave, uncovered, on high just until tender, turning once, 6-8 minutes.
food.step 2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Refrigerate until serving.
food.step 3: Slice potatoes into 1/2-in.-thick rounds; brush both sides with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat on each side until browned, 4-5 minutes. Serve with spread. If desired, sprinkle with chives.
food.description: Grilled sweet potatoes with a Gorgonzola cheese and mayo dip

food.recipe: You can make this avocado salad smooth or chunky depending on your tastes.
food.step 1: In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt. Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic. Stir in cayenne pepper. Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately
food.ingredients: 3 avocado, NS as to Florida or Californias avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed
food.description: Guacamole is an avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed in Mexico and is usually paired with tortilla chips

food.recipe: an easy and tasty indo chinese recipe made with finely chopped vegetables and chinese sauces. it is perhaps one of the sought after appetizer recipe, which is typically served just before the meal but can be served as a light meal for lunch and dinner. the manchow recipe can be made with different ingredients and sauces, but this recipe sticks to the basic healthy vegetable-based soup recipe.
food.step 1: firstly, in a large vessel take 4 cup water, 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp oil.
food.step 2: once the water comes to a boil, break in 1 pack hakka noodles.
food.step 3: boil for 5 minutes or refer package instructions to know the cooking time.
food.step 4: cook until the noodles turn al dente without overcooking.
food.step 5: drain off the noodles and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process.
food.step6: now add 1 tsp cornflour and mix gently.
food.step7: deep fry in hot oil by spreading noodles uniformly.
food.step8: stir occasionally, keeping the flame on medium.
food.step9: flip over and fry both sides until the noodles turn crisp.
food.step10: finally, drain off the crispy noodles and keep aside.
food.ingredient 10: 2 chilli, finely chopped2 chilli, finely chopped
food.ingredient 16: 2 tbsp soy sauce2 tbsp soy sauce
food.description: Manchow soup is a soup popular in Indian Chinese cuisine due to its easy preparation and hot spicy taste. It is available in many restaurants and street food carts alike. Although the soup is named after Manchuria it does not resemble any that is normally found in the cuisines of the region.

food.recipe: a popular mawa or khoya based cake recipe, filled with mawa flavour and dry fruits topping. it is generally served as a snack with evening tea or as a morning breakfast. it is very filling with mild sweetness and makes a perfect combo with cup of tea or coffee.
food.step 1: firstly, take ½ cup (120 gm) butter and 1 cup (150 gm) powdered sugar.
food.step 2: beat smooth and fluffy.
food.step 3: sieve 1½ cup (240 gm) maida, 1 tsp baking powder and ¼ tsp baking soda.
food.step 4: mix well using cut and fold method.
food.step 5: now add ¼ cup (60 ml) curd and ¾ cup (190 ml) milk.
food.step6: mix well using cut and fold method.
food.step7: now crumble the prepared mawa and add to cake batter.
food.step8: bake the cake at 180 degree celsius or 356 degrees fahrenheit for 60 minutes.
food.step9: finally, serve eggless mawa cake or refrigerate and enjoy for a week
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup milk powder½ cup milk powder
food.ingredient 4: ½ cup (120 gm) butter½ cup (120 gm) butter
food.ingredient 7: 1 tsp baking powder1 tsp baking powder
food.ingredient 8: ¼ tsp baking soda¼ tsp baking soda
food.ingredient 9: ¼ cup (60 ml) curd / yogurt, fresh
food.ingredient 10: ¾ cup (190 ml) milk¾ cup (190 ml) milk
food.description: Mawa Cake is a cake with an Indian touch. It is made using ingredients commonly used in Indian sweets like mawa (also known as khoya), saffron and cardamom. The cake is popular in Parsi/Irani bakery shops in Mumbai and Pune. It is made from mawa which is nothing but dried whole milk.

food.recipe: Miguelitos de la Roda are a light and flaky pastry with cream filling. This delicious dessert was invented in La Roda in the Spanish province of Albacete.
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: Heat oven to 400 F (200 C).
food.step 3: Thaw the puff pastry for approximately 20 minutes. Be sure that you do not allow the pastry to warm up or it will be too difficult to work with. It should still be cold.
food.step 4: Sprinkle a few tablespoons of flour on a board or marble.
food.step 5: Using a rolling pin, roll it out to extend the pastry.
food.step6: Using a very sharp knife, cut the pastry into squares about 2 inches (4 centimeters) wide.
food.step7: Place pastry squares on a cookie sheet.
food.step8: Beat the egg and brush each square using a pastry brush.
food.step9: Bake on the center rack for 10 to 12 minutes or until pastry is browned on top and crispy. Remove and allow to cool.
food.description: Miguelitos are a type of cream filled puff pastry, which can also be referred to as a cake.

food.recipe: Mizu Yokan is a traditional Japanese dessert, or wagashi, as it is known in Japanese cuisine. Yokan is a general term which refers to this jelly dessert made of red azuki beans, agar, and sugar.
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: Prepare the gelatin mixture: In a large bowl, soak the dried kanten (agar agar) stick in water for one hour or until softened.
food.step 3: Remove kanten from water and squeeze the softened kanten to remove excess water.
food.step 4: Using your hands, tear the kanten into small pieces.
food.step 5: In a medium pan, add the kanten pieces or kanten powder with 1 1/4 cup of water and bring to a boil, making sure to stir constantly. Turn down the heat to low. Simmer until the kanten dissolves completely. All the while, make sure to stir the kanten and water.
food.step6: Next, add sugar and stir well.
food.step7: Add pre-made sweet red bean paste (anko or koshian). Stir constantly, making sure the bean paste is diluted in the agar agar and water mixture. Continue to simmer until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat.
food.step8: Pour the mixture into a shallow rectangular plastic container. Allow it to cool to room temperature and then store in the refrigerator to chill. The mizu yokan should become firm.
food.ingredients: 1 stick dried kanten (agar agar), or 2 teaspoons kanten (vegan gelatin) powder
food.ingredient 5: 3/4 pound/1 1/2 cup anko (sweet azuki red bean paste)
food.description: Yōkan is a thick, jellied Japanese dessert made of red bean paste, agar, and sugar. It is usually sold in a block form, and eaten in slices.

food.recipe: Tickle your tastebuds and warm your insides with this easy mizutaki chicken hot pot recipe. Mizutaki is a nabe-style hot pot dish of chicken and assorted vegetables that is boiled in a large pot filled with dashi broth. Like other nabe dishes, mizutaki is typically prepared communally, at the table, with an electric cooker. We recommend you enjoy this warming dish during the colder winter months.
food.step 1: Start by cutting up the chicken into small bite-size pieces. Slice the tofu into small cubes. Slice up the cabbage into bite-size pieces.  Remove the stems from the shiitake mushrooms. Cut the leek and carrots into thin rounds.
food.step 2: Mix the sachet konbu kelp dashi soup stock powder with 1L hot water and taste the dashi.
food.step 3: Start heating the dashi soup stock on the stove and add the chicken. Remove any foam or impurities that rise to the surface of the liquid. Turn the heat down after boiling and allow the chicken to simmer.
food.step 4: Add the other ingredients to the pot and simmer them until soft and fully cooked. In separate small serving bowls, add a little ponzu sauce and then dip the cooked ingredients in the ponzu before eating. Add some perilla leaves if you would like before serving.
food.ingredient 8: 1 sachet konbu kelp dashi soup stock
food.ingredient 9: ponzu citrus seasoned soy sauce dipping sauce, to taste
food.description: Mizutaki is a Japanese Chicken Hot Pot in which chicken, assorted vegetables, mushrooms, and tofu are cooked in a light kombu dashi broth.

food.recipe: Pani puri is a popular street food of India, where crisp fried dough balls (puri) are stuffed with potatoes, sprouts, spicy tangy water or sweet chutney.
food.step 1: Boil the potatoes till they are cooked completely.
food.step 2: Peel them and then chop them.
food.step 3: Finely chop the onion if using it.
food.step 4: In a small bowl, mix the potatoes, onions, coriander leaves, cumin powder, chaat masala powder and black salt or regular salt. Mix well and keep aside.
food.step 5: In a blender add all the ingredients mentioned above for the pani.
food.step6: Add water and grind to a fine chutney.
food.step7: Remove the green chutney in a large bowl. Rinse the mixer jar with ½ cup water first and then add this water in the bowl. Then add ½ to ¾ cup more water.
food.step8: Mix well. Check the seasoning. Add more salt or jeera powder or chaat masala or jaggery if required. If you want a thin pani, you could add some water. But keep on checking the seasoning, as per your taste.
food.step9: Add the boondi to the pani.
food.step10: You can chill the pani in the fridge or add some ice cubes to it.
food.step11: Crack the top of the puri with a spoon.
food.step12: Add 2 to 3 teaspoons of the boiled potato-onion filling in the poori.
food.step13: Stir the green pani first and then add it in the poori. Optionally you can add some sweet chutney in the puri.
food.ingredient 6: ½ cup tightly packed chopped mint leaves
food.ingredient 7: 1 cup tightly packed chopped coriander leaves
food.ingredient 9: 2 to 3 green chilies, , chopped (for a less spicy pani, add about 1 green chili)
food.ingredient 10: 1 tablespoon tightly packed tamarind1 tablespoon tightly packed tamarind
food.ingredient 11: 3.5 to 4 tablespoons grated or powdered jaggery or sugar or add as required or 1.5 tablespoons chopped seedless dates & 1.5 tablespoons powdered jaggery, the sweetness can be adjusted as per your taste
food.ingredient 15: 1 to 1.25 cups water to be added later, add water as per the consistency you want
food.ingredient 16: 1 to 1.5 tablespoons boondi (fried tiny gram flour balls), optional
food.ingredient 17: black salt or regular salt as required
food.description: Panipuri or Phuchka is a type of snack that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It consists of a round, hollow puri, filled with a mixture of flavored water, tamarind chutney, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion or chickpeas

food.recipe: roasted in a hot oven until they’re golden brown, caramelized, sweet, and tender, all while intensifying the natural (and unique!) flavor of parsnips.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 425F.
food.step 2: Preheat the oven to 425F.
food.step 3: Place in a large bowl and toss with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
food.step 4: Evenly distribute the parsnips on a baking sheet in a single layer, making sure they have a little room on the sides to brown and caramelize.
food.step 5: Roast for about 20-25 minutes, until the parsnips are starting to turn golden brown on the edges. Toss the parsnips to redistribute, then roast for another 10-15 minutes, until tender and golden.
food.step6: Serve warm and enjoy!
food.description: Roasted parsnips which are usually paired with dips, mayo or ketchup

food.recipe: Roscon de Reyes is a traditional dessert, served the night before or the morning of Reyes or Epiphany on Jan. 6. Dia de Reyes or simply Reyes is the day when children in Spain receive gifts from the Reyes Magos–Wise Men or Magi—the three kings who brought baby Jesus gift
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients
food.step 2: Sift flour and salt together in a large mixing bowl. Make a hole in the center of the flour.
food.step 3: In a small mixing bowl, stir and dissolve the dry yeast in the lukewarm milk mixed with the lukewarm water.
food.step 4: Once dissolved, pour the dissolved yeast into the center of the flour. Stir in just enough flour from around the sides of the bowl to make a thick batter.
food.step 5: With your hand, grab about a teaspoon of the flour from the side of the bowl and sprinkle it over the top of the batter.
food.step6: Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel and leave in a warm place, away from any draft. Allow batter to turn spongy, about 15 minutes.
food.step7: In a medium-size mixing bowl, use a hand mixer or whisk to beat together the butter and sugar. The mixture should be smooth and creamy. Set aside.
food.step8: Add grated orange and lemon rinds, eggs, brandy and water to the bowl with the flour mixture. Mix well. The dough will be sticky.
food.step9: Beat flour mixture until it is elastic and smooth. Beat in the reserved butter-sugar mixture and mix until the dough is smooth. The dough should be formed into a ball, then covered with oiled plastic wrap.
food.step10: Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel and leave it again in a warm place and allow to rise until doubled in size. This will take approximately 1 1/2 hours.
food.step11: While you are waiting for the dough to rise, grease a large baking sheet with vegetable shortening and set aside for later use. If you will use a baking stone, no need to grease it.
food.step12: Once the dough has doubled, remove the plastic wrap and punch down dough. Lightly flour a clean counter or cutting board and place dough on it.
food.ingredient 4: 1/3 cup lukewarm milk (mixed with 1/3 cup lukewarm water)
food.time: Bake for 30 minutes or until golden
food.description: Roscón de reyes or rosca de reyes is a Latin pastry traditionally eaten to celebrate Epiphany throughout Ibero America, originally from Spain it is more commonly associated and celebrated in Mexico and Mexican diaspora throughout the world, as well as throughout the Hispanic world.

food.recipe: In a small bowl, combine the bread crumbs with 2 tablespoons of the melted butter, Parmesan, 1 tablespoon chopped parsley and the pepper and set aside.
food.step 1: Debeard and clean the exterior of the mussel shells very well (they will be used later for service).
food.step 2: Debeard and clean the exterior of the mussel shells very well (they will be used later for service).
food.step 3: Remove the mussels from the pot, discarding any that did not open, and when cool enough to handle, remove the flesh and chop. Rinse the shells and put aside for service. Strain the liquid from the pot and reserve. Wipe the Dutch oven clean with a paper towel.
food.step 4: Place the pot over medium-high heat, add the remaining olive oil and, when shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers and saute until the onions are just starting to caramelize, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the serrano, the remaining garlic and the tomatoes and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
food.step 5: Add the butter and the flour. Once the butter melts, slowly incorporate the milk. Add the reserved cooking liquid from the mussels, a little at a time, until the mixture is creamy but not runny. Add the chopped mussels and gradually add 1 cup panko, as needed, and stir gently to combine.
food.step6: Preheat the oven to broil and adjust the rack to 6 inches below the element.
food.step7: Spread the rock salt evenly in an ovenproof serving platter. Fill the mussel shells with 2 to 3 tablespoons of the mussel-vegetable mixture. Place the remaining cup of panko in a shallow bowl or plate and spread out. Gently roll the filled shells in the panko. Nest the filled mussels into the rock salt on the prepared platter. Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper, place under the broiler and broil until golden brown and bubbly, 2 to 3 minutes, watching carefully to avoid burning.
food.step8: Sprinkle with the chopped Italian parsley, squeeze a few lemon wedges over the mussels and garnish with remaining lemon wedges and serve immediately.
food.ingredients: 2 pounds medium fresh mussels, scrubbed and de-bearded, preferably Green Lipped
food.ingredient 5: 1/2 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc
food.ingredient 8: 1 cup finely diced red bell peppers
food.ingredient 10: 1 1/2 cups seeded and finely diced Roma tomatoes (about 4)
food.ingredient 13: 1/2 cup whole milk, at room temperature
food.ingredient 19: 2 tablespoons Italian flat-leaf parsley, for garnish
food.ingredient 20: 1 lemon, cut in wedges, for garnish
food.restaurants: ["mahesh lunch home'","'gajalee'","'ronalodo's family restaurants'","'somethings fishy restaurants"]
food.description: Stuffed mussels is a generic name for meals made of plump orange mussels, herbed and spiced rice, pine nuts, and occasionally currants. It is a popular and common street food in Istanbul, and Izmir, in Turkey, owing to their coastal nature

food.recipe: The tang yuan dough recipe makes about one dozen sesame balls (four servings). The filling recipe makes about four dozen. You can store leftover filling in the refrigerator––it will be good for a month or two, and you can make more dough whenever you want to enjoy them fresh.
food.step 1: In a food processor or blender, finely grind the sesame seeds. Add the caster sugar and use a spatula to mix together in the food processor a bit
food.step 2: Then add the butter and pulse for 10 seconds at a time until the mixture is well combined.
food.step 3: Scoop everything out into a bowl and put in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
food.step 4: The purpose of this cooling process is to harden the mixture slightly for easy handling later.
food.step 5: While the filling is cooling, make the dough. Put the sweet rice flour into a mixing bowl. Slowly add in the warm water, while stirring to form a dough. The dough can’t be too wet, or it will not hold its shape. Cover with a damp towel.
food.step6: Now boil some water in a small pot, take out a small piece of the dough, about 1” in diameter. Add it to the boiling water and cook the piece of dough until it floats. Scoop it out and add it to the rest of the dough. Mix the two parts together until the dough is soft and smooth.
food.step7: Divide the dough into 12 equal pieces (about 18 grams each, if you want to be really exacting), and roll them into balls. Keep the dough and dough balls covered with a damp paper towel while assembling.
food.step8: Take out the filling after it’s cooled for 30 minutes. It should be slightly hard, but still workable. Roll the tang yuan filling into small marble-sized balls, about 4 to 5 grams each.
food.ingredient 4: 1 cup + more for dusting sweet rice flour, also known as glutinous rice flour
food.serving: Servings: 3 Making around 12 middle size Tang Yuan
food.description: Tangyuan or tang yuan is a Chinese dessert that is a ball of glutinous rice flour and water that has been either boiled and served in a hot broth or syrup or else deep-fried. Tangyuan can be either small or large and filled or unfilled.

food.recipe: Delicious Japanese teppanyaki fried rice with the option to add carrots, peas, onion, or even make it into tasty chicken fried rice.
food.step 1: Preheat griddle to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
food.step 2: If adding carrots, peas, or onion to fried rice, cook for 3-4 minutes on griddle with 1 teaspoon vegetable oil per half cup of vegetables until they begin to soften. Set aside.
food.step 3: If adding chicken, dice chicken into 1/2″ cubes, pat diced chicken dry with paper towel, and season with salt & pepper. Add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to hot griddle and add chicken. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Set aside.
food.step 4: Scramble eggs and cook on lightly greased griddle. Continue stirring until cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
food.step 5: Melt butter on griddle and add rice. Stir to mix with melted butter. Drizzle soy sauce over rice and add garlic salt, mix well. Add scrambled eggs (and vegetables and/or chicken if desired) and blend.
food.ingredient 5: 2 Green Onion Stalks, sliced for topping
food.description: Glutinous rice, known in Japan as mochigome (もち米), is used for making mochi (餅) and special dishes such as sekihan. It is a short-grain rice, and can be distinguished from uruchimai by its particularly short, round, opaque grains, its greater stickiness when cooked, and firmer and chewier texture.

food.recipe: This is a holiday drink that my family enjoys in the winter. The batter makes an excellent topping for both alcoholic beverages as well as hot cocoa, eggnog, or warm milk for the kids.
food.step 1: Beat egg whites and salt until foamy in a large glass or metal mixing bowl until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites should form a sharp peak that holds its shape.
food.step 2: Beat the egg yolks to soft peaks in a separate bowl. Beat the butter and confectioners' sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks and vanilla to the butter mixture; mix. Stir in the nutmeg, cloves, allspice, and the egg whites; beat until well blended. Batter can be frozen or kept in refrigerator for several weeks.
food.step 3: To make a Tom and Jerry, fill a cup of hot water with spiced rum or brandy, warm milk, hot cocoa, or eggnog and stir in 1 heaping tablespoon of batter.
food.description: A Tom and Jerry is a traditional Christmas time cocktail in the United States, and is a variant of eggnog with brandy and rum added and served hot, usually in a mug or a bowl.

food.recipe: Homemade pico de gallo is the best! Chopped fresh tomatoes, chile peppers, red onion, cilantro, and lime are meant to be consumed fresh—it's called salsa fresca, for a reason.
food.step 1: Prep the ingredients: Roughly chop the tomatoes, chiles, and onions. Be careful while handling the chile peppers. Use a plastic baggie or disposable gloves to handle them, or wash your hands thoroughly with soap and hot water after handling and avoid touching your eyes for several hours.
food.step 2: Set aside some of the seeds from the peppers. If the salsa isn't hot enough, you can add a few for more heat.
food.step 3: Make the salsa: Place all of the ingredients in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade. Pulse only a few times, just enough to finely dice the ingredients and not enough to purée. If you don't have a food processor, you can finely dice by hand.
food.step 4: Adjust seasonings: Place in a serving bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. If the chilies make the salsa too hot, add some more chopped tomato. If it's not hot enough, carefully add a few of the seeds from the chilies, or add a little more ground cumin.
food.step 5: Let the salsa sit for an hour (room temperature or chilled) for the flavors to combine.
food.step6: erve with chips, tortillas, tacos, burritos, tostadas, quesadillas, pinto or black beans. The salsa will keep refrigerated for up to 5 days.
food.ingredients: 2 to 3 medium sized fresh tomatoes (1 to 1 1/2 pounds), stems removed
food.ingredient 3: 2 serrano chiles or 1 jalapeño chile (stems, ribs, seeds removed), less or more to taste
food.ingredient 7: Pinch dried oregano (crumble in your fingers before adding), more to taste
food.ingredient 8: Pinch ground cumin, more to taste
food.description: Lime juice, onions, and tomatoes are all rich sources of the antioxidant vitamin C. Vitamin C helps prevent heart disease and promotes healthy aging. ... But salsa is often served raw, which is especially helpful for absorption of vitamin C.

food.recipe: In a nonstick skillet, cook Canadian bacon over medium-high heat 1-2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Remove and keep warm.
food.step 1: Place 4 of the waffles on a work surface. Spread one side of each with the mustard (if using).
food.step 2: Top with the ham, cheese, and the remaining waffles. Spread the top of each sandwich with 1/2 tablespoon of the butter
food.step 3: Melt the remaining butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Place the sandwiches in the skillet, buttered-side up.
food.step 4: Cook, pressing occasionally with the back of a spatula, until the cheese melts and the waffles are golden, 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
food.description: Tostada is a Spanish word meaning "toasted". In Mexico and other parts of Latin America, it is the name of various local dishes which are toasted or use a toasted ingredient as the main base of their preparation. Tostada usually refers to a flat or bowl-shaped tortilla that is deep fried or toasted.

food.recipe: This is a classic and easy whoopie pies recipe. It is made of soft, moist chocolate round cakes sandwiched with a sweet, creamy, fluffy filling.
food.step 1: Prepare oven and baking sheets: Set over racks in upper and lower third of the oven and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 18 by 13-inch baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside.
food.step 2: Prepare oven and baking sheets: Set over racks in upper and lower third of the oven and preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 18 by 13-inch baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside.
food.step 3: Mix wet ingredients: In a large mixing bowl using an electric hand mixer or in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment mix together brown sugar, buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg and vanilla extract until well blended.
food.step 4: Blend wet and dry mixtures: Add flour mixture and mix just until combined, then pour in hot water and mix just until combined.
food.step 5: Drop batter onto prepared baking sheets: Scoop batter out using a medium cookie scoop or 1 1/2 Tbsp at a time, and drop onto prepared baking sheets, spacing 2-inches apart.
food.step6: Bake until set: Bake first two sheets at a once, rotating sheets halfway through baking, until cookies spring back when touched or toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 8 – 10 minutes total.
food.step7: Bake until set: Bake first two sheets at a once, rotating sheets halfway through baking, until cookies spring back when touched or toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 8 – 10 minutes total.
food.ingredients: All-purpose flour – I recommend using unbleached flour but the standard bleached all-purpose flour will work as well.
food.ingredient 2: Unsweetened cocoa powder – use good quality cocoa for the best tasting cookies.
food.ingredient 3: Baking soda – this helps the cookies rise. Use baking soda that hasn’t expired so ensure it works properly.
food.ingredient 4: Salt – this will keep the cookies from tasting flat, don’t forget it!
food.ingredient 5: Light brown sugar – in a pinch you can make your own brown sugar. To do measure out 1 cup white sugar, omit 1 Tbsp and replace with 1 Tbsp molasses, mix well.
food.ingredient 6: Buttermilk – don’t keep buttermilk on hand? You can make your own just mix 1/2 cup milk with 1 1/2 tsp vinegar or lemon juice. Rest 5 minutes.
food.ingredient 7: Vegetable oil – canola oil will work fine too.
food.ingredient 8: Egg – the egg helps bind the ingredients together, but if there is an allergy you can check these substitutes here.
food.ingredient 9: Egg – the egg helps bind the ingredients together, but if there is an allergy you can check these substitutes here.
food.ingredient 10: Hot water – just hot from the tap is fine no need to heat.
food.description: The whoopie pie is an American baked product that may be considered either a cookie, pie, sandwich, or cake. It is made of two round mound-shaped pieces of usually chocolate cake, or sometimes pumpkin, gingerbread or other flavored cakes, with a sweet, creamy filling or frosting sandwiched between them.

food.recipe: Thanks to the lunar calendar, the date of the annual Mid-Autumn Festival changes year-to-year, but it always hovers around mid-September to early October. This year’s Mid-Autumn Festival is on October 4, which means…it’s time for a mooncake recipe!
food.step 1: Mix sugar syrup, alkaline water and peanut oil together thoroughly
food.step 2: Sift all purpose flour in a large bowl, make a well in the center and pour in the sugar syrup mixture. Using a rubber spatula to mix and form to a soft dough.
food.step 3: Cover the dough using cling wrap then set it aside in the fridge for at least an hour or overnight before using.
food.step 4: After one hour, remove the dough from fridge. Lightly dust some flour on table and knead dough again till smooth. Measure dough to about 70g and roll it into a ball.  Make 9 balls. I used balance of dough to make mooncake biscuits.
food.ingredients: 450g low protein flour (pau flour/cake flour/all purpose flour)
food.ingredient 2: 280g homemade golden syrup (click here for recipe)
food.restaurants: ["Pritam Da Dhaba","Angrezi Dhaba","Tamasha","Gallops","Persian Darbar","Lucky Restaurant","3 Wise Monkeys","Sindhful","Light Of Bharat","BKC DIVE","Oheka"]
food.description: A mooncake is a Chinese bakery product traditionally eaten during the Mid-Autumn Festival. The festival is about lunar appreciation and Moon watching, and mooncakes are regarded as an indispensable delicacy. Mooncakes are offered between friends or on family gatherings while celebrating the festival.

food.recipe: This Punjabi style aloo matar is a simple and home style recipe of Punjabi peas and potatoes curry.
food.step 1: Take ½ cup chopped onion, 1 cup chopped tomatoes, ½ inch ginger (chopped) and 3 to 4 garlic (chopped) in a grinder or blender jar.
food.step 2: Without adding any water, grind or blend to a smooth paste
food.step 3: Keep this ground paste aside.
food.step 4: Heat oil in a pot or pressure cooker. First crackle the cumin seeds. Then add the ground onion-tomato paste.
food.step 5: Stir and then add the ground almond/cashew powder or malai (cream).
food.step6: Saute the ground paste till the oil releases from the sides. The masala paste will also thicken. The mixture splutters. So do cover partly with a lid. Once the mixture stops spluttering, then remove the lid and saute.
food.step7: Then add the asafoetida powder, red chilli powder and turmeric powder.
food.step8: Stir and then add the peas and potatoes. Saute for a minute. Add water and salt.
food.step9: Stir well and cover the pot. Simmer till the potatoes and peas are cooked well. If pressure cooking then add 1 cup water and pressure cook for 2 to 3 whistles till the potatoes & peas are cooked completely.
food.step10: Lastly sprinkle punjabi garam masala powder or garam masala powder and stir.
food.step11: Then add 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves (cilantro leaves).
food.step12: Stir well and serve aloo matar hot with pooris, chapatis or rice.
food.ingredients: 1 medium onion or 80 grams or ½ cup chopped onions
food.ingredient 2: 2 medium to large tomatoes or 150 grams or 1 cup chopped tomatoes
food.ingredient 7: 1 to 2 tablespoon fresh malai or low fat cream or almond or cashew powder (optional)
food.ingredient 8: 250 grams potaotes or 3 medium or 2 large potatoes - peeled and diced
food.ingredient 9: 1 cup green peas - fresh or frozen
food.ingredient 11: ½ teaspoon red chili powder or as required
food.ingredient 13: ½ teaspoon garam masala powder or as required
food.restaurants: ["shree gangour sweets","chandu halwai grant road","m n mithaiwala","punjabi sweet house and restaurants","adarsh mithai mandir","vyanjan","tharu sweets","sindhu sweets","jhama sweets ghatkopar east"]
food.description: Aloo mutter is a Punjabi dish from the Indian subcontinent which is made from potatoes and peas in a spiced creamy tomato based sauce. It is a vegetarian dish. The sauce is generally cooked with garlic, ginger, onion, tomatoes, cilantro, cumin seeds and other spices.

food.recipe: This all-American chili recipe is perfect for an outdoor cookout but can also be made on the stove for a comfort classic on a cold day.
food.step 1: Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Remove casings from sausage. Add sausage, onion, and the next 4 ingredients (onion through jalapeño) to pan; cook 8 minutes or until sausage and beef are browned, stirring to crumble.
food.step 2: Add chili powder and the next 7 ingredients (chili powder through bay leaves), and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in wine, tomatoes, and kidney beans; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
food.step 3: Uncover and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard the bay leaves. Sprinkle each serving with cheddar cheese.
food.step 4: Note: Like most chilis, this version tastes even better the next day.
food.ingredient 15: 1 1/4 cups Merlot or other fruity red wine
food.ingredient 16: 2 (28-ounce) cans no-salt-added whole tomatoes, undrained and coarsely chopped
food.ingredient 18: 1/2 cup (2 ounces) shredded reduced-fat sharp cheddar cheese
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: A bowl of warm chili is satisfying comfort food on a cold day. For informal get-togethers, serve in a slow cooker to keep it warm.

food.recipe: balushahi is a famous North Indian sweet. In south India, the same sweet is called as badusha or badhusha. In all miThai shops you can easily get balushahi or badusha
food.step 1: Take ¼ cup ghee in a bowl.
food.step 2: With a spoon or spatula or a small wired whisk, beat the ghee till it is smooth, light and fluffy. Its color will also lighten.
food.step 3: Add ¼ cup chilled fresh curd (dahi).
food.step 4: Again with a spoon or spatula or a small wired whisk, mix and whip the curd with the creamed ghee.
food.step 5: Cream till light and smoothCream till light and smooth
food.step6: Now using a sieve, take 2 cups maida (all purpose flour) in it. Place it on the bowl itself. You can also sift the flour separately in a plate or tray.
food.step7: Add 1 pinch salt, 1 pinch baking soda and ½ teaspoon baking powder.
food.step8: Sift directly in the creamed ghee and curd.
food.step9: Mix the flour lightly with the creamed ghee and curd using a spoon or spatula.
food.step10: Sprinkle some cold water in parts and begin to mix it. Overall you can use 8 to 9 tablespoons cold water. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons water at a time and mix.
food.step11: Mix and combine everything to form a soft dough. Do not knead. Just mix and bring everything together to a dough. In case the dough becomes sticky, then add 1 to 2 tablespoons flour. Cover the dough and keep aside for 15 minutes. Use light pressure from hands and form a dough. Do not knead heavily or if required then knead very lightly.
food.ingredient 2: ¼ cup ghee or 60 grams ghee
food.ingredient 3: ¼ cup fresh curd or 60 grams curd
food.ingredient 4: 8 to 9 tablespoons cold water for kneading or as required
food.ingredient 8: 1 heaped cup sugar or 200 grams sugar
food.ingredient 10: ½ to 1 teaspoon cardamom powder - add as required
food.ingredient 12: a few drops of lemon juice – optional
food.ingredient 13: oil or ghee for deep frying, as required
food.ingredient 14: 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped pistachios or almonds or both
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Balushahi is a traditional dessert originating from the Indian subcontinent. It is popular sweet from the Indian subcontinent. Balushahi is similar to a glazed doughnut in terms of ingredients, but differs in texture and taste. In South India, a similar pastry is known as badushah.

food.recipe: a really easy and quick basic recipe of burfi made with khoya or mawa. It took me just about 20 minutes to make this barfi right from the preparation to the cooking.
food.step 1: First grate or crumble the unsweetened khoya.
food.step 2: In a small bowl dissolve a few saffron strands in 1 tsp of milk. This is an optional step.
food.step 3: Grease a bit of ghee, on a butter paper lined on a tray or on a thali/tray.
food.step 4: Add the grated khoya in a thick bottomed pan.
food.step 5: Begin to cook on a low flame for 2 to 3 minutes stirring often.
food.step6: Switch off the flame and add sugar.
food.step7: Stir. Then turn on the flame. The whole mixture's consistency will become smooth and slightly thin, due to the sugar getting melted.
food.step8: Stir often and continue to cook on a low flame.
food.step9: When the mixture becomes slightly thick and starts leaving the sides of the pan, as you see in the pic in step number 9, its time for the next step
food.step10: Avoid cooking too much as then the barfi will have a chewy texture. The time taken to get this texture right from the time, sugar is added is about 8 to 9 minutes on a low flame. The time will vary a couple of minutes here and there, depending on the size, type, quality of the pan and intensity of the flame.
food.step11: Add chopped dry fruits (almonds, pistachios) or your choice of dry fruits. Also add cardamom powder.
food.step12: Stir and cook for a minute. Switch off the flame
food.ingredients: 250 grams unsweetened khoya (mawa or dried evaporated milk solids)
food.ingredient 2: 5 tablespoon sugar or add as required
food.ingredient 3: 3 to 4 green cardamoms (choti elaichi) - powdered in a small grinder or mortar-pestle. (about ¼ to 1/3 teaspoon of cardamom powder, husks removed)
food.ingredient 5: 12 to 15 almonds (badam) or cashews (kaju) - finely chopped
food.ingredient 8: ¼ to 1/3 teaspoon ghee for greasing the pan or tray
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Barfi, borfi or burfi is a dense milk-based sweet from the Indian subcontinent, and a type of mithai. The name is a derivative of the Persian word barf, which means snow. A few of the famous varieties of barfi include besan barfi, kaaju barfi, pista barfi, and sing barfi.

food.recipe: An old-fashioned English bread and butter pudding that goes easy on the wallet. Day-old bread works best in this recipe.
food.step 1: Grease a 1 litre/2 pint pie dish with butter. Cut the crusts off the bread. Spread each slice with on one side with butter, then cut into triangles.
food.step 2: Arrange a layer of bread, buttered-side up, in the bottom of the dish, then add a layer of sultanas. Sprinkle with a little cinnamon, then repeat the layers of bread and sultanas, sprinkling with cinnamon, until you have used up all of the bread. Finish with a layer of bread, then set aside.
food.step 3: Gently warm the milk and cream in a saucepan over a low heat to scalding point. Do not let it boil. Crack the eggs into a bowl, add three-quarters of the sugar and lightly whisk until pale. Add the warm milk and cream mixture and stir well, then strain the custard into a bowl. Pour the custard over the prepared bread layers, sprinkle with nutmeg and the remaining sugar and leave to stand for 30 minutes.
food.step 4: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Place the dish into the oven and bake for 30–40 minutes, or until the custard has set and the top is golden brown.
food.time: Preparation Time: 20 mins , Cooking Time: 45 mins
food.restaurants: ["Jhunka Bhakar Kendra","Bhakar","Jayshree Zunka Bhakar Kendra","Akansha zunka bhakar","Pop 3Sixtyy","Wakhra Paratha","Eggs Corner","Swag Paratha","Mozzarella Pizza Hub"]
food.description: Bread and butter pudding is a traditional type of bread pudding popular in British cuisine. It is made by layering slices of buttered bread scattered with raisins in an oven dish, over which an egg custard mixture, made with milk or cream and normally seasoned with nutmeg, vanilla or other spices, is poured.

food.recipe: The deep dish pizza crust. A crunchy-edged, flaky crust is key in Chicago-style pizza. It’s absolutely not a regular pizza crust. No, this crust is unique. And that’s why I steered completely away from my regular pizza crust recipe and dove headfirst into something completely nuts.
food.step 1: Combine the flour, cornmeal, salt, sugar, and yeast in the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment. If you do not have a stand mixer, use your hand mixer and a very very large bowl. If you do not have any mixer, you will do this all by hand. Again, use a very large bowl. Give those ingredients a quick toss with your mixer on low or with a large wooden spoon. Add the warm water and 1/4 cup of melted butter. The warm water should be around 90°F (32°C). Make sure it is not very, very hot or it will kill the yeast. Likewise, make sure the butter isn’t boiling hot. If you melt it in the microwave, let it sit for 5 minutes before adding. On low speed, beat (or stir) the dough ingredients until everything begins to be moistened. Continuing on low speed (or remove from the bowl and knead by hand if you do not own a mixer), beat the dough until it is soft and supple and gently pulls away from the sides of the bowl and falls off of the dough hook- about 4-5 minutes. If the dough is too hard (it will be textured from the cornmeal), but if it feels too tough, beat in 1 teaspoon of warm water. Alternatively, if it feels too soft, beat in 1 Tablespoon of flour.
food.step 2: Remove the dough from the bowl and form into a ball. Lightly grease a large mixing bowl with olive oil and place the dough inside, turning it around so that all sides of the dough are coated in the oil. Cover the bowl tightly with aluminum foil and allow to rise in a warm environment for 1-2 hours or until double in size. For this warm environment, here is what I do: Preheat oven to 250°F (121°C). Once at 250°F, turn oven off. Place bowl inside. Close the oven. The lingering heat will help your dough rise. This is especially ideal on cold winter days.
food.step 3: Once the dough is ready, lightly flour a large work surface. Remove dough from the bowl, set the bowl and aluminum foil aside (to use later). Gently punch down the dough to remove any air bubbles and roll the dough into a large 15×12 inch rectangle. Spread 1/4 cup of softened butter on top of the dough. Roll it up lengthwise per the photos below. Cut the dough log in half. Form the two pieces of dough into balls and place back into your greased bowl. Cover with aluminum foil and allow to rise in the refrigerator (not in a warm place) for 1 hour until they are puffy as you make the sauce.
food.step 4: For the sauce: Place butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat and allow it to melt. Once melted, add the grated onion, salt, oregano, and red pepper flakes. Once the onion has slightly browned after about 5 minutes, add the garlic, tomatoes, and sugar. Turn the heat down to low-medium and allow it to simmer until it’s hearty, fragrant, and thick- about 30 minutes. You’ll have about 2 and 1/2 cups of sauce at this point. If you have more than that, keep simmering until the amount has reduced. Remove from heat and set aside until ready to be used. You may store the sauce in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days if planning to make the pizza another day. You may freeze this sauce for up to 2 months as well.
food.step 5: Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C).
food.step6: Assemble the pizzas: After the dough balls have risen in the refrigerator, they should be puffy. Keep one ball of dough in the refrigerator as you work with the first one. Roll it out on a lightly floured work surface, working it into a 12-inch circle. Using your rolling pin as a guide (see photos below), place over a 9×2 inch deep dish cake pan. Using your fingers, press the dough into the cake pan. Make sure it is nice and tight fitting inside the pan. Trim any excess dough off the edges with a small knife. Repeat with 2nd dough. Brush the top edges of the dough with a little olive oil, which gives the crust a beautiful sheen. Fill each pizza with 1/2 of the cheese (about 2 cups/8 oz per pizza), then your toppings which I’ve listed as optional in the recipe ingredients. On top of those optional toppings is the sauce. Pour about 1 and 1/4 cups (300ml) of sauce on top of each. If you do not like that much sauce, you can reduce to 3/4 cup (180ml) per pizza and have leftover sauce. Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup (22g) of grated parmesan cheese.
food.step7: Place the cake pans on top of a large baking sheet, which will catch anything potentially spilling over the sides of the pans. (Nothing usually does.) Bake for 20-28 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Feel free to loosely cover the pizzas with aluminum foil after the 15 minute mark to prevent any heavy browning and uneven baking. Remove the pizzas from the oven and allow to cool in the pans placed on a wire rack for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, slice, serve, and enjoy. Place any leftover pizza in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 5 days.  Reheat leftovers in a 300°F (149°C) oven for 15-20 minutes or until hot.
food.ingredient 5: 2 and 1/4 teaspoons (7g) Red Star Platinum yeast (1 standard packet)
food.ingredient 7: 1/2 cup (115g) unsalted butter, divided (1/4 cup melted, 1/4 cup softened to room temperature)
food.ingredient 14: 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (optional, but recommended)
food.time: Preparation Time: 20 min , Baking time: 40 min.
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Chicago-style pizza is pizza prepared according to several different styles developed in Chicago. The most famous is deep-dish pizza. The pan in which it is baked gives the pizza its characteristically high edge which provides ample space for large amounts of cheese and a chunky tomato sauce.

food.recipe: My version of chicken parmesan is a little different than what they do in the restaurants, with less sauce and a crispier crust.
food.step 1: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
food.step 2: Place chicken breasts between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2-inch. Season chicken thoroughly with salt and pepper.
food.step 3: Beat eggs in a shallow bowl and set aside.
food.step 4: Mix bread crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a separate bowl, set aside.
food.step 5: Place flour in a sifter or strainer; sprinkle over chicken breasts, evenly coating both sides.
food.step6: Dip flour coated chicken breast in beaten eggs. Transfer breast to breadcrumb mixture, pressing the crumbs into both sides. Repeat for each breast. Set aside breaded chicken breasts for about 15 minutes.
food.step7: Heat 1 cup olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Cook chicken until golden, about 2 minutes on each side. The chicken will finish cooking in the oven.
food.step8: Place chicken in a baking dish and top each breast with about 1/3 cup of tomato sauce. Layer each chicken breast with equal amounts of mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and provolone cheese. Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese on top and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
food.step9: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly, and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
food.ingredients: 4 eaches skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
food.ingredient 2: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
food.ingredient 4: 1 cup panko bread crumbs, or more as needed
food.ingredient 6: 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more if needed
food.ingredient 9: ¼ cup fresh mozzarella, cut into small cubes
food.restaurants: ["Prithvi Cafe'","'Starbucks'","'Leopold Cafe'","'Grandmama's All Day Cafe'","'Leepold cafe"]
food.description: Chicken parmigiana, or chicken parmesan, is a dish that consists of breaded chicken breast covered in tomato sauce and mozzarella, parmesan, or provolone cheese. A slice of ham or bacon is sometimes added. It is also known colloquially in the United States as chicken parm and in Australia as a parma, parmi, or parmy.

food.recipe: This is true Mexican comfort food, what your mom made you for breakfast when she had some stale tortillas that needed to get used up
food.step 1: 1 Fry the tortillas: In a large sauté pan, coat pan generously with corn oil, (1/8 inch), heat on medium high to high. When the oil is quite hot, add the tortillas, fry until golden brown.
food.step 2: Remove tortillas to a paper towel lined plate to soak up excess oil. Sprinkle a little salt on the tortillas.
food.step 3: Add 2 Tbsp oil to pan, bring to high heat again. Add the salsa and let salsa cook for several minutes. If you have a few sprigs of epazote, add them to the salsa.
food.step 4: Add the fried tortilla quarters to the salsa. Gently turn over the pieces of tortilla until they are all well coated with salsa. Let cook for a few minutes more.
food.step 5: Serve chilaquiles with garnishes and fried eggs and beans or nopalitos.
food.ingredients: 1 dozen corn tortillas, preferably stale, or left out overnight to dry out a bit, quartered or cut into 6 wedges
food.ingredient 4: 1 1/2 to 2 cups red chile sauce or salsa verde*
food.description: Chilaquiles from the Nahuatl word chīlāquilitl is a traditional Mexican dish consisting of corn tortillas cut in quarters and lightly fried.

food.recipe: Soak the chickpeas overnight in warm water with a little salt. Next day, remove and drain them. Place the meat, bacon, washed bones and the ham in a wide-based earthenware dish, and cover with around 4 litres of water. Put the dish on the flame and when it comes to the boil, any scum will rise to the surface. Remove it with a spoon for skimming and add the chickpeas. When it reaches boiling point again, add the carrot, onion and the turnip
food.step 1: Allow garbanzo beans to sit in water overnight. drain excess water and set aside.
food.step 2: Peel the garlic, onion, carrots and potatoes and set aside.
food.step 3: Cook veal, bones, chorizo and ham in a large pot in just enough water to cover. Add salt to taste.
food.step 4: When the water begins to boil, remove the excess foam
food.step 5: After an hour, add the chickpeas, garlic, onion and carrots, whole.
food.step7: Cover pot and simmer for an hour and a half.
food.step8: Drain the stock and reserve the rest of the ingredients on a platter.
food.step9: Put the stock back into the same pot and use it to cook the noodles.
food.step10: In a different pot, boil the peeled potatoes. Drain and place along with the rest of the ingredients you reserved.
food.step11: Cut the cooked vegetables into big chunks and add to the meat platter.
food.ingredient 2: 9 oz. veal, cut into 2 inch chunks
food.ingredient 7: 1 large 10 inch chorizo cut into 4 inch pieces
food.ingredient 13: Water, enough to cover the ingredients and two inches over
food.restaurants: ["The Butler And The Bayleaf'","'Oye Kake'","'Bombay Vintage'","'The Butter Kitchen'","'Papa Pancho Da Dhaba'","'The Fork Tale'","'North West'","'Via Bombay"]
food.description: Cocido madrileno is a traditional chickpea-based stew from Madrid, Spain. A substantial dish prepared with meat and vegetables, it is most popular during the winter but is served throughout the year in some restaurants.

food.recipe: This is said to be the closest to the rangoon served at a certain Asian food chain. The rangoon can also be deep-fried instead of baked
food.step 1: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly spray baking sheet with cooking spray.
food.step 2: Combine garlic, cream cheese, crab, green onions, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce in a bowl. To prevent wonton skins from drying, prepare only 1 or 2 rangoon at a time. Place 1 teaspoon of filling onto the center of each wonton skin. Moisten the edges with water and fold the wonton skin diagonally to form a triangle, pressing edges to seal. Moisten one of the bottom corners. Create a crown by pulling both bottom corners together and sealing. Arrange the rangoon on the baking sheet and lightly spray with cooking spray.
food.step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.
food.ingredient 3: 1 (6 ounce) can crabmeat, drained and flaked
food.ingredient 4: 2 medium (4-1/8" long)s green onions with tops, thinly sliced
food.description: Crab Rangoon, sometimes called crab puffs, crab rangoon puffs, or cheese wontons, are filled crisp dumpling appetizers served in American Chinese and, more recently, Thai restaurants.

food.recipe: Here is a simple but delicious crepe batter which can be made in minutes. It's made from ingredients that everyone has on hand.
food.step 1: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and the eggs. Gradually add in the milk and water, stirring to combine. Add the salt and butter; beat until smooth.
food.step 2: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe. Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly.
food.step 3: Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown. Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side. Serve hot.
food.step 4: 1 cup all-purpose flour
food.description: A crêpe or crepe is a type of very thin pancake. Crêpes are usually of two types: sweet crêpes and savoury galettes. Crêpes are served with a variety of fillings, from the simplest with only sugar to flambéed crêpes Suzette or elaborate savoury galettes.

food.recipe: Mitarashi Kushi Dango is a traditional wagashi (Japanese sweet). Round dumplings are generally called dango, and kushi dango means skewered sweet dumplings. These kushi dangos are coated with a sweet soy sauce are called mitarashi. Usually, 3 to 5 dangos (traditionally 5) are used per skewer
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: Combine shiratamako, joshinko, and sugar in a bowl.
food.step 3: Gradually pour 3/4 cup hot water over the combination. Stir in hot water a little bit a time and knead slowly until the dough becomes smooth. The texture is like squeezing an "earlobe." Feel free to mix it using a spatula until combined.
food.step 4: Knead the dough with hands until smooth.
food.step 5: Divide the dough into small pieces and roll into small balls.
food.step6: Place the dumplings in a preheated steamer and steam them on high heat for about 10 minutes.
food.step7: Cool the dumplings and put dumplings on skewers. (3 or 4 dumplings for a skewer)
food.step8: To make the mitarashi sauce, mix water, sugar, and soy sauce in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
food.step9: Pour the katakuriko starch mixture into the sauce, stirring well. Bring to a boil again and stop the heat.
food.step10: Grill the skewered dumplings until slightly grill-marked.
food.step11: Brush the mitarashi sauce over dumplings.
food.ingredient 2: 1 1/3 cup shiratamako/mochiko, sweet rice /glutinous rice flour
food.ingredient 8: 1 1/2 tbsp. katakuriko starch or cornstarch, mixed with 1 1/2 tbsp. of water
food.description: Dango is a Japanese dumpling and sweet made from mochiko, related to mochi. It is often served with green tea. Dango is eaten year-round, but the different varieties are traditionally eaten in given seasons. Three to five dango are often served on a skewer.

food.recipe: Elote (aka Mexican Street Corn) is an unbelievably popular antojito (little craving or street food) that you can find all over Mexico and the US. It's often served on a stick, though you could skip the skewer and make it right on the grill.
food.step 1: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high. Grill corn, turning often, until slightly charred all over, about 10 minutes.
food.step 2: Brush corn with a layer of mayonnaise and sprinkle with chili powder, cotija, and cilantro. Serve warm with lime wedges
food.step 3: Serve warm with lime wedges.
food.ingredients: 6 to 8 medium ears sweet corn, husks removed
food.ingredient 2: 1/2 cup Mexican crema, or sour cream
food.ingredient 3: 1/2 cup Mexican crema, or sour cream
food.ingredient 6: 1/4 teaspoon ground chipotle pepper, to taste
food.ingredient 7: 2 teaspoons lime zest, from one lime
food.ingredient 8: 2 tablespoon lime juice, from one lime
food.description: Elote in a Cup (Mexican Corn in a Cup or Elote en Vaso) is a popular way to enjoy your favorite elote Mexicano off of the cob.

food.recipe: Try this Spanish crepes recipe for frisuelos. This simple frisuelos recipe make a delicious breakfast, snack or dessert!
food.step 1: Beat the eggs and add the sugar, and continue beating until light and fluffy.
food.step 2: Add the liqueur (if using), milk, salt and lemon peel and continue to beat the mixture.
food.step 3: Add the flour, a little at a time, until the crepe batter is uniform and there aren't any lumps.
food.step 4: Optionally, you can let the batter rest for an hour, and then strain it to make sure there aren't any lumps.
food.step 5: Using a paper towel, coat a frying pan with olive oil (just a thin layer).
food.step6: Add a very small amount of batter to the hot pan (starting with just two tablespoons). Spread it out to completely cover the pan.
food.step7: After about 30 seconds, it should be ready to flip.
food.step8: When each frisuelo is cooked, put in on a large plate and sprinkle sugar on top. Layer the frisuelos on top of one another, until you've used up all of the batter!
food.ingredient 5: 1 tablespoon of anís or another liqueur like cognac, rum, brandy etc. if you prefer-- or skip this altogether to make it alcohol free!
food.ingredient 6: Zest from 1/2 a lemon or another citrus fruit if you like to experiment
food.description: This traditional recipe for Pancakes Filled with Custard (Frisuelos con Crema Pastelera) is taken from Claudia Roden's The Food of Spain and makes a rich and .

food.recipe: Burns Night is just days away, so why not celebrate with your own homemade haggis. Danny Kingston shares his favourite recipe for this traditional Burns Night staple, which is surprisingly easy to make
food.step 1: Rinse the stomach thoroughly and soak overnight in cold salted water.
food.step 2: Rinse the liver, heart, and tongue. In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook these parts over medium heat for 2 hours. Remove and mince. Remove any gristle or skin and discard.
food.step 3: In a large bowl, combine the minced liver, heart, tongue, suet, onions, and toasted oats. Season with salt, pepper, and dried herbs. Moisten with some of the cooking water so the mixture binds. Remove the stomach from the cold salted water and fill 2/3 with the mixture. Sew or tie the stomach closed. Use a turning fork to pierce the stomach several times. This will prevent the haggis from bursting.
food.step 4: In a large pot of boiling water, gently place the filled stomach, being careful not to splash. Cook over high heat for 3 hours.
food.step 5: Serve with mashed potatoes, if you serve it at all.
food.description: Haggis is a savoury pudding containing sheep's pluck (heart, liver, and lungs), minced with onion, oatmeal, suet, spices, and salt, mixed with stock, and cooked while traditionally encased in the animal's stomach though now often in an artificial casing instead.

food.recipe: Super good honey toast which taste so delicious for breakfast. It is one of the easiest recipe you could ever make. The more butter you add the more tasty it gets
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 350°. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
food.step 2: In a small bowl, toss the berries with the sugar; set aside to macerate while you prepare the toast box.
food.step 3: Using a serrated knife and starting from the crustless side of the bread, cut a square out of the center of the loaf (do not cut all the way through), leaving a ½-inch border on all four sides and at the bottom crust. Remove the cube and cut into 1-inch pieces. Leave the box intact.
food.step 4: Spread the pieces and the toast box out on the prepared baking sheet and brush them on all sides with melted butter. Bake, turning the pieces occasionally so they brown evenly, until the small cubes are crisp and golden, about 15 minutes. Remove the cubes to the bowl with the macerating fruit, and continue baking the toast box until crisp, about 10 minutes more.
food.step 5: Brush the inside of the toasted bread box with the sweetened condensed milk
food.step6: Gently toss the bread cubes with the prepared fruit. Transfer the mixture into the toast box and drizzle with 2 tablespoons honey. Top the toast with ice cream and whipped cream and garnish with cookies, candies, and nuts as desired. Drizzle with the final tablespoon of honey and serve immediately with forks and steak knives.
food.ingredients: One 4-inch slab milk bread or other soft, unsliced white bread, cut from the end of the loaf (there should be crust on 5 sides)
food.ingredient 2: 1⁄2 cup assorted ripe berries, pitted cherries, or melon balls
food.ingredient 6: 1 ripe banana, peeled and sliced crosswise
food.ingredient 8: 2 scoops vanilla or ginger ice cream
food.ingredient 10: Assorted nuts, cookies, and candies for garnish (such as Pocky brand biscuits, wafer straws, mini macarons, mochi, daifuku, matcha truffles, and praline roses)
food.description: Honey toast, also known as Shibuya toast, brick toast, and hanito is a Japanese dessert that originated from the district of Shibuya during the Japanese asset price bubble, often served at karaoke bars. It is also popular in other parts of the world, most prominently Taiwan and Singapore.

food.recipe: Super good honey toast which taste so delicious for breakfast. It is one of the easiest recipe you could ever make. The more butter you add the more tasty it gets.
food.step 1: Super good honey toast which taste so delicious for breakfast. It is one of the easiest recipe you could ever make. The more butter you add the more tasty it gets.
food.step 2: Remove to a plate. Spoon some more butter on top and drizzle with honey
food.step 3: Enjoy hot.
