food.ingredient 4: 2 green chilies or 2 teaspoons green chilies2 green chilies or 2 teaspoons green chilies
food.ingredient 7: grinding1 to 2 tablespoon water for grinding
food.ingredient 10: ¼ teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper
food.ingredient 11: ½ teaspoon coriander powder (ground coriander)½ teaspoon coriander powder (ground coriander)
food.ingredient 15: 1 cup besan (gram flour or chickpea flour)
food.description: Kothimbir vadi is a delicious Savorycrisp snack made with gram flour (besan), coriander leaves and spices. In marathi language “kothimbir” or “kothmir” stands for coriander leaves. The word 'vadi' means cubes or slices or wedges. To prepare kothimbir vadi is very simple.

food.recipe: A traditional French-style lemon tart with creamy, dreamy lemon curd filling, that tastes just like the ones in Paris. It’s my mom’s recipe and has been a favorite in my family for years.
food.step 1: To make the lemon curd: In a medium heatproof bowl, place eggs, sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, and heavy cream and whisk to combine. Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water (bain-marie). Cook on moderate heat, whisking constantly, until mixture becomes thick (mine was ready in 10 minutes, but it can take up to 20). If you have a thermometer, it should register 170°F/75°C; otherwise, it should coat the back of a wooden spoon and leave a clear pass if you run your finger through it. The curd will thicken more once cooled.
food.step 2: Remove from heat and immediately strain mixture through a sieve. Add butter, a few cubes at a time, and whisk until completely melted and incorporated, and mixture is smooth. Take your time with it—the whisking makes for an airy and light texture. Allow to cool to room temperature before filling the tart. (Lemon curd can be kept in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week, or can be frozen for up to 2 months. To thaw, place overnight in the fridge. Whisk the mixture to smoothen it before using.)
food.step 3: Fill the tart shell with lemon curd, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours until chilled. Serve with berries and whipped cream if you like. The tart is rich, so cut your servings small.
food.ingredients: 2 large eggs plus 2 egg yolks (or 3 whole eggs)
food.ingredient 4: 1/2 cup (120 ml) freshly squeezed lemon juice (2-3 lemons for both zest and juice)
food.ingredient 6: 1/2 cup (1 stick/115 g) unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
food.description: A tart is a baked dish consisting of a filling over a pastry base with an open top not covered with pastry. The pastry is usually shortcrust pastry; the filling may be sweet or savoury, though modern tarts are usually fruit-based, sometimes with custard.

food.recipe: Layer the fish masala and rice; sprinkle biryani masala, fried cashews, raisins, fried onions, chopped coriander leaves and mint leaves, sprinkle left over ghee and few drops of saffron milk over the rice as the final layering. Repeat this process.
food.step 1: Marinate the cleaned fish with the ingredients meant for marination and keep it aside for 30 minutes.
food.step 2: Put all the ingredients for white paste in to a blender and grind it into a soft paste and keep it aside.
food.step 3: Heat the frying pan in medium heat and pour some oil and shallow fry the marinated fish and keep it aside.
food.step 4: Chop the onions into thin slices. Heat the frying pan and pour 2 Tablespoon of ghee and fry the onion till it turns golden brown color. Add the ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, crushed green chillies and saute it for a couple of minutes. Now add the chopped tomato and fry it a couple of minutes. Once the tomato is cooked add yogurt & salt to taste, stir it well. Now add the shallow fried fish pieces and make sure the fish pieces are covered with the masala. After 5 minutes add the white masala and mix it well. When the gravy becomes thick and fish is cooked remove the fish masala from the fire and keep it aside.
food.step 5: Heat the pan in medium fire and add 1 Tablespoon of ghee. Add whole cardamom, cloves and broken cinnamon and fry it. Add washed rice and stir it. When the rice starts cracking add 4 cups of boiling water. Add salt to taste, coriander, mint leaves and lemon juice. Cook the rice until the water is dried completely.
food.step6: Heat the ghee in a pan and add the cashew nuts and raisins and fry till it turns into golden color and keep aside.
food.step7: Now take a heavy bottomed vessel and add the cooked rice in one layer at the bottom. Add a few spoons of the fish masala. Toss some cashew nuts and raisins and cover with a rice layer.
food.step8: Layer it up, finishing with the garnishes on top.
food.step9: Take a napkin (radius of the vessel), dampen it with water and cover the vessel.
food.step10: Put the biryani on dum for 1 hour in low heat for the flavours to develop. Serve hot.
food.description: Fish biryani is a layered rice dish made with fish, basmati rice, spices & herbs. Biryani is most commonly made with chicken or mutton.

food.recipe: an easy and popular, tasty south indian staple breakfast recipe made with rice and urad dal. basically an extension to the traditional dosa recipe, where dosa is made crisp and stuffed with potato masala
food.step 1: firstly, in a large bowl take 3 cup sona masuri rice and ½ tsp methi.
food.step 2: rinse well and soak in enough water for 4 hours.
food.step 3: also, add 1 onion and saute until onions shrink slightly.
food.step 4: further, add ¼ tsp turmeric and 1 tsp salt. saute well.
food.step 5: now add 3 potato and mix well, mash slightly making sure everything is well combined.
food.step6: turn off the flame and add 2 tbsp coriander and 2 tbsp lemon juice.
food.step7: mix well and aloo bhaji for masala dosa is ready. keep aside.
food.step8: firstly, add a ladleful of batter on hot tawa.
food.step9: spread as thin as possible making a crispy dosa.
food.step11: also, place 2 tbsp of prepared aloo masala in the centre.
food.step12: roast until the dosa turns golden brown and crisp.
food.step13: scrape the sides of dosa and roll the dosa
food.ingredients: 3 cup sona masuri rice3 cup sona masuri rice
food.ingredient 2: ½ tsp methi / fenugreek seeds½ tsp methi / fenugreek seeds
food.ingredient 4: 1 cup urad dal1 cup urad dal
food.ingredient 5: 2 tbsp toor dal2 tbsp toor dal
food.ingredient 6: 2 tbsp chana dal2 tbsp chana dal
food.ingredient 10: 1 tsp urad dal1 tsp urad dal
food.ingredient 11: 1 dried red chilli1 dried red chilli
food.ingredient 14: 2 chilli, finely chopped2 chilli, finely chopped
food.description: Masala dosa or masale dose is a variation of the popular South Indian food dosa, which has its origins in Tuluva Mangalorean cuisine. It is made from rice, lentils, potato, methi, and curry leaves, and served with chutneys and sambar.

food.recipe: This Moong dal tadka is a vegan recipe of mung lentils cooked with onion, tomatoes, ginger and then tempered with cumin, garlic, green chili and some Indian spice powders.
food.step 1: In a pressure cooker take the chopped onions, chopped tomatoes and finely chopped ginger. Also add the turmeric powder, red chili powder and water to the cooker. Mix well.
food.step 2: Pressure cook for 5 to 6 whistles on medium flame till the moong lentils are softened well. Once the pressure settles down, remove the lid and stir the dal.
food.step 3: If the dal looks thick, then add some water and simmer for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 4: Add salt. Mix very well and keep aside. Check the taste and if required you can add more salt.
food.step 5: In a small pan, heat oil or ghee or butter. First fry the cumin seeds.
food.step6: Next add the garlic and green chili and fry for some seconds. Don't brown the garlic. Switch off the flame.
food.step7: Now add the garam masala powder, red chili powder and asafoetida. Switching off the flame earlier ensures that the spice powders don't get burned.
food.step8: Quickly stir and immediately pour the tempering mixture in the dal.
food.step9: Stir the dal and serve hot moong dal with steamed rice or chapatis.
food.step10: The moong dal tadka tastes better as it is and there is no need to garnish or add coriander leaves to it. But if you want you can always garnish with some coriander leaves. For a slight tang you can also squeeze some lemon juice
food.ingredients: ½ cup moong dal (split skinned mung lentils)
food.ingredient 2: 1 medium sized / ⅓ cup finely chopped onions
food.ingredient 3: 1 medium size tomato - chopped1 medium size tomato - chopped
food.ingredient 4: ½ inch ginger (adrak) - finely chopped or grated
food.ingredient 5: ¼ teaspoon red chili powder or ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper
food.description: Moong Dal Tadka is a simple Indian dal made with split petite yellow lentils. Tempered with mustard, cumin, garlic & curry leaves

food.recipe: For the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch nonstick springform pan with nonstick cooking spray.
food.step 1: In an electric mixer on high speed, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Add the sugar slowly, then the vanilla, baking powder, and salt while beating, about 2 more minutes. Turn the power off and fold in the walnuts and Maria crackers. Transfer to the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
food.step 2: For the frosting: In an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese, sour cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract until soft peaks form and the mixture is smooth.
food.step 3: To assemble: Remove the cake from the oven. Let cool for 15 minutes. Remove the springform. Using an offset spatula, spread the frosting all over the cake. Garnish with the strawberries and serve.
food.ingredient 13: 1 1/2 pounds sliced fresh strawberries, for garnishing
food.description: Strawberry meringue cake (mostachon de fresa) Think pavlova, Mexican-style. Believed to have originated in Monterrey in Mexico's north-east, mostachon is a traditional meringue cake, which typically includes crushed plain biscuits and walnuts in the meringue to create an extra crisp base.

food.recipe: These Banana Nutella Quesadillas are full of chocolate and banana goodness.  The buttery cinnamon sugar crust on the outside of each tortilla adds a nice crunch to this easy dessert.
food.step 1: Spread butter on one side of each of the tortillas, and sprinkle them with cinnamon sugar.
food.step 2: Flip the tortillas over and spread the other side with Nutella. Top with banana slices on half of the tortilla.
food.step 3: Fold each tortilla in half and place in a warm skillet. Fry each side until golden brown.
food.step 4: Cut each tortilla in half and serve right away with Cool Whip, if desired.
food.description: These Banana Nutella Quesadillas are full of chocolate and banana goodness. The buttery cinnamon sugar crust on the outside of each tortilla adds a nice crunch to this easy dessert. ... Maybe I should make some more Cheesecake Nutella Twists or another pan of these Banana Nutella

food.recipe: These chicken breasts are fast, easy, and delicious. By 'pan-roasting,' you can easily monitor the internal temp. Leaving the skin on adds a lot of flavor and much needed moisture.
food.step 1: Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper.
food.step 2: Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it starts to shimmer. Place chicken breasts in skillet skin side down. Sprinkle with fresh herbs. Do not disturb the breasts until the skin side sears, 5 or 6 minutes. Turn chicken.
food.step 3: Cook until internal temperature reaches 150 degrees F, about 5 minutes. Add vinegar and butter to pan with chicken. Shake pan gently until butter melts and internal temperature of chicken reaches 160 to 165 degrees F, 2 to 3 minutes more. Add a splash of chicken broth or water if sauce needs to be thinned.
food.ingredients: 4 1/2 breast, bone ins boneless chicken breast halves with skin
food.ingredient 2: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
food.ingredient 3: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs (thyme, parsley, rosemary)
food.ingredient 6: 4 tablespoons cold butter, cut into small pieces
food.ingredient 7: 1 tablespoon chicken broth (or water), if needed to thin sauce
food.description: These chicken breasts are fast, easy, and delicious. By 'pan-roasting,' you can easily monitor the internal temp. Leaving the skin on adds a lot of flavor and much needed moisture.

food.recipe: Pasta with basic Tomato and Basil Sauce. This is the most basic and simplest cooked pasta sauce, hence it is the benchmark of a good Italian home cook.
food.step 1: Heat the oil in a large skillet, and add garlic and chilly flakes.
food.step 2: As soon as the garlic gives off its aroma and becomes opaque, add the tomatoes. Cook over high heat until the tomato begins to thicken. Use a wooden spoon to stir and help break the tomato pulp.
food.step 3: Add the basil, either whole or roughly chopped, and salt. When the sauce is cooked, remove it from the heat and run it through a food processor for a minute.
food.step 4: Cook the pasta in abundant boiling water, till al dente, and drain.
food.step 5: Place in a serving bowl with the sauce. Drizzle a little olive oil over the pasta and mix well with the sauce.
food.step6: Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
food.ingredient 6: 1 packet Penne (though you could use any pasta here
food.description: Pasta Con Pomodoro E Basilico Recipe. About Pasta Con Pomodoro E Basilico Recipe: Pasta with basic Tomato and Basil Sauce. This is the most basic and simplest cooked pasta sauce, hence it is the benchmark of a good Italian home cook.

food.recipe: Ever wondered how to make bubble tea? Here is a simple bubble tea recipe that shows how you can make this beverage at home!
food.step 1: Prepare the tea: Steep the tea bags or leaves with 4 cups of freshly boiled water. Let the tea sit in water until it cools completely. (See note 2)
food.step 2: Prepare the simple syrup (if using): Add the water and sugar to a saucepan and quickly stir everything together. Heat the water on medium-high and cook until the water boils and the sugar completely dissolves. Remove the saucepan from heat and let the simple syrup cool before transferring to a jar.
food.step 3: Cook the tapioca pearls: Bring about 4 cups of water to boil and add the tapioca pearls. Stir the pearls and wait for them to float to the top. Then, cook them for another 5 minutes. Test a pearl to see if it has reached the desired level of softness. Cook the pearls for another few minutes if they are still stiff. Use a slotted spoon to remove the pearls from the hot water. Quickly rinse the pearls with water. Transfer the pearls into a bowl, and mix the pearls with a few tablespoons of simple syrup (to taste).
food.step 4: Assemble the drinks: Strain the tea into a pitcher. Divide the cooked tapioca pearls into 4 large glasses. Next, add a few ice cubes to each glass. Pour 1 cup of the tea into each glass. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of milk and 1 1/2 tablespoons of simple syrup into each glass. Stir and taste the milk tea. Add more milk or simple syrup to your taste.
food.step 5: If you are serving the beverage to guests, have a small pitcher of milk and the jar of simple syrup ready so that each guest can adjust their drinks to their taste. The drink is usually served with large boba straws (large enough for the tapioca pearls to go through). If you don't have the straws on hand, you can use spoons to scoop out the tapioca pearls.
food.ingredients: 8 bags of black tea or 3 tablespoons loose-leaf black tea
food.ingredient 4: whole milk to serve (or your choice of milk)
food.ingredient 5: simple syrup to serve (or your choice of sweetener)
food.description: Bubble tea is a Taiwanese tea-based drink invented in Tainan and Taichung in the 1980s. Recipes contain tea of some kind, flavors of milk, and sugar. Toppings, known as "pearls", such as chewy tapioca balls, popping boba, fruit jelly, grass jelly, agar jelly, alovera jelly, sago and puddings are often added.

food.recipe: These addictive Spanish pork skewers are called pincho morunos because of their fascinating history. The marinade is a delicious blend of spices and they make the perfect tapa!
food.step 1: Trim the pork loin of excess fat and then cut into 1.5 inch cubes and put into a large freezer bag
food.step 2: Mix all spices, olive oil and lemon juice in a bowl and then pour over the pork cubes
food.step 3: Seal the bag and toss the spice mixture with the pork, then marinate in the fridge overnight (or a minimum of 2 hours)
food.step 4: Remove the marinated pork cubes and place on metal skewers with a little bit of space between each cube
food.step 5: Grill on a high heat until browned on the outside but just cooked through (don't overcook or they'll be dry!)
food.step6: Rest the skewers for five minutes and serve with lemon wedges
food.ingredients: 2 pounds of pork tenderloin cleaned of excess fat/veins
food.ingredient 12: Juice of 1/2 a lemon for marinade
food.description: Pinchitos or Pinchos Morunos is a Moorish-derived food in Spanish cuisine, similar to Kebab. The name pinchitos is used in the southern Spanish autonomous communities of Andalusia and Extremadura. They consist of small cubes of meat threaded onto a skewer which are traditionally cooked over charcoal braziers.

food.recipe: made this nacho cheese sauce has nothing to do with the super bowl and everything to do with the fact that I have just had a crappy week. :) After a series of unfortunate events and two recipe flops, I had an, “Ugh, I give up. Just give me some chips and nacho cheese.” moment.
food.step 1: Add the butter and flour to a small sauce pot. Heat and whisk the butter and flour together until they become bubbly and foamy. Continue to cook and whisk the bubbly mixture for about 60 seconds.
food.step 2: Whisk the milk into the flour and butter mixture. Turn the heat up slightly and allow the milk to come to a simmer while whisking. When it reaches a simmer, the mixture will thicken. Once it's thick enough to coat a spoon, turn off the heat.
food.step 3: Stir in the shredded cheddar, one handful at a time, until melted into the sauce. If needed, place the pot over a low flame to help the cheese melt. Do not over heat the cheese sauce.
food.step 4: Once all the cheese is melted into the sauce, stir in the salt and chili powder. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed. If the sauce becomes too thick, simply whisk in an additional splash of milk.
food.description: Cheese sauce makes or breaks any nacho recipe. The Best Queso recipe is easy and flavorful, with sharp and smoky notes. Start dipping those tortilla chips!

food.recipe: Angku is a small dark orange oval nyonya delicacy which is made with glutinous rice flour wrapped with green bean filling. Angku has a high ritual value and it is commonly used for Chinese prayers and served during baby full moon parties.
food.step 1: Steam green bean over boiling water for 30-40 minutes till soft.
food.step 2: Blend or mashed green bean till become a paste.
food.step 3: In a wok, combine green bean paste, sugar and oil. Stir on low medium heat till thick and do not stick to your hands.
food.step 4: Cool it and shaped into 30 balls of about 20g. ( The size of filling will depend on the size of your mould).
food.step 5: Mix coloring, wheat starch and water. Stir till blended.
food.step6: Add in boiling water and mix till smooth and become translucent.
food.step7: Add in sugar, glutinous rice flour, sweet potatoes and water gradually. Knead till combined.
food.step8: Slowly add in oil and keep on kneading till smooth and do not stick onto your hands.
food.step9: Lightly grease the cut banana leaves with oil.
food.step10: Divide skin dough into 30 pieces. Flatten each dough into 1/4 inch thick and wrap the filling inside. Roll into a ball.
food.step11: Lightly dust the Angku mould with glutinous rice flour. Press the dough ball into the mould and lightly knock it out.
food.step12: Place Angku on the banana leaf.
food.step13: Steam over boiling water for 10 minutes.
food.ingredients: 300 g split green bean, washed and soaked for 6 hours
food.ingredient 5: 200 g wheat starch, Tung Mein Fun
food.ingredient 8: 100 g mashed orange color sweet potato
food.description: Red tortoise cake is a small round or oval-shaped Chinese pastry with soft, sticky glutinous rice flour skin wrapped around a sweet filling in the centre. It is molded to resemble a tortoise shell and is presented resting on a square piece of banana leaf.

food.recipe: A "San Jacobo" is a popular "merienda" (afternoon snack) or tapa in Spain. It consists of a slice of cheese between 2 slices of cooked ham, which is breaded and then fried. It is delicious when the outside is crispy, while the cheese inside melts between the slices of ham. Could the "San Jacobo" be Spanish fast food? It's delicious, easy to prepare and economical.
food.step 1: Lay 4 slices of ham on clean work area or counter.
food.step 2: Lay a cheese slice on each ham slice and another slice of ham on top.
food.step 3: Break the eggs into a medium-size bowl or a small, open baking dish with a flat bottom. Add water to eggs and beat with a wire whip.
food.step 4: Put flour and breadcrumbs onto a dinner plate and mix together.
food.step 5: Pour enough oil into a medium frying pan to completely cover the bottom. Heat on medium.
food.step6: When oil is hot, bread the ham and cheese. Dip the ham and cheese into the beaten egg and then dredge in the flour and breadcrumb mixture.​​
food.step7: Fry the San Jacobo in the oil until golden brown and turn over and fry on the flip side.
food.step8: Remove from the frying pan and place on a paper towel to drain.
food.step9: Repeat the breading and frying with each of the other 3 San Jacobos.
food.step10: Serve hot accompanied by bread
food.ingredient 7: 8 oz/1/4 liter olive oil for frying
food.description: A cordon bleu or schnitzel cordon bleu is a dish of meat wrapped around cheese, then breaded and pan-fried or deep-fried. Veal or pork cordon bleu is made of veal or pork pounded thin and wrapped around a slice of ham and a slice of cheese, breaded, and then pan fried or baked.

food.recipe: This Restaurant Style Mughlai Shahi paneer is a delicious creamy gravy made with cottage cheese, onions, nuts, curd and spices.
food.step 1: Boil onions, cashews, almonds, magaz, ginger and garlic in 1.5 cups water for 8-10 minutes till the onions become soft.
food.step 2: Strain the stock and keep aside.
food.step 3: Make a paste of the cooked onions, ginger, garlic along with the dry fruits adding 1 or 2 tsp of the strained water.
food.step 4: Heat 2 to 3 tablespoons oil in a pan.
food.step 5: Fry all the “Whole spices” mentioned in the above list till they release their aroma in the oil.
food.step6: Add the ground onion-dry fruits paste and saute till the oil starts to leave the sides of the paste.
food.step7: Add the dry spice powders and stir.
food.step8: Now add the whisked yogurt, stock+water, salt and sugar.
food.step9: Stir well and simmer for 10-12 minutes or till the gravy thickens slightly on a low flame.
food.step10: If using cream, then whisk the cream till smooth and keep aside.
food.step11: Add the cardamom powder and crushed saffron.
food.step12: Stir and add the cubed paneer. If adding cream, you can add the cream with the paneer.
food.step13: Simmer for 1-2 minutes till the paneer is cooked.
food.ingredient 2: 1 to 1.5 cups strained stock (got from boiling the onions with dry fruits) + water or 1.5 cups water1 to 1.5 cups strained stock (got from boiling the onions with dry fruits) + water or 1.5 cups water
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup full fat fresh curd (yogurt) – whisked till smooth
food.ingredient 8: ¼ teaspoon cardamom powder¼ teaspoon cardamom powder
food.ingredient 9: 1 or 2 tablespoon full fat cream or 70-80% fat cream (amul cream which is available in india can also be used), optional
food.ingredient 11: 1 or 2 drops of kewra water (screwpine water) – optional
food.description: Shahi paneer is a preparation of paneer, native to the Indian subcontinent, consisting of a thick gravy of cream, tomatoes and Indian spices.

food.recipe: While most candy-making is a pain in the ass, maple syrup snow candy couldn’t be easier. Safety note: Unless there are many inches of freshly fallen snow in your yard, find your ice somewhere else.
food.step 1: Pack snow or grated ice on a rimmed baking sheet. Press down to create an even layer, and place in freezer.
food.step 2: Combine maple syrup and ginger in a small saucepan over high. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring often, until a candy thermometer registers 240°F (soft ball stage), about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat.
food.step 3: Place prepared baking sheet of snow from freezer to the counter. Pour hot syrup mixture into 6long strips over the snow. Quickly sprinkle a bit of salt over each syrup strip. Working quickly, use a craft stick to press gently on 1 end of each strip; roll slightly hardened maple candy mixture onto the stick, gently forming into a candy pop at the end of each stick
food.step 4: Place finished candy pops on a sheet of parchment paper while you make the rest, and enjoy candy immediately.
food.ingredients: 8 cups snow or finely grated ice
food.ingredient 4: ½ teaspoon flaky sea salt (such as Maldon
food.description: Maple syrup snow candy is candy in its simplest form. It's made by pouring boiling maple syrup on a clean bed of snow. The cold snow instantly stops the syrup from cooking, and cools it to the consistency of taffy in seconds.

food.recipe: Soy milk is a delicious and healthy alternative to cow’s milk. You can find it at pretty much any supermarket and is so inexpensive, but homemade soy milk is much better than store-bought
food.step 1: Soak the soybeans in water overnight (ideally 12 hours or longer).
food.step 2: Drain the soybeans and remove the outer skins. Removing the outer skins is optional, but your milk will have a better texture if you do.
food.step 3: Blend the soybeans with 3 cups of water (750 ml) until well blended and almost smooth.
food.step 4: Strain the blended mixture using a nut milk bag, a cheesecloth, a napkin or a fine mesh strainer.
food.step 5: Pour the mixture into a pot or a saucepan and add 1 cup of water (250 ml). Bring to a boil, stir and skim foam.
food.step6: Keep leftovers in a sealed container in the fridge for about 3-5 days.
food.ingredient 3: ½ teaspoon vanilla extract or a piece of vanilla bean
food.description: A Shirley Temple is a non-alcoholic mixed drink traditionally made with ginger ale and a splash of grenadine, garnished with a maraschino cherry. Modern Shirley Temple recipes may substitute lemon-lime soda or lemonade and sometimes orange juice in part, or in whole.

food.food_item: Spicy Chicken Wings with Blue Cheese Dip
food.recipe: This creamy Blue Cheese Dip is perfect alongside buffalo chicken wings, or cut vegetables like celery, carrots, or bell pepper.
food.step 1: Make the dip: Pulse the sour cream, blue cheese, mayonnaise, garlic, milk and lemon juice in a food processor until combined but still chunky. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
food.step 2: Make the wings: Heat 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large deep skillet over high heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 375 degrees F. Set a rack on a rimmed baking sheet.
food.step 3: Mix the flour and paprika in a shallow dish. Dredge the wings in the flour mixture to coat, tapping off the excess. Fry the wings in batches, turning as needed, until cooked through and deep golden brown, about 15 minutes. (Return the oil to 375 degrees F between batches.) Remove with tongs and transfer to the rack to drain.
food.step 4: Meanwhile, combine the hot sauce, butter and honey in a medium pot over medium heat until the butter melts. Continue to cook, stirring, until the sauce thickens slightly, about 10 minutes. Reserve one-quarter of the sauce for serving. Add the cooked wings to the pot and toss with the remaining sauce. Serve with the blue cheese dip and reserved sauce.
food.ingredient 7: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
food.ingredient 8: Vegetable or peanut oil, for frying
food.ingredient 11: 3 pounds chicken wings, split at the joints, tips removed
food.ingredient 12: 1 1/2 cups Frank's RedHot sauce (or 3/4 cup other hot sauce)

food.recipe: Veg spring rolls are a popular Chinese snack. These delicious vegan spring rolls are crunchy from outside, with a spiced vegetable filling from inside.
food.step 1: First cook 75 grams noodles as per package instructions. Add the noodles in hot boiling water and cook them.
food.step 2: Once the noodles should be cooked well, then strain the noodles and rinse them thoroughly in water.
food.step 3: Strain and keep aside.
food.step 4: Chop the veggies in thin long strips. For cabbage and carrot, you can shred them. Slice the green bell pepper/capsicum in thin strips. French beans you can slice them very thinly, diagonally. Chopping takes time, so you can also use a food processor to chop the veggies
food.step 5: Please note you can use your choice of veggies.
food.step6: Now heat 2 tbsp sesame oil in a wok or kadai. Keep the flame on medium intensity and add 1/3 cup spring onion whites.
food.step7: Stir and then add all the veggies.
food.step8: Increase the flame to high and stir fry the veggies for 4 to 5 minutes on a high flame.
food.step9: Then add 1/2 tsp crushed black pepper powder and 1 tsp finely chopped celery (optional).
food.step10: Add 1 tbsp soy sauce. Both black pepper and soy sauce can be adjusted as per your taste.
food.step11: Stir everything very well. Then add the cooked noodles.
food.step12: Season with salt. Add less salt as soy sauce already has salt. Stir again very well. The filling has to be dry.
food.ingredients: 2 tablespoon sesame oil or any oil
food.ingredient 2: 150 grams cabbage or about 2.25 to 2.5 cups shredded cabbage
food.ingredient 3: 80 grams carrot or 2 small carrots shredded or ½ cup shredded carrots
food.ingredient 4: 1 small to medium green bell pepper (capsicum) - thinly sliced or 1/3 cup thinly sliced green bell pepper
food.ingredient 5: 7 to 8 french beans, sliced very thinly or ¼ cup thinly sliced beans
food.ingredient 6: 2 to 3 cup small to medium spring onions (scallions) or 1/3 cup spring onions whites
food.ingredient 7: ½ teaspoon crushed black pepper or black pepper powder or add as per taste
food.ingredient 10: 1 cup cooked noodles or about 75 grams uncooked noodles (optional)
food.ingredient 12: 2 to 3 tablespoon chopped spring onion greens
food.description: Spring roll is a fried dish usually available as a dim sum. They typically contain minced pork, shredded carrot, bean sprouts and other vegetables served with Worcestershire sauce.

food.recipe: Our family recipe for sticky Chinese Chicken Wings! Tossed in a savoury, sweet, garlicky Asian marinade, then baked in the oven and basted until deeply golden and very, very sticky
food.step 1: mix the Chinese chicken wing marinade and pour over wings;
food.step 2: marinade for a mere 10 to 15 minutes – don’t marinade for longer otherwise it will make the wings too salty and also makes the marinade watery (from drawing moisture out of the wings) which makes it harder to baste;
food.step 3: Spread wings out on tray lined with foil and paper. Yes, use both. You’ll thank me later – when you’re sleeping tonight instead of scraping super-glued marinade off the tray; and
food.step 4: bake for 50 minutes until golden and sticky, basting 2 – 3 times with reserved marinade and tray juice
food.step 5: Shake excess marinade off wings (but reserve the marinade) and spread on baking tray - can be fairly snug but not super squished (use 2 trays if needed).
food.step6: Bake 45 - 50 minutes, basting with a brush at 25 minutes and 35 minutes, using the reserved marinade and juieces on the tray.
food.step7: The meat should be able to be pulled off the bones quite easily, they should be just starting to char on the edges and a sticky, dark red/golden colour all over.
food.step8: Sprinkle with garnishes - coriander/cilantro leaves, sesame seeds, chilli, sliced shallots/scallions - then serve!
food.description: One medium, baked chicken wing with skin provides 86 calories, 8 grams of protein, 0 grams of carbohydrate, 6 grams of fat, 2 grams of saturated fat, 3 grams of monounsaturated fat, 1 gram of polyunsaturated fat, and 143 milligrams of sodium.

food.recipe: Southern sweet tea, perfect for hot summer days
food.step 1: Sprinkle a pinch of baking soda into a 64-ounce, heat-proof, glass pitcher. Pour in boiling water, and add tea bags. Cover, and allow to steep for 15 minutes.
food.step 2: Remove tea bags, and discard; stir in sugar until dissolved. Pour in cool water, then refrigerate until cold.
food.description: Sweet tea is most commonly made by adding sugar or simple syrup to black tea either while the tea is brewing or still hot, although artificial sweeteners are also frequently used. Sweet tea is almost always served ice cold. It may sometimes be flavored, most commonly with lemon but also with peach, raspberry, or mint.

food.recipe: Prepare the onions, avocado dip, and beans as directed, in that order.
food.step 1: In a large bowl, combine beef, egg, onion, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Roll into meatballs about 1 to 1 1/2 inches in size.
food.step 2: In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the meatballs until browned on all sides.
food.step 3: In a separate medium bowl, mix together the water, vinegar, ketchup, cornstarch, sugar and soy sauce. Pour over the meatballs, and allow sauce to thicken. Continue to heat until the sauce just starts to bubble.
food.description: These meatballs are baked in the oven in a retro sweet and sour sauce that can't be beat!

food.recipe: Truly amazing vegetarian tacos featuring easy-to-make refried beans, quick-pickled onions, and creamy avocado sauce! Your whole family will love these meatless tacos. Recipe yields 8 hearty tacos (about 4 servings)
food.step 1: Prepare the onions, avocado dip, and beans as directed, in that order.
food.step 2: Once they’re ready, warm the tortillas in a large skillet over medium heat in batches, flipping to warm each side. Alternatively, you can warm them directly over a low flame on a gas range. Stack the warmed tortillas on a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm
food.step 3: To assemble the tacos, spread refried beans down the center of each tortilla. Top with avocado dip and onions (for reference, I used all of the beans and about half of the avocado dip and onions). Finish the tacos with garnishes of your choice, and serve immediately.
food.step 4: Leftover components are best served separately; reheat the tortillas and beans before serving. Leftover pickled onions and avocado dip are great on quesadillas, nachos or tortilla chips, sandwiches, etc.
food.restaurants: ["That Place","The Ozona Westex Grill and Bar"]
food.description: A taco is a traditional Mexican dish consisting of a small hand-sized corn or wheat tortilla topped with a filling. The tortilla is then folded around the filling and eaten by hand.

food.recipe: Taiyaki kind of resembles the Koi nobori (carp shaped streamers) that families raise up outside the house to wish the success for lives of the boys in the family
food.step 1: Divide the An to 6 x 40g each and shape them into a 10cm long cylinder with cling wrap and set aside.
food.step 2: Sift the flour and baking powder in a large bowl and make a well in the centre.
food.step 3: Mix all the wet ingredients together and pour it into the well of flour.
food.step 4: Combine them but try not to overmix.
food.step 5: Place some cling wrap over the bowl and refrigerate for about 30 minutes to rest the batter.
food.step6: Heat the taiyaki pan over low-medium heat and pour about 2 tbs batter on on side of the pan. Pour the batter from the top edge so that the batter will dribble down to the bottom of the pan.
food.step7: Place a roll of sweet red bean paste in the centre and pour more batter (about 2 tbs) over the paste.
food.step8: Press the pan and cook each side for 3-5 minutes over low heat.
food.step9: When both sides have cooked, remove the Taiyaki carefully
food.step10: Repeat the above process for the remaining batter and An.
food.ingredients: 1 cup plain flour1 cup plain flour
food.description: Taiyaki is a Japanese fish-shaped cake. It imitates the shape of the tai, which it is named after. The most common filling is red bean paste that is made from sweetened azuki beans. Other common fillings may be custard, chocolate, cheese, or sweet potato.

food.recipe: This is the season for new harvest rice so we’ll be making Takikomi Gohan with lots of mushrooms. The aroma of the mushrooms has permeated the entire dish, making it exceptionally delicious!
food.step 1: Rinse the rice beforehand and place it into a rice cooker.
food.step 2: Add the kombu and bonito dashi stock but use slightly less liquid compared to regular steamed rice. Distribute the rice evenly.
food.step 3: Next, cut the chicken breast into 1cm (0.4") cubes
food.step 4: Place the chicken pieces into a bowl. Add the sake, salt, soy sauce and mirin, and lightly stir.
food.step 5: And now, let’s cut the vegetables. Cut about a 3cm (1.2") thick piece of the carrot. Slice it into 5mm (0.2") slices and chop it into fine strips.
food.step6: Then, add the carrot to the bowl.
food.step7: Make numerous shallow cuts around the gobo, burdock root lengthwise.
food.step8: Then, shave the gobo with a knife while gradually rotating it. This cutting method, known as Sasagaki will help to make the firm gobo root easier to eat.
food.step9: Lightly rinse to keep it from discoloring, squeeze out the water and place it into the bowl.
food.step10: Detach the stem of the shiitake mushroom and remove the bottom end. Slice the cap into 6mm (0.2) slices. Thinly slice the stem using diagonal cuts.
food.ingredient 2: 180 ml        Dashi Stock kombu and bonito
food.description: Takikomi Gohan is a Japanese rice dish which short-grain rice are cooked with vegetables, mushrooms, seafood or meat. It's usually seasoned with Japanese stock (dashi) and soy sauce.

food.recipe: Tempura is a popular Japanese dish of vegetables and seafood coated in a very light and airy batter and fried to perfection. It's served at Japanese restaurants worldwide, but it's also fun and easy to make from scratch at home.
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: In a small bowl, sift the flour once or twice to remove any clumps and to make it light and soft. Set aside.
food.step 3: In a separate medium bowl, gently beat egg until the yolk and egg whites are just barely incorporated.
food.step 4: Combine the water and ice cubes in a cup. Using a strainer, strain the water (you should have 1 cup of ice-cold water) and add it to the bowl with the beaten egg. Make sure you do not actually add ice cubes to the tempura batter.
food.step 5: Add the sifted flour into the bowl with the egg and water mixture and lightly combine the flour using chopsticks. Be careful not to overmix the batter; it should be a little lumpy.
food.step6: The batter is now ready for immediate use. If for some reason the batter won't be used right away, place it in the refrigerator temporarily (for a few short minutes) to keep it ice cold until you're ready to deep-fry your tempura. Do not store in the fridge for an extended period of time.
food.description: Tempura is a Japanese dish usually consisting of seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep fried. The dish was influenced by fritter-cooking techniques introduced by the Portuguese residing in Nagasaki in the 16th century.

food.recipe: however, you can use any idli rice or dosa rice. i do not recommend to use basmati rice for this recipe. secondly, i have added finely chopped green chillies as a topping, skip this if you do not like it or serving it to kids. lastly, if you are using an idli batter then make sure the batter is bit thin but comparatively thicker to dosa batter.
food.step 1: firstly, in a large bowl take 2 onion, 2 chilli, 1 inch ginger, few curry leaves, 2 tbsp coriander and ½ tsp salt.
food.step 2: mix well making sure everything is well combined
food.step 3: also, heat the griddle and pour a ladleful of dosa batter.
food.step 4: spread out in a circular motion slightly thick than regular masala dosa.
food.step 5: now spread the toppings on top of the uttappa evenly.
food.step6: after the topping have been added press gently so the toppings are pressed into the batter.
food.step7: cover it and let it cook for 1-2 minutes in low flame.
food.step8: flip over on the other side once the uttappa turns golden brown.
food.step9: finally, onion uttapam is ready to be served with chutney of your choice.
food.ingredients: 2 onion, finely chopped2 onion, finely chopped
food.ingredient 6: 3 cup dosa rice / sona masuri rice
food.ingredient 8: 1 cup urad dal1 cup urad dal
food.description: Uttapam is a type of dosa from South India. Unlike a typical dosa, which is crisp and crepe-like, uttapam is thicker, with toppings.

food.recipe: Vanilla Pound Cake is a classic recipe that’s sweet, dense, and incredibly EASY to make with simple ingredients and bakes in only 60 minutes!
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and flour and butter an 8x4 inch loaf pan.
food.step 2: To a stand mixer add the butter and sugar on high speed and beat until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes.
food.step 3: On medium speed add in the vanilla and the eggs one at a time, then the milk until fully combined.
food.step 4: Add in the flour, baking powder and salt until just combined then pour into the loaf pan and bake for 60 minutes.
food.description: Pound cake is a type of cake traditionally made with a pound of each of four ingredients: flour, butter, eggs, and sugar. Pound cakes are generally baked in either a loaf pan or a Bundt mold, and served either dusted with powdered sugar, lightly glazed, or sometimes with a coat of icing.

food.recipe: These are crisp and tasty veg cutlet made with mixed vegetables. These vegan patties are a good tea time snack.
food.step 1: Boil 1 large potato, 1 medium carrot and ½ cup matar (green peas) very well in a steamer or pressure cooker.
food.step 2: When the veggies are cooling, blitz 4 to 5 slices of bread in a food processor or grinder till fine to get bread crumbs.
food.step 3: Keep the bread crumbs aside in a plate or tray.
food.step 4: Peel the potatoes and carrots and chop them. Take them in a bowl along with the cooked peas.
food.step 5: Mash them with a masher or fork.
food.step6: Add 1 tsp crushed ginger+green chili paste, ¼ tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp cumin powder, ½ tsp garam masala powder, 3 tbsp bread crumbs and salt as required.
food.step7: Instead of bread crumbs you can also add 2 to 3 slices of bread dipped in water and then squeezed completely of the water.
food.step8: Mix everything very well. Check the taste and add more salt or the spice powders if required.
food.step9: In another small bowl, take 2 tbsp maida (all purpose flour) and 3 tbsp water.
food.step10: Stir and mix this mixture to get a smooth paste without any lumps.
food.step11: Now take the cutlet mixture in a plate and using a cutlet mould, shape it or make small to medium-sized round cutlets by rolling and flattening the mixture in your palms.
food.ingredients: ½ cup boiled and chopped carrots or 1 medium carrot, steamed or boiled
food.ingredient 2: 1 cup boiled and chopped potatoes or 100 grams or 1 large potato, steamed or boiled
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup fresh green peas , steamed or boiled
food.ingredient 4: ½ inch ginger + 1 or 2 green chilies crushed to a paste½ inch ginger + 1 or 2 green chilies crushed to a paste
food.ingredient 7: 3 tablespoons bread crumbs or bread pulp from 2 to 3 bread slices
food.ingredient 10: ⅓ cup bread crumbs or add as required⅓ cup bread crumbs or add as required
food.ingredient 11: 2 to 3 tablespoons oil for shallow frying

food.recipe: Delicious and creamy restaurant style vegetable kofta curry recipe. This dish is made with a mix of vegetables like carrots, cauliflower, capsicum, peas and potatoes. The vegetables are not cooked but minced raw.
food.step 1: In a food processor add the cauliflower, carrots, corn, peas and pulse to get a grated like consistency. Remove this mixture into a bowl.
food.step 2: To this add the mashed/grated boiled potato, green chilli,coriander leaves and all the dry spices, salt pepper. Give it a quick stir.
food.step 3: Sprinkle some water (not too much just a little to wet the bread) on the bread and crush it, add this to the mixture along with cornflour.
food.step 4: Add a tbsp of cornflour at a time and add as much required to bind the mixture.
food.step 5: Mix everything well.
food.step6: Now make small balls of this mixture and keep aside.
food.step7: In the mean while heat some oil in a vessel and once hot add a tiny piece of the mixture to test.
food.step8: If it turns dark too quickly the oil is too hot, lower the flame. If its crumbling that means you can add more bread or cornflour. If its turning golden brown slowly that means the oil temp is perfect.
food.step9: Go ahead and add the kofta's. Dont add too many at a time as that will lower the oil temperature and cause the kofta's to crumble.
food.step10: Once golden brown flip and let the other side cook and get the golden brown color.
food.step11: Drain and remove on the absorbent paper.
food.step12: Continue frying the remaining kofta's in the same manner.
food.ingredients: 1 large potato boiled mashed/grated or 2 small
food.ingredient 6: 2 green chillies finely chopped, adjust to taste
food.ingredient 7: handful of coriander leaves finely chopped
food.ingredient 9: 2 tbsp of cornflour or as needed
food.ingredient 13: 1 tsp cumin seeds powder1 tsp cumin seeds powder

food.recipe: A Victoria Sponge was the favorite sponge cake of Queen Victoria, and has since become a tried-and-true recipe for tea-time sponge cakes. Victoria Sponges are generally filled with jam, and are undecorated on the top, but you can serve each piece with a dollop of whipped cream, or shake some powdered sugar over the top if you'd like.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch springform pan.
food.step 2: Beat butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color. Add room-temperature eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into butter mixture before adding the next. Beat in vanilla. Pour in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing until just incorporated. Pour batter into prepared pan.
food.step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool the cake in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn the cake out onto a wire rack to cool completely
food.step 4: This cake can be served as is, just dusted with confectioners' sugar. Alternately, cut the cake in half horizontally and sandwich the layers together with jam or custard.

food.recipe: This fried wonton recipe is tender wrappers stuffed with ground pork, mushrooms and seasonings, then deep fried to crispy golden brown perfection
food.step 1: Place the pork, mushrooms, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, salt, pepper, ginger and garlic in a large bowl. Stir until thoroughly combined.
food.step 2: Place one wonton wrapper on a flat surface. Keep the remaining wrappers covered so that they don't dry out. Brush the two edges of the wonton wrapper farthest away from you with water.
food.step 3: Place 3/4 teaspoon of the pork mixture onto the center of the wrapper. Fold the wrapper over into a triangle shape, then bring the two bottom corners together to make a purse shape. Use a bit of water to "glue" the bottom corners together.
food.step 4: Repeat the process with the remaining wrappers and filling.
food.step 5: Heat 3 inches of oil in a large deep pot to 375 degrees F.
food.step6: Fry 6-8 of the wontons at a time for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and repeat the process with the remaining wontons.
food.step7: Serve immediately, with a side of sweet chili sauce if desired.
food.ingredient 13: sweet chili sauce for serving optional
food.description: A wonton is a type of Chinese dumpling commonly found across regional styles of Chinese cuisine.

food.recipe: Chicken yakitori is an easy Japanese grilled recipe served on skewers. The meat is basted with a savory-sweet sauce as it cooks over a hot barbecue grill. A quick appetizer for a crowd or dinner served with a few extra sides
food.step 1: In a medium-size pot whisk together soy sauce, water, mirin, rice vinegar, sugar, ginger, garlic, and cornstarch.
food.step 2: Bring mixture to a boil, constantly whisk until sauce is slightly thickened, about 1 minute.
food.step 3: Transfer 1 cup of the sauce to a bowl to use for basting the chicken.
food.step 4: Thread cut pieces of chicken on wooden skewers that have been soaked in water for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper on both sides.
food.step 5: Drizzle both sides of skewers with a small amount of oil to prevent sticking when cooking.
food.step6: Preheat grill over medium-high heat. Use a paper towel dipped in oil to clean and grease the grill grates.
food.step7: Once the grill is hot add the skewers and cook for 4 minutes. Flip over and baste the cooked side with the sauce. Cook 4 minutes.
food.step8: Flip skewer over, baste with sauce, cook 2 minutes covered.
food.step9: Flip skewer over again, baste, cook 2 minutes covered.
food.step10: Repeat flipping, basting and covered cooking 2 additional times, 16 minutes total cooking time.
food.step11: Sprinkle chicken yakitori skewers with sesame seeds. Serve immediately with additional sauce.
food.ingredient 9: 2 pounds chicken thighs, boneless, skinless, cut into 1” by 1 ¼” pieces
food.ingredient 10: 8 bamboo skewers, or metal skewers8 bamboo skewers, or metal skewers
food.ingredient 11: kosher salt, as needed for seasoingkosher salt, as needed for seasoing
food.ingredient 12: black pepper, as needed for seasoning
food.ingredient 14: 1 teaspoon sesame seeds1 teaspoon sesame seeds
food.description: Yakitori is a Japanese type of skewered chicken. Its preparation involves skewering the meat with kushi, a type of skewer typically made of steel, bamboo, or similar materials. Afterwards, they are grilled over a charcoal fire. During or after cooking, the meat is typically seasoned with tare sauce or salt.

food.recipe: A great, quick and easy recipe for Yorkshire pudding. Everybody loves 'em!
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
food.step 2: In a medium bowl, beat eggs with milk. Stir in flour. Set aside.
food.step 3: Divide butter evenly into the twelve cups of a muffin tin, about 1/2 teaspoon per cup. Place tin in oven to melt butter, 2 to 5 minutes. Remove tin from oven, and distribute batter evenly among buttery cups.
food.step 4: Bake in preheated oven 5 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake 25 minutes more or until puffed and golden.
food.description: Yorkshire pudding is a common English side dish consisting of a baked pudding made from batter consisting of eggs, flour, and milk or water. It is a versatile food that can be served in numerous ways depending on the choice of ingredients, the size of the pudding, and the accompanying components of the dish.

food.recipe: Five Spice Roasted Peanuts for this month’s Recipe Redux Theme “A Nutty Nut Day.” Today is National Nut Day so we’re all sharing healthy recipes featuring nuts.
food.step 1: Put water, salt, sugar, five spice powder and garlic in a large pot. Stir to mix well and bring to a boil. Add peanuts and mix well with liquid. Bring to a boil again; reduce heat to medium and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Turn heat off and leave peanuts in the pot for 1/2-1 hour, stirring 2-3 times; drain
food.step 2: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Spread boiled peanuts on Silplat lined baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, stirring once or twice. Reduce heat to 250 degrees and continue roasting for 1 1/2 - 2 hours, stirring the peanuts once or twice, checking for brownness. Turn off oven, open the oven door for 5 minutes to lower the temperature, and leave the peanuts in the oven another hour or two, or overnight to crisp up.
food.ingredients: 4 cups raw shelled peanuts skin on
food.description: Chinese Five-Spice Peanuts. Chinese Five-Spice is a blend made of (most commonly) cinnamon, cloves, star anise, fennel, and Szechuan peppercorns. These peanuts make a great party snack, plus they'll keep well in a tightly-sealed container on your countertop for a few days, or more.

food.recipe: Typically, 1 medium apple yields 1-1/3 cups sliced. For 6 cups of sliced apples, you will need about 5 medium apples. Plus, you'll have a little left over for a snack or to use in any of these apple recipes
food.step 1: In a small bowl, combine the sugars, flour and spices; set aside. In a large bowl, toss apples with lemon juice. Add sugar mixture; toss to coat.
food.step 2: Line a 9-in. pie plate with bottom crust; trim even with edge. Fill with apple mixture; dot with butter. Roll remaining crust to fit top of pie; place over filling. Trim, seal and flute edges. Cut slits in crust.
food.step 3: Beat egg white until foamy; brush over crust. Sprinkle with sugar. Cover edges loosely with foil.
food.step 4: Bake at 375° for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly, 20-25 minutes longer. Cool on a wire rack.
food.ingredient 7: 6 to 7 cups thinly sliced peeled tart apples
food.time: Preparation Time : 20 min , Bake time : 45 min
food.restaurants: ["cafe madras","hotel ram ashray","chaitanya","prakash shkahari kendera","banana leaf''","arya bhavan","trupti","A.Rama Nayak's Udipi Shri Krishna Boarding'","Diva Maharashtracha"]
food.description: An apple pie is a pie in which the principal filling ingredient is apple. It is often served with whipped cream, ice cream, or cheddar cheese. It is generally double-crusted, with pastry both above and below the filling; the upper crust may be solid or latticed.

food.recipe: This has all the flavor and heartiness of a great samosa without the frying. Although this is an easier, healthier version of the fried samosa, it tastes very authentic. This recipe has the added advantage that you can make ahead and freeze uncooked samosas, simply skip the egg brushing, freeze until you're ready and cook at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve warm, plain, or with chutney.
food.step 1: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer potatoes to a bowl; coarsely mash.
food.step 2: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
food.step 3: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir onions, coriander seed, curry powder, ginger, salt, turmeric, cumin, allspice, cayenne pepper, and cinnamon until onion is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove skillet from heat and stir tomatoes and peas into onion mixture; pour into mashed potatoes and thoroughly mix. Cool completely.
food.step 4: Cut each pie crust into 8 even triangles. Spoon filling onto the wide end of each triangle; fold corners over filling creating a triangular 'hat' shape. Pinch the dough together to form a seal. Brush egg white over each samosa and arrange on a baking sheet.
food.step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until samosas are golden brown, about 15 minutes
food.ingredient 16: 2 eaches egg whites, beaten, or as needed
food.restaurants: ["Pritam Da Dhaba","Angrezi Dhaba","Tamasha","Gallops","Persian Darbar","Lucky Restaurant","3 Wise Monkeys","Sindhful","Light Of Bharat","BKC DIVE","Oheka"]
food.description: This has all the flavor and heartiness of a great samosa without the frying. Although this is an easier, healthier version of the fried samosa, it tastes very authentic. Serve warm, plain, or with chutney.

food.recipe: Serve this quick after-school snack to your kids as an alternative to traditional fried cheesesticks.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 425°.
food.step 2: Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1/3 cup panko to pan, and cook for 2 minutes or until toasted, stirring frequently. Remove from heat, and place the panko in a shallow dish.
food.step 3: Cut mozzarella sticks into 1-inch pieces. Working with one piece at a time, dip cheese in egg substitute; dredge in panko. Place cheese on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425° for 3 minutes or until the cheese is softened and thoroughly heated.
food.step 4: Pour the marinara sauce into a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH 1 minute or until thoroughly heated, stirring after 30 seconds. Serve with mozzarella pieces.
food.ingredient 5: 1/4 cup lower-sodium marinara sauce (such as McCutcheon's)
food.restaurants: ["shree gangour sweets","chandu halwai grant road","m n mithaiwala","punjabi sweet house and restaurants","adarsh mithai mandir","vyanjan","tharu sweets","sindhu sweets","jhama sweets ghatkopar east"]
food.description: a delicious breaded cheese stick oven baked to perfection. Paired with a warm marinara sauce it makes a great simple homemade appetizer for parties!

food.recipe: This shockingly easy banoffee pie recipe combines a crunchy graham cracker crust, soft and sweet dulce de leche, thick slices of fresh banana, and a mountain of billowy whipped cream. Everyone who tries a slice is instantly hooked.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).
food.step 2: If you’re starting out with full-sheet graham crackers, you can use a food processor or blender to grind them up. Or crush them in a zipped top bag with a rolling pin. Mix the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and granulated sugar together in a medium bowl until combined. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Press the mixture into the bottom and slightly up the sides of a 9-inch pie dish. Make sure it is tight and compact. Use the bottom of a flat measuring cup to press it down tightly. Bake the crust for 15-16 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for at least 15 minutes (and up to 2 days) before adding the layers. Meanwhile, make the whipped cream. (Next step.)
food.step 3: For the whipped cream: Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks and are the perfect consistency for topping and piping on desserts.
food.step 4: Spread dulce de leche on top of the crust. Arrange banana slices in 1-2 layers on top of the dulce de leche, then spread whipped cream on top.
food.step 5: Refrigerate pie uncovered for at least 2 hours and up to 1 day. Garnish with toppings before serving, if desired.
food.step6: Cover and store leftover pie in the refrigerator for up to 5 days
food.ingredients: 2 cups (480ml) cold heavy cream or heavy whipping cream
food.ingredient 2: 1/4 cup confectioners’ sugar or granulated sugar*
food.ingredient 4: optional toppings: chocolate shavings, chopped nuts, or toffee bits for garnish
food.time: Prep Time: 30 minutesSetting Time: 5 hours 20 minutesTotal Time: 5 hours 50 minutes
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Banoffee pie is an English dessert pie made from bananas, cream and toffee, combined either on a buttery biscuit base or one made from crumbled biscuits and butter. Some versions of the recipe also include chocolate, coffee or both.

food.recipe: The American Biscuit is very similar to the British Scone. To make a good Biscuit, the correct mixing of the ingredients is crucial.
food.step 1: Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and place the oven rack in the center of the oven. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
food.step 2: n a large mixing bowl, sift or whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar (if using). Cut the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs (use a pastry blender, two knives, or fingertips). Add the milk and lightly beaten egg and mix just until the dough comes together (the texture should be sticky, moist, and still lumpy)
food.step 3: Place the dough on a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until it just comes together. Roll or pat the dough to about a 3/4 inch (2 cm) thickness. Cut out biscuits with a lightly floured 3 inch (7.5 cm) round cookie cutter. Place on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with the milk or cream. Bake for about 15 to 17 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of a biscuit comes out clean. Remove from oven and place on a wire rack. Serve warm with butter.
food.ingredient 5: 1/2 cup (113 grams) cold unsalted butter, cut into chunks
food.ingredient 6: 3/4 cup (180 ml/grams) cold milk (whole or 2% reduced fat)
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Most other countries probably wouldn't consider the humble biscuit to be substantial enough to be a snack, but the British practically replace entire meals with tea and biscuits.

food.recipe: These mysore bajji are crisp, soft and fluffy fritters made with urad dal, some spices and fresh coconut bits.
food.step 1: Soak the urad dal overnight in enough water or for 5-6 hours.
food.step 2: Drain the urad dal. in a mixer or wet grinder, grind the lentils till smooth and fluffy, adding very little water.
food.step 3: Pour the batter in a bowl.
food.step 4: Mix in all the ingredients, except oil.
food.step 5: Heat oil for deep frying in a kadai or fryer.
food.step6: Shape the batter in a round shape on your palms and slid these gently into the oil.
food.step7: Fry in medium hot oil till the bondas are crisp and golden.
food.step8: Drain them on kitchen towels to remove excess oil.
food.step9: Serve hot mysore bonda with coconut chutney.
food.step10: First fry the curry leaves in 1 or 2 tsp oil till they get crisp.
food.step11: Grind all the ingredients mentioned under the coconut chutney list, along with the fried curry leaves and oil, with little water.
food.step12: Serve the coconut chutney with the mysore bonda.
food.ingredient 7: 8 to 10 curry leaves - chopped8 to 10 curry leaves - chopped
food.ingredient 10: water as required for soaking and grinding urad dal
food.ingredient 11: oil for shallow or deep frying the vadas
food.description: Bonda is a typical South Indian snack that has various sweet and spicy versions in different regions. Most common of which is "Aloo Bonda", and other region specific variations including potato replaced with sweet potato, tapioca, grated pineapple, green peas, etc.

food.recipe: Bow tie pasta recipe with vegetables.This is a very basic masala pasta recipe made with bow tie pasta variety.I got this pack of bow tie pasta as a gift hamper and the last cup was waiting to be used up so made this easy and quick pasta for breakfas
food.step 1: Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in the oil, flour, garlic and seasonings until blended. Gradually add the milk, broth and water. Bring to a boil; cook and stir until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.
food.step 2: Remove from the heat; stir in cheese and sour cream. Drain pasta; toss with sauce.
food.description: Bow Ties are a popular treat in which deep-fried egg roll wrappers are dipped in brown sugar. Children love this sweet treat.

food.recipe: This is a crisp and tasty bread roll with a soft spiced mashed potato filling.
food.step 1: Rinse 3 to 4 large potatoes or 425 grams potatoes very well in water. Then place them in a 3 litre pressure cooker. Add water just about covering the potatoes. Also add ½ teaspoon salt.
food.step 2: Pressure cook the potatoes for 5 to 6 whistles on medium to medium-high flame.
food.step 3: When pressure settles down on its own, open the lid. Then check the potatoes with a knife, and it should slid easily. Let the potatoes become warm.
food.step 4: Then peel and grate them. You can even mash them with a potato masher.
food.step 5: Add 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves and 1 green chili, finely chopped.
food.step6: Add all the spice powders.
food.step7: Also add salt as per taste. You can add ½ to 1 teaspoon lemon juice or ½ to 1 teaspoon dry pomegranate seeds powder instead of dry mango powder
food.step8: Mix very well. Check the taste and add more spice powders, salt and dry mango powder if required.
food.step9: Take a portion of the mixture and make small to medium rolls of potato filling. The size of the rolls will depend on the size of the bread.
food.step10: Take the bread slices and slice off the side crusts.
food.step11: Take ⅓ cup water in a plate or a bowl. Dip one bread slice in the water completely.
food.step12: Just keep the bread in water and remove after 1 to 2 seconds. Just let the bread absorb the water. It should get damp but not overly. Otherwise the bread slice breaks. The idea is to make the bread moist enough so that it becomes pretty flexible which would make the rolling and shaping easier.
food.step13: Press the bread between your palms so that the excess water is drained.
food.ingredients: 3 to 4 large potatoes or 425 grams of potatoes3 to 4 large potatoes or 425 grams of potatoes
food.ingredient 7: ¼ teaspoon crushed black pepper or ¼ teaspoon black pepper powder¼ teaspoon crushed black pepper or ¼ teaspoon black pepper powder
food.ingredient 8: ¼ teaspoon garam masala powder or add as required¼ teaspoon garam masala powder or add as required
food.ingredient 10: ½ to 1 teaspoon dry mango powder or add as per taste - dry pomegranate seeds powder can be also be added instead of mango powder
food.description: Bread roll is a tasty snack that can be made in a jiffy if you have leftover boiled potatoes. These bread roll are a favorite At Homeand I usually pair them with the evening chai as a snack.

food.recipe: Salads usually require forks, but Grace Parisi transforms a classic Caesar into a clever finger food. She tosses chopped endives with a lemony dressing, then spoons the mixture inside elegant endive spears, topping it with cheese and crunchy mini croutons
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 350°. In a medium bowl, toss the bread with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Spread the bread on a baking sheet and toast for about 10 minutes, stirring once, until golden and crisp.
food.step 2: Meanwhile, in the same bowl, using a spoon, mash the anchovies to a paste with the garlic and a pinch of salt. Whisk in the mayonnaise, lemon zest and lemon juice, then whisk in the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the 1/4 cup of grated cheese.
food.step 3: Trim the endives and remove the 60 largest leaves from 6 of the heads. Stack the leaves and trim them to about 4 inches. Thinly slice the remaining endive, along with the trimmings of the 6 other heads (you should have about 3 cups), and toss with the dressing. Spoon the salad onto each spear and garnish with the croutons and grated cheese. Serve immediately.
food.ingredient 5: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
food.ingredient 8: 1/4 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, plus more for garnish
food.description: A Caesar salad is a green salad of romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, anchovies, garlic, Dijon mustard, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. In its original form, this salad was prepared and served tableside.

food.recipe: Treat yourself with this super moist Japanese sponge cake with a hint of sweetness from honey! Made with only 4 ingredients, Japanese Castella Cake is a very popular confectionary in Japan. Try this delicious cake for your weekend baking project. It makes the perfect holiday or hostess gift too.
food.step 1: Gather all the ingredients.
food.step 2: Cut parchment paper to fit the baking pans (See the video for this process).
food.step 3: Preheat oven to 320 ºF (160 ºC)
food.step 4: Sift the bread flour with the sifter or a fine-meshed strainer twice. Holding the handle with one hand and tapping the strainer gently with the other, the flour will gradually sift through the strainer.
food.step 5: Add 2 ½ Tbsp warm water to honey and whisk well.
food.step6: Fit the mixer with the whisk attachment. Crack eggs into the bowl and vigorously whisk until combined.
food.step7: Add the sugar.
food.step8: Beat the eggs and sugar on high speed (Speed 10) for 5 minutes (See Notes).  The volume of the beaten eggs will increase about 4 times. The texture will be thick and the color will be pale yellow. When you stop the mixer and lift the whisk attachment, the mixture should fall in ribbons
food.ingredients: 6 large eggs (50 g each w/o shell) (at room temperature - very important!
food.ingredient 3: 200 g bread flour (1 ½ cup + 2 ½ Tbsp) (See Notes)
food.description: Castella is a kind of Wagashi originally developed in Japan based on the "Nanban confectionery" transmitted from Portugal. There is no confectionery called “Castella” in Portugal, and the prototype confectionery described later also differs in appearance and manufacturing method from Kasutera.

food.recipe: Cheesy Chicken Tikka Recipe is a delicious and indulgent party appetizer with double marinated chicken tikka with lovely melt in the mouth cheese. Serve it along with Dahi Pudina Chutney and some pickled onions.
food.step 1: To begin making the Cheesy Chicken Tikka Recipe, thoroughly wash and clean the chicken.
food.step 2: *For the first marination:
food.step 3: To marinate the chicken, in a mixing bowl, add chicken pieces, ginger paste, garlic paste, black pepper powder, and lemon juice.
food.step 4: Coat well. Cover and rest for 15-20 minutes.
food.step 5: For the second marination:
food.step6: In another bowl, combine the egg, cheese, cream, corn flour, green chilli, coriander leaves, nutmeg powder, mace powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
food.step7: After 15-20 minutes add the marinated chicken in the second marination mix.
food.step8: Preheat the oven at 180 C. Put an aluminum foil on the baking tray. Take wooden or metal skewer. Grease them with oil/butter.
food.step9: Now stick the marinated chicken pieces on the skewer, preferably 4 to 5 pieces on 1 skewer. Put them on the tray and drizzle some oil and cook for 20 minutes.
food.step10: After 7-8 minutes turn each skewer and cook the other side. If you still feel that the tikkas are becoming a little dry, apply some oil/butter on them.
food.step11: Stove Top Method:
food.step12: Heat a tava or griddle. Apply some butter on it. When it starts to sizzle put the skewers on the tava. Turn them from time to time. Cook till they turn golden brown on all sides. Serve with some salad by the side.
food.step13: Serve Cheesy Chicken Tikka Recipe along with dip like Pudina Dahi Chutney and another appetizer like Smoked Tandoori Paneer Tikka Recipe for your party appetisers.
food.situation: The Biryani Life , Bandra | SLAY Coffee , Bandra
food.description: Cheesy chicken tikka is a party appetizer that just melts in your mouth. The taste is incredibly cheesy and yummy.

food.recipe: My family absolutely loves this easy Chicken Chimichangas recipe! A delicious crispy burrito served topped with sour cream, guacamole and salsa
food.step 1: Cook chicken breasts in frying pan until tender and no longer pink. Allow to rest for a few minutes before chopping.
food.step 2: Add refried beans, chicken, cheese, salsa, spices, and green onions to a mix bowl and mix to combine.
food.step 3: Place about 1/2 cup of the chicken mixture in the center of each tortilla.
food.step 4: Fold opposite sides over filling and roll up like a burrito
food.step 5: For baked chimichangas, preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Brush chimichangas lightly with oil and bake for about 25 minutes, until golden and crispy.
food.step6: For pan fried chimichangas, heat a skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add oil to skillet and place chimichangas seam side down. Turn lightly every 2-30 seconds until lightly golden on all sides.
food.step7: Serve warm, topped with salsa and sour cream and a side of Authentic Mexican Rice .
food.ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken , chopped or shredded
food.ingredient 7: 1 cup shredded cheese , cheddar or Mexican blend
food.description: Chicken Chimichangas. ... A large flour tortilla filled with shredded chicken, refried beans, cheese, salsa and spices, rolled up like a burrito and then pan fried or baked. Served topped with sour cream, guacamole and salsa, this Mexican inspired recipe is delicious!

food.recipe: This flavorful recipe is definitely on my weeknight dinner rotation. The chicken fajita marinade in these popular wraps is mouthwatering. They go together in a snap and always get raves! —Julie Sterchi, Campbellsville, Kentucky
food.step 1: In a large bowl, combine 2 tablespoons oil, lemon juice and seasonings; add the chicken. Turn to coat; cover. Refrigerate for 1-4 hours.
food.step 2: In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, saute peppers and onions in remaining oil until crisp-tender. Remove and keep warm.
food.step 3: Drain chicken, discarding marinade. In the same skillet, cook chicken over medium-high heat until no longer pink, 5-6 minutes. Return pepper mixture to pan; heat through.
food.ingredient 9: 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, optional
food.ingredient 10: 1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips
food.description: A fajita in Tex-Mex and Mexican cuisine is any grilled meat that is usually served as a taco on a flour or corn tortilla

food.recipe: Vinny Dotolo and Jon Shook spent a month perfecting their creamy chicken-liver mousse, topped with a jam of sweet sautéed shallots and balsamic vinegar.
food.step 1: In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Season the livers with salt and pepper. Cook over high heat until browned, 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
food.step 2: Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in the skillet. Add the onion and thyme and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the onion is softened, 10 minutes. Add the livers and cook, stirring, until heated through, 2 minutes; let cool. Discard the thyme. In a food processor, puree the livers and the remaining 6 tablespoons of butter until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve and season well with salt. Press plastic wrap onto the surface and refrigerate until chilled.
food.step 3: Brush the warm toasts with oil, rub with garlic and spread the liver mousse on top. Garnish with the Shallot Jam and serve.
food.ingredients: 1 stick plus 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened
food.description: Chicken livers are flambéed with bourbon and smeared on grilled bread with a smoky-sweet pecan garnish.

food.recipe: Chicken Marsala is an Italian-American dish of golden pan-fried chicken cutlets and mushrooms in a rich Marsala wine sauce.
food.step 1: Place the flour, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken to the bag; seal bag tightly and shake to coat chicken evenly. Set aside.
food.step 2: Heat the oil and 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. (Use a stainless steel pan for the best browning. Nonstick will work too, but you won’t get that nice golden color on the chicken.) Place the flour-dusted chicken in the pan, shaking off any excess first, and cook, turning once, until the chicken is golden and just barely cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes total. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.
food.step 3: Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter in the pan. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms begin to brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the shallots, garlic, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt; cook for 1 to 2 minutes more.
food.step 4: Add the broth, Marsala, heavy cream, thyme, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper; use a wooden spoon to scrape any brown bits from the pan into the liquid. Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, until the sauce is reduced by about half, slightly thickened, and darkened in color, 10 to 15 minutes (you’re going for a thin cream sauce; it won’t start to thicken until the very end of the cooking time). Add the chicken back to the pan, along with any juices that accumulated on the plate. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the chicken is warmed through and the sauce thickens a bit more, 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley, if using, and serve.
food.step 5: If your chicken breasts are large (like the ones in the photos that are about 3/4 lb. each), it’s best to first cut them horizontally to form four flat fillets, then pound them to an even 1/4-inch thickness.
food.step6: If you pound large chicken breasts without first halving them, they’ll be huge. Of course, you could also pound them thin first and then cut them in half vertically; the only drawback is that they’ll lose their natural shape (which, admittedly, is not a big deal!).
food.ingredients: 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, pounded ¼-inch thick (see note), or chicken tenderloins
food.ingredient 6: 1 (8-oz) package pre-sliced bella or button mushrooms
food.ingredient 7: tablespoons finely chopped shallots, from 1 medium shallot
food.ingredient 13: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, for serving (optional)
food.description: Chicken marsala is an Italian-American dish made from chicken breast and Marsala wine. It is a variation of traditional Italian scaloppina dishes, of which there are many varieties throughout Italy.

food.recipe: Chicken cubes and root vegetables wrapped in a flaky dough. These hearty pasties are sure to keep you warm and full this winter
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 180°C. Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and curry and fry until onions are soft but not brown. Add carrot and celery and cook for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 2: Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken and corn and stir until combined. Stir in flour, then gradually start adding stock, stirring, until mixture thickens. Set aside to cool.
food.step 3: Cut each pastry sheet into 4. Add about 2 tablespoons of the mixture to the centre of a piece of pastry. Fold over a corner diagonally to enclose the filling and form a triangle. Use a fork to seal the edges, then brush with milk or egg yolk.
food.step 4: Repeat with remaining pastry and mixture. Place on a lined baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden.
food.ingredient 9: 375ml (1 1/2 cups) Massel chicken style liquid stock
food.ingredient 11: Milk or egg yolk, to brush pastry
food.description: Jamie's Cornish pasty recipe goes down well with all the family; a great and tasty snack, full of goodness and Jamie's Cornish pasties are no different.

food.recipe: Kebabs are famous all over the world for all the right reasons. These are not only delicious and easy to eat but are also full of health, especially if you make them the ‘healthy way’.
food.step 1: Wash the veggies, drain the water and start with blending the finely chopped onions, green chillies, and coriander leaves in a blender and make a thick paste.
food.step 2: Add in the minced chicken and blend until all the ingredients are well combined. Take this out in a bowl and add all the spices and mix.
