food.step 3: Now add in the melted butter, lemon juice and bread crumbs. Combine all these well and let it rest for 30 minutes. Apply some butter on your hands and start sticking the minced chicken mix on the skewers.
food.step 4: Now, you can either put it in an oven or heat a tawa and apply some butter on it. Now take each skewer and roast it for 3-5 minutes on each side. Now that your kebabs are ready, serve them with green chutney and sliced onions.
food.description: Ever wondered why the phrase “say cheese” is used just before a photograph is clicked? Simply because ‘cheese’ makes one smile! Not only the word but cheese as a food makes a lot of palates happy. It is an inexpensive, versatile and nourishing food. We have our very own Indian version as well as the ones made from soy milk that are even healthier. Whichever form, this is one food that is loved by one and all!

food.recipe: This is an easy recipe for Chicken Tikka Masala--chicken marinated in yogurt and spices and then served in a tomato cream sauce. Serve with rice or warm pita bread.
food.step 1: Slice the chicken into bite-sized chunks. Combine the cubed chicken with the yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, salt, cumin, garam masala, and paprika and stir until well-coated.
food.step 2: Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
food.step 3: Preheat the oven to 500°F (260°C). Line a high-sided baking pan or roasting tray with parchment paper.
food.step 4: Place the marinated chicken pieces on bamboo or wooden skewers, then set them over the prepared baking pan, making sure there is space underneath the chicken to help distribute the heat more evenly. Bake for about 15 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges.
food.step 5: Make the sauce: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat, then sauté the onions, ginger, and garlic until tender but not browned. Add the cumin, turmeric, coriander, paprika, chili powder, and garam masala and stir constantly for about 30 seconds, until the spices are fragrant. Stir in the tomato puree, tomato sauce, and 1 ¼ cups of water, then bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes. Pour in the cream.
food.step6: Remove the chicken from the skewers and add to the sauce, cooking for another 1-2 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve over rice or alongside naan bread.
food.description: Chicken tikka masala is a dish of chunks of roasted marinated chicken in a spiced curry sauce. The sauce is usually creamy and orange-coloured. There are multiple claims to its place of origin such as the Indian subcontinent and the United Kingdom. It is among the United Kingdom's most popular dishes.

food.recipe: Chicken is a versatile meat that is able to take on many flavors. Depending on what you are looking for, it can be a perfect main dish any day of the week. This Chicken with Red Mole Sauce is flavorful, hearty, spicy and savory.
food.step 1: Cook the chicken in a pot of water with the onion, garlic, and the 3 peppercorns. Once the chicken is completely cooked, set it aside with 3 cups of the water that was used to cook the chicken.
food.step 2: Remove the stems and seeds from all of the chili peppers and place them in a pot of boiling water.After the peppers have boiled for 5 minutes, turn off the stove and let them sit for 15 minutes.
food.step 3: While the peppers are sitting in the water, pour ½ tbsp of vegetable oil into a pan and add the pumpkin seeds.
food.ingredient 8: peppers (Note:, can be found at most Latin American supermarkets or at Whole Foods stores.)
food.description: This Chicken with Red Mole Sauce is flavorful, hearty, spicy and savory. It takes about an hour to prepare, so it isn’t a quick dish. But the flavor more than makes up for it. It is a surprising sensation for the palate.

food.recipe: You call it Chili, we call it Chilli Con Carne. Whatever you know this as, the alluring smell as a pot of Chilli bubbles away on the stove is a universal language!!
food.step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and onion, cook for 1 minute, then add capsicum and cook for 2 minutes until onion is translucent.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and onion, cook for 1 minute, then add capsicum and cook for 2 minutes until onion is translucent.
food.step 3: Turn heat up to high and add beef. Cook, breaking it up as you go, until mostly browned.
food.step 4: Add remaining ingredients, with 1/2 cup of water for Quick Cook or 1 1/2 cups for Slow Cook. Bring to simmer, then adjust heat per step below:
food.step 5: Quick Cook - 20 to 40 minutes, uncovered, on medium low heat so it's bubbling gently; OR
food.step6: Slow Cook - 1.5 hours to 2 hours, covered, on low heat so it's bubbling very gently. (Note 3 Slow Cooker)
food.step8: Serve over rice, or ladle into bowls and serve with corn chips or warm tortillas on the side with Toppings of choice (Note 6). See Note 7 for more serving options. My usual: Either over rice or with corn chips, always with sour cream, cheese and coriander.
food.ingredient 4: 1 red capsicum (bell pepper), diced1 red capsicum (bell pepper), diced
food.ingredient 7: 800g / 28 oz can crushed tomato800g / 28 oz can crushed tomato
food.ingredient 8: 14 oz / 420g can red kidney beans , drained (or other beans
food.description: Chili con carne or chilli con carne, meaning 'chili with meat', also known as simply chili or chilli, is a spicy stew containing chili peppers, meat, and often tomatoes and beans. Other seasonings may include garlic, onions, and cumin. The original dish originated in southern Texas with working-class Mexican women.

food.recipe: This is the best chocolate chip cookie recipe ever! No funny ingredients, no chilling time, etc. Just a simple, straightforward, amazingly delicious, doughy yet still fully cooked,
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking pan with parchment paper and set aside.
food.step 2: In a separate bowl mix flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder. Set aside.
food.step 3: Cream together butter and sugars until combined.
food.step 4: Beat in eggs and vanilla until fluffy.
food.step 5: Mix in the dry ingredients until combined.
food.step6: Roll 2-3 TBS (depending on how large you like your cookies) of dough at a time into balls and place them evenly spaced on your prepared cookie sheets. (alternately, use a small cookie scoop to make your cookies).
food.step7: Bake in preheated oven for approximately 8-10 minutes. Take them out when they are just BARELY starting to turn brown.
food.step8: Let them sit on the baking pan for 2 minutes before removing to cooling rack.
food.ingredient 10: 2 cups chocolate chips (or chunks, or chopped chocolate)
food.description: A chocolate chip cookie is a drop cookie that originated in the United States and features chocolate chips or chocolate morsels as its distinguishing ingredient.

food.recipe: This classic chocolate mousse is light yet intensely chocolate. Don’t be fooled by the French name — it’s quick and easy to make!
food.step 1: Place the butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Break the chocolate into small pieces directly into the bowl. Microwave it in 20-second intervals, stirring between each bout of heat, until the chocolate is about 75% melted. Stir, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the chocolate completely. (Alternatively, place the chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl and place over a saucepan containing about 1 inch of barely simmering water
food.step 2: Stir with a wooden spoon until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth.) Let the mixture cool for a few minutes, then whisk in the egg yolks one at a time, mixing until smooth after each addition. Set aside.
food.step 3: n the bowl of a stand mixer or electric hand mixer, beat the egg whites on medium-high speed until foamy. Add the cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form (the peaks should be just starting to hold, and will melt back into themselves after a second)
food.step 4: Gradually beat in 1/4 cup of the sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form (the peaks will stand straight up when the beaters are lifted from the mixture). Using a large rubber spatula, fold the egg white mixture into the chocolate mixture until uniform. Set aside.
food.step 5: In another bowl, beat the heavy cream on medium-high speed until it begins to thicken up. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar and the vanilla and continue beating until the cream holds medium peaks (when you lift the beaters or whisk out of the bowl, the peaks will slightly droop down, but they won't lose their shape entirely).
food.step6: Fold the whipped cream into the chocolate mixture. Be sure it is fully incorporated but don't mix any more than necessary. Divide the mousse between 6 individual glasses, cover, and chill until set, at least 2 hours.
food.step7: Up to a few hours before serving, whip the cream until it begins to thicken up. Add the sugar and whip to medium peaks. Dollop the whipped cream over the mousse and top with chocolate shavings.
food.step8: Make-Ahead Instructions: Mousse can be made up to 1 day ahead of time. Cover with plastic wrap and keep chilled in the refrigerator. Add whipped cream topping and chocolate shavings up to a few hours before serving.
food.ingredient 3: 3 large eggs, yolks and whites separated
food.description: A mousse is a soft prepared food that incorporates air bubbles to give it a light and airy texture. It can range from light and fluffy to creamy and thick, depending on preparation techniques. A mousse may be sweet or savory.

food.recipe: If for some reason you don’t eat all your cochinita pibil at one sitting, it will keep for several days in the fridge. Achiote is an essential ingredient for this recipe, there is no substitute.
food.step 1: Marinate pork in achiote paste with orange juice, lime juice, salt: The night before or the morning of that you plan to serve this, mix the orange and lime juice with the achiote paste and salt in a blender until combined. Be sure to rinse the blender soon afterwards, as the achiote stains.
food.step 2: Cut the pork into chunks of about 2 inches square. Don’t trim the fat, as you will need it in the braising to come. You can always pick it out later. Put the pork in a non-reactive (glass, stainless steel or plastic) container, then pour over the marinade mixture.
food.step 3: Bake in oven 3 to 4 hours: Cooking this takes 3-4 hours, so plan ahead. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
food.step 4: Line a large casserole with a double layer of heavy-duty foil, or a triple layer of regular foil – you want a good seal. (Traditionally, cochinita pibil is wrapped in banana leaves, which add a wonderful flavor to the pibil. So, if banana leaves are available—you may be able to get them at the same store as the achiote paste, or at an Asian market—consider using them. Just heat the leaves first to make them more pliable.)
food.step 5: To serve, either use this as taco meat or eat it the way we do: Over rice, garnished with cilantro, lime wedges and queso seco, a Mexican dry cheese a little like Greek feta. Pickled red onions are a traditional garnish, and if you like them, they’re good, too.
food.ingredient 2: 1 cup orange juice, freshly squeezed if possible
food.ingredient 3: 1/2 cup lime juice, juice of 4-5 limes
food.ingredient 5: 3 ounces of red (rojo) achiote paste, available in Latin markets
food.ingredient 7: Dry Mexican cheese (queso seco), for garnish
food.description: Mexican cochinita pibil, or pulled pork shoulder marinated and braised in achiote paste, orange juice, and lime. ... Celebrate Cinco de Mayo with Simply Recipes contributor Hank Shaw‘s Cochinita Pibil, or pulled pork braised in citrus and achiote.

food.recipe: One of the greatest comfort foods of all time! A ground beef (mince) filling in a tasty gravy, topped with mashed potato. Make it a Shepherd's Pie simply by swapping the beef for lamb.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 1 minute. Then add carrots and celery. Cook for 3 minutes or until softened and sweet.
food.step 2: Turn heat up to high. Add beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until browned.
food.step 3: Add flour and mix in. Add tomato paste, broth, red wine, bouillon cube, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, bay leaves, salt and pepper.
food.step 4: Bring to simmer, then turn down heat so it is simmering rapidly - I have it on medium high. Cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it reduces down to a gravy consistency (Note 1) (see video). Taste then add more salt if desired.
food.step 5: Transfer to 6 cup pie dish (1.5 litre / quart). Cover, cool if you have time (even overnight). Cool filling = easier to top with mash (Note 2)
food.step6: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
food.step7: Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 minutes or until soft. Drain then return to pot on turned off stove. Shake briefly and allow to steam dry for 30 seconds or so (Note 3).
food.step8: Add butter and mash until melted, then add milk and salt. Mash until smooth.
food.step9: Spread onto pie, use a fork to rough up the surface (rougher surface = more golden bits). Sprinkle with paremsan, drizzle with butter (or skip this and just drizzle with olive oil)
food.step10: Bake for 25 - 30 minutes or until golden on top and bubbling on the edges. Stick a knife into the middle to ensure it is piping hot.
food.step11: Stand for 5 minutes before serving, garnished with fresh thyme leaves if desired.
food.ingredients: 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil1 1/2 tbsp olive oil
food.ingredient 6: 750g / 1.5 lb beef mince (ground beef)750g / 1.5 lb beef mince (ground beef)
food.ingredient 9: 2 cups (500 ml) beef stock / broth , low sodium
food.ingredient 10: 1/2 cup (125 ml) red wine (or water)1/2 cup (125 ml) red wine (or water)
food.ingredient 11: 1 beef bouillon cube , crumbled (stock cube, or 1 tsp stock powder)1 beef bouillon cube , crumbled (stock cube, or 1 tsp stock powder
food.ingredient 13: 1 tsp dried thyme (or 3 sprigs fresh thyme)
food.ingredient 16: 1/2 tsp black pepper1/2 tsp black pepper
food.description: Originally, a pie made with any kind of meat and mashed potato was called a "cottage pie". In modern British English, the dish is usually called "cottage pie" if it is made with beef.

food.recipe: Take your BBQ Chicken Sandwich game to the next level with this super easy, kinda tangy, kinda spicy, slow cooker recipe for pulled chicken. Perfect for the big game or any big gathering for that matter!
food.step 1: Place chicken breasts in the crockpot and sprinkle with garlic salt and paprika.
food.step 2: Add 1 cup of barbecue sauce and light beer.
food.step 3: Cover and cook on low 8 hours, stirring after about 4 hours.
food.step 4: Shred the chicken. Top with remaining barbecue sauce and green onions and serve on a sesame seed bun.
food.time: Prep Time: 5 minutes  Cook Time: 8 hours  Total Time: 8 hours 5 minutes
food.description: Crock Pot BBQ Beer Chicken is an easy slow cooker meal that produces a juicy, flavorful chicken. Great economical way to feed the family!

food.recipe: To make croquetas we vary from the basic bechamel recipe slightly by adding more flour than fat to create a VERY thick sauce that can be shaped once it has chilled
food.step 1: Melt butter and oil in a medium sauté pan over medium heat.
food.step 2: Add the flour and stir to moisten it completely. Sauté the flour until it begins to turn a light brown color 2-3 min.
food.step 3: Add the milk a little by a little, stirring constantly to incorporate each addition, until you have added it all. (At first, it will look like you won't be able to get a smooth sauce, but continue working your sauce with a rubber spatula as you add a little milk at a time and it will smooth out.) Reduce the heat to medium low as needed, if your milk seems to scald before you can mix it into the roux. Continue heating the mixture as needed until it is creamy, thick, and smooth.
food.step 4: Add the diced ham and nutmeg. Mix well.
food.step 5: Taste your mixture and add salt as necessary.
food.step6: Remove your mixture from the heat and let it cool slightly
food.step7: Transfer the croqueta dough into a casserole dish and cover it with plastic wrap (or a lid). Refrigerate the dough overnight.
food.step8: Place the beaten egg in a shallow bowl. Place the breadcrumbs in a second, wide bowl.
food.step9: (We found it easiest to shape all the croquettas first and then bread them. But, if you have extra hands in the kitchen, now is a good time to employ their help, assembly-line-style.)
food.step10: Working with roughly 2 Tbsp of dough at a time, shape the chilled dough into little, fat thumbs. (Your hands will get sticky while shaping the dough. Keeping them lightly floured helps to cut down on the stickiness.)
food.step11: Dip each croqueta, one at a time, in the beaten egg, turning to coat.
food.step12: Then, roll it in the breadcrumbs, pressing to coat.
food.step13: Place the breaded croquetas on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Once all the croquetas are breaded, place your baking sheet in the freezer for 10-15 minutes, to firm them up slightly.
food.ingredient 3: Scant 1/2 c unbleached all purpose flour
food.ingredient 5: ¼ lb ham, diced into small pieces
food.ingredient 7: Salt (to taste -- only needed if your ham isn’t too salty)
food.description: A croquette is a small breadcrumbed fried food roll containing, usually as main ingredients, ground meat, shellfish, fish, ham, cheese, mashed potatoes or vegetables, and mixed with béchamel or brown

food.recipe: This is the crumpet recipe released by Warburtons, the UK’s biggest commercial crumpet maker. They’re an absolute dead ringer for store bought, with the signature holes, distinct “spongey” texture, perfect for toasting.
food.step 1: Place flour, water and salt in a bowl and whisk for 2 minutes (electric beater 1 minute on speed 5).
food.step 2: Yeast Mixture - Dissolve Yeast into 1 tbsp warm water in a small bowl.
food.step 3: Add Yeast Mixture, sugar and baking powder into bowl, then whisk for 30 seconds (or 15 sec speed 5).
food.step 4: Cover with cling wrap or plate, then place in a very warm place for 15 to 30 minutes until the surface gets nice and foamy. It will only increase in volume by ~10 - 15%.
food.step 5: Grease 2 or 3 rings with butter (approx 9 cm / 3.5" wide, though any ring or metal shaper will do, Note 3) (TIP: Non stick rings - brush with melted butter. Everything else - smear with butter)
food.step6: Brush non stick skillet lightly with melted butter then place rings in the skillet.
food.step7: Turn stove on medium high (medium for strong stoves) and bring to heat (Note 4 for "sizzle test").
food.step8: Pour 1/4 cup batter into the rings (65ml), about 1cm / 2/5" deep (will rise ~60%).
food.step9: Cook for 1 1/2 minutes - bubbles should start appearing on the surface (but not popping yet).
food.step10: Turn heat down to medium, cook for 1 minute - some bubbles should pop around the edges.
food.step11: Turn heat down to medium low, cook for a further 2 1/2 to 4 minutes, until the surface is "set" and it's clear there will be no more bubbles popping! (At this stage you can help the final bubbles pop with a skewer!)
food.step12: Remove rings (you might need to run knife around to loosen).
food.step13: Then flip and cook the other side for 20 to 30 seconds for a blush of colour.
food.ingredients: 150g (1 cup) white flour , plain / all purpose
food.ingredient 2: 200ml (3/4 cup + 1 tbsp) warm water , tap water (200g) (Note 1)200ml (3/4 cup + 1 tbsp) warm water , tap water (200g) (Note 1)
food.ingredient 3: 1/2 tsp salt , cooking/kosher salt (1/4 tsp table salt)
food.description: Light, filling and goes oh so well when warmed up with a generous portion of gorgeous yellow butter slowly melting across the surface.

food.recipe: Double rising agent is the key here for the signature holes - baking powder PLUS yeast. Just one doesn't cut it, and baking soda doesn't work as well.

food.step 3: Add Yeast Mixture, sugar and baking powder into bowl, then whisk for 30 seconds (or 15 sec speed 5).
food.step 4: Cover with cling wrap or plate, then place in a very warm place for 15 to 30 minutes until the surface gets nice and foamy. It will only increase in volume by ~10 - 15%.
food.step 5: Grease 2 or 3 rings with butter (approx 9 cm / 3.5" wide, though any ring or metal shaper will do, Note 3) (TIP: Non stick rings - brush with melted butter. Everything else - smear with butter)
food.step6: Brush non stick skillet lightly with melted butter then place rings in the skillet.
food.step7: Turn stove on medium high (medium for strong stoves) and bring to heat (Note 4 for "sizzle test").
food.step8: Pour 1/4 cup batter into the rings (65ml), about 1cm / 2/5" deep (will rise ~60%).
food.step9: Cook for 1 1/2 minutes - bubbles should start appearing on the surface (but not popping yet).
food.step10: Turn heat down to medium, cook for 1 minute - some bubbles should pop around the edges.
food.step11: Turn heat down to medium low, cook for a further 2 1/2 to 4 minutes, until the surface is "set" and it's clear there will be no more bubbles popping! (At this stage you can help the final bubbles pop with a skewer!)
food.step12: Remove rings (you might need to run knife around to loosen
food.step13: Then flip and cook the other side for 20 to 30 seconds for a blush of colour.

food.description: The term deviled, in reference to food, was a common term in the 1700's. It pertained to spicy or zesty foods. When eggs were prepared in the way we are talking about, a healthy amount of mustard and pepper was used. They became popular and got their name around 1786 here in the U.S.

food.recipe: You can make this avocado salad smooth or chunky depending on your tastes.
food.step 1: In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt. Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic. Stir in cayenne pepper. Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.
food.ingredients: 3 avocado, NS as to Florida or Californias avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed
food.restaurants: ["Icy Spicy Restaurant","Jim - Me's Kitchen","Cantonese","The Oriental Blossom - Marine Plaza","Wok Hei","Stone Oven","5 Spice"]
food.description: Guacamole is an avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed in Mexico and is usually paired with tortilla chips

food.recipe: The traditional Jaffa Cake is something of a British icon. The small biscuits have a layer of sponge, topped with a sweet orange jelly and finished off with plain chocolate (in the U.S., this is known as semi-sweet chocolate).
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C.
food.step 2: Grease a shallow bun tin with a little of the butter and put to one side.
food.step 3: Break the tablet of jelly cubes and place into a heatproof bowl or jug. Cover with boiling water and stir well until the jelly dissolves.
food.step 4: Stir in the marmalade and put to one side to cool slightly.
food.step 5: While the jelly is cooling, line out a 10-by-10-inch tray or Pyrex square bowl with plastic wrap. Pour in the jelly and pop into the refrigerator to set, about 45 minutes.
food.step6: Place the egg and sugar into a baking bowl and using an electric hand whisk. Whisk until light and creamy and pale in color.
food.step7: Sift the self-raising flour into the bowl. Then, using a metal tablespoon, fold the sifted flour into the egg mixture.
food.step8: Put a good tablespoon into each cup of the bun tin. Tap the tin gently on the worktop before popping it into the center of the preheated oven.
food.step9: Cook until golden and slightly firm (the sponge should spring back when pressed lightly), about 8 to 10 minutes.
food.step10: Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before removing and placing on a cooling rack
food.step11: While the sponge is cooking melt the chocolate. Put a heatproof bowl over a pan of barely simmering water. Add the chocolate and leave to melt. If you must stir, use a wooden spoon, never a metal one.
food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: Not quite a biscuit, but not quite a cake, and therefore perfectly suited to serve the cravings of those out there who cannot decide between the two

food.recipe: 30 min prior to cooking, wash the rice a few times and let the rice soak in water for at least 30 minutes. *5
food.step 1: Meanwhile, cut the chicken into about 1 cm sized dice, and slice the carrot, deep fried tofu, and konnyaku.
food.step 2: Set the chopped ingredients aside.
food.step 3: Drain the rice and place it in the rice cooker.
food.step 4: Add all the seasonings in a measuring cup and add water to make a total of 2 cups (that is, the water and the
food.step 5: Place the rice cooker over high heat. When it boils, turn the heat down to low-medium with the lid on. From this point forward, do not open the lid and cook a further 15-20 minutes.
food.step6: After 15-20 minutes, turn the heat off and let it stand for further 10 minutes without opening the lid to steam cook.
food.step7: Open the lid and turn the rice and ingredients to spread evenly and also let the excess moisture evaporate.
food.step8: Serve the seasoned rice in a rice bowl.
food.ingredient 2: 150g/5oz g Chicken meat (2 chicken tenders strips) *
food.ingredient 4: 1 sheet deep fried tofu (It is also called "Aburaage" *31 sheet deep fried tofu (It is also called "Aburaage" *3
food.description: No Japanese meal is complete without gohan – fluffy, slightly sticky rice. Top this versatile food with pickles, spring onions, nori or katsuobushi flakes

food.recipe: Baby potatoes simmered (dum cooked) in a spicy yogurt sauce or gravy. An authentic recipe from the Kashmiri cuisine.
food.step 1: Rinse the baby potatoes well. Brush or scrub the mud etc from them. Take 3.5 cups water in a pan. Add the potatoes.
food.step 2: On a medium to high flame boil the water, so that the potatoes are half cooked.
food.step 3: Drain them and allow to become warm or cool down at room temperature.
food.step 4: Peel the potatoes. This task takes a lot of time, so do it while listening to music or watching your favorite tv show. If you want you can keep the peels too.
food.step 5: With a fork, tooth pick or skewer, poke holes in the potatoes all over. Halve them or you can keep them whole if they are small. This is done so that when cooking on dum, the potatoes absorb the flavors of the masala in which they are getting cooked.
food.step6: Whisk the fresh full fat curd or yogurt till smooth. Keep aside.
food.step7: In a small bowl, take kashmiri red chili powder and water.
food.step8: Mix and stir well to get a smooth mixture.
food.step9: 500 grams potatoes or 20 to 22 baby potatoes
food.step10: 3 to 3.5 cups water
food.step11: ¼ teaspoon salt
food.step12: 3 teaspoon kashmiri red chili powder (or deghi mirch), mixed in 2 tablespoon water
food.step13: ½ tablespoon ginger powder
food.ingredients: 1 tablespoon fennel powder1 tablespoon fennel powder
food.ingredient 8: 6 tablespoon fresh full fat curd, beaten or whisked till smooth (yogurt)
food.description: Dum Aloo or Alu Dum is a potato based dish, it is a part of the traditional Kashmiri Pandit cuisine, from the Kashmir Valley, in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir. The potatoes, usually smaller ones, are first deep fried, then cooked slowly at low flame in a gravy with spices.

food.recipe: Khandvi is a soft, melt in the mouth, spiced and seasoned gram flour rolls. A favorite snack from the Gujarati cuisine.
food.step 1: Take the yogurt in a bowl. Add water and stir well till smooth.
food.step 2: Add ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, asafoetida and salt.
food.step 3: If using fresh yogurt, then to add the sourness, add about ½ tsp of lemon juice.
food.step 4: Add the gram flour/besan. With a wired whisk, keep on stirring and mixing till all the lumps are dissolved and you get a smooth batter. There should be no lumps in the batter. You can also use a hand held beater to mix the batter.
food.step 5: Spread oil on plates or boards or tray. Large steel lids or thalis work very well. You can also use the back of a large baking tray or your kitchen counter top.
food.step6: Also mix the chopped coriander leaves and grated coconut. Keep aside.
food.step7: Pour the batter in a sauce pan or a broad frying pan. Switch on the stove top and keep the flame to the lowest. Begin to stir.
food.step8: Keep on stirring when the khandvi batter is getting heated up. Lumps begin to form and you have to continuously stir so that the lumps don't form.
food.step9: The batter would thicken and keep on thickening. Keep on stirring. Best to use a wooden spatula or a heat proof silicon spatula.
food.step10: The batter also should not be allowed to stick at the bottom. So you have to stir continuously.
food.step11: Spread a few teaspoons of the batter on a greased plate. Let it cool a bit and then begin to roll. If you are unable to roll, then the batter needs to be cooked more.
food.step12: The final consistency of the khandvi batter is shown in pic 17 below. It took me 17 minutes to get the correct consistency on a low flame. The timing will vary depending on the intensity of the flame, the thickness/thinness of the pan and the size of the pan. Just do the plate test and when you can form the rolls, then the khandvi batter is ready. If the batter becomes too thick, then it becomes difficult to spread and you don't get thin layers in the rolls. In this case, still spread the batter. You will get thick slices, but still they taste good.
food.ingredients: 1 cup besan (gram flour) or 100 grams besan
food.ingredient 2: ¾ cup sour curd, about 150 grams (dairy or vegan curd)
food.ingredient 3: 2.25 cups water, to be mixed with the curd (alternatively you can also use 3 cups sour buttermilk or chaas)
food.ingredient 4: 1 teaspoon ginger + green chili paste, about ½ inch ginger & 1 green chili crushed in a mortar-pestle
food.ingredient 6: ⅔ teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 13: 2 teaspoons white sesame seeds2 teaspoons white sesame seeds
food.ingredient 14: 1 teaspoon green chili , chopped or ½ red chilli powder
food.description: Khandvi, also known as Patuli, Dahivadi or Suralichi Vadi, is a Savorysnack in Maharashtrian cuisine as well as in Gujarati cuisine of India. It consists of yellowish, tightly rolled bite-sized pieces and is primarily made of gram flour and yogurt.

food.recipe: Make the lobster salad: In a bowl, stir the lobster meat, lemon juice, salt, pepper, celery, and mayonnaise together. Taste and add more salt, pepper, or lemon juice, if you like.
food.step 1: Toast the buns: Spread the outsides of the buns with softened butter. Set a skillet or cast iron pan over medium-high heat. Toast the buns for about 30 seconds on each side, or until golden brown.
food.step 2: Assemble the lobster rolls: Fill each bun with lobster salad. Serve with potato chips and a wedge of lemon.
food.ingredients: 1 pound cooked lobster meat, cut into 1-inch pieces
food.description: It is made of lobster meat served on a grilled hot dog-style bun with the opening on the top rather than the side.

food.recipe: Place sticky rice in a large bowl and cover completely with water. Let stand for at least 2 hours or overnight.
food.step 1: for the Marinated Chicken: In a medium bowl, mix chicken with the remaining marinade ingredients until thoroughly combined. Let stand in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
food.step 2: or the Sticky Rice Seasoning: Stir together all ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
food.step 3: For the Lotus Leaf Packages: Cut each lotus leaf in half down the middle. Place leaves in a large container, cover with water, weighing leaves down with a plate if necessary, and soak for 1 hour.
food.step 4: Drain sticky rice well and transfer to a large bowl. Stir in dried shrimp, if using.
food.step 5: In a non-stick skillet or wok, heat 2 teaspoons of oil over high heat until shimmering. Add shallot and garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute. Add shiitake mushrooms and cook, stirring, until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Scrape mixture into the sticky rice and stir to combine. Stir in the Sticky Rice Seasoning
food.step6: In the same skillet or wok, heat remaining 1 teaspoon oil over high heat until shimmering. Add marinated chicken, and cook, stirring, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate.
food.step7: If you are using cooked salted duck eggs, peel the eggs, then slice in half and gently scoop out yolks with a spoon (it’s ok if some of the egg whites are attached). If you are using raw salted duck eggs, crack the eggs into a small bowl and separate the whites from the yolks (the yolks should be bright orange and fairly firm); carefully slice the yolks in half with a knife. Set cooked or uncooked yolks aside on a small plate.
food.step8: To form packages, drain lotus leaves, pat dry with towels, and arrange on a work surface. Alternatively, arrange 4 pieces parchment paper on work surface.
food.step9: Place about 1/2 cup of sticky rice mixture in the center of each lotus leaf.
food.step10: Arrange cooked chicken, Chinese bacon, Chinese sausage, and salted duck yolks on top of each stick rice mound.
food.step11: Scoop another 1/2 cup of sticky rice mixture directly on top of the rice mounds on each lotus leaf, carefully spreading it out to cover the meats and egg yolk; it's okay if the rice can’t cover everything.
food.step12: Wrap each lotus-leaf or parchment package by folding edges around filling to form a tight package. Using kitchen twine, tie up each package.
food.step13: Bring water to a boil in a steamer setup. Arrange rice packages in steamer and steam for 1 hour 30 minutes; make sure to check water level occasionally, topping up with more boiling water if needed to prevent it from going dry.
food.ingredient 2: 1/2 pound skinless, boneless chicken thighs, sliced thinly
food.description: Lo mai gai, is a classic dim sum dish served during yum cha. The portion size of lo mai gai is generally quite large, so there is a smaller variant created known as jan jyu gai.

food.recipe: i would heavily recommend to use a fresh and moist paneer for preparing the kofta balls. also with aloo, it has to be well boiled and mashed so that it is easy to shape and also deep fry.
food.step 1: firstly, in a large mixing bowl take 3 potato and ¾ cup paneer.
food.step 2: also add 1 chilli, 2 tbsp coriander, ¼ tsp cumin powder and ½ tsp salt.
food.step 3: add 2 tbsp raisins and 2 tbsp cashew to have crunchy bite in kofta.
food.step 4: mix well making sure all the spices are well combined
food.step6: prepare a small ball sized kofta by greasing hand with oil.
food.step7: deep fry on medium hot oil.
food.step8: stir occasionally, making sure the koftas are cooked uniformly.
food.step9: fry until the kofta turn golden brown and crisp.
food.step10: drain off the koftas and keep aside.
food.step11: firstly, in a pan heat 2 tbsp oil and saute 1 onion, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste.
food.step12: saute until onions changes colour slightly.
food.step13: further add 2 tomato and saute slightly
food.ingredient 2: ¾ cup paneer / cottage cheese, grated
food.ingredient 3: 1 chilli, finely chopped1 chilli, finely chopped
food.ingredient 5: ¼ tsp cumin powder¼ tsp cumin powder
food.ingredient 15: 1 tsp cumin / jeera1 tsp cumin / jeera
food.description: In recipes for malai kofta, the fried dumpling balls, koftas, are made with potatoes and paneer. Keep collecting the malai in the same container and refrigerate it. The flavour becomes even richer when vegetables are added to it. An example of this would be methi matar malai where the main constituent is green peas.

food.recipe: Veg Manchurian is a tasty Indo Chinese dish of fried veggie balls in a spicy, sweet and tangy sauce. There are 2 popular variations of making veg manchurian.
food.step 1: Take the finely chopped or grated veggies in a bowl.
food.step 2: Then add the dry ingredients – corn starch, all-purpose flour (maida), black pepper and salt.
food.step 3: Mix and gather the whole mixture together. Then kind of mix and knead so that the veggies leave water and you get a dough-like mixture. But do not knead like that a bread or roti dough. Gluten strands can form that will give a dense chewy texture in the fried veggie balls. So just mix very well and press so that the veggies release their juices.
food.step 4: Then take a small portion of the mixture in your hands.
food.step 5: Press and roll it in your palm and make a round veggie ball. You can spread some oil on your palms while making the vegetable balls
food.step6: Make all veggie balls this way and keep aside.
food.step7: Heat oil for deep frying in a kadai or pan. Add a small piece of a ball to the hot oil. If the balls does not stick or settle down at the bottom of the pan, but comes up steadily the oil is ready for frying these veg manchurian balls. If the balls break, then some more binding agent is required. So you can add 2 to 3 teaspoons of some more all purpose flour (maida).
food.step8: Gently place the balls in the hot oil. The oil has to be medium hot. Too much heat and the manchurian balls will be browned from top and uncooked from inside. Less hot oil will make the balls absorb too much of oil.
food.step9: When cooked from one side, turn the balls with a slotted spoon.
food.step10: Fry the balls till crisp and golden.
food.step11: Remove them with a slotted or perforated spoon and drain as much as oil as possible.
food.step12: Place the fried veg manchurian balls on kitchen paper towels. For a low fat version, you can cook the veggie balls in an appe-appam pan or æbleskiver pan.
food.step13: Fry the veg manchurian balls this way in batches and keep aside.
food.ingredient 2: ½ cup finely chopped cabbage (purple or green)
food.ingredient 3: ¼ cup finely chopped green bell pepper (capsicum)
food.ingredient 4: ¼ cup finely chopped spring onions (scallions)
food.ingredient 5: ½ teaspoon freshly crushed black pepper or black pepper powder or white pepper powder
food.ingredient 8: ½ teaspoon salt or add as per taste
food.ingredient 9: oil as required, for shallow or deep frying – sunflower oil or any neutral tasting oil
food.ingredient 10: 1 tablespoon cornflour (known as corn starch outside india)
food.ingredient 11: 1 to 1.5 tablespoons oil – toasted sesame oil or sunflower oil or any neutral tasting oi
food.ingredient 12: 4 tablespoons finely chopped onions or chopped spring onion whites (scallion whites)
food.ingredient 19: 2 to 3 teaspoons red chilli sauce (spicy and not sweet)
food.ingredient 20: 1 teaspoon rice vinegar or regular white vinegar or apple cider vinegar
food.description: Gobi Manchurian is an Indian cuisine fried cauliflower food item popular in India. Gobi Manchurian is the result of the adaptation of Chinese cooking and seasoning techniques to suit Indian tastes.

food.recipe: Mango sheera or halwa is sweet and smooth pudding with mango flavors.
food.step 1: Powder the cardamom and discard the husks.
food.step 2: Heat ghee or oil in a thick bottomed pan.
food.step 3: Add the sooji or rava and fry till they change color and you get a lovely aroma
food.step 4: Add dry fruits and continue to fry for a few minutes.
food.step 5: Heat 1.5 cups of water separately.
food.step6: Add this hot water to the sooji and dry fruits mixture. Stir well.
food.step7: Add milk and sugar. Continue to stir.
food.step8: The semolina absorbs both water and milk and will swell.
food.step9: You have to stir continuously so that the mixture does not stick at the bottom of the pan.
food.step10: After 1 or 2 minutes, add mango pulp.
food.step11: Stir again well and ensure that the mango pulp is mixed well.
food.step12: Add cardamom powder and saffron.
food.step13: Stir till the moisture reduces.
food.ingredient 2: 1 medium sized or large alphonso mango (or any other variety), chopped and pureed
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup sugar or as required
food.ingredient 4: 2 tablespoon ghee or oil2 tablespoon ghee or oil
food.ingredient 5: 1 cup milk - 250 ml milk1 cup milk - 250 ml milk
food.ingredient 7: dry fruits - cashews, raisins, charoli (chironji) as required
food.ingredient 10: a few pomegranate arils for garnish
food.description: This halwa is quite easy- to- make and can be prepared in a jiffy. It is garnished with fried cashew nuts and almonds. It can be served as a post-dinner dessert.

food.recipe: This recipe offers a fun Cajun twist on our New Orleans-style Jambalaya. Corn maque choux is a traditional south Louisiana dish with corn and peppers, usually serves as a side or over rice. Add some andouille sausage in our version to kick up the flavor!
food.step 1: Heat oil in large skillet on medium-high heat. Add sausage; cook and stir 2 minutes. Add celery, bell pepper and onion; cook and stir 3 minutes or until sausage is browned and vegetables begin to softened
food.step 2: Stir in water, tomatoes and Rice Mix. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in corn; cover and cook 5 minutes longer or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving
food.ingredient 2: 1/2 pound andouille sausage, cut into 1/4-inch slices
food.description: Maque choux is a Creole dish originating from Louisiana. It is typically prepared with a combination of corn, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onions, and some recipes also call for the addition of celery and garlic. Usually served with rice

food.recipe: Matar paneer is a spiced and creamy curry made with peas and cottage cheese
food.step 1: In a grinder or blender take all the ingredients Mentioned under “masala paste” – ½ cup chopped onions, ¾ cup chopped tomatoes, ½ inch ginger, (2-3) garlic, (1-2) green chilies, (10-12) chopped cashews, 2 tbsp coriander leaves, (4-5) black pepper, ½ inch cinnamon, 1 tsp coriander seeds and (2-3) cloves.
food.step 2: Grind all the ingredients to a smooth paste.
food.step 3: No need to add water while grinding. There should be no small bits and pieces of cashews in the paste.
food.step 4: Keep the ground paste aside.
food.step 5: Heat oil or ghee. Add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds. Saute the cumin till they splutter
food.step6: Then add the ground masala paste. Stir. Take care while sauteing as the paste splutters. If there is too much spluttering, then cover partly with a lid till the spluttering stops.
food.step7: Saute for 10-12 minutes or more on a low to medium flame till the oil separates from the paste.
food.step8: Add all the dry spice powders – turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder. Stir well.
food.step9: If adding cream or malai, you can add now. Stir and saute for a minute.
food.step10: Then add the peas or matar. Stir again.
food.step12: Add water and season with salt.
food.step13: When the pressure drops on its own, open the lid of the pressure cooker.
food.ingredient 2: 1 cup peas or matar – fresh or frozen
food.ingredient 3: 1 to 1.25 cup water or 250 to 315 ml water or add as required
food.ingredient 6: ¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder
food.ingredient 7: ¼ to ½ teaspoon garam masala powder or punjabi garam masala powder
food.ingredient 10: 2 to 2.5 tablespoon oil or ghee2 to 2.5 tablespoon oil or ghee
food.ingredient 11: a few coriander leaves (dhania patta) for garnishing
food.ingredient 13: 3 medium sized ripe red tomatoes – roughly chopped or ¾ cup roughly chopped tomatoes3 medium sized ripe red tomatoes – roughly chopped or ¾ cup roughly chopped tomatoes
food.ingredient 14: 1 medium to large onion – roughly chopped or ½ cup roughly chopped onions
food.ingredient 18: 2 tablespoon roughly chopped coriander leaves – chopped
food.description: Mattar paneer, also known as matar paneer, and mutter paneer is a vegetarian North Indian dish consisting of peas and paneer in a tomato based sauce, spiced with garam masala. It is often served with rice and an Indian type of bread. Various other ingredients are often added, such as "aloo", corn, yogurt or cream.

food.recipe: In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar. Stir in vanilla and water. Add the flour and almonds, mix until blended. Cover and chill for 3 hours.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
food.step 2: Shape dough into balls or crescents. Place on an unprepared cookie sheet and bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from pan to cool on wire racks. When cookies are cool, roll in confectioners' sugar. Store at room temperature in an airtight container.
food.description: Delicious nutty cookies that are rolled in powdered sugar. These are perfect for any special occasion.

food.recipe: The key to Montadito is the bread or pan.  The ideal substitute for a true Spanish loaf which is the smallest baguette or Junquillo I have ever seen is a very fresh baguette.  Rustic is best, but in a pinch, I’ve used grocery baguettes.  Trust me it’s the bread.
food.step 1: Slice the baguette lengthwise and lay it open. Slice the tomatoes in half, and over a bowl using your hands or a lemon juicer “juice” each half, you are looking for just the liquid but if a bit of pulp gets in there it’s not a problem. Add one good glug of olive oil to the tomato juice. And a grind or two of sea salt. Whisk lightly with a fork.
food.step 2: Using a spoon, dress both sides of the bread with the juice in a thin layer but covering most of the surface. You don’t want so much the bread is mushy, just a flavorful coating. Lay a single layer of prosciutto on the bread and the single layer of cheese. Grind a small amount of sea salt over the cheese to taste.
food.step 3: Place the top on the sandwich and slice into two-bite tapas-sized sandwiches.
food.ingredient 4: 200 gms Cheese (A semi-dry cheese like manchego or Iberico thinly sliced works well)
food.description: A Montadito is a staple of the culinary arts from Spain. It is a unique tapa-sized rolls of bread similar to a baguette but wider and with a twist. ... The etymology of the word 'montadito' stems from the word 'montar', which means 'to mount' in Spanish.

food.recipe: Although the exact origin of natillas (custard in English) is not known, nuns in convents across Europe prepared them. One of the theories is that the nuns actually developed the dessert.
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: Pour 5 cups of milk into a large saucepan. Add lemon peel and cinnamon stick and warm the milk, uncovered, over medium heat, until just before it boils. Remove from heat and allow to sit for 10 minutes.
food.step 3: In a small bowl, whisk remaining one cup milk with the cornstarch.
food.step 4: Place egg yolks in a large mixing bowl. Add the sugar and beat with an electric mixer until it is frothy.
food.step 5: Add the milk-cornstarch mixture and continue to beat with mixer until thoroughly mixed. Set aside.
food.step6: Remove the lemon peel and cinnamon stick from the warm milk, using a slotted spoon.
food.step7: Return the pot to the stove on medium heat. After milk is hot, but not boiling, add the vanilla extract.
food.step8: Slowly pour egg yolk mixture into the warming milk, hile beating with electric mixer on low speed
food.step9: Using a wooden spoon, stir continuously over medium heat, so the milk does not stick. Stir until mixture thickens.
food.step10: Ladle thickened mixture through a fine mesh sieve placed over a large bowl, in order to eliminate any lumps.
food.step11: Pour strained natillas mixture evenly into 6 small bowls, ramekins, or cups. Allow to cool to room temperature on the counter.
food.step12: Cover ramekins with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.
food.description: Natilla is a rich, custard-like dessert thickened with cornstarch and flavored with panela (raw, unrefined cane sugar). It can be found in Spain and many countries.

food.recipe: nodles have been a popular choice for many indian’s when it comes to indo chinese recipes. there are myriad ways to make an amazing noodles recipe which mainly differs with sauces and toppings added to it
food.step 1: firstly, in a large vessel take 6 cup water, 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp oil.
food.step 2: once the water comes to a boil place a pack of hakka noodles (125 gm)
food.step 3: boil the noodles for 3 minutes or till it turns al dente. refer package instructions to know the exact cooking time.
food.step 4: drain off the water from noodles and pour 1 cup of cold water to prevent from further cooking.
food.step 5: drizzle 1 tsp oil and mix gently, to avoid noodles from sticking to each other. keep aside.
food.step6: now in a large kadai heat 2 tbsp oil and saute 2 clove garlic, 1 inch ginger and 1 chilli.
food.step7: saute ½ onion, 2 tbsp spring onion on high flame.
food.step8: further add ½ carrot, ¼ green capsicum, 5 snow pea, 5 beans, chopped, ¼ red capsicum and 5 florets broccoli.
food.step9: stir fry on high flame for 2 minutes or until veggies are cooked yet retain their crunch.
food.step10: also add 3 tbsp cabbage and stir fry.
food.step11: further add 2 tbsp tomato sauce, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tbsp chilli sauce, ¼ tsp pepper powder and ½ tsp salt.
food.step12: stir fry until sauces are well combined.
food.step13: add in boiled noodles and mix gently.
food.ingredient 12: 5 snow pea, chopped5 snow pea, chopped
food.ingredient 17: 2 tbsp tomato sauce2 tbsp tomato sauce
food.ingredient 20: 1 tbsp chilli sauce1 tbsp chilli sauce
food.ingredient 21: ¼ tsp pepper powder¼ tsp pepper powder
food.description: Noodles are a type of food made from unleavened dough which is rolled flat and cut, stretched or extruded, into long strips or strings. Noodles can be refrigerated for short-term storage or dried and stored for future use. Noodles are usually cooked in boiling water, sometimes with cooking oil or salt added.

food.recipe: Learn to make one of Japanese cuisine's favourite snack foods with this onigiri recipe. Onigiri are balls of rice, usually wrapped with nori seaweed and containing a meat or vegetable filling. Much like sandwiches in the West, onigiri are readily available in convenience stores across Japan and are great for a quick and easy snack.
food.step 1: Begin by cooking the Japanese rice according to your favourite method.
food.step 2: With a small amount of salt sprinkled on your hands, mould the rice into small balls or triangles approximately 8cm wide.
food.step 3: Create a small well in the centre of the rice and put in your choice of ingredients. Then mould the rice with your hands around the well to cover your filling completely.
food.step 4: Using a sheet of nori seaweed, wrap up your ball of rice.
food.step 5: Sprinkle some sesame seeds or cut up shiso leaves to put on the rice for a little extra flavour (optional). Enjoy for a snack or during lunch.
food.description: Onigiri is a Japanese food made from white rice formed into triangular or cylindrical shapes and often wrapped in nori (seaweed). Traditionally, an onigiri is filled with pickled ume (umeboshi), salted salmon, katsuobushi, kombu, tarako, or any other salty or sour ingredient as a natural preservative. Most Japanese convenience stores stock their onigiri with various fillings and flavors. There are even specialized shops which only sell onigiri to take out. Due to the popularity of this trend in Japan, onigiri has become a popular staple in Japanese restaurants worldwide.

food.recipe: Prepare joconde (almond sponge cake). Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Grease and line with parchment paper two 9x13 inch (23x33cm) baking pan.
food.step 1: Sift the almond flour and powdered sugar into a large  bowl. Add the whole 5 eggs and mix until the mixture is creamy and fluffy. Incorporate flour.
food.step 2: In another bowl whip the egg whites and salt until foamy. Gradually add sugar and continue mixing until stiff peaks form.
food.step 3: Fold the whipped whites into the almond mixture and add melted butter
food.step 4: Divide batter evenly into prepared pans.
food.step 5: Cool completely.
food.step6: When completely cooled use a 8 inch (20cm) square ring to cut the sponge cakes into three
food.step7: Prepare coffee syrup . Place the water, sugar and coffee into a small saucepan and bring to boil over medium heat.
food.step8: Prepare chocolate croustillant. Melt the chocolate over bain-marie. Add Pailleté feuilletine and stir to combine
food.step9: Spread the croustillant on top of one square sponge cake. Refrigerate to set
food.step10: Prepare chocolate ganache. Place chocolate into a bowl. Heat cream into a small sauce pan until it starts to boil. Pour over the chocolate. Let sit for 1 minute. Stir until completely melted. Set aside to cool, at room temperature
food.step11: Prepare coffee buttercream. Mix egg yolks in a heatproof bowl until creamy and light yellow colored.
food.step12: In a small saucepan combine sugar with water and instant coffee and place on medium heat. Using a candy thermometer measure syrup temperature. When it reaches 240 F (115C) pour it gradually over the creamy egg yolks, while mixing continuously. Continue mixing until the mixture is cooled.
food.step13: Gradually add softened butter, mix on low until  butter is incorporated and then mix on high speed until smooth and fluffy
food.description: Opera cake is a French cake. It is made with layers of almond sponge cake soaked in coffee syrup, layered with ganache and coffee French buttercream, and covered in a chocolate glaze.

food.recipe: Orange squash recipe - do it yourself homemade orange squash made from fresh oranges.
food.step 1: First begin making the sugar syrup.
food.step 2: Dissolve the sugar in water in a large saucepan or pot.
food.step 3: Add lemon juice and stir. Let the sugar solution come to a boil.
food.step 4: Lower the flame and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes till the sugar solution thickens a bit.
food.step 5: You don't need any thread consistency.
food.step6: You don't need any thread consistency.
food.step8: Remove from the pan and let the solution become warm.
food.step9: Filter the sugar solution to remove the impurities.
food.step10: Filter the sugar solution to remove the impurities.
food.step11: Let the sugar solution cool at room temperature.
food.step12: Crush saffron threads and add them to the warm sugar solution. This is an optional step.
food.ingredients: 2.25 to 2.50 kg oranges - yields 5 to 5.5 cups orange juice
food.ingredient 4: 3 to 4 tablespoons lemon juice or ½ teaspoon citric acid
food.description: Squash is a non-alcoholic concentrated syrup used in beverage making. It is usually fruit-flavoured, made from fruit juice, water, and sugar or a sugar substitute. Modern squashes may also contain food colouring and additional flavouring.

food.recipe: Panettone is a towering round of sweet bread speckled with raisins, citrus, and almonds with a plush, buttery texture that is popular both here and all over Italy during the winter holidays.
food.step 1: 1 Make the sponge (starter) and let it rise: In the bowl of a stand mixer, stir 1 cup flour and 1 tablespoon instant yeast together until blended. Add the water and mix with a spoon. It should be the consistency of thick cake batter. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let rise for 45 minutes. The sponge should double in size.
food.step 2: Soak the fruit: In a small bowl, stir the dark raisins, golden raisins, candied orange peel, rum, and water together. Cover with a plate and let soak overnight. Measure the almonds and set the measuring cup on top of the plate (so you don’t forget them).
food.step 3: Measure the flour and salt: In a bowl, whisk the remaining flour and salt together until blended.
food.step 4: Mix the dough: Once the sponge has risen, transfer the bowl to a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Set it on medium speed, and add the eggs to the sponge one at a time, until each is incorporated. Continue at medium speed and add the orange zest, sugar, and vanilla.
food.step 5: Knead the dough: Switch to the dough hook. Knead on low speed for 8 minutes, or until the dough is very smooth and elastic. Stop 2 or 3 times to push down any dough that creeps up on the dough hook.
food.step6: With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the butter, a few tablespoons at a time, until it is incorporated. Continue to mix with the dough hook for 3 minutes until the dough is silky and shiny.
food.step7: Overnight rise in the refrigerator: Keeping the dough in the bowl, pat it into a ball. Spray lightly with vegetable oil spray and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on the dough. Refrigerate for 8 hours or up to 2 days.
food.ingredients: 5 cups (600g) all-purpose flour, divided, plus a little more as needed
food.ingredient 2: 1 tablespoon instant yeast (slightly more than 1 packet)
food.ingredient 9: 12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks, 170g) room temperature unsalted butter, to make the dough
food.ingredient 10: 1 tablespoon (14g) cold unsalted butter for the top of the dough
food.ingredient 11: Vegetable oil spray (for the dough bowl)
food.description: Panettone, a perfect dessert for christmas and new year is an italian type of sweet bread originally from Milan. The procedure of making this cake like dessert is quite long but interesting.It involves ingredients like nuts, eggs and sugar. Have a wonderful Christmas with this delicious Panettone.

food.recipe: I've been experimenting with cobbler for some time and this recipe is the final result. Loved by all. Use fresh Georgia peaches, of course!
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
food.step 2: In a large bowl, combine peaches, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, and cornstarch. Toss to coat evenly, and pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
food.step 3: Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, baking powder, and salt. Blend in butter with your fingertips, or a pastry blender, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in water until just combined.
food.step 4: Remove peaches from oven, and drop spoonfuls of topping over them. Sprinkle entire cobbler with the sugar and cinnamon mixture. Bake until topping is golden, about 30 minutes.
food.ingredients: 8 medium (2-1/2" dia) (approx 4 per lb)s fresh peaches - peeled, pitted and sliced into thin wedges
food.ingredient 13: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, chilled and cut into small pieces
food.description: Cobbler is a dish consisting of a fruit or savoury filling poured into a large baking dish and covered with a batter, biscuit, or dumpling before being baked. Some cobbler recipes, especially in the American south, resemble a thick-crusted, deep-dish pie with both a top and bottom crust.

food.recipe: These tiny cheddar biscuits are a delicious snack for cocktail parties. Beware - once you start, it's difficult to stop noshing on them!
food.step 1: In a large bowl, mix together the butter, Cheddar cheese, pecans, cayenne pepper and salt until well blended. Gradually mix in flour, using your hands to work in the last bit. The result will be a stiff dough much like shortbread. Form the dough into logs about 1 inch thick, and 10 inches long. Wrap each log in waxed paper, and refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.
food.step 2: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Unwrap the chilled logs of dough, and slice into 1/4 inch thick rounds using a sharp knife. Place slices about 1 inch apart onto cookie sheets lined with parchment paper.
food.step 3: Bake for exactly 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm and slightly browned at the edges. Allow wafers to cool for 1 minute before removing from the pan.
food.description: Pecans lightly brushed with egg whites are baked into cheesy, buttery wafers with a touch of chile flakes.

food.recipe: Soak the skewers for at least 60 minutes or more totally submerged in water before using it to prevent burns. You may skip this part if pan grilling.
food.step 1: Blend red pepper, jalapeno pepper, chili pepper, garlic, basil, oregano, and onions in a food processor or blender. Add olive oil, coconut milk to facilitate blending. Then mix in smoked paprika, lemon juice black and or white pepper
food.step 2: Refrigerate and use when ready. You may make this a day or more ahead of time.
food.step 3: Trim chicken thighs of excess fat and pat dry with a cloth or paper napkin. Cut chicken thighs into 2-inch chunk.
food.step 4: Season with salt, chicken bouillon and pepper or adobo seasoning mix. You can either marinate the chicken now or thread then marinate-about 4 pieces per skewer. Making sure the skewer is fully covered with chicken chunks.
food.step 5: Place in a zip lock bag, or sealed containers and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
food.step6: When ready to grill. Using tong remove excess marinates and reserve.
food.step7: Pre heat grill to medium- high heat.
food.step8: Place chicken over medium heat, and then brush with oil to prevent chicken from sticking. Grill for about 10 to 15 minutes, rotating from sides for even cooking. Keep an eye on it -- if they are browning too quickly, turn the heat down.
food.step9: Grill in batches if you have a small grill. Transfer the skewers to a platter.
food.step10: In a small saucepan simmer the remaining peri peri marinade and the one from the chicken for about 7 minutes. Serve with chicken
food.ingredient 2: 1- teaspoon chicken bouillon optional1- teaspoon chicken bouillon
food.ingredient 3: ¼ cup olive oil or more
food.ingredient 4: ¼ cup chopped onions¼ cup chopped onions
food.ingredient 5: ¼ medium red pepper¼ medium red pepper
food.ingredient 6: 1 fresh jalapeno peppers coarsely chopped, seeds removed1 fresh jalapeno peppers coarsely chopped, seeds removed
food.ingredient 7: 1 fresh chili pepper or more coarsely chopped adjust to taste more or less
food.ingredient 10: Juice of I medium sized lemon adjust to tasteJuice of I medium sized lemon adjust to taste
food.ingredient 12: 2-3 tablespoons fresh oregano2-3 tablespoons fresh oregano
food.ingredient 13: ½ cup coconut milk optional½ cup coconut milk optional
food.time: Prep Time: 15 mins , Cook Time: 135 mins
food.description: A mouth-watering chicken starter! This chicken satay recipe has a spicy twist with the addition of fiery peri peri sauce. Serve this appetizer at a dinner party or prepare for a game night with friends, the succulent chicken pieces slathered in spices and grilled to perfection would tingle everyone's taste buds.

food.recipe: Heat a frying pan or a wok then put-in the flour. Toast the flour until you smell the aroma and the color turns light brown. Make sure to stir while toasting to prevent the flour from being burnt.
food.step 1: Once the flour is toasted, let it cool down for about 20 minutes then transfer to a mixing bowl.
food.step 2: Add the powdered milk then stir using a balloon whisk.
food.step 3: Put-in the granulated sugar then stir again.
food.step 4: Add-in the crushed pinipig then stir until very ingredient is well distributed.
food.step 5: Pour-in the softened butter and mix well. You may use your clean hands in doing the procedure. After mixing, let it stand for at least 10 minutes to allow the butter to cool. This will make the mixture more intact.
food.step6: Using a polvoron molder, scoop the mixture and put it on top of a pre-cut Japanese paper or cellophane then wrap.
food.step7: Serve. Share and enjoy
food.description: A polvorón is a type of heavy, soft, and very crumbly Spanish shortbread made of flour, sugar, milk, and nuts. They are mostly produced in Andalusia, where there are about 70 factories that are part of a syndicate that produces polvorones and mantecados.

food.recipe: Barbecue pork ribs made in the oven! It's easy, the ribs are meltingly tender and it's packed full of flavour from the rub, braising the ribs in cider (see Note 1 for subs!) and the homemade barbecue sauce glaze!
food.step 1: Combine the Rub ingredients and rub onto both sides of the ribs (most on meaty side). Set aside to marinate for 20 minutes (or overnight).
food.step 2: Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F (all oven types).
food.step 3: Place ribs on a tray in a single layer. Pour apple cider underneath the ribs, cover with foil then bake for 1 hour 30 minutes or until the meat is pretty tender (Note 5).
food.step 4: Remove from oven, turn up to 180°C/350°F. Remove foil, drizzle with olive oil, then return ribs to oven for 15 minutes or until rub becomes nice and crusty.
food.step 5: Line a new tray with foil then baking / parchment paper (you'll thank me later).
food.step6: Remove ribs from oven, transfer to lined tray. Pour any juices from tray over the ribs.
food.step7: Flip ribs so the bonier side is up. Slather with Barbecue Sauce, then bake 10 minutes.
food.step8: Remove from oven, then turn ribs over so the meaty side is up. Slather with Barbecue Sauce, bake 5 minutes. Repeat 2 or 3 more times until you've got a thick glaze on the ribs.
food.step9: Cut ribs into individual or multiple rib portions and serve with remaining Barbcue Sauce!
food.step10: 2.5 tsp paprika powder
food.step11: 2 tsp garlic powder (sub with onion powder)
food.step12: 1.5 tsp onion powder (sub with garlic powder)
food.step13: 1 tsp cayenne pepper (omit for not spicy)
food.ingredient 4: 0.5 tsp black pepper0.5 tsp black pepper
food.ingredient 6: 1 1/2 cups tomato ketchup (or Aussie tomato sauce)
food.ingredient 7: 1/2 cup water (or use remaining apple cider!)
food.ingredient 9: 1/3 cup brown sugar1/3 cup brown sugar
food.ingredient 11: 1.5 tsp garlic powder1.5 tsp garlic powder
food.ingredient 12: 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
food.description: Pork ribs are a cut of pork popular in Western and Asian cuisines. The ribcage of a domestic pig, meat and bones together, is cut into usable pieces, prepared by smoking, grilling, or baking – usually with a sauce, often barbecue – and then served.

food.recipe: The trick is to cook them low and slow, to really dry out the skin and cook them, then blast them in the oven on a high heat where (hopefully) you should see those bad boys puff up.
food.step 1: Cut pork skin into 2.5cm pieces. Add to a pan of cold water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 minutes.
food.step 2: Strain off the pork pieces and pat dry with a paper towel. Lay the pork pieces flat on a baking tray and dry out in a low oven at 80ºC (60ºC fan) for 1 hour.
food.step 3: Meanwhile use a pestle and mortar to grind the fennel seeds and salt together. After the hour, remove pork skin from the oven and increase the temperature to 240ºC (220ºC fan).
food.step 4: Season pork pieces with fennel salt and bake in the oven for approximately 20 minutes. You should see the pork pieces puff up and become crispy. If the crackling looks like it’s jumping and popping, this is normal.
food.step 5: Line a plate with a double layer of kitchen towel. Remove pork scratchings from oven when crispy and dry and drain on kitchen paper.
food.step6: Serve warm or cold with a pint of bitter!
food.ingredients: 300 g pork belly skin, your local butcher should be able to help with this
food.description: Salty, delicious, addictive and goes down great with a cold beer

food.recipe: This Rajma recipe is a creamy, tangy and spiced curry made with dried kidney beans. This restaurant style Rajma Masala is made in a base of sautéed onions, tomatoes, spices and cream making it truly delicious.
food.step 1: Soak the rajma (kidney beans) for at least 8 hours or overnight. Pressure cook for 5-6 whistles until soft yet not mushy. Set aside.
food.step 2: Heat oil and add the cumin seeds. When they sizzle and begin to change colour, add the onions. When they turn pink, add the powdered cinnamon, ginger, and green chillies. Fry for 2-3 mins.
food.step 3: Then add the coriander powder, amchur or tamarind, and turmeric. Mix well and cook for another 3-4 mins. My onion-masala mixture is red because I used red chilli powder instead of green chillies.
food.step 4: Add the cooked rajma along with the water used to cook it in and the sliced tomato. Mix well and let simmer for 5 mins.
food.step 5: When the gravy thickens a bit, add the chaat masala and salt. Mix well, bring to boil again and turn off heat.
food.step6: Add cooked rice and mix gently.
food.step7: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves (cilantro) and serve warm with some plain yogurt
food.ingredients: 1 cup of rajma / red kidney beans
food.ingredient 8: 2-3 green chillies, chopped (or ¾ tsp red chilli powder)
food.ingredient 11: 1 tsp of amchur (dried mango powder) or use a little tamarind as a substitute
food.description: Rājmā or Rāzmā is a popular vegetarian dish, originating from the Indian subcontinent, consisting of red kidney beans in a thick gravy with many Indian whole spices, and is usually served with rice.

food.recipe: red velvet cake is much more than vanilla cake tinted red. This recipe produces the best red velvet cake with superior buttery, vanilla, and cocoa flavors, as well as a delicious tang from buttermilk. My trick is to whip the egg whites, which guarantees a smooth velvet crumb.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Grease two 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans.
food.step 2: Make the cake: Whisk the flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.
food.step 3: Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium-high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Add the oil, egg yolks, vanilla extract, and vinegar and beat on high for 2 minutes. (Set the egg whites aside.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.
food.step 4: Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on medium-high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Add the oil, egg yolks, vanilla extract, and vinegar and beat on high for 2 minutes. (Set the egg whites aside.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.
food.step 5: Divide batter between cake pans. Bake for 30-32 minutes or until the tops of the cakes spring back when gently touched and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. If the cakes need a little longer as determined by wet crumbs on the toothpick, bake for longer. However, careful not to overbake as the cakes may dry out. Remove cakes from the oven and cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.
food.step6: Make the frosting: In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and butter together on medium-high speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners’ sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes until completely combined and creamy. Add more confectioners’ sugar if frosting is too thin or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Frosting should be soft, but not runny.
food.step7: Assemble and frost: Using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard or crumble over finished cake. Place 1 cake layer on your cake stand or serving plate. Evenly cover the top with frosting. Top with 2nd layer and spread remaining frosting all over the top and sides. I always use an icing spatula and bench scraper for the frosting. I used Wilton piping tip #12 for decoration around the top.
food.step8: Refrigerate cake for at least 30-60 minutes before slicing. This helps the cake hold its shape when cutting.
food.step9: Cover leftover cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for 5 days. Frosted cake or unfrosted cake layers can be frozen up to 2-3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator and bring to room temperature before decorating/servingg
food.ingredient 5: 1/2 cup (115g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature
food.ingredient 8: 4 large eggs, room temperature and separated
food.ingredient 11: liquid or gel red food coloring
food.description: Red velvet cake is traditionally a red, red-brown, crimson or scarlet colored chocolate layer cake, layered with white cream cheese or ermine icing. Traditional recipes do not use food coloring, with the red color due to non-Dutched, anthocyanin-rich cocoa.

food.recipe: These sandwiches are really delicious and easy to make. They are one of my family's fix-it-quick favorites. I like to serve them with big bowls of steaming vegetable soup and dill pickles on the side. Enjoy!
food.step 1: Preheat a large skillet or griddle on medium heat.
food.step 2: Lightly butter one side of bread slices. Spread non-buttered sides with Thousand Island dressing. On 4 bread slices, layer 1 slice Swiss cheese, 2 slices corned beef, 1/4 cup sauerkraut and second slice of Swiss cheese. Top with remaining bread slices, buttered sides out.
food.step 3: Grill sandwiches until both sides are golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Serve hot.
food.description: The Reuben sandwich is an American grilled sandwich composed of corned beef, Swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and Russian dressing, grilled between slices of rye bread. It is associated with kosher-style delicatessens, but it is not kosher, because it contains both meat and cheese.

food.recipe: Amazing, mind-blowing salt and pepper chicken wings. Green onion, garlic and sesame oil make these the most amazing wings you will ever eat.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
food.step 2: Combine salt and pepper together in a bowl. Place chicken wings on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Sprinkle the wings with the salt and pepper, then shake on the baking tray to cover completely.
food.step 3: Bake for 15 minutes then turn and bake for another 15-20 minutes until crispy and cooked through. We like our wings very crispy.
food.step 4: As soon as the wings are close to being done, heat the sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat then add the garlic and onions. (jalapeno as well if you are adding it in.)
food.step 5: Cook until the garlic has browned slightly.
food.step6: Remove chicken wings from oven and place in a large bowl.
food.step7: Toss the chicken wings with the garlic oil until completely coated.
food.step8: Toss the chicken wings with the garlic oil until completely coated.
food.step9: Serve and enjoy!
food.ingredient 7: chili pepper flakes optional but the heat is nice
food.description: Salt and Pepper chicken wings is a popular dish at Chinese restaurants that is often ordered in bulk for Asian potluck parties. Wings are fried to a crunchy golden brown and then tossed in a garlic, red chili, white and black pepper mixture, that makes them flavorful and addictive.

food.recipe: Boil the dried red chilies in little water for about 3 – 4 minutes. Let it cool and coarsely grind with Vinegar, salt, sugar, Soy sauce, ginger and garlic.  Heat 1 tbsp Sesame oil and sauté this paste for a minute. Allow to cool.
food.step 1: Clean and cut the chicken into bite size cubes. Marinate chicken with salt, 1 tbsp Szechuan Chilli Paste, Soy Sauce, Ginger Garlic paste and pepper powder for half an hour. Just before frying, add Corn Flour and mix well. Deep fry in oil till slightly brown. Keep aside
food.step 2: Remove excess oil and add the sliced red chilies  and julienned ginger(add sliced green chilies as well if you want it spicier). Drain and keep aside for garnishing. Add chopped garlic and cubed Onion and stir fry for a minute.Next add the cubed Bell Pepper/ Capsicum and fry for few seconds.
food.step 3: Mix in 1 ½ tbsp. Szechuan Chilli Paste and fry for another minute. Mix the Soya sauce and Tomato Sauce with 1 cup water and add to the pan. Let it boil and add the chopped Spring Onion bulbs and the fried Chicken pieces. Cook covered on low flame for two minutes. Adjust the salt.
food.step 4: Mix corn flour in little water and add to the gravy, stirring continuously to thicken the gravy and coat the pieces
food.step 5: Lastly, add the chopped Spring onion greens and serve Szechuan chicken/ Chilli Chicken as appetizer or  with Fried rice, Noodles, Naan or Roti.
food.step6: Dried Kashmiri Red Chili        : 12-15 nos.
food.description: The ingredients used include dry sherry, Worchester sauce, soy sauce, cornstarch, egg whites, brown sugar, sesame oil, red bell peppers, carrots, garlic, green onions, boneless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, chili paste, cayenne pepper and red chili.

food.recipe: This is a very simple recipe for scones. You can customize them by adding dried fruit or nuts. Half and half can also be substituted for milk if you wish.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
food.step 2: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Cut in butter. Mix the egg and milk in a small bowl, and stir into flour mixture until moistened.
food.step 3: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead briefly. Roll dough out into a 1/2 inch thick round. Cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet
food.step 4: Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.
food.description: A scone is a baked good, usually made of wheat, or oatmeal with baking powder as a leavening agent and baked on sheet pans. A scone is often slightly sweetened and occasionally glazed with egg wash. The scone is a basic component of the cream tea

food.recipe: My father made this for me while experimenting in the kitchen. It was absolutely the most delicious way to use shrimp. I think I've gotten pretty good at making this dish but it still doesn't compare to my father's! Don't be fooled by the ingredients. Most are optional and this is easy to make! Great for parties as appetizers or a main dish.
food.step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the shrimp, onion, water chestnuts, celery, and green onion. Stir in crabmeat, egg, parsley, sesame oil, soy sauce, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste
food.step 2: Make the dipping sauce: In a small mixing bowl, whisk together soy sauce, water, sesame oil, parsley, garlic powder, and sugar; set aside.
food.step 3: In a heavy skillet, heat 2 cups oil, or enough to be 1/2 inch deep, over medium heat. Spread a thick layer of shrimp filling on one side of each slice of bread.
food.step 4: Fry the topped bread in hot oil until golden brown and shrimp is pink, turning once. Do not let the filling sit on the bread too long or the sandwich will get soggy. Drain on paper towels and let cool for a minute. Slice diagonally and serve with dipping sauce or alone.
food.ingredients: 1 pound fresh shrimp, peeled, deveined and finely minced
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup finely chopped water chestnuts
food.restaurants: ["Anda Apna Apna","Malvan Tadka","Anda Lovers","Surti Anda","Masala Library","Punjabi Tadka - Ramee Guestline Hotel","Oye Kake","Urban Tadka"]
food.description: Shrimp toast or prawn toast is a Chinese dim sum dish. It is made from small triangles of bread, brushed with egg and coated with minced shrimp and water chestnuts, then cooked by baking or deep frying. It is a common appetizer in Australian and American Chinese cuisine.
