food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: A gordita in Mexican cuisine is a pastry made with masa and stuffed with cheese, meat, or other fillings. It is similar to a pasty and to the Colombian and Venezuelan arepa. Gordita means "chubby" in Spanish.

food.recipe: These are great for snacking
food.step 1: Spread almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet and place in a cold oven
food.step 2: Turn oven on to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake almonds, stirring occasionally, until light tan and fragrant, 12 to 15 minutes. The nuts will continue to cook after removing from oven.
food.step 3: Meanwhile, mix sugar and salt together in a small bowl; sprinkle about 1 tablespoon sugar mixture into a large bowl.
food.step 4: Stir honey, water, and almond oil together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Add almonds; cook and stir until almonds have absorbed all the liquid, about 5 minutes.
food.step 5: Transfer coated almonds to the large bowl sprinkled with sugar mixture. Sprinkle remaining sugar mixture over almonds; toss to coat evenly.
food.step6: Spread almonds onto waxed paper to cool completely. Store at room temperature in a tightly covered container or plastic bag.
food.description: While honey-roasted nuts are high in fat, a large portion of it is healthful. Unsaturated fats help you absorb vitamins and keep your muscles healthy by aiding in the construction of cells. Each 1-ounce serving of almonds contains 14 grams of fat. ... Monounsaturated and polyunsaturated are both heart-healthy.

food.recipe: Masala Omelette is a super quick egg recipe which can be whipped in no time and makes for a lovely breakfast. Pair it with slices of white bread for a hearty homely breakfast
food.step 1: Break the eggs in a bowl.
food.step 2: Whisk them well.
food.step 3: Add all the remaining ingredients except ghee in the eggs and whisk well.
food.step 4: Heat a non stick frying pan.
food.step 5: Add ghee and spread it all over the pan.
food.step6: Pour the egg mixture in the heated pan.
food.step7: Cook until the lower side is set.
food.step8: Flip and cook from other side as well.
food.step9: Serve hot with buttered toast and tomato ketchup.
food.description: An Indian omelette or Masala Omelette is a version of the omelette found in South Indian cuisine. Its main ingredients are eggs, herbs, tomatoes and spices that vary by region. Grated cheese is sometimes put over the omelette, and they may also be filled with things such as shrimp and/or chicken flavoured with curry

food.recipe: Chinese dumplings (Jiaozi) are a rather popular dish during the Chinese New Year season. This is a fantastic recipe to make if you want to impress all of your family and friends the next time you're going to a holiday party.
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients
food.step 2: Stir the salt into the flour. Slowly stir in the cold water, adding as much as is necessary to form a smooth dough.
food.step 3: Knead the dough into a smooth ball.
food.step 4: Cover the dough and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
food.step 5: While the dough is resting, make the filling; add the soy sauce, salt, rice wine, and white pepper to the meat, stirring in only one direction.
food.step6: Add the remaining ingredients, stirring in the same direction, and mix well.
food.step7: Divide the dough into 60 pieces. Roll each piece out into a circle about 3 inches in diameter.
food.step8: Place a small portion (about 1 level tablespoon) of the filling into the middle of each wrapper.
food.step9: Wet the edges of the dumpling with water.
food.ingredient 6: 1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine (or dry sherry)
food.description: Jiaozi are a kind of Chinese dumpling, commonly eaten in China and other parts of East Asia. They are one of the major dishes eaten during the Chinese New Year and year-round in the northern provinces. Though considered part of Chinese cuisine, jiaozi are popular in other parts of East Asia and in the Western World.

food.recipe: Japanese shaved ice is called kakigori. There are a variety of flavors, and a traditional kind is Ujikintoki made with shaved ice on the bottom, drizzled with green tea syrup and topped with red bean paste
food.step 1: Gather the ingredients.
food.step 2: Dissolve green tea powder and granulated sugar in 2 tablespoons of hot water.
food.step 3: Cool the syrup and put in a small serving bowl.
food.step 4: Shave ice over the green tea syrup, using a home shaved ice machine.
food.step 5: Top with anko.
food.step6: Pour sweetened condensed milk over the ice.
food.ingredient 5: Ice cubes or a block of ice
food.description: Kakigōri is a Japanese shaved ice dessert flavored with syrup and a sweetener, often condensed milk.

food.recipe: Cut the meat into bite-sized pieces. Cut potatoes, carrots, onions, garlic and ginger in the size you want. We recommend quartering the onions and dicing the potato. Chop the ginger and the garlic in very fine pieces.
food.step 1: Parallel you can cook the rice already (see instructions). The easiest way is to cook it with the rice cooker, but a normal pot will also give the desired result.
food.step 2: Fry the onions with ginger and garlic over medium heat with a little bit oil until the onions have a golden yellow color.
food.step 3: Then add the meat and sauté briefly. If the meat sticks in the pan, add a bit more oil.
food.step 4: Once the meat has stopped looking pink from the outside, add water, potatoes and carrots and set the cooker to low heat. Simmer for 20 minutes with the lid closed. But beware, it does not overcook!
food.step 5: When the soup has finished cooking, you can carefully remove the foam that has formed on the surface. Make sure that you do not wash away too much of the precious broth. In general, 2 tablespoons of foam per serving should suffice.
food.step6: Turn off the heat, add the curry spice mixture and stir well for a few minutes.
food.step7: Done is the traditional Japanese dish Karē Raisu! Ittadakimasu!
food.description: Kare raisu is an example of yōshoku, i.e. dishes typical for Western cuisine, which have been adapted to Japanese culinary tastes. Japanese curry always contains meat (poultry, pork or beef) and well-known European cuisine vegetables such as carrots, potatoes and onions.

food.recipe: Place a kadhai or wok on medium heat, pour in oil. When oil is hot but not smoking, toss in green cardamom, black cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf. Stir fry till aromatic, about 2 minutes, then slide in onion. Sauté till golden brown.
food.step 1: Add garlic paste, ginger paste, and green chillies. Stir well, about 2 minutes, then slide in tomatoes. Sauté, stirring occasionally, till the tomato softens and is cooked through, about 7 minutes.
food.step 2: Toss in red chilli powder, turmeric powder, roasted cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala powder, and stir. Add keema, mix well, and cook for 5–6 minutes. Add salt.
food.step 3: Cook for another 3 minutes, add ½ cup water and bring to a boil. Transfer to a pressure cooker and cook for 8–10 minutes after the cooker has reached full pressure (the first whistle). Remove from heat and allow to cool before opening the cooker.
food.step 4: Heat butter in a pan and very lightly brown the pao. Serve keema immediately with hot pao on the side accompanied with a wedge of lime to garnish. Or slice the pao in half, leaving one side attached, and fill liberally with keema; top with a squeeze of lime juice. Serve immediately.
food.ingredient 7: 250 grams onions, (about 2½ medium onions), finely chopped
food.description: Keema pav is mutton mince is served with buttered bread. The dish perhaps originated in the Irani Restaurants of Mumbai and then became popular across the country as street food.

food.recipe: This delicious chicken dish is exquisite and easy to prepare. The light and luscious lemon sauce really pops without being too acidic; it is simply divine. Serve it with herb-roasted potatoes or lemon-rice pilaf.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Place a serving platter into the oven to warm.
food.step 2: Season the chicken breast pieces with salt and pepper and dredge them in flour. Shake off excess flour. Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet; pan-fry the chicken pieces until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Work in batches and do not crowd skillet, adding oil as needed . Place the chicken pieces onto the warmed platter in the oven. When finished with all the chicken, drain most of the oil from the skillet, leaving a thin coating on the surface of the pan.
food.step 3: Cook and stir the minced garlic in the skillet until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Pour in the chicken broth. Scrape and dissolve any brown bits from the bottom of the skillet. Stir in the lemon slices and bring the mixture to a boil. Let cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce reduces to about 2/3 cup, 5 to 8 minutes. Add the lemon juice and capers; simmer until the sauce is reduced and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes more. Drop the butter into the skillet and swirl it into the sauce by tilting the skillet until the butter is melted and incorporated. Add the parsley; remove from heat and set aside.
food.step 4: Arrange the chicken medallions on serving plates and spoon sauce over each portion to serve.
food.ingredients: 3 large skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1/2-inch medallions
food.ingredient 4: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or as needed
food.description: Chicken breast cutlets are dredged in flour or gluten-free flour and pan-seared until golden brown. In the same pan, a rich flavorful sauce of lemon juice, white wine (or broth), and salty capers simmer with the chicken to create a slightly thickened sauce that coats the chicken.

food.recipe: This easy, no bake mud pie has a decadent chocolate custard filling smothered in a layer of chocolate ganache, topped with whipped cream with chocolate shavings and it's all in an tasty Oreo crust.
food.step 1: For the Crust: Add Oreos to the bowl of your food processor and pulse until pulverized. Drizzle in melted butter and pulse a few times to combine.
food.step 2: Transfer cookie mixture to pie dish and press into a thin layer. You can use measuring cup or glass to help press into a uniform layer. Chill pie crust in freezer until ready to fill
food.step 3: For the Filling: In a medium pot add 1 1/2 cups milk, cream, sugar, and salt. Whisk together and place over medium heat. Cook while stirring until simmering, then remove from heat.
food.step 4: Whisk yolks together in a large bowl and set aside. In a small bowl mix 1/2 cup of milk with corn starch and whisk into yolks. Whisk the hot milk mixture into the yolks, then pour the mixture back into the pot. Place pot on medium heat and whisk continuously until it comes to a boil. Reduce to medium-lot and whisk for another 2-3 minutes before removing from heat.
food.step 5: Add chopped chocolate and vanilla, and stir until melted.
food.step6: Pour filling into your chilled crust. Smooth top with a spatula and place in fridge to chill while you make the ganache
food.step7: In a medium bowl melt the chocolate and cream in a few 20 second bursts in the microwave at 50% power. Stir together and then pour over the pie filling and smooth. Place pie in refrigerator to chill for at least 3 hours.
food.step8: Before serving mix the whipped cream, sugar and vanilla in a stand mixer until thick soft peaks form.
food.step9: Spoon whipping cream over pie and shave some chocolate over the top.
food.description: Mississippi mud pie is a chocolate-based dessert pie that is likely to have originated in the U.S. state of Mississippi. The treat contains a gooey chocolate sauce on top of a crumbly chocolate crust. The pie is usually served with ice cream.

food.recipe: Make these delicious Kebabs from North India and we are sure you will make it again and again. The mutton galouti kebab has minced mutton kheema that is mixed along with Indian spice powders and papaya to help it tenderises the meat
food.step 1: To begin making the Mutton Galouti Kebab, first take a big bowl and mix the minced mutton, lemon juice, papaya paste, ghee and salt in a bowl and keep it aside for 10 minutes.
food.step 2: In a blender add rest of the ingredients one by one - onions, ginger garlic paste, gram flour, mint leaves, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala and black pepper powder. Blend it well with little or no water
food.step 3: Once all these ingredients have ground and combined well, add in the minced meat and blend well for second time until all ingredients combine well and is a smooth texture
food.step 4: Transfer it in a container with a lid and refrigerate overnight or for 8 hours. This helps in the mutton absorbing all the flavours of the spices
food.step 5: Take out this mutton mixture from the fridge after 8 hours, and prepare patties and keep it ready on the plate.
food.step6: Heat a grilled iron pan with some oil to coat the surface. Place the Kebabs/patties and shallow fry on medium to low flame for about 10 on each side of the Kebab. Fry the remaining kebabs too and serve hot.
food.step7: Serve Mutton Galouti Kebab along with Dhaniya Pudina Chutney for your party appetisers.
food.description: The mutton galouti kebab has minced mutton kheema that is mixed along with Indian spice powders and papaya to help it tenderises the meat. The soft and juicy kebab can be served along with Pudina chutney and Pickled onions as a starter for your weekend.

food.recipe: It’s a famous all-time favorite snack for young adults. Can be made spicy and tangy as needed.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a nonstick wok on high. Once the oil is heated, reduce the heat to its lowest setting.
food.step 2: Drop 1 peanut (coated in the mixture) at a time, making sure they don’t clump/cling together. Add as many as will fit the wok and still be easily stirred. Keep frying the peanuts at low heat till they become slightly brown (takes 3-4 minutes per batch).
food.step 3: Remove the fried peanuts to a paper napkin to soak up excess oil. Cool completely before storing in an air tight container.
food.ingredient 4: 1 teaspoon Baking Powder Or Baking Soda
food.description: A nutcracker is a type of alcoholic drink consisting of a mixture of hard liquor and sugary beverages such as fruit juice.

food.recipe: in a large kadai heat 3 tsp oil and saute 1 tsp cumin, 1 dried red chilli and few curry leaves.
food.step 1: further add 3 clove garlic, 1 inch ginger and 1 chilli. saute on high flame.
food.step 2: additionally add 2 tbsp tomato sauce, 1 tsp chilli sauce and ¼ tsp salt. stir fry on high flame.
food.step 3: keeping the flame on low add 2 tbsp water and 2 tbsp curd.
food.step 4: mix well until the curd combines well
food.step 5: optionally add 2 drops food colour for bright red colour and mix well.
food.step6: now add in fried paneer and give a good mix.
food.step7: finally, garnish paneer 65 with chopped coriander leaves and enjoy.
food.ingredient 3: ½ tsp pepper, crushed½ tsp pepper, crushed
food.ingredient 7: ½ tsp garam masala½ tsp garam masala
food.ingredient 10: 1 tsp lemon juice1 tsp lemon juice
food.description: paneer 65 fry is moderately spicy, flavorful and tastes delicious. It goes well as a party snack too along with masala tea. Paneer 65 is made by batter frying the paneer until crisp and then it is tossed in a spicy tempering masala. Most times when paneer cubes are batter fried, they absorb lot of oil.

food.recipe: To make the croutons: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. If desired, line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up
food.step 1: Slice your bread* into 1-inch cubes (no larger) and place them on the baking sheet. Drizzle the cubes with the olive oil, sprinkle them with the salt, and toss until thoroughly combined. Bake until deeply golden, about 7 to 10 minutes
food.step 2: Meanwhile, prepare your salad dressing: In a bowl, combine the olive oil, vinegar, oregano, garlic, salt, and a generous amount of black pepper. Whisk until combined.
food.step 3: We’re going to add the onion to mellow its flavor and lightly pickle it—first, cut your sliced onion down the middle to make the pieces more manageable. Then, stir the onions into the dressing. Place the bowl in the refrigerator while you assemble the salad.
food.step 4: To prepare the salad: Transfer the prepared tomatoes to a large serving platter. Nestle about half of the croutons in between the tomatoes, and distribute the rest on top. Place the cucumber rounds and mozzarella all over the salad.
food.ingredient 2: 1 small French bread or boule, cut into 1-inch cubes (6 cups)
food.ingredient 4: 2 large, ripe tomatoes, cut into 1-inch cubes
food.ingredient 5: 1 hothouse cucumber, unpeeled, seeded, and sliced 1/2-inch thick
food.ingredient 6: 1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch cubes
food.ingredient 7: 1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch cubes
food.ingredient 8: 1/2 red onion, cut in 1/2 and thinly sliced
food.description: Panzanella or panmolle is a Tuscan chopped salad of soaked stale bread, onions and tomatoes that is popular in the summer. It often includes cucumbers, sometimes basil and is dressed with olive oil and vinegar. It is also popular in other parts of central Italy.

food.recipe: Spaghetti Pasta Carbonara—indulgent and delicious, yet so easy! Pasta carbonara takes only 30 min start to finish! Learn how to make carbonara sauce with bacon or pancetta and loads of parmesan.
food.step 1: Heat pasta water: Put a large pot of salted water on to boil (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water.)
food.step 2: Sauté pancetta/bacon and garlic: While the water is coming to a boil, heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the bacon or pancetta and cook slowly until crispy
food.step 3: Beat eggs and half of the cheese: In a small bowl, beat the eggs and mix in about half of the cheese.
food.step 4: Cook pasta: Once the water has reached a rolling boil, add the dry pasta, and cook, uncovered, at a rolling boil.
food.step 5: Toss pasta with pancetta/bacon: When the pasta is al dente (still a little firm, not mushy), use tongs to move it to the bowl with the bacon and garlic. Let it be dripping wet. Reserve some of the pasta water.
food.step6: Move the pasta from the pot to the bowl quickly, as you want the pasta to be hot. It's the heat of the pasta that will heat the eggs sufficiently to create a creamy sauce.
food.step7: Add the beaten egg mixture: Add the beaten eggs with cheese and toss quickly to combine once more. Add salt to taste. Add some pasta water back to the pasta to keep it from drying out.
food.ingredients: 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil or unsalted butter
food.ingredient 2: 1/2 pound pancetta or thick cut bacon, diced
food.ingredient 5: 1 cup grated parmesan or pecorino cheese
food.ingredient 6: 1 pound spaghetti pasta (or bucatini or fettuccine
food.ingredient 7: Salt and black pepper to taste
food.time: Preparation Time : 105 mins , Cooking time : 20 mins
food.description: Carbonara is an Italian pasta dish from Rome made with egg, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper. The dish arrived at its modern form, with its current name, in the middle of the 20th century. The cheese is usually Pecorino Romano, Parmigiano-Reggiano, or a combination of the two.

food.recipe: Peri Peri Fish Fingers Recipe is a fun food that is a must try for your party appetizers. Fish is one of the safest way to gain good fats/protein for your body. The fish fingers are coated three times with seasoned flour, egg and then crumb coated which is what gives the fish fingers a crispy and crunchy texture.
food.step 1: In a small plate, add flour, salt and pepper and mix it well. In another bowl break an egg and add milk and whisk well. Also keep the bread crumbs ready in a separate plate.
food.step 2: Heat a kadai/heavy bottomed pan with enough oil to fry. Add the fish on to a seasoned flour and coat them well. Dust out any excess flour.
food.step 3: Dip the fish into the egg mixture and then finally crumb coat it completely and shake off the excess
food.step 4: Drop the fish finger slowly and carefully into the hot oil. Do the same for the rest. After 2 minutes flip it over. Cook until the fish fingers turn golden brown.
food.step 5: Drain them out and place them in a paper napkin to remove any excess oil.
food.step6: To make the peri peri masala powder mix all the spice including red chilli powder, red chilli flakes, garlic powder, dry ginger powder, cinnamon powder and dried oregano into a bowl. Sprinkle them over the fish finger and toss well till it is evenly coated.
food.step7: Serve the Peri Peri Fish Fingers Recipe along with a Cottage Cheese Dip or Roasted Tomato Pasta Sauce or a salad by the side to enjoy your starters.
food.ingredients: 2 Basa fish , cut into finger length size
food.description: Peri Peri Fish Fingers are Fish fingers that are crumb coated and fried till crispy and crunchy making it a perfect starter/appetizer for your Indian Dinner Parties. ... Serve the Peri Peri Fish Fingers Recipe along with a Cottage Cheese Dip or Roasted Tomato Pasta Sauce or a salad by the side to enjoy your starters.

food.recipe: Poha is one of India’s most popular breakfast (especially in North and western India).
food.step 1: To a strainer, add flattened rice (poha). Rinse it under running water until it turns soft. To check if it's done, press a flake between your thumb and index finger, it should break easily.
food.step 2: Add turmeric and 1/2 teaspoon salt to the poha and toss to combine. Set it aside while you make the tempering in the pan.
food.step 3: Heat oil in a pan on medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the mustard seeds and let them pop.
food.step 4: Then add the peanuts and saute for a minute or two until they start turning brown.
food.step 5: Then add the chopped onion, green chili and curry leaves. Cook for 2 minutes until the onions soften.
food.step6: Add the green peas (which had been soaked in warm water for 10 minutes prior) and mix. Cook for 2 minutes until raw smell of peas goes away.
food.step7: Then add in the rinsed poha and toss to combine. Taste test some poha and if it feels dry, sprinkle little water all over (I usually do that). Cook for 1-2 minutes.  Also tastes test and add more salt as needed at this point (I added around 1/8 teaspoon).
food.step8: And then cover the pan with a lid and turn heat to low. Let it be like that for 2 minutes. Then turn off the heat.
food.step9: Squeeze in some fresh lemon juice. Garnish poha with more cilantro and sev and serve with a cuppa chai.
food.ingredients: 1.5 cups poha 114 grams, use thick poha
food.ingredient 3: 1/2 teaspoon + 1/8 teaspoon salt divided, adjust to taste
food.ingredient 4: 1/3 cup green peas I used frozen, soaked in warm water for 10 minutes
food.ingredient 5: 2 teaspoons oil 10 ml, I used avocado oil
food.ingredient 12: 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro + more to garnish
food.description: Poha is an Indian dish prepared in the Indian states of Maharashtra, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Telengana, Karnataka, Gujarat and Rajasthan. Pohey tends to be spicy. ... Pohay is made of processed flattened rice, roasted with chilies, onions, mustard and cumin seeds and curry leaves (called Kadi-patta).

food.recipe: The southern region of Oaxaca, Mexico is known as the land of siete moles or seven moles. I developed this chicken dish using the herbs and tomatillos needing to be used up. This is also known as a verde mole. It's an interesting taste difference using the mole both cooked and in the raw form in this dish. Serve alongside a Mexican style rice and a green salad.
food.step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the chicken, and season with oregano, minced garlic, and salt and pepper. Cook and stir until the chicken is lightly browned. Stir in the onion, then cover and reduce heat to low
food.step 2: Place tomatillos, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, whole garlic, lime juice, and salt in a blender. Pulse to a chunky consistency. Pour half of the tomatillo mixture over the chicken. Continue simmering until chicken is tender, 35 to 40 minutes more. Serve with remaining sauce and top with Monterey Jack cheese.
food.ingredient 9: 2 peppers jalapeno pepper, seeds and ribs removed
food.description: After the chicken is sautéed with fresh veggies, it is smothered with mo

food.recipe: For a delicious sweet/savoury dish that is filling and flavoursome without containing massive amounts of sugar or fat, this pumpkin oyaki recipe is the bee's knees. Sweet-savoury pumpkin encased in a chewy dumpling style shell, pumpkin oyaki is a Japanese favourite that is halfway between a pasty and a dumpling. Perfect for enjoying with a cold beer or as a lunch time treat.
food.step 1: Mix together the vegetable oil, a pinch of salt and a cup of hot water together. In a separate bowl add the flour, then mix in the salted hot water a bit at a time.
food.step 2: When the mixture has cooled enough to handle, make sure everything is well incorporated by hand. Then knead on a lightly floured surface for around 3 minutes.
food.step 3: Put it back in a bowl, cover with cling wrap and leave to sit for 15-20 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix together the pumpkin, soy sauce, sugar and salt.
food.step 4: Divide the mixture into 12 and roll into circles about 10cm across. You’ll have some oyaki wrappers left over, so you can freeze these for future use or fill your own favourite filling.
food.step 5: Add a dab of the pumpkin filling to the centre of the dough. Gather the dough over it and make sure that where you gather the dough, there is no gap.
food.step6: Warm some vegetable oil in a frying pan. Next, add the oyaki and cook over a high heat until both sides are nicely browned
food.step7: Place the oyaki into a steamer and steam for a further 10 minutes over a medium heat.
food.description: Sweet-savoury pumpkin encased in a chewy dumpling style shell, pumpkin oyaki is a Japanese favourite that is halfway between a pasty and a dumpling. Perfect for enjoying with a cold beer or as a lunch time treat.

food.recipe: Did you know you can make your own Rumchata with ingredients you have around your house? Well, now you know!
food.step 1: Add heavy whipping cream, simple syrup, rum, vanilla, and cinnamon to a blender. Blend until well combined. Pour mixture into an air-tight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. If desired, mix into hot chocolate, garnish with whipped cream, and sprinkle with additional ground cinnamon and nutmeg.
food.ingredient 5: Hy-Vee ground cinnamon, plus additional for garnish
food.ingredient 6: Hy-Vee ground nutmeg, plus additional for garnish
food.ingredient 7: Hot chocolate, for serving, if desired

food.recipe: Shortbread cookies aren’t just for the holidays! These delicious, perfectly sweet treats have a wonderful crisp texture and just dissolve in your mouth
food.step 1: In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat butter and vanilla extract until creamed.
food.step 2: Add confectioners sugar and salt; mix until combined.
food.step 3: Scrape bowl down and add flour while beating on low. Scrape bowl once more and mix until combined.
food.step 4: Shape the dough into a rectangular prism, wrap in plastic and chill until firm. At least an hour.
food.step 5: Preheat oven to 350F (177C). Use a sharp knife to cut 1/2 inch thick slices
food.step6: Place slices, spaced at least an inch apart onto a baking sheet lined with a silicone mat or parchment paper
food.step7: Use a fork or skewer to indent a pattern onto the top.
food.step8: Bake for about 10 minutes, rotating baking sheet in the oven halfway through.
food.step9: Transfer to a wire sheet to cool.
food.ingredients: 10 tbsp unsalted butter unsalted butter, at room temperature 142g
food.ingredient 2: 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar1/2 cup confectioners' sugar
food.description: Shortbread is a traditional Scottish biscuit usually made from one part white sugar, two parts butter, and three parts plain wheat flour. Other ingredients like ground rice or cornflour are sometimes added to alter the texture.

food.recipe: This French carrot salad recipe is simple and fresh! You’ll need carrots, olive oil, lemon, honey, cumin, parsley and chives. Chickpeas are optional but recommended. Recipe yields 4 servings
food.step 1: To prepare the carrots: You can grate them on the large holes of a box grater, or use short strokes with a julienne peeler, or process them in a food processor fitted with a grating attachment. You’ll end up with about 3 cups grated carrots.
food.step 2: Place the carrots in a medium serving bowl. Add the chives, parsley and optional chickpeas to the bowl.
food.step 3: To make the dressing, whisk all of the ingredients together in a small bowl until completely blended.
food.step 4: Pour the dressing over the carrot mixture and stir until the mixture is evenly coated in dressing. For best flavor, allow the salad to marinate for 20 minutes before serving. Toss again before serving. This salad keeps well in the refrigerator, covered, for about 4 days.
food.ingredient 2: 2 tablespoons finely snipped chives or chopped green onion
food.ingredient 4: Optional: 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, or 1 ½ cups cooked chickpeas
food.description: The carrot (Daucus carota subsp. sativus) is a root vegetable, usually orange in colour, though purple, black, red, white, and yellow cultivars exist. ... The carrot is a biennial plant in the umbellifer family Apiaceae. At first, it grows a rosette of leaves while building up the enlarged taproot.

food.recipe: Chutney sandwich is a four-ingredient, quick and easy to prepare sandwich. No onion no garlic recipe.
food.step 1: Rinse the 1 cup tightly packed coriander leaves and then roughly chop them. Also rinse and chop the green chilies.
food.step 2: Take the chopped coriander leaves, ¼ cup grated coconut, 1 green chili & 1/2 tsp sugar in a grinder jar.
food.step 3: Add 4 tbsp water and grind to a smooth chutney.
food.step 4: Take the chutney in a bowl and keep aside.
food.step 5: Spread butter evenly on bread slices. If packing the sandwiches for tiffin box or picnics, then spread a generous amount of butter, so that the bread does not become soggy.
food.step6: If you want you can slice the edges. Since I was using homemade white bread, the edges were soft and not stiff like the store brought bread. Hence I did not slice the edges.
food.step7: Now spread the chutney on the slices.
food.step8: Usually I spread the coriander coconut chutney on both slices. But if you want, then you can spread the chutney on only one slice.
food.step9: Bring together the bread slices to form a sandwich.
food.step10: Slice & serve the chutney sandwich plain with some tea or coffee.
food.ingredients: 1 cup tightly packed coriander leaves (cilantro leaves) - chopped
food.ingredient 4: ½ teaspoon sugar or as required
food.ingredient 6: ¼ teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 7: 12 to 15 bread slices - white or brown or whole wheat or multi grain bread
food.description: Delicious easy sandwich made using green chutney. This sandwich is so refreshing and taste good. Perfect to put in your kids lunch box.This is a super easy sandwich to make. You only need some soft bread, some butter and some delicious green chutney. This recipe is great for parties and picnic. Or makes a great dish to have with your evening tea.

food.recipe: Indian dessert made with semolina, ghee and sugar. Sooji halwa is one of the most common Indian desserts made in every household.
food.step 1: To a pan, add sugar, water and milk. Stir and let it heat up on medium heat. You don't want to boil it but mixture should be heated through and sugar should be dissolved.
food.step 2: While the milk-water heats up, put a pan on medium heat and add ghee to it. Let the ghee melt. Then add sooji to the pan and stir. Add in the broken cashews and stir.
food.step 3: Stirring continuously, roast the sooji on low-medium heat. Add cardamom powder and continue to stir.
food.step 4: Stir for around 8 to 9 minutes on low-medium heat. As soon as sooji is fragrant and beginning to change color, that it the time to add the liquid.
food.step 5: Add the heated milk-water-sugar-mixture into the pan. It will bubble a lot as you add the liquids into the pan so be careful and add slowly.
food.step6: Whisk the sooji continuously as you add the liquids. Add the liquids in 2-3 parts, whisking continuously with one hand.
food.step7: Keep stirring, sooji will begin to absorb the liquid and thicken up.
food.step8: Garnish with more cashews and serve sooji halwa warm!
food.ingredients: 1/3 cup sugar 75 grams, or use more for a sweeter halwa
food.ingredient 4: 1/2 cup ghee 100 grams, in semi-solid state
food.ingredient 5: 1/2 cup sooji (semolina) 90 grams, use fine sooji
food.ingredient 6: 10 whole cashew nuts broken into small pieces
food.description: Sajjige, as it is called in parts of Tulunadu, is a highly heralded as a sweet dish. Semolina, when made sweet, is called sheera. Sajjige is served as a breakfast or a dessert item.

food.recipe: This gorgeous candy is very easy, but it does take a while to make--mostly standing at the stove and stirring. But it's worth it for the gorgeous nut-studded, amazingly textured final product.
food.step 1: Line an 8x11-inch baking dish with plastic wrap, allowing ends to hang over the sides. Place 1 sheet of 8x10 wafer paper in the bottom of the pan. Keep the roasted almonds and pistachios in a warm place until ready to add at the end. This makes it easier to mix them in.
food.step 2: Pour honey into a heavy-bottomed pot. Add sugar. Mix and stir over low heat with a spatula, stirring constantly until mixture turns from grainy to silky and smooth, about 30 minutes. Remove pot from heat.
food.step 3: Place the egg whites in a mixing bowl; add a pinch of salt. Whisk until whites form soft peaks, 3 to 4 minutes. Place pot back on low heat. Gradually whisk about a quarter of the whipped egg whites into the honey/sugar mixture; whisk in the remaining egg whites in 3 more batches
food.step 4: Continue cooking over low heat, stirring constantly with a spatula until mixture turns a brighter white and a ribbon of the mixture does not immediately incorporate back into the rest of the mixture and stays intact on the surface for a while. This will take about 40 minutes. You can add a few drops of the mixture into a small bowl of ice cold water to test the consistency; ideally it should feel like soft clay.
food.step 5: Whisk in vanilla and lemon zest. Add warm almonds and pistachios and stir to incorporate evenly.
food.step6: Transfer mixture to prepared baking dish. Even out as best you can with a clean oiled spatula. Top with 2nd sheet of wafer paper, shiny side up. Cover with plastic wrap and press down evenly, tamping mixture down gently but firmly. Remove top layer of plastic.
food.step7: Allow torrone to sit at room temperature until cool, firm, and ready to cut, 1 or 2 hours. Lift torrone from baking dish with the edges of the bottom layer of plastic wrap. Invert and remove plastic from the bottom. If the plastic wrap is difficult to remove from the edges of the torrone, you can trim off the edges.
food.step8: Cut torrone into 1-inch squares using a sharp serrated knife.
food.ingredient 5: 2 large egg whites large egg whites, at room temperature
food.description: Turrón, or torrone, is a southern European nougat confection, typically made of honey, sugar, and egg white, with toasted almonds or other nuts, and usually shaped into either a rectangular tablet or a round cake.

food.recipe: Rava upma is a savory South Indian breakfast dish made with cream of wheat (sooji or rava).
food.step 1: Finely chop 1 medium sized onion, 1 to 2 green chillies and 1/2 inch ginger and some coriander leaves.
food.step 2: Also take 8 to 10 curry leaves, 10 to 12 cashews, 1 tsp chana dal and 1 tsp urad dal.
food.step 3: Heat a pan or kadai first. Add 1 cup rava or cream of wheat.
food.step 4: Begin to roast the rava. Stir often while roasting the rava.
food.step 5: The rava or sooji grains should become fragrant and start to look dry, separate and crisp. Don't brown the rava
food.step6: Switch off the flame and then add the roasted rava in a plate and keep aside.
food.step7: In a pan, heat 2 tbsp ghee or oil. add 1 tsp mustard seeds.
food.step8: When you hear the crackling sound of mustard seeds, it means they are getting fried.
food.step9: Now add the 1/2 tsp cumin seeds along with 1 tsp chana dal and 1 tsp urad dal.
food.step10: Immediately then add cashews and begin to fry. By the time, the cashews get golden the dals would also get golden.
food.step11: Now add the finely chopped onions. Saute the onions till they become translucent.
food.step12: Then add the chopped green chilly, ginger, curry leaves. Saute for a minute.
food.step13: Then add 2.5 cups water to this mixture. Add salt as required.
food.ingredients: ▢1 cup fine rava (sooji or cream of wheat or semolina)
food.ingredient 4: 1 teaspoon chana dal (split and skinned bengal gram)
food.ingredient 5: 1 teaspoon urad dal (split and skinned black gram)
food.ingredient 6: ▢½ inch ginger grated or chopped finely
food.ingredient 10: 1 sprig curry leaves or 10 to 12 curry leaves
food.ingredient 12: 1 to 2 teaspoons sugar or add as required, optional
food.description: Upma, uppumavu or uppittu is a dish originating from the Indian subcontinent, most common in South Indian, Maharashtrian, and Sri Lankan Tamil breakfast, cooked as a thick porridge from dry-roasted semolina or coarse rice flour.

food.recipe: Delicious South Indian style vegetarian kurma recipe made with mixed veggies, coconut, green chillies, spices and herbs.
food.step 1: Soak 12 to 15 cashews in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Later drain and keep aside.
food.step 2: Rinse and soak 1 to 1.25 cups mediums sized cauliflower florets in hot water for 15 to 20 minutes. This step is optional and only to get rid of any insects or worms in the cauliflower. After blanching the cauliflower, drain them and keep aside.
food.step 3: Rinse, peel and chop the rest of the veggies.
food.step 4: Add the the ingredients mentioned under 'for ground paste' in a in a wet grinder jar.
food.step 5: Pour ½ cup water and grind to a smooth fine paste. Keep aside.
food.step6: Heat 2 tbsp oil. Add the chopped onions.
food.step7: Stir and saute till the onions turn translucent or a light brown. Add 7 to 8 curry leaves and stir.
food.step8: Next add the chopped tomatoes, ¼ tsp turmeric powder and ½ tsp red chili powder. Stir and saute for 2 to 3 minutes.
food.step9: Add the ground paste. Stir and mix well. Saute stirring often for 4 to 5 minutes on a low to medium flame.
food.step10: Then add 2 tbsp fresh curd/yogurt. If you want, you can skip yogurt too.
food.step11: Mix the curd very well with the rest of the masala.
food.step12: Add the chopped mix veggies. Stir and saute for 1 to 2 minutes.
food.step13: Then add 1.25 cups water. For slightly thin gravy you can add 1.5 cups water. If cooking in a pan, then add 1.5 to 2 cups of water. Stir well
food.ingredients: 5 tablespoon desiccated coconut or fresh coconut
food.ingredient 12: a small tiny piece of stone flower (pathar phool) - optional

food.recipe: Wagashi are sweet Japanese confections made from bean paste. Similar to marzipan, the paste can be sculpted into gorgeous little shapes inspired by the season. Making wagashi is not hard, but can be time consuming and requires a bit of practice to master the techniques
food.step 1: Take the soaked and peeled sweet potatoes and add them to a pan of water. Place this pan over low flame. Cook the potatoes over low heat for 8-10 minutes or until they have softened. Once done, remove from heat and strain all the excess water and transfer the cooked potatoes into a large bowl.
food.step 2: Now, sprinkle salt and sugar and mix well with the potatoes. Using a fork or a spatula, mash the potatoes and mix the sugar along with salt in these. Transfer the mashed potato mixture into a round mould. Cover it with cling film and refrigerate the mixture until it hardens.
food.step 3: In the meantime, in a bowl, add a small amount of water and sweet rice flour. Mix it well and then add the cake flour and a pinch of salt. Whisk the ingredients well to ensure that there are no lumps. Now, take the mould out from the freezer and cut the chilled potato filling into small pieces in a shape of your choice and dip each piece into the flour mixture
food.step 4: Sprinkle the black sesame seeds onto the dipped pieces so that they stick to the flour mix. Now, heat a non-stick pan on low flame and add vegetable oil to it. Once it is hot, place the potato pieces onto the pan and let these cook until golden brown in color. Once done, remove from flame and let these cool for a while. Serve these with a hot cup of tea and enjoy!

food.recipe: Chinese style water chestnut cake--a traditional and yummy dim sum dessert
food.step 1: Soak the flour with 150ml water and stir until smooth. Set aside for 10 minutes. Then re-stir. You can strain the mixture if necessary.
food.step 2: In a deep plan, add the remaining water and the sugar pieces, heat over slow fire until the sugar is completely dissolved. Bring to boil and add minced fresh water chestnut in. Stop fire until the content begin to boil again.
food.step 3: After the sugar water boils, stir the sugar water slowly to the square pan for soaking the flour in first step immediately. During the process, keep stirring the flour water to avoid settling to the bottom. After adding the boiling sugar water, the batter will become really thick. Shake it slightly to trowel.
food.step 4: Set up the steamer and wok and then steam the batter for around 20 minutes. To check whether the batter is completely done, insert a toothpick in and see whether it is clean after pulling out.
food.step 5: Cook down completely and then cut it into thick slices. In summer days, it can be directly served cold after stored in fridge. And in winter days, pan-frying the cake with a small amount of oil and serve hot.
food.ingredient 2: 5 fresh water chestnut , or you can use canned one too
food.ingredient 3: 2 slabs of sugar pieces , around 190g, this can be replaced by brown sugar or white sugar
food.ingredient 4: 700 ml water , 150ml for soaking + 550ml for sugar water

food.recipe: One of my favourite hot pots, yosenabe is packed with seafood, chicken and vegetables. Unlike shabushabu, you don’t need dipping sauces for this as yosenabe is cooked in flavoured soup. You can cook them all and serve, or let people cook piece by piece for entertainment. Cook Time assumes the hot pot is cooked at once.
food.step 1: Put dashi soup stock in a donabe pot or an electric skillet.
food.step 2: Heat the soup and bring to a boil.
food.step 3: Season with sake, soy sauce, mirin, and salt.
food.step 4: Turn down the heat to low. Add salmon and clams in the pot at first.
food.step 5: Put other ingredients and simmer until softened and cooked through.
food.step6: Prepare individual serving bowls for diners and have them take some simmered ingredients in the bowl as they eat.
food.ingredient 6: 4 or 8 hard shell clams, cleaned and sand expelled
food.ingredient 7: 2 salmon steaks, or salmon fillets, cut into 2-inch lengths and bones removed
food.ingredient 8: 1/4 head hakusai (Chinese cabbage), washed and cut into 2-3 inch lengths
food.ingredient 9: 1 negi, leek, rinsed and cut diagonally
food.ingredient 10: 1 carrot, peeled and cut into 1/4 inch thick rounds
food.ingredient 13: 1 shungiku (chrysanthemum greens), washed and cut into 2-3 inch lengths *optional`
food.calories: Yield: 12 servings, Amount per serving: 268 calories, Calories: 268g,
food.restaurants: ["Hyderabad Xpress","Lucky Restaurant","Delhi Darbar","Juice & More","India Bistro","Behrouz Biryani","Rivaayat Biryani","Sujata Veg Treat","Strictly Biryani","Northern Tadka","Jyran - Sofitel","Birista - Biryanis & Kebabs","Biryani Guru","Curry Culture","Jaffer Bhai's Delhi Darbar"]
food.description: Yosenabe is basically a combination Japanese hot pot. You can put in almost any kind of meat and vegetables that go well with the soup stock. Depending on the region in Japan, even the soup is made with different flavouring. Yose comes from the verb, yoseru which means gather or collect.

food.recipe: With a mandoline (or precise knife skills), thinly slice the potato to about 1/10 inch (2.5 mm) thick. You do not want to see through the slices.
food.step 1: Put the potato slices in a bowl and pour water over top. The potatoes should be submerged - if not, add more liquid. Soak for 30 minutes. Drain and pat completely dry.
food.step 2: In a large freezer bag or bowl (preferably with a lid so you can shake it for easier coating), combine the paprika, onion powder, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, and chili powder.
food.step 3: Fill a fryer (or a really deep saucepan) with frying oil of choice and heat to 350F. Place a cooling rack on top of a cookie sheet.
food.step 4: When the oil is ready, ensure the potato slices are completely dry. Fry a few at a time until golden brown, being careful not to overcrowd the fryer. Time will vary depending on the size and thickness of the slices, but the average is 3-5 minutes, flipping each chip over halfway through frying.
food.step 5: Repeat with the remaining slices, ensuring the oil is 350F when frying. You may need to pause in between batches to let the oil heat up again.
food.step6: Preheat oven to 400F. Line two baking sheets with foil and lightly grease with cooking spray.
food.step7: Ensure the potato slices are completely dry then place the slices in a single layer on the two sheets. Brush each slice with oil.
food.step8: Bake for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown and crisp (but not burnt). If you find that some of the smaller pieces are baking faster after 10 minutes, you can remove those then finish baking the rest. Let cool for a few minutes to finish crisping up then toss in the spice mixture.
food.ingredients: 1 large russet potato, peeling optional (roughly 6-8 ounces)
food.ingredient 9: Frying oil (such as vegetable or peanut), enough to fill a fryer or to brush slices before baking
food.serving: Yield: Yields about 7 cups, or about 200 chips; yields about 3 Tbs. of seasoning
food.restaurants: ["Ovenfresh","Grandmama's Café","Arya Bhavan","Salt Water Cafe","Guru Kripa","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Candies","Terttulia","Cafe Trofima","Flea Bazaar Café","Bombay Salad Co.","Todi Mill Social"]
food.description: Barbecue chips combine classic barbecue sauce spices such as chile powder, garlic powder and onion powder with the added kick of cayenne pepper.

food.recipe: Basque-Style Chicken simmered in an easy sauce with roasted chili peppers, ham, tomatoes, garlic, and olives. Makes a warming, hearty dinner on a chilly night.
food.step 1: Roast the chiles: Turn on the broiler and set a rack about 5 inches from the broiler element. Brush the chiles with enough oil to lightly coat. Broil for 5 minutes, turning several times, or until they are charred. (Alternatively, roast the chiles on the open flame of a gas stovetop.)
food.step 2: Peel the chiles: Carefully pull the charred skin of the chili by hand. Cut the chile open, remove and discard the seeds, and chop coarsely.
food.step 3: Brown the chicken: Trim away the excess fat from the thighs. Sprinkle all over with salt and pepper.
food.step 4: In a large deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add half of thighs, skin side down. Cook for 4 minutes, or until golden on the undersides. Turn and brown the other sides for 3 minutes.
food.step 5: Make the sauce: Discard all but 2 tablespoons fat from the pan. Add the onion, ham, and garlic. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes until the onions have started to soften. Add the roasted chiles and jalapeño. Continue cooking, stirring often, for 2 minutes.
food.step6: ook the chicken: Return all the chicken to the pan, skin side up, along with any juices in the bowl. It’s ok if the thighs are a tight fit. Spoon some of the sauce over the chicken. Return to a boil, lower the heat, and partially cover.
food.step7: Finish and serve: Taste the sauce for seasoning and add more salt and black pepper, if you like. Sprinkle the dish with the chopped olives and parsley. Serve hot.
food.ingredients: 3 mild chili peppers (Anaheim, poblanos, Fresno, or another variety)
food.ingredient 9: 1 jalapeño or other small hot chili pepper, seeded and chopped
food.ingredient 12: 1/2 cup pitted green olives, coarsely chopped
food.restaurants: ["Satkar Rice Plate House","gajalee","fishland","soul fry","highway gomantak","pangat","jai hind lunch home"]
food.description: Smoked paprika is a traditional ingredient in Spanish cuisine, and adds a nice punch of flavor in this spicy dish prepared in the style of Spain's northwestern Basque region . Serve the chicken with saffron rice to soak up the tasty sauce.

food.recipe: Our traditional Battenberg cake is a delicious project for an afternoon in the kitchen. Bake this easy but impressive cake for a special occasion
food.step 1: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and line the base and sides of a 20cm square tin with baking parchment (the easiest way is to cross 2 x 20cm-long strips over the base). To make the almond sponge, put the butter, sugar, flour, ground almonds, baking powder, eggs, vanilla and almond extract in a large bowl. Beat with an electric whisk until the mix comes together smoothly. Scrape into the tin, spreading to the corners, and bake for 25-30 mins – when you poke in a skewer, it should come out clean. Cool in the tin for 10 mins, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling while you make the second sponge.
food.step 2: For the pink sponge, line the tin as above. Mix all the ingredients together as above, but don’t add the almond extract. Fold in some pink food colouring. Then scrape it all into the tin and bake as before. Cool.
food.step 3: To assemble, heat the jam in a small pan until runny, then sieve. Barely trim two opposite edges from the almond sponge, then well trim a third edge. Roughly measure the height of the sponge, then cutting from the well-trimmed edge, use a ruler to help you cut 4 slices each the same width as the sponge height. Discard or nibble leftover sponge. Repeat with pink cake.
food.step 4: Take 2 x almond slices and 2 x pink slices and trim so they are all the same length. Roll out one marzipan block on a surface lightly dusted with icing sugar to just over 20cm wide, then keep rolling lengthways until the marzipan is roughly 0.5cm thick. Brush with apricot jam, then lay a pink and an almond slice side by side at one end of the marzipan, brushing jam in between to stick sponges, and leaving 4cm clear marzipan at the end. Brush more jam on top of the sponges, then sandwich remaining 2 slices on top, alternating colours to give a checkerboard effect. Trim the marzipan to the length of the cakes.
food.step 5: Carefully lift up the marzipan and smooth over the cake with your hands, but leave a small marzipan fold along the bottom edge before you stick it to the first side. Trim opposite side to match size of fold, then crimp edges using fingers and thumb (or, more simply, press with prongs of fork). If you like, mark the 10 slices using the prongs of a fork
food.step6: Assemble second Battenberg and keep in an airtight box or well wrapped in cling film for up to 3 days. Can be frozen for up to a month.
food.ingredient 10: pink food colouring, we used ½ tsp Squires rose food paste
food.restaurants: ["Jimmy Boy","Qutuz Irani Cafe","Yazdani Bakery & Restaurant","Chai Pe Charcha","Sassanian","Chai-Coffi","Chai-Coffi","Chaayos - Meri Wali Chai"]
food.description: Battenberg or Battenburg is a light sponge cake held together with jam. The cake is covered in marzipan and, when cut in cross section, displays a distinctive two-by-two check pattern alternately coloured pink and yellow.

food.recipe: Talented Irish chefs have found ways to incorporate it into salads and main dishes. Black pudding recipe vary wildly throughout Ireland; some include barley, breadcrumbs, and flour, but oatmeal is the old-fashioned thickener. Be sure it's steel-cut or pinhead oatmeal, and cook it until just tender.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 325°F and grease 2 glass loaf pans. (If you don't have glass loaf pans, line metal loaf pans with parchment to keep the blood sausage from reacting with the metal and creating an off-flavor.) Stir 1 teaspoon of salt into the blood.
food.step 2: Bring 2 1/2 cups water to a boil and stir in the oats. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes, until just tender, not mushy.
food.step 3: Pour the blood through a fine sieve into a large bowl to remove any lumps. Stir in the fat, onion, milk, pepper, allspice and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Add the oatmeal and mix to combine. Divide the mixture between the loaf pans, cover with foil, and bake for 1 hour, until firm. Cool completely. Seal in plastic wrap and wither freeze for extended use or store in the refrigerator for up to a week.
food.step 4: To serve, cut a slice about 1/2-inch thick off the loaf. Fry in butter or oil until the edges are slightly crisped and browned.
food.ingredient 4: 2 cups finely diced pork fat (or beef suet), finely chopped
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Black pudding is a distinct regional type of blood sausage originating in the United Kingdom and Ireland. It is made from pork blood, with pork fat or beef suet, and a cereal, usually oatmeal, oat groats or barley groats

food.recipe: This recipe works great with other cobbler fruit and is an excellent light dessert that isn't too sweet! Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
food.step 2: In an 8 inch square baking dish, mix blueberries, 3 tablespoons sugar, and orange juice. Set aside. In a small bowl, thoroughly mix flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
food.step 3: In a medium bowl, cream butter and 1/2 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla extract. Gradually add flour mixture, stirring just until ingredients are combined. Drop batter by rounded tablespoons over blueberry mixture. Try to cover as much of filling as possible.
food.step 4: Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, until topping is golden brown and filling is bubbling
food.restaurants: ["The Bombay Canteen","Bademiya","Sarvi","Chinese N Grill","Chinese N Grill","Olympia Coffee House","Ahmed Bhai's Bry & Dry","Ayub's","Cafe Military","Ideal Corner","Delhi Darbar","Lucky Restaurant"]
food.description: Cobbler is a dish consisting of a fruit or savoury filling poured into a large baking dish and covered with a batter, biscuit, or dumpling (in the United Kingdom) before being baked. Some cobbler recipes, especially in the American south, resemble a thick-crusted, deep-dish pie with both a top and bottom crust.

food.recipe: Completely from-scratch with homemade pastry cream, buttery sponge cake, and shiny chocolate glaze, this classic Boston cream pie recipe is supremely decadent and satisfying
food.step 1: Read the recipe and watch the helpful video above before beginning as there are many little steps that are time sensitive or require cooling.
food.step 2: Make the pastry cream: Heat half-and-half in a medium saucepan over medium heat until simmering. Meanwhile, whisk egg yolks, granulated sugar, and salt together in a bowl until smooth. Add flour and whisk until combined. Mixture will be thick. Whisk about 1/2 cup half-and-half into yolk mixture to temper, then slowly whisk tempered yolk mixture into half-and-half in the saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low and continue to cook, whisking constantly, for 5 minutes as the mixture thickens. (America’s Test Kitchen instructs for 7-8 minutes, but mine began thickening quickly.)
food.step 3: Increase heat to medium and cook, whisking vigorously, until bubbles burst on the surface, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and whisk in the butter and vanilla extract until combined. Pastry cream will be thick. Strain through a fine-mesh strainer set over a bowl. Press plastic wrap directly on surface of pastry cream and refrigerate until set, at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours.
food.step 4: Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C). Grease two round 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper, then grease the parchment paper. You must use parchment! See recipe note.
food.step 5: Make the cake: Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a small bowl. In the microwave or on the stove, heat milk and butter together until butter has melted. Stir in the vanilla extract. Cover loosely to keep warm. In a large bowl using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the eggs and granulated sugar together on high speed until light and creamy, about 4 minutes. Add hot milk mixture and whisk by hand until combined, then whisk in the dry ingredients. Batter will bubbly on top and somewhat thick, similar to pancake batter.
food.step6: Divide batter evenly between 2 pans. Bake until the tops of cakes are light brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20-22 minutes.
food.step7: Remove cakes from the oven and set on a wire rack. Allow to cool completely in the pan. As the cakes cool, check the pastry cream in the refrigerator. If it’s too thick, it won’t easily spread and could tear the cake. I remove pastry cream from the refrigerator about 20 minutes before assembling the cake.
food.step8: Assemble the cake:  Once cakes are cool, run a thin knife around the edges to release them from the pans. Place bottom cake layer on your cake stand or serving plate. Spread pastry cream evenly on top. Place second cake layer on top and gently press down to adhere to the pastry cream. Refrigerate cake while preparing the chocolate glaze.
food.step9: Make the glaze: Heat heavy cream and corn syrup in a small saucepan over medium heat until just simmering. As it heats up, place chocolate in a heat-proof glass bowl with a pouring spout (I use this 2-cup liquid measuring cup). Once simmering, remove cream from heat and pour over chocolate. Let sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Gently whisk until smooth.
food.step10: Pour glaze into the center of cake. Spread glaze to the edges of cake allowing it to gently drip down the sides. Refrigerate cake, uncovered, for at least 2 hours (and up to 24 hours) before slicing and serving. If chilling for longer than 2 hours, allow cake to come to room temperature before slicing and serving.
food.step11: Cover leftover cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for 5 days
food.ingredient 2: 6 large egg yolks, at room temperature
food.ingredient 6: 1/4 cup (4 Tablespoons; 60g) unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces
food.description: A Boston cream pie is a yellow butter cake filled with custard or cream and topped with chocolate glaze. The dessert acquired its name when cakes and pies were cooked in the same pans, and the words were used interchangeably.

food.recipe: These American traybake brownies include all of our favourite things, chocolate, booze and bacon - pure decadence
food.step 1: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. In a small pan, warm (don’t boil) the cherries in the bourbon, then leave to infuse for at least 20 mins.
food.step 2: Meanwhile, mix the cinnamon with the maple syrup and brush both sides of the bacon with it. Lay the rashers on a rack set over a roasting tin covered in foil and roast, basting occasionally with the syrup, for about 20 mins until they look nicely browned. Take them out and leave to cool completely on the rack while you make the brownie mixture
food.step 3: Follow your chosen recipe to make the brownie mixture and heat oven to the required temperature. Drain the bourbon-soaked cherries and add them to the brownie mixture. Chop the bacon into little pieces (it will crumble very easily) and add to the mixture too, stirring everything together. Bake as per the recipe, then leave to cool completely before dusting with cocoa and slicing into squares.
food.ingredient 6: your favourite brownie mixture (see Goes well with for our Best-ever brownies recipe)
food.ingredient 7: a little cocoa powder , for dusting
food.time: Prep: 25 mins Cook: 55 mins plus macerating
food.description: These American traybake brownies include all of our favourite things, chocolate, booze and bacon - pure decadence

food.recipe: Vitaly Paley, the chef and owner of Paley's Place, created this deliciously indulgent version of the classic tuna melt while competing in a cook-off sponsored by the Oregon Dungeness Crab Commission. Pairing moist chunks of crab with brioche, truffle butter and nutty Gruyère cheese easily snagged him a first-place prize.
food.step 1: Preheat the broiler. Spread the cut sides of the brioche with the truffle butter and set on a baking sheet, cut sides up. Broil the rolls 6 inches from the heat, until toasted. Reduce the oven temperature to 400°.
food.step 2: In a large bowl, mix the mayonnaise, red onion, parsley, lime juice, apple and hot sauce and season with salt and pepper. Fold in the crabmeat.
food.step 3: Set the top halves of the rolls aside. Top the bottoms with the crab salad and sprinkle with the Gruyère. Bake in the upper third of the oven until the cheese is melted. Close the crab melts and serve.
food.ingredients: 8 small, round brioche or buttery dinner rolls, split crosswise
food.ingredient 2: 6 tablespoons truffle butter or unsalted butter, softened (see Note)
food.ingredient 7: 1/2 Granny Smith apple—quartered lengthwise, cored and thinly sliced crosswise
food.description: Brioche is a bread of French origin that is similar to a highly enriched pastry, and whose high egg and butter content give it a rich and tender crumb. Chef Joël Robuchon described it as "light and slightly puffy, more or less fine, according to the proportion of butter and eggs.

food.recipe: Put the saffron in a small bowl and wet it with 1 tbsp warm water. Put the mussels and wine in a large pan, cover and cook over a high heat for 3-4 minutes, shaking the pan now and then, until the mussels have opened
food.step 1: Tip the mussels into a colander set over a bowl to catch all the cooking liquid (discard any that remain closed). Transfer the mussels to a large serving bowl and keep warm.
food.step 2: Melt the butter in a pan, add the onion, garlic and curry powder, then cook gently without browning for 2-3 minutes. Add the cognac and cook until it has almost all evaporated, then stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in the saffron liquid and all except the last 1-2 tbsp of the reserved mussel cooking liquid (which may contain some grit or sand).
food.step 3: Bring the sauce to a simmer, then cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the crème fraîche and simmer for a further 3 minutes or until slightly reduced. Taste and season, stir in the parsley, then pour the sauce over the mussels. Serve with plenty of crusty French bread.
food.ingredient 2: 1.75kg mussels, cleaned and de-bearded (discard any open mussels that don’t close when firmly tapped)
food.ingredient 7: ½ tsp good-quality medium curry powder
food.description: Mouclade is a dish made of mussels, mainly from Saintonge origin. It is made with bouchot mussels from the region. To this very popular seafood in Charente-Maritime, we add shallots, butter from Charentes, egg yolks, pineau des Charentes, garlic, bouquet garni and cream.

food.recipe: The word aamras means mango juice. Basically aamras is plain mango puree or pulp. You can also call it mango nectar. aamras is a summer delight in a bowl.
food.step 1: Rinse the alphonso mangoes. Then peel and chop them.
food.step 2: In a blender, add the chopped mango pieces and blend.
food.step 3: Add cardamom powder and crushed saffron strands.
food.step 4: Stir very well. To thin down the aamras, you can add some sugar or some milk or water.
food.step 5: Pour in small bowls and chill in the refrigerator.
food.step6: Serve aamras with puri. You can also serve with chapatis.
food.step7: You could even add your choice of dry fruits to the aamras. If adding cashew-nuts, fry the cashew-nuts till golden brown and then mix it with the aam ras.
food.ingredients: 400 grams mangoes or 2 large alphonso or 3 to 4 kesar mangoes
food.ingredient 5: ¼ teaspoon dry ginger powder (saunth) - optional
food.ingredient 6: water or milk as required - optional
food.restaurants: ["Mangoes Mumbai","shreeji aamrus","pancham puriwala","golden star thali","sheetal diary"]
food.description: Aamras or mango juice - easy to prepare and a traditional sweet served with pooris,

food.recipe: The yoghurt makes the gravy thick which helps coat all the chicken pieces evenly. Tailor the heat your requirement by using a little less of the whole red chillies and the chilli powder. Like any other meat dish, if this is made a little in advance the taste develops and is much nicer.
food.step 1: Take chicken pieces in a bowl, add yogurt, ½ tsp turmeric powder, salt and mango pickle and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 10-15 minutes.
food.step 2: Heat a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, fennel seeds and nigella (onion) seeds and dry roast till fragrant. Transfer into a mortar and coarsely pound with the pestle.
food.step 3: Heat mustard oil in a non-stick kadai till it smokes then switch off heat and let the oil cool slightly. Switch on the heat again, add cloves, bay leaves, green chillies and onion, mix and sauté till golden brown
food.step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes or till the raw smells disappear. Add tomatoes, mix and sauté till the tomatoes become pulpy.
food.step 5: Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt and mix well. Add 1 cup water, mix well and continue to saute till oil separates.
food.step6: Add chicken and mix well. Add 2 tsps ground spices and mix well. Cover and cook till the chicken is ¾ cooked.
food.step7: Uncover the pan and cook till the chicken is cooked completely and the gravy thickened.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle a little ground spices, garnish with green chillies and coriander sprig and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Chicken cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.restaurants: ["Pritam Da Dhaba","Hardeep Punjab","Masala Library","Sindhful","Shalimar","Hitchki","Pizza By The Bay","Jaffer Bhai's Delhi Darbar","Copper Chimney","Noor Mohammadi Hotel","Cafe Noorani","Pot Pourri"]
food.description: The yoghurt makes the gravy thick which helps coat all the chicken pieces evenly. Tailor the heat your requirement by using a little less of the whole red chillies and the chilli powder. Like any other meat dish, if this is made a little in advance the taste develops and is much nicer.

food.recipe: Boil the potatoes and bream them finely. After this, heat a pan. Add some oil to it. When the oil is hot add cumin seeds, asafoetida, turmeric powder, green chili, ginger paste and coriander powder. Saute the masala for a while and then add curd to it and mix thoroughly.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and allow them to change colour.
food.step 2: Add garlic, ginger, green chillies and spring onions, mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes
food.step 3: Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and Kitchen King Masala, mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 4: Grate the potatoes and add to the pan. Add ½ cup water and mix well. Cook for 1 minute.
food.step 5: Add coriander leaves, salt and dried mango powder, mix well and cook for 1 minute. Take it off the heat.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.
food.ingredient 14: Spring onion green chopped for garnish
food.description: Aloo bharta is instantly prepared recipe made of boiled potatoes and spices, a specialty from Northern India.

food.recipe: Aloo Bhujia is a dry snack made with chickpea flour and mashed potatoes/boiled potatoes. It is a must make during festivals or during meet ups, and is served with Murukku, Chivda Namkeen, and other dry snacks. It can also be enjoyed as an evening snack with a hot cup of tea.
food.step 1: Mix besan, grated potato and oil in a pan.
food.step 2: Mix together nicely.
food.step 3: Add salt, 1 tsp chaat masala, red chilli powder, hing, baking soda and lemon juice. Mix nicely.
food.step 4: Add very little water and knead to make a tight dough.
food.step 5: Cover and keep the dough for 10 minutes.
food.step6: Heat oil in a pan.
food.step7: Divide the dough in 4 parts. Fill one part in the sev press fitted with fine net.
food.step8: Press the sev press over the hot oil. Simmer the heat. Fry till golden brown from both the sides. Remove from oil on a kitchen tissue lined plate.
food.step9: Sprinkle the remaining chat masala and dry pudina powder on top and mix well..
food.step10: Cool the aloo bhujia.
food.step11: Store in an airtight container.
food.restaurants: ["Chhotu Motu Joshi Sweet Shop","Bikaji Food Junxon"]
food.description: Bikaneri bhujia, often simply called bhujia, is a popular crispy snack prepared by using moth beans and besan and spices, originating from, Bikaner, a town in the western state of Rajasthan in India.

food.recipe: Aloo Gobi is a delicious Indian dish made with cauliflower and potatoes. There are many variations of making this popular dish.
food.step 1: First soak the cashews in warm water for 30 minutes. Then drain and blend them to a smooth paste with about 2 tbsp water in a grinder or blender.
food.step 2: Rinse and peel the potatoes and then dice them. Chop the onions and tomatoes finely.
food.step 3: Chop the gobi/cauliflower into medium sized florets. Rinse the florets well in water.
food.step 4: Heat enough water with salt for the florets to be immersed in, on stove top or in the microwave
food.step 5: Add the rinsed florets and keep them immersed in the hot water for 15-20 mins. This is to to get rid of the insects or worms that might be in the cauliflower.
food.step6: Then drain the cauliflower and rinse once again with fresh water.
food.step7: Heat the butter and oil in a pan and add all the whole spices or whole garam masala listed above. Saute till the spices become fragrant.
food.step9: Add the ginger-garlic paste. Stir and saute till the raw aroma of the garlic-ginger goes away
food.step10: Add the chopped tomatoes and saute till the tomatoes become soft and pulpy. This takes about 5-7 minutes on a low to medium flame.
food.step11: Add the cashew paste and all the spice powders one by one - turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder.
food.step12: Stir and saute till you see fat coming from the sides of the masala paste.
food.step13: The masala paste will start getting together and you will clearly see the fat leaving the sides. This process takes about 8-10 minutes on a low to medium flame.
food.ingredients: 1 medium sized cauliflower or approx 2.5 to 3 cups chopped medium cauliflower florets
food.ingredient 2: 2 medium sized potatoes or approx 2 to 2.5 cups diced potatoes
food.ingredient 3: 1 medium to large onion - finely chopped
food.ingredient 5: 15 whole cashews soaked in hot water for 20-30 minutes
food.ingredient 6: 1 inch ginger + 3-4 garlic cloves - crushed to a paste in a mortar-pestle or approx 1 to 1.25 teaspoon ginger garlic paste
food.ingredient 7: ½ teaspoon kashmiri red chili powder or deghi mirch or ¼ teaspoon red chili powder - adjust as per the heat in the red chili powder
food.ingredient 10: ¼ to ½ teaspoon garam masala or tandoori masala powder
food.ingredient 11: ½ teaspoon crushed kasuri methi (dry fenugreek leaves)
food.restaurants: ["Crystal","Pancham Puriwala","Paratha World","Little Bites","Oye Kake","Talli Turmeric","Uttam Da Dhaba","Bon Appetit","Punjab Grill"]
food.description: This aloo gobi masala is a rich, creamy and delicious curry dish made with potatoes, cauliflower, spices and herbs in a makhani gravy.

food.recipe: Aloo paratha is One of the most popular paratha recipe from Punjab, India. This delicious Punjabi aloo paratha is one of the most loved breakfast at any place
food.step 1: First boil the potatoes and peel them. You can boil or steam the potatoes in a pressure cooker, steamer or electric cooker.
food.step 2: Chop and then mash the potatoes with a potato masher.
food.step 3: The potatoes should be mashed very well. There should be no lumps or small pieces in it.
food.step 4: Now add the chopped green chilies, garam masala powder, red chili powder, dry mango powder and salt.
food.step 5: Mix the spice powders and green chilies with the mashed potatoes very well. Check the taste and add more salt or red chili powder or dry mango powder as per your taste.
food.step6: In another bowl or pan, take whole wheat flour (atta).
food.step7: Make a well in the center. Add salt, oil and about half of the water.
food.step8: Bring the mixture together and knead into a smooth soft dough.
food.step9: Cover and keep the dough aside for 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step10: Pinch two small balls from the dough. Flatten them and dust with whole wheat flour.
food.step11: With a rolling pin, roll them into about 4 to 5 inches diameter rounds . Try making both the rounds of the same size.
food.step12: On one of the rolled dough circle, place the potato stuffing in the center and keep about 1 inch empty space from the sides.
food.step13: Gently place the second circle on top.
food.ingredients: 3 to 4 medium potatoes , boiled and mashed
food.ingredient 3: ¼ to ½ teaspoon kashmiri red chilli powder or deghi mirch, optional
food.ingredient 4: ¼ to ½ teaspoon punjabi garam masala powder or garam masala powder
food.ingredient 5: ½ to 1 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder)
food.ingredient 6: 2 to 3 teaspoons finely chopped coriander leaves, optional
food.ingredient 8: oil or ghee, as required for roasting parathas
food.ingredient 11: white butter or yogurt to serve with the aloo paratha
food.restaurants: ["Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Chai Pe Charcha","Oye Kiddan","Lassi Te Parrontthe","Prithvi Cafe","Times Of Paratha","Guru Kripa","Paratha House","The Food Boxz","Taste Of Punjab","Paratha Express","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Paratha Corner","Chakh Le The Street Food","Bimal Paratha House","Crystal"]
food.description: Punjabi aloo ka paratha is a popular Indian breakfast of unleavened whole wheat flatbread stuffed with a spiced potato stuffing.

food.recipe: To make patra, the taro root leaves are smeared with a sweet, spicy and tangy besan or gram flour paste and stacked upon each other They are then rolled and steamed. The steamed rolls are then tempered or fried.
food.step 1: Soak the tamarind in 1/4 cup water for 30 mins.
food.step 2: Rinse the taro leaves well and wipe them dry.
food.step 3: Prepare them as shown in the pics below like removing the central vein and stalks etc.
food.step 4: Now squeeze the tamarind directly into the water and extract the pulp.
food.step 5: Take all the ingriedients for the batter in a mixing bowl.
food.step6: Add the tamarind pulp and mix well to make a thick batter.
food.step7: Add some water if required.
food.step8: Check the taste and add more salt or powdered jaggery if required.
food.step9: The batter has to be really thick.
food.step10: For the first roll use 10 leaves and for the second roll use remaining 10 leaves.
food.step11: Now spread the batter on each leaf and arrange them as shown in the above pics.
food.step12: Roll the edges vertically and spread some batter on them.
food.step13: Now roll horizontally and tightly.
food.ingredients: 20 medium sized colocasia leaves or taro root leaves or arbi ke patte
food.ingredient 6: 1.5 tablespoon seedless tamarind (imli) soaked in ¼ cup water
food.ingredient 7: 2.5 cups besan (gram flour or chickpea flour)
food.ingredient 8: 3 to 4 tablespoon powdered jaggery or as required
food.description: Alu vadi also known as patra or pathrode is a delicious dish of colocasia or taro root leaves smeared with spiced, sweet and tangy gram flour paste and steamed to be tempered later

food.recipe: Basically a traditional maharashtrian style dal recipe  prepared with toor dal / pigeon pea lentil.in other words the combination of sweet, sour, spice and tangy taste makes it unique and specific to marathi cuisine.
food.step 1: firstly, in a large kadai heat 1 tbsp ghee and saute 1 tsp mustard, ½ tsp jeera, pinch of hing and few curry leaves
food.step 2: also add 1 green chilli, ¼ tsp turmeric and saute on low flame
food.step 3: further add 2 cup cooked toor dal (1 cup dal + 3 cup water pressure cooked for 5 whistles)
food.step 4: get the dal to boil and add 1 tbsp goda masala, ¼ tsp chilli powder, ½ tbsp jaggery, 5 kokum, 2 tbsp coconut, ¾ tsp salt. mix well.
food.step 5: add ½ cup water and adjust consistency as required.
food.step6: mix well and boil for 5 minutes or till spices gets cooked completely.
food.step7: finally, add coriander leaves and serve amti dal with hot steamed rice.
food.ingredient 3: ½ tsp jeera / cumin pinch of hing /
food.ingredient 9: ¼ tsp kashmiri red chilli powder
food.description: the word amti literally means tangy with the combination of spice and sweetness. the tangy taste is mainly due addition of kokum, sweetness from jaggery and spice is from the goda masala. it is ideally served with plain rice jeera rice for lunch and dinner.

food.recipe: Egg tadka dal is extremely easy to make. This lentil dish is made with whole moong dal or green gram. You can also make it with split moong dal. It is best to soak the lentil over night in some cold water. The next day simply pressure cook it for 2 to 3 whistles.
food.step 1: Break the eggs into a bowl, add 1 onion, 2 tbsps coriander leaves, 1 green chilli and salt and whisk well.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add butter and let it melt. Add garlic, ginger and remaining green chillies, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes or till the raw smells disappear.
food.step 3: Add red chillies, mix and sauté for 30 seconds. Add remaining onion, mix and sauté till golden brown.
food.step 4: Add tomato and salt, mix and sauté till tomatoes become pulpy
food.step 5: Reduce heat, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and garam masala powder, mix and saute for 1 minute
food.step6: Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring continuously, for 2 minutes. Add dal, mix well, and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step7: Add remaining coriander leaves. Crush kasuri methi and add and mix well. Let the mixture come to a boil.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["Anda Apna Apna","Malvan Tadka","Anda Lovers","Surti Anda","Masala Library","Punjabi Tadka - Ramee Guestline Hotel","Oye Kake","Urban Tadka"]
food.description: Egg tadka dal is a a majorly popular and one of the most loved dish in India especially in Bengal and Punjab. It is mostly prepared in dhabas i.e. Indian road side small food stalls; do not mistake dhaba as restaurants.

food.recipe: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and cook, stirring until onion is soft but not browned.
