Pour in the rice, and cook stirring for 2 minutes, then stir in the wine, and continue cooking and stirring until the liquid has evaporated. Add hot chicken stock to the rice 1/3 cup at a time, stirring and cooking until the liquid has evaporated before adding more.
food.step 1: Cut mozzarella cheese into 8 small cubes.
food.step 2: Divide risotto into 8 equal portions and stuff each portion with a cheese cube and shape into a ball and place them on a plate.
food.step 3: Break eggs into a bowl and whisk well
food.step 4: Combine breadcrumbs and olive oil in a bowl and mix well. Put the refined flour in another bowl.
food.step 5: Roll the balls in refined flour, dip in the whisked egg and roll in the breadcrumb till well coated. Repeat the coating in whisked egg and breadcrumbs
food.step6: Place the prepared balls in an air fryer and fry at 180º C for 15 minutes.
food.step7: Arrange the prepared arancini on a serving plate and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: An Italian rice ball made with white wine risotto, and a gooey mozzarella center. Fantastic for lunch or dinner - can be frozen.

food.recipe: Badami paneer is a rich and exotic Indian curry that you’ve got to try if you love Indian Vegetarian curries. Paneer i.e Indian cottage cheese is cooked in aromatic almond based sauce and Indian spices.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add fennel seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add cloves, ginger and onions, mix and sauté till onions are golden
food.step 2: Add tomatoes, mix well, cover and cook till tomatoes are pulpy.
food.step 3: Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and cumin powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add salt, mix well and cook for 30 seconds. Take the pan off the heat and let the mixture cool slightly. Transfer into a blender jar and blend into a fine paste.
food.step 4: Heat another non-stick pan, add the ground paste and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add almond paste and fresh cream, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 5: Add salt and mix. Add paneer pieces and mix gently. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Almond paste blanched, peeled and ground 1/2
food.ingredient 2: Paneer (cottage cheese) cut into 1 inch cubes 250 grams
food.restaurants: ["Masala Kitchen","Masala Cuisine","Pritam Da Dhaba","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Masala Kraft - The Taj Mahal Palace","Angrezi Dhaba","Hardeep Punjab","The Bayview Restaurant - Marine Plaza"]
food.description: Badami paneer is a high protein North Indian curry that is humble enough for your everyday meal and luxurious enough for treating your guests with something special.

food.recipe: Bajra roti also known as bajra bhakri is a gluten free flatbread made from millet flour or bajra flour.
food.step 1: Heat or warm the water. Add salt and oil. Stir.
food.step 2: Add the bajra flour. Stir with a spoon. Knead into a smooth dough.
food.step 3: If the dough becomes sticky, then add more flour.
food.step 4: If the dough is dry, then add some water.
food.step 5: Meanwhile heat a tava or flat fry pan
food.step6: Make medium sized balls. Dust with flour and use a ziplock bag for rolling.
food.step7: Remove gently from the ziplock bag and place the roti on the hot tava.
food.step8: Cook till both sides have brown spots and done.
food.step9: Apply oil or ghee on one side.
food.step10: You can also fry the bajra roti like parathas with oil or ghee directly in the tava/frying pan.
food.ingredient 5: some bajra flour or whole wheat flour for dusting
food.ingredient 6: sunflower oil or ghee for applying on the roti or for frying them
food.description: They are very easy to make and make a good accompaniment to lentil or any Indian vegetable-based curry dish. They are heaty and good to have during winters or cold climate.

food.recipe: These fried char-siu chicken dumplings (Chinese BBQ chicken dumplings) are an incredibly tasty appetizer recipe that is a fun weekend project to make.
food.step 1: Combine refined flour, salt and coconut milk in a bowl. Mix well and knead into a hard dough. Set aside.
food.step 2: Roughly chop the chicken and place in a bowl.
food.step 3: Finely chop spring onion with greens. Chop red chilli. Add these to the chicken alongwith ginger, garlic, Hoisin sauce, barbecue sauce, salt and sesame seeds and mix well. Add lemon juice and mix again.
food.step 4: Divide the dough into equal portions and dust them with flour. Roll out portions into medium size discs. Apply water on the edges, place a portion of chicken mixture in the centre and bring the edges together and make into flower shape dumplings.
food.step 5: Place sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan and bring it to a boil. Put a bamboo steamer on it and place cabbage leaves in the steamer
food.step6: Place the dumplings on the leaves, cover and steam for 5-10 minutes.
food.step7: Serve hot with light soy sauce.
food.restaurants: ["Icy Spicy Restaurant","Jim - Me's Kitchen","Cantonese","The Oriental Blossom - Marine Plaza","Wok Hei","Stone Oven","5 Spice"]
food.description: These fried dumplings are a nice weekend project that can be streamlined if you make the filling ahead of time.

food.recipe: The marinade combines Sambal chili paste with soy sauce, ginger, brown sugar, and garlic. You will want to let those flavors sink in before this salmon takes a quick trip over a hot grill.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven at 200˚C.
food.step 2: Slice the lemon and 4-5 garlic cloves thinly
food.step 3: Place fish on the worktop, sprinkle salt and crushed black peppercorns into the slit and also on either side of the fish
food.step 4: Brush barbeque sauce inside and outside the fish. Stuff each fish with 3-4 lemon slices, 3-4 dill sprigs, 1-2 oregano sprigs, 1-2 thyme sprigs, 1-2 rosemary sprigs, 2 red chillies and remaining garlic cloves.
food.step 5: Tie the fish with a thread and make diagonally slashes on the fish, apply a little barbeque sauce on top and insert the garlic slices into the slashes. Drizzle some olive oil on each fish. Drizzle a little oil on the baking tray and place the fish in it. Place the remaining lemon slices and remaining red chillies on the side.
food.step6: Drizzle some more oil on top, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes. Take them out of the oven and place them on a serving plate. Cut and discard the thread.
food.step7: Garnish with orange slices and serve hot with salad.
food.ingredients: Indian Salmon ( Rawas) cleaned, deboned and slit into a butterfly 2
food.restaurants: ["Utsav- The Barbeque Restaurant","UBQ by Barbeque Nation","Barbeque & Biryani","Koliwada Chicken & Fish Fry Corner"]
food.description: the perfect fish for the grill​ and easily can become a personal favorite. It can be a bit of a splurge, but this recipe makes it worth the price.

food.recipe: Basically, a sweetened evaporated milk prepared by boiling the milk till it is reduced. it is later served chilled with toppings from dry fruits like pista, badam and cashews. the recipe is very similar to the popular north indian rabri recipe and basundhi is particularly famous in western and south indian states
food.step 1: firstly, in a large thick bottomed kadai boil 2-litre milk stirring occasionally.
food.step 2: once the milk comes to a boil, add 2 tbsp chopped cashew, almonds and pistachios.
food.step 3: stir well making sure milk doesn't stick to the bottom
food.step 4: boil the milk on low flame for 30 minutes or till milk reduces.
food.step 5: keep stirring in between to avoid sticking till the milk reduces to quarter.
food.step6: now add ½ cup sugar and ¼ tsp saffron and mix well.
food.step7: boil for another 5 minutes or till the milk thickens completely.
food.step8: now add ¼ tsp cardamom powder and mix well.
food.step9: finally, serve basundi chilled or hot garnished with few dry fruits.
food.ingredient 7: ¼ tsp cardamom powder / elachi powder
food.restaurants: ["Rabdi Wala","powai sweet and milk center","shree narayan dairy","chandu halwai","trapti milk and status bar"]
food.description: basundi is hugely popular in gujarat, maharashtra and karnataka where it is served chilled with mixed nuts. moreover, it is also confused with the other popular milk-based dessert

food.recipe: All you need is some chicken stock (home made if possible), one block of firm tofu, two eggs, some minced garlic and ginger, and your standard seasoning (salt & pepper). To get a thick soup, you will need corn starch. And for the finishing touch, some sesame oil and thinly sliced scallions.
food.step 1: Heat chicken stock in a non-stick wok.
food.step 2: Cut beancurd into small cubes. Halve spring onion bulbs vertically, then slice horizontally and add to the stock.
food.step 3: Chop the spring onion greens.
food.step 4: Break eggs and separate the yolks and whites into two separate bowls. For this recipe use only the whites.
food.step 5: Mix cornstarch with ¼ cup water in a small bowl.
food.step6: Add beancurd to the wok along with light soy sauce, salt and crushed black peppercorns.
food.step7: Add 2 tbsps of cornstarch mixture and mix.
food.step8: Whisk the egg whites and then add to the soup in a thin stream. It will coagulate and rise to the top.
food.step9: Add spring onion greens and mix. Serve piping hot.
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: it is really a recipe catered to the eater because if you want your soup sweeter - add more sugar. If you want your bean curd sheets to break up into finer pieces - cook it longer. Be aware though. If you could this too long, the bean curd sheets will break down so much that it will melt away into something that just looks like soy milk

food.food_item: Beancurd With French Beans And Hoisin Sauce
food.recipe: Each Chinese dish reflects a balance of taste, texture, aroma and colour. Be it sweet, sour, pungent, hot, salty or spicy – all the six basic flavours are incorporated deftly in all Chinese dishes.
food.step 1: Cut beancurd into two inch cubes and then cut each cube into four triangles.
food.step 2: Heat sesame oil in a pan. Add ginger and garlic and sauté for two minutes. Add onion and sauté for further two minutes.
food.step 3: Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep fry French beans for two minutes. Drain and set aside.
food.step 4: Add hoisin sauce to the onion along with red chilli paste and mix. Add the French beans and mix. Add beancurd triangles, soy sauce, salt and toss gently.
food.step 5: Serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Some other accounts of the history of Chinese cuisine takes the beginning to the Chinese stone age. However today Chinese cuisine enjoys the distinction of being the most popular in the world.

food.recipe: To prepare the sharbat, you will need ripe bel fruits. The pulp is removed and then mashed. The mixture is strained and then sugar or jaggery is added.
food.step 1: First take the bel fruits and with a rolling pin (belan) hit all around. For this recipe I have used 3 medium sized bel fruits.
food.step 2: You will see the outer hard shell cracking. Open the hard shell and you will see a brown colored pulp.
food.step 3: With a spoon scoop out the soft pulp.
food.step 4: Add the scooped soft pulp in a bowl.
food.step 5: Then add 1 cup water.
food.step6: After 20 minutes, with a veggie masher, mash the pulp. Mash very well.
food.step7: Then using a strainer, strain the mashed mixture in parts. Also overall add about ½ to ¾ cup water while straining.
food.step8: With a spoon stir so that the mixture is strained well.
food.step9: Once the mixture is strained, then add 12 tablespoons jaggery. You can also add sugar. Both jaggery and water can be adjusted as per your requirements.
food.step10: Then add roasted cumin powder, cardamon powder and 2 pinches of black salt.
food.step11: Mix very well.
food.step12: Pour in glasses and serve bel sherbet. You can make the bel sherbet thin or thick by adding more or less water.
food.ingredients: 3 small to medium sized bel fruit (bengal quince or stone apple or wood apple)
food.ingredient 3: 12 tablespoons jaggery or add as required
food.ingredient 4: ⅓ teaspoon cardamom powder (choti elaichi powder)
food.ingredient 5: ⅓ teaspoon of roasted cumin powder (bhuna jeera powder)
food.restaurants: ["Health Juice Centre","ajmeri sharbat","ashok dry fruit","hakeemi sharbat"]
food.description: A summer cooling drink is this bel ka sherbet. Bel fruit is also known as bengal quince, stone apple or wood apple.

food.recipe: The method for making besan barfi is straightforward and if you follow all the steps correctly, then treat yourself to a decadent & delicious barfi whose flavor lingers even after you have eaten it.
food.step 1: Heat ghee in a non-stick deep pan and when it melts, add besan and mix well. Sauté till the colour changes and the mixture is fragrant
food.step 2: Meanwhile, to make sugar syrup heat sugar with a little less than ½ cup water in a non-stick deep pan and stir till the sugar melts. Cook till the syrup comes to a little more than a one string consistency. This will take about 10 minutes.
food.step 3: Grease a barfi tray with a little ghee
food.step 4: Switch off the heat under both the pans. . Add green cardamom powder to the sugar syrup and mix well.
food.step 5: Add the sugar syrup to the besan mixture and mix till well combined. Switch on the heat under the pan and cook stirring continuously on low heat till the mixture comes together
food.step6: Transfer the mixture into the greased burfi tray and spread it evenly. Sprinkle pistachio slivers and gently press them with a spatula.
food.step7: Set aside for 5 minutes. Cut into desired shaped pieces and set aside for 15-20 minutes before separating the pieces
food.step8: Arrange them on a serving plate and serve or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 15-20 days.
food.restaurants: ["shree gangour sweets","chandu halwai grant road","m n mithaiwala","punjabi sweet house and restaurants","adarsh mithai mandir","vyanjan","tharu sweets","sindhu sweets","jhama sweets ghatkopar east"]
food.description: Besan ki barfi is a traditional Indian sweet of a rich and decadent barfi made with gram flour, sugar and ghee.

food.recipe: Bhakri or bhakhri is a mouth-watering dish of Maharashtrian cuisine, and is a type of bread that can be eaten both in breakfast and dinner as well.
food.step 1: To prepare this Maharashtrian recipe, make a stiff dough of flour with water. Knead it well.
food.step 2: Take a small sized dough, make a ball out of it and place it on a plastic sheet
food.step 3: Wet your hands with water and pat the dough gently into a thick, flat disk. Make sure that the dough does not stick while patting.
food.step 4: Heat a griddle and place the disk on it. Sprinkle some sesame seeds and roast it well.
food.step 5: When the bottom of the dough turns crispy brown, turn it over and cook the other side. When it is done, serve after putting some ghee.
food.restaurants: ["Satkar Rice Plate House","Gomantak","Goa Portuguesa","MH-09 Shetkari","Kath N Ghat","Mi Hi Koli","Acharekar's Malvan Katta","Gajalee","Jai Hind Lunch Home","Maharashtra Lunch Home"]
food.description: Bhakri has its origin in Maharashtrian cuisine, it is an integral part of Gujarati as well as Goan cuisine. Traditionally, it is made with jowar flour

food.recipe: This is A simple bhindi recipe to make. cooking the okra does not take much time. Its the preparation and stuffing that takes some time. But fairly easy to make. The recipe uses goda masala. But if you do not have goda masala, then just skip it and add garam masala powder instead.
food.step 1: Heat a pan and add 1/4 cup peanuts.
food.step 2: On a low flame, roast the peanuts till they are crunchy and golden. Keep aside and allow them to cool.
food.step 3: Rinse 20 to 22 medium sized bhendi (okra or bhindi) in running water for a couple of times.
food.step 4: Then dry them with a clean kitchen towel or dry them naturally by spreading them in a plate.
food.step 5: Slice off the crown and base tip of the bhendi. With a knife give a slit on one side. Make slits on all the okra and keep aside.
food.step6: In a grinder jar, add the roasted peanuts along with 1 green chili, 2 to 3 garlic, and 1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves.
food.step7: Without adding water coarsely grind and keep this mixture aside.
food.step8: In a plate or mixing bowl, take the ground mixture along with 1/4 cup tightly packed grated coconut, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1/2 tsp coriander powder, 2 tsp goda masala or 1/2 tsp garam masala powder, 1/2 tsp lime or lemon juice and 1/2 tsp sugar or salt as per taste.
food.step9: Mix the stuffing mixture very well.
food.step10: Now stuff this mixture in each bhindi very well
food.step11: Heat 3 tbsp oil and crackle 1/2 tsp mustard seeds first. Use a shallow frying pan.
food.step12: Lower the flame and then add 1/4 tsp turmeric powder and a pinch of asafoetida.
food.step13: Stir very well and then add the stuffed okra. Stir the okra well.
food.ingredients: 200 grams okra (bhindi or bhendi or lady finger) or 20 to 22 small to medium sized okra
food.ingredient 6: a few chopped coriander leaves for garnish
food.ingredient 7: 2 to 3 garlic chopped + ¼ cup chopped coriander leaves + ¼ cup roasted peanuts + 1 green chili, chopped
food.ingredient 8: ¼ cup tightly packed grated coconut or ¼ cup unsweetened desiccated coconut
food.ingredient 11: 2 teaspoon goda masala or ½ teaspoon garam masala powder
food.ingredient 12: ½ teaspoon lime or lemon juice or add as per taste
food.ingredient 13: ½ teaspoon sugar or powdered jaggery or add as per taste (optional)
food.description: Bharli bhendi is a delicious recipe of stuffed okra with a spiced coconut-peanut filling.

food.recipe: For the bharli vangi we need to use baby eggplants or small eggplants. This type is easily available in India. If you still have to make this recipe and do not have baby eggplants, you then buy the regular eggplants and chop them and make this recipe.
food.step 1: Wash the brinjals, slit them into 4 without breaking them and soak in salted water for 20 mins. You can also chop them and soak in salted water.
food.step 2: Dry roast the peanuts first, when they start to become brown, add the sesame seeds followed by dessicated coconut. Roast them till all of them are browned and smell fragrant. You can also roast them separately.
food.step 3: When the coconut, peanuts and sesame seeds cool down. Add them in a grinder with half of the chopped onions, ginger, garlic
food.step 4: Grind to a smooth paste with some water. Make sure not to make it too liquidy
food.step 5: If You Have Chopped The Brinjals, Follow These Steps To Make Bharli Vangi
food.step6: In pan heat oil, add the onions and fry them till they turn transparent. Now add the ground masala to the pan.
food.step7: Fry the masala for 2-3 mins. Add the all the dry spice powders and tomatoes
food.step8: Mix it well with the rest of the masala paste. Fry for another 2-3 mins.
food.step9: Finally add the chopped brinjals. Add 2 cups water, salt and mix the entire curry.
food.step10: Cover and let the brinjals cook for 30-35 minutes. when the dish is ready, garnish with coriander leaves.
food.step11: Serve bharli vangi hot with rice or chapati or puri.
food.ingredients: 500 grams baby brinjals (baingan or eggplant or vangi)
food.ingredient 11: ¼ teaspoon garam masala powder or goda masala powder

food.recipe: Brain masala fry, a usually preferred recipe to prepare once in a while by the tempting flavors of this dish and the rich health benefits it provides.
food.step 1: Soak Brain in hot water for 5 minutes this helps in cleaning.
food.step 2: Take a pan add oil, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, caraway seeds and saute
food.step 3: Now add chopped onions, salt cook till it becomes light brown color.
food.step 4: Add Turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, green chilies, curry leaves, pepper powder, coriander powder, red chili powder saute all this for few minutes.
food.step 5: Cut brain into equal pieces and add to the masala cook for 5 minutes by closing with a lid.
food.step6: Lastly, add chopped Coriander leaves and lemon juice
food.restaurants: ["The Bombay Canteen","Bademiya","Sarvi","Chinese N Grill","Chinese N Grill","Olympia Coffee House","Ahmed Bhai's Bry & Dry","Ayub's","Cafe Military","Ideal Corner","Delhi Darbar","Lucky Restaurant"]
food.description: Bheja fry is a classic recipe made with goat brain and freshly grounded masala spices enhancing the taste even more

food.recipe: Bhel puri is mainly made with puffed rice mixed with onions, tomatoes, assorted chutneys etc
food.step 1: Rinse and roughly chop ½ cup fresh coriander leaves (or ¼ cup mint leaves + ¼ cup coriander leaves).
food.step 2: Add the coriander leaves in a small grinder jar. Also add ½ inch ginger (peeled and roughly chopped), 1 to 2 green chillies and ¼ teaspoon salt.
food.step 3: Add ½ teaspoon lemon juice.
food.step 4: Add 2 to 3 tablespoons water or add as required and grind to a smooth chutney. Avoid making green chutney thin. Remove green chutney in a bowl and keep aside.
food.step 5: Peel and chop the potatoes. Finely chop 1 small to medium sized onion and 1 medium sized tomato. You can also chop 1 green chilli if you want. Chop some coriander leaves too.
food.step6: Take 2 cups puffed rice (murmura) in a pan. On a low flame stirring often dry roast the puffed rice.
food.step7: Roast the puffed rice for 2 to 3 minutes they become crisp. You don’t need to brown them. Let the puffed rice cool at room temperature.
food.step8: Assemble everything before you begin. Keep the chutneys in a bowl. These chutneys stay well for about a week in the fridge. So you can keep the leftovers in the fridge.
food.step9: In a bowl now take the chopped boiled potatoes, onions and tomatoes. You can also add some boiled moong beans or steamed moong bean sprouts at this step.
food.step10: Add sweet chutney, green chutney and red chutney. You can add the amount of chutneys as per the taste you want in a bhel puri. So for a spicy bhel puri, add more of red chutney and green chutney. For a sweet taste add more of the sweet chutney. So add accordingly.
food.step11: Add ½ to 1 teaspoon chaat masala and ½ teaspoon roasted cumin powder. Also add some black salt as per taste. If you do not have black salt, then use pink salt, rock salt or white salt.
food.step12: Drizzle ½ to 1 teaspoon lemon juice or add as per taste. mix very well.
food.step13: Now add 1 tablespoon masala chana (optional) and 2 tablespoons roasted peanuts. at this step you can also add some crushed puri or papdi.
food.ingredients: ½ cup fresh coriander leaves or ¼ cup mint leaves + ¼ cup coriander leaves
food.ingredient 6: 2 to 3 tablespoons water or add as required
food.ingredient 7: 2 cups puffed rice – murmura, mandakki, pori
food.ingredient 10: ½ cup boiled moong beans or boiled moong bean sprouts – optional
food.ingredient 11: ½ to 1 teaspoon lemon juice or add as required
food.ingredient 15: 5 to 6 puri or papdi, broken in pieces – optional
food.restaurants: ["Sai krupa bhelpuri house & beverages","spice club","sharma bhel puri house","bombay bhel puri","kishan bhel puri","gupta bhelpuri center","munna bhel puri house"]

food.recipe: Pick a roomy pot that gives the pasta plenty of space to move around in. This is a good time to call that eight-or 12-quart stockpot into action.
food.step 1: Heat sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan and bring it to a boil.
food.step 2: Add oil, pasta and salt. Stir to mix, cover and cook on high heat for 10-12 minutes.
food.step 3: Strain and use as required.

food.recipe: the popular way is to make it via dum style where the rice and gravy cooked in layers which makes it more flavourful. one such popular urban variant is the mumbai style bombay biryani recipe known for its long grain rice and full of spice.
food.step 1: firstly, in a large vessel take 6 cup water.
food.step 2: add spices like 2 pods cardamom, 4 cloves, 1 inch cinnamon, 2 bay leaf, ½ tsp pepper.
food.step 3: boil for 2 minutes or until flavours is in the water.
food.step 4: add in 1 cup basmati rice and stir well. make sure to soak rice for at least 20 minutes.
food.step 5: boil for 3 minutes or until rice is half cooked. do not cook fully.
food.step6: drain off the rice and keep aside.
food.step7: firstly, in a large kadai heat 2 tbsp oil and 1 tsp ghee.
food.step8: saute 1 bay leaf, 1 mace, 1 inch cinnamon, 1 star anise, 1 back cardamom, 3 cloves, 2 pods cardamom, 1 tsp cumin and ½ tsp fennel.
food.step9: add 1 onion followed by 1 tsp ginger garlic paste
food.step10: saute until onions turn golden brown.
food.step11: further add 1 tomato and saute until tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
food.step12: now add 1 potato, ½ carrot and ½ tsp salt
food.step13: urther add ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp chilli powder, ½ tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp coriander powder, 4 prunes and ½ tsp salt.
food.ingredient 3: 2 bay leaf / tej patta,1 tsp pepper,1 tsp salt
food.ingredient 4: 2 tsp oil,1 chilli, slit,1 cup basmati rice
food.ingredient 17: ¼ tsp turmeric,1 tsp kashmiri red chilli powder
food.ingredient 18: ½ tsp cumin powder,1 tsp garam masala

food.recipe: veggie sandwich is a popular street food of bombay, which is mainly served with boiled potatoes and other vegetables. in addition, these sandwich also contains mumbai sandwich masala and mumbai sandwich chutney.
food.step 1: firstly, take 3 bread slices and cut the edges of bread slices.
food.step 2: furthermore, spread green chutney to one bread slice.
food.step 3: then place 4 slices of boiled potatoes over green chutneybread slice.
food.step 4: followed by, sprinkle generous amount of bombay sandwich masala.
food.step 5: furthermore, place tomato slices and cucumber slices.
food.step6: then cover it with butter bread slice facing butter side downwards.
food.step7: after that, spread green chutney over the bread slice.
food.step8: furthermore, place beetroot slices.
food.step9: then again sprinkle generous amount of bombay sandwich masala.
food.step10: after that, place again boiled potato slices.
food.step11: cover with the final butter slice facing the butter side downwards.
food.step12: now, garnish with tomato sauce and poke the toothpick.
food.step13: furthermore, cut to 4 pieces.

food.ingredient 14: 4 slices beetroot, thinly sliced (canned / cooked beetroot)

food.recipe: Fish is marinated with some spices, coated with rice flour mixture, dipped in besan batter and deep fried. It tastes just awesome.
food.step 1: Clean wash and shallow fry bombil till golden and crispy
food.step 2: Remove from oil and keep aside
food.step 3: Meanwhile chop tomatoes and onions,crush garlic and green chilli together
food.step 4: Take oil add onion and cook till golden in colour
food.step 5: To this add garlic and green chilli crushed and saute for 30 seconds
food.step6: Add tomatoes and cook till they are cooked to this add dry masala
food.step7: Cook till oil separates add coriander leaves and fried bombil
food.step8: Cover and cook for 2 minutes,serve with roti, dal rice or khichdi

food.recipe: Bun doesn’t need an introduction, but the masks here is no ordinary butter but a mouthwatering blend of fresh cream and butter. Drooling, yet? Go ahead and satiate yourself with this recipe.
food.step 1: Cut the bun into thin slices. Each slice should be about 2 slices of normal bread held together. Do not cut the slices too thin or t0o thick because then the maska (butter & cream) will not be able to absorb it properly.
food.step 2: Apply a layer (or two) of fresh cream on the white side of the bread. The more cream you add, the creamier your bun will be
food.step 3: Spread some sugar over the cream. If you are already using sweet bread, then add just a bit of sugar as too much of sugar will ruin the flavour of the maska.
food.step 4: Place the slices of the bun with the creamy side up in the microwave and warm it for 3 minutes on medium heat.
food.step 5: Meanwhile, slices the cold butter. The slices of butter should be approximately the size of the bun slices.
food.step6: Now place a slice of butter between two bun slices
food.step7: Serve with hot tea

food.recipe: We like to use use any big tomato that looks juicy at the farmers market, but if you'd like to make this recipe when tomatoes are not in season, we recommend using the cherry or grape variety.
food.step 1: Slice bread diagonally, drizzle some olive oil and add garlic on top
food.step 2: Heat a non-stick tawa. Place the bread garlic side down on it and toast till done. Flip, drizzle some more olive oil and toast till the other side is also evenly done.`
food.step 3: Combine cherry tomatoes, black olives, green olives, mozzarella cheese, roughly torn basil leaves, salt, crushed peppercorns in a bowl and mix well. Drizzle some more olive oil and mix well.
food.step 4: Place a spoonful of the cheese mixture on each toasted bread.
food.step 5: Place the prepared bread on a serving dish, garnish with basil leaves and serve immediately

food.description: Nothing screams summer quite like bruschetta. We know it may sound strange, but rubbing the toasted bread with garlic will help impart tons of flavor into your tiny toasts. Top them with simply marinated tomatoes for the ultimate summer snack.

food.food_item: Bundles Of Vegetables In Chilli Honey Sesame
food.recipe: Give this absolutely lip smacking recipe of Honey Chilli Sesame Potatoes, that has a perfect blend of asian flavours and makes a great side dish along with some Hakka Noodles and Vegetable Fried Rice.
food.step 1: Soak dried mushrooms in warm water for twenty to thirty minutes. Drain and slice them.
food.step 2: Bring vegetable stock to a boil, add chopped ginger and salt to it and blanch all the vegetables one at a time.
food.step 3: Drain and reserve the stock. Using a selection of all the prepared ingredients, make up bundles and tie around the middle with the green of the spring onions.
food.step 4: Heat oil in a pan, add chopped garlic and sauté for one or two minutes
food.step 5: Add one cup of vegetable stock and add MSG, salt, wine, black peppercorns, honey, vinegar, red chilli sauce, soya sauce and bring to a boil.
food.step7: Simmer for a few minutes and then pour over the bundles, coating them evenly.
food.step8: Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

food.recipe: We love the cuisine because it’s loaded with flavor and spice and is great for cold nights. One dish we keep going back for is the butter chicken.
food.step 1: Using 2 Tbsp of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the pieces of the chicken so each side is browned. They do not need to be fully cooked all the way through. Work in batches, and set aside when you’re done.
food.step 2: Melt another 2 Tbsp of butter in the pan over medium heat. Add the onion, and cook until beginning to soften — about three minutes. Add the garlic, garam masala, ginger, chili powder, cumin, and cayenne. Stir to combine, and cook for about 45 seconds before adding the tomato sauce.
food.step 3: Bring the mixture to a simmer and let cook for five minutes before adding the cream. Bring the mixture back to a simmer, add the browned chicken, and let simmer for 10-15 minutes. Keep the heat low here — not a rolling boil.
food.step 4: Stir in the remaining 2 Tbsp of butter, and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
food.step 5: Serve garnished with lime and cilantro, alongside rice and naan.
food.ingredient 2: 2 lbs boneless/skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1” chunks
food.ingredient 10: 1 1/2 cups tomato sauce**** (or one 14 oz can would work)

food.description: This easy Indian butter chicken recipe makes Indian food a synch! This creamy tomato sauce is similar to chicken tikka masala, but maybe even better!

food.recipe: This dish is semi difficult but the result is O so delectable. I had something like this at Crustaceans in San Francisco and searched until I found this similar sounding dish. They used the wonderful dungeness crab, but here in VA I had to settle for blue crab, which turned out just as delicious.
food.step 1: Wash the crabs thoroughly (with the help of a toothbrush).
food.step 2: Boil sufficient water in a heavy bottomed vessel.
food.step 3: Add the crabs and little salt.
food.step 4: Remove the crabs after about 2 to 3 minutes.
food.step 5: Very carefully remove the crabs and shell them.
food.step6: Scoop out the unwanted things from the crabs
food.step7: Crack the pincers. Heat the wok.
food.step8: Add olive oil and then the butter.
food.step9: Add garlic and saute till pink.
food.step10: Add green chillies. Saute for few seconds.
food.step11: Add the crab and little salt. Mix gently.
food.step12: Cover with a lid having some water on it. Simmer.
food.step13: Check after 5 to 7 minutes.

food.recipe: A very easy to make buttery crab recipe with the dominant flavors of garlic, chillies and black pepper
food.step 1: Cut capsicum into diamond shaped pieces. Cut crab sticks into diagonal pieces.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps butter in a non-stick wok, add garlic and sauté for ½ minute
food.step 3: Add crab stick pieces, capsicum, salt and crushed peppercorns and mix well.
food.step 4: Add ¼ cup water and mix. Add cornstarch slurry and mix well. Add remaining butter, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 5: Transfer onto a serving dish and serve hot.

food.recipe: The crunchy homemade garlic croutons really elevate this salad, making it look and taste quite fancy. The cheese crusted onto each little toast will have you snacking on these croutons!
food.step 1: Boil sufficient water in a non stick pan, add eggs and boil them for four minutes only.
food.step 2: Crush sea salt, garlic and black peppercorns in a mortar. Add Worcestershire sauce, mustard paste and mix well. Break the eggs and add. Add the extra virgin oil and mix well.
food.step 3: Cut the bread slices into one inch pieces. Heat the oil in another non stick pan, add the bread pieces and sauté till slightly crisp and browned at the edges.
food.step 4: Wash and dry the lettuce leaves well, tear them roughly and place in a large bowl.
food.step 5: Tear basil leaves and add to the lettuce. Add the cheese shavings or grated cheese.
food.step6: Add the fried bread and toss lightly. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss lightly. Serve immediately.

food.description: Classic Caesar Salad with crisp homemade croutons and a light caesar dressing – for when you want to impress your dinner guests.

food.recipe: Prepare the chicken by cutting the breast and thigh portions into 5 x 7.5cm (2 x 3") pieces. Cut the wings into 3 portions and discard the end tips. Keep the drumsticks whole. Heat the oil in a large frying pan, add the chicken and stir fry for 10 minutes or until well browned. Drain off the excess oil.
food.step 1: Heat ½ tablespoon oil in a non-stick wok. Add noodles and sauté for half a minute. Add bean sprouts and mix. Add spring onion greens, soy sauce and mix well.
food.step 2: Add salt and ½ teaspoon pepper powder and mix well. Cook for a minute.
food.step 3: Heat remaining oil in another non-stick wok. Add garlic and sauté till lightly browned. Add chicken strips, mix and cook on high heat till chicken changes colour.
food.step 4: Add remaining pepper powder and salt and mix well. Add ginger juliennes and mix well.
food.step 5: Add vinegar and mix. Add sugar, mix well and simmer for a minute.
food.step6: Take cornstarch in a bowl. Add chicken stock and mix well into a smooth slurry.
food.step7: Add slurry to the chicken and mix well. Increase heat and cook till the sauce thickens and chicken is fully cooked.
food.step8: Transfer chicken in a serving dish. Top with noodle-sprout mixture and serve immediately
food.ingredients: Boneless chicken cut into thin strips 250 grams

food.recipe: In a blender, combine coffee, ice cream and chocolate syrup. Blend until smooth. Pour over crushed ice. Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and serve.
food.step 1: To make coffee decoction, heat ¼ cup water in a non-stick pan, add coffee powder and mix well. Cook till it thickens. Cool to room temperature.
food.step 2: Blend together chocolate ice cream, chocolate sauce reserving some for rimming and coffee decoction till smooth.
food.step 3: Rim individual glasses with reserved chocolate sauce, place some of the ice cubes in each glass, pour the prepared chocolate cooler, pipe out a rosette on top, dust coffee powder on top and serve chilled.

food.recipe: This lasagne is a fibre rich, supercharged veggie bonanza, including lots of different coloured vegetables. The hero of this dish – pumpkin, is a rich source of antioxidants especially vitamin A and many other vitamins, minerals and protective phytochemicals.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 180º C.
food.step 2: To make white sauce, heat extra virgin olive oil in a non-stick pan, add whole wheat flour and sauté lightly. Add buttermilk and whisk rapidly so that no lumps are formed. Add 2 tbsps grated processed cheese and mix well. Add salt and mix well. Cook till the sauce thickens
food.step 3: Spread 4 tbsps white sauce in a baking dish and place 2 lasagna sheets over it.
food.step 4: Blend carrot and pumpkin with vegetable stock and dried herbs to a smooth paste.
food.step 5: Spread 2 tbsps carrot-pumpkin mixture over the lasagna sheets in the baking dish, spread 2 tbsps breadcrumbs and 1 tbsp grated processed cheese. Place 2 lasagna sheets over the cheese, spread 2 tbsps white sauce, sprinkle crushed peppercorns and place 1 lasagna sheet. Spread remaining carrot-pumpkin mixture and 2 tbsps grated processed cheese and drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil.
food.step6: Place the dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes.
food.step7: Remove the baking dish from oven, halve the lasagna, place them on a serving plate, garnish with green and red capsicum curls, sprinkle crushed peppercorns and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Carrots cut into small pieces and blanched 2 medium
food.ingredient 2: Pumpkin peeled, cut into small pieces and blanched 1/4 medium
food.ingredient 5: Extra virgin olive oil 2 tablespoons + for drizzling
food.ingredient 13: Green and red capsicum curls for garnishing

food.recipe: Chakli is a deep fried snack made from rice flour, gram flour, wheat flour or a mixture of lentil flours. They are also known as Murukku in south.
food.step 1: First take the rice flour and gram flour in a bowl.
food.step 2: Add the carom seeds, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, asafoetida and salt.
food.step 3: Mix everything with a spoon.
food.step 4: Heat butter or oil in a bowl or small pan.
food.step 5: Add the hot butter or oil to flour mixture.
food.step6: Mix the butter/oil with your fingertips with the flours.
food.step7: Add this hot water in parts to the flour mixture. Mix with a spoon.
food.step8: Add more hot water as required and begin kneading.
food.step9: Knead to a dough which is firm. Cover and let the dough rest for 30 minutes.
food.step10: Apply some water in the chakli/murukku maker and place a portion of the dough inside it.
food.step11: Tighten the lid and press the chakli maker to prepare the chakli. Move in rounds to get a spiral shape. Make the chaklis on butter paper or aluminium foil, so thats its easy to remove them.
food.step12: if the chakli breaks while forming them, this means that the dough does not have enough moisture. Add 1 or 2 tbsp of water and knead the dough again.
food.step13: Break the dough towards the end and press it to the last concentric circle of the spiral.
food.ingredient 4: ⅔ to ¾ cup water - add as required
food.ingredient 8: 1 teaspoon red chili powder or add as required
food.ingredient 9: a generous pinch of asafoetida (hing) - optional
food.ingredient 10: 1 tablespoon sesame seeds - white or black (safed til or kala til)
food.description: Crisp & crunchy snack for Diwali festival. chakli is a deep-fried snack made from rice flour, gram flour, wheat flour or a mixture of lentil flours.

food.recipe: Sauté it, fry it, toss it, bake it, steam it – eat it the way you want to. Whatever its form may be upon being cooked, its flavour may change but its flesh remains high in protein, low in fat and can be digested easily.
food.step 1: Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick pan.
food.step 2: Place the chicken pieces in a glass bowl, add cornstarch, dark soy sauce and mix. Set aside
food.step 3: Add garlic cloves to the pan and sauté on medium heat till well browned.
food.step 4: Roughly chop spring onion bulbs. Tear spinach leaves and add to the garlic.
food.step 5: Add a little salt and sauté for a while. Transfer into a serving bowl and set aside.
food.step6: Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep fry chicken on high heat till golden brown.
food.step7: Drain on absorbent paper. Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick pan, add spring onions and sauté.
food.step8: Add chicken pieces and mix. Add oyster sauce, salt, crushed red chillies and vinegar and toss.
food.step9: Crush Sichuan peppers and add to the pan and mix well.
food.step10: Transfer into the serving bowl over the garlic-spinach mixture and serve hot.

food.recipe: So what exactly is a Vada Pav? Vada = deep fried potato patties and pav = burger buns. You can say it’s kind of a potato sandwich or burger but what makes it so special is all the chutneys that go with it!
food.step 1: To begin making the Homemade Vada Pav Recipe With Cheesy Aloo Vada we will first make the dry garlic chutney powder.
food.step 2: Into a preheated pan add oil, sesame seeds, dry red chillies, and allow the sesame seeds to crackle.
food.step 3: Once done add the garlic cloves and roast them until the raw smell of the garlic goes away.
food.step 4: Once done add the desicated coconut, salt to taste. Roast until lightly golden in colour and turn off the heat. Allow the garlic mixture to cool.
food.step 5: Once the mixture has cooled completely add it to the blender and blend to make a coarse powder. Keep aside.
food.step6: The next step is to make the Vada for the Vada Pav.
food.step7: Into a preheated pan add oil. Once the oil is hot add the mustard seeds and allow it to crackle.
food.step8: Once the mustard seeds have crackled add the onions, ginger, garlic, green chillies, asafoetida and saute until the onions soften and turn golden brown in colour
food.step9: After the onions have changed colour add the boiled potatoes, turmeric powder and salt to taste. Mix well to combine and saute for 3 to 4 minutes
food.step10: Finally add the chopped coriander leaves, stir to combine and turn off the heat
food.step11: Allow the potato mixture to cool down before making the vadas.
food.step12: While the potato mixture is cooling make the vada batter. Into a mixing bowl add gram flour, turmeric powder, ajwain, salt to taste and add little water at a time to make a thick lump free batter which coats the back of the spoon. Keep aside
food.step13: Now grease your palms with oil. Take a large lemon size portion of the potato mixture. Flatten it and place a few chopped cheese cubes in the centre. Bring the edges of the potato mixture together and seal. Make a small disc and keep aside
food.restaurants: ["Babu Vada Pav","laxman om vada pav","aram vada pav","babu vada pav","vidharva vada pav","parleshwar vada pav","anand vada pav"]
food.description: Vada Pav is a famous street food in Gujarat and Maharashtra. Walk through the streets of Mumbai and you will find Vada Pavs in every nook and corner of the city. You will also find people from all over India relishing this lip smacking delicacy when they visit Mumbai.

food.recipe: In a large bowl, cream together margarine and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until just blended. Mix in walnuts. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C.Sieve together refined flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
food.step 2: Add castor sugar and egg whites and beat till well blended. Add walnuts and mix well.
food.step 3: Place a silicon sheet on a baking tray and pour spoonfuls of mixture on it keeping little distance between each
food.step 4: Lightly spread in the shape of cookies.
food.step 5: Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for ten minutes.
food.step6: Remove from oven and cool. Serve.

food.description: Delicious cookies that taste like brownies

food.recipe: Chicken Biryani is a delicious savory rice dish that is loaded with spicy marinated chicken, caramelized onions, and flavorful saffron rice.
food.step 1: To marinate the chicken for the biryani, combine the vegetable oil, garlic, ginger, chili peppers, mint, cilantro, garam masala, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl and stir together. Add the chicken pieces and toss together making sure the chicken is thoroughly coated in the marinade. Allow the chicken to marinate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight.
food.step 2: n a pot wide enough to hold the chicken in a single layer, add the ghee and onions and saute the onions until they are well caramelized (15-20 minutes). Transfer the caramelized onions to a bowl and set aside.
food.step 3: While the onions caramelize, prepare the rice by washing in a strainer under cold running water until the water runs clear.
food.step 4: To par-boil the rice, add the water, salt, cardamom, cumin and bay leaf to a pot and bring to a boil. Add the rice and boil for 7 minutes. Drain the rice, reserving 1 cup of the liquid.
food.step 5: In the pot you caramelized the onions in, add the chicken in a single layer, skin-side down. Fry until golden brown on one side (about 5 minutes). Flip the chicken over and fry the other side until golden brown. Transfer the chicken back to the bowl you marinated it in.
food.step7: Top the rice with the chicken in a single layer.
food.step9: Finish putting together the Biryani by adding the rest of the rice in an even layer. Add 1 cup of reserved liquid from boiling the rice. Cover the pot with a lid and put the pot on the stove over medium heat and set the timer for 20 minutes. When you can see steam escaping from under the lid, turn down the heat to low and continue cooking until the timer goes off and then turn off the heat.
food.step11: Mix the Chicken Biryani together and then transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve.
food.restaurants: ["Biryani By Kilo","Go Biryan","Hyderabad Xpress","Curry Me Up","Birista - Biryanis & Kebabs","Biryani Barbeque Chinese By Borivali Biryani Centre","The Bohri Kitchen","Dum Matka","Kareem's","Lucky Restaurant","Biryani Guru","Bismillah Catering","Khane Khas","Urban Tadka","Maharaja Biryani"]
food.description: Chicken Biryani is a dish that has spread across a wide swath of South Asia, reaching as far west as Iraq and as far east as Indonesia

food.food_item: Chicken Burger With Whole Meal Bun
food.recipe: they’re made with low-fat chicken burgers, filled with a low-fat yogurt dressing instead of mayo and cheese, and are brimming with salad to help fill you up. And we’ve served them in a wholemeal roll to boost fibre.
food.step 1: Soak soya nuggets in two cups of water for ten minutes. Drain. Mix together chicken mince, green chillies, coriander leaves, onion, carrot and salt and blend in a mixer.
food.step 2: Add soaked soya nuggets and blend again. Transfer the mixture into a bowl. Slightly dampen your hands and shape the mixture into four equal sized patties.
food.step 3: Heat a griddle, put a little oil and cook the patties on medium heat. Turn and cook on the other side.
food.step 4: Cook till golden on both sides. To serve, cut roundels of onions and separate into rings. Heat a little oil in a griddle and grill the onion rings.
food.step 5: Add Soy or Worcestershire sauce and mix. Add brown sauce and mix and cook covered for two minutes.
food.step6: Slit the buns horizontally. Heat a little olive oil on the griddle and roast the bun on both sides. Tear lettuce leaves.

food.step 1: Trim stems of the broccoli and slice them. Separate florets. Chop ginger and garlic in a chopper.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add broccoli stems and sauté for ½ minute. Add broccoli florets, salt and 1 tsp sugar.
food.step 3: Sprinkle a little water and cook for 2-3 minutes or till broccoli is cooked, but crunchy. Set aside in a plate.
food.step 4: Slice spring onions bulbs. Cut chicken breasts into ½ inch cubes and put in a bowl.
food.step 5: Add half the chopped ginger-garlic, soy sauce, 3 tbsps cornflour, remaining sugar, ½ tsp crushed red chillies, salt and 2 tbsps sesame oil and mix well.
food.step6: Set aside to marinate for 15 minutes. Heat remaining sesame oil in a non-stick wok.
food.step7: Deseed and break red chillies and add to the wok and sauté for ½ minute. Add spring onion bulbs, remaining chopped ginger-garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step8: Add marinated chicken and sauté on high heat for 1 minute. Sprinkle a little water and cook.
food.step9: Mix remaining cornflour in ¼ cup water. Add broccoli to the chicken and stir. Add hoisin sauce and mix.
food.step11: Cook till chicken is done. Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds and serve hot with steamed rice.

food.recipe: This chicken fried rice has moist and tender chicken with flavorful peas and carrots and long rice cooked together. Make this unique and your own with this favorite Chinese rice!
food.step 1: In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil. Season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides
food.step 2: then add to skillet, and cook until golden and no longer pink, 8 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and let rest 5 minutes
food.step 3: then cut into bite-sized pieces.
food.step 4: To the same skillet, heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil. Add onion and carrots and cook until soft, 5 minutes
food.step 5: Add garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant, 1 minute more
food.step6: Stir in rice and peas and cook until warmed through, 2 minutes.
food.step7: Push rice to one side of skillet and add remaining tablespoon sesame oil to other side.
food.step8: Add egg and stir until almost fully cooked, then fold eggs into rice.
food.step9: Add chicken back to skillet with soy sauce and green onions and stir to combine
food.restaurants: ["Fried Chicken Cuisine","MFC - Mr. Fried Chicken","Fried Nation","Angrezi Dhaba","New York Pizza & Fried Chicken","Flea Bazaar Café","Butter Chicken Factory","SFC - Shwezy Fried Chicken","Hardeep Punjab","Gymkhana 91 Bar & Kitchen"]
food.description: Chicken fried rice is the comfort dish of Chinese food. It's been around for a very long time and is also common in East, Southeast, and South Asian cuisines.

food.recipe: A lovely blend of protiens, vitamins and essential carbs, this is for sure a keepsake recipe for every mom. Kids will just love it's melt in mouth texture and will never say no to it. This can be made with both chicken and mutton
food.step 1: Take multi grain khichdi mix in a strainer placed over a bowl and wash it thoroughly with water.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps ghee in a non-stick pressure cooker, add the spice mix – which comes with the khichdi mix - and saute for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 3: Add the washed grains, mix well and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add sufficient water and mix. Place the lid on and cook under pressure till 5 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to reduce completely
food.step 4: Meanwhile, take chicken in a bowl, add yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and garam masala powder. Squeeze the juice of ½ lemon, and add ¼ cup fried onions.Chop mint leaves and coriander leaves and add. and mix well. Set aside to marinate till the grains are done.
food.step 5: Heat remaining ghee in a non-stick deep pan,add the chicken and sauté on high heat for 3-4 minutes. Add the cooked khichdi and mix well. Add sufficient water and mix well. Add remaining fried onions and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes or till the chicken is cooked completely. Switch off the heat.
food.step6: Open the lid and mash the khichda with a hand blender.
food.step7: Transfer into serving bowl.Garnish with fried onions and a mint sprig, Drizzle a little red chilli oil and serve hot with lemon wedges.
food.ingredients: Chicken leg boneless, cut into 1 inch pieces 400 grams

food.description: A super healthy one pot meal with rice, broken wheat and lentils. This is a pure bliss when served hot on any given day

food.recipe: We spread most of the pesto over the crust, and tossed the chicken in what was left. After sprinkling on the cheese we added a handful of pine nuts on top & then tossed it in the oven to cook for about 8 minutes. It came out looking amazing!
food.step 1: Preheat oven at 180° C.
food.step 2: Mix salt, crushed peppercorns, one teaspoon mixed herbs and one teaspoon olive oil in a small bowl. Rub this mixture all over the chicken breasts and set aside to marinate for five to ten minutes.
food.step 3: To make pesto sauce, grind together garlic, walnuts and crushed peppercorns. Add Parmesan cheese, basil leaves and olive oil and grind to a smooth pastel. Transfer the pesto into a bowl, add salt and mix well.
food.step 4: Heat one tablespoon olive oil in a non-stick grill pan. Place the marinated chicken in it and grill, turning sides, till evenly done from both sides and grill marks appear on them
food.step 5: Cut yellow and red capsicums into thin strips.
food.step6: Spread the pesto sauce generously evenly on the pizza bases. Place red and yellow capsicum strips on them. Sprinkle salt, crushed peppercorns and remaining mixed herbs on top.
food.step7: Cut chicken into thin strips and put over the capsicum strips.. Top with olives and cheese cubes.
food.step8: Place the pizzas on a baking tray, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for ten to fifteen minutes or till the cheese melts.
food.step9: Cut into wedges and serve hot.

food.description: A Vibrant Pesto Sauce, Mozzarella, Chicken. And A Sprinkle Of Pine Nuts. This Pesto Chicken Pizza Is Fresh, Flavorful And Absolutely Perfect For Summer!

food.recipe: The white wine sauce with capers complements the flavor of the lemon juice, and makes a great topping for wild rice.
food.step 1: Slice each chicken breast into two. In a bowl mix together two tablespoons olive oil, salt, parsley, thyme and black pepper powder.
food.step 2: Marinate the chicken breast for half an hour with the above mixture. Sprinkle the flour over them.
food.step 3: Heat the remaining olive oil in a grill pan. Grill the chicken pieces until browned on both sides or till done.
food.step 4: In another bowl mix together feta cheese, garlic, lemon juice and lemon zest and mix well.
food.step 5: Coat the chicken with the cheese mixture and gratinate till the cheese melts.
food.step6: Serve hot with lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves.

food.recipe: This Classic Chicken Pasta Puttanesca recipe is to die for! It is made with olives, capers, whole wheat pasta, and sautéed chicken. Easy to make pasta recipes that the whole family can enjoy, even the little ones.
food.step 1: Flatten chicken breasts with a mallet and place on a plate. Sprinkle salt, crushed peppercorns and add ½ teaspoon chopped garlic. Rub well and marinate for 10-15 minutes
food.step 2: Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan.
food.step 3: Heat oil in a non-stick grill pan.
food.step 4: Add remaining garlic to the olive oil and sauté till light brown.Add onion and sauté till pink.
food.step 5: Add tomatoes, mix well and cook for a minute.
food.step6: Place the marinated chicken breasts in the grill pan and grill till evenly done from both sides.
food.step7: Add salt to the tomatoes and mix well. Cook for 2 minutes.
food.step8: Slice olives and chop capers. Add these to the tomatoes and mix well. Add little water and mix well. Reduce heat, add chilli flakes, dried herbs and tomato ketchup and mix well.
food.step9: Chop 4-5 basil leaves and add. Mix well.
food.step10: Add spaghetti and mix well. Add little water, mix well and cook on low heat for 1 minute.
food.step11: Roughly chop the grilled chicken and add to the pasta and switch off heat. Mix well.
food.step12: Tear remaining basil leaves and add. Sprinkle parmesan cheese and mix well.
food.step13: Sprinkle parmesan cheese, garnish with a basil sprig and serve hot

food.recipe: Chicken Steak Recipe With Pan Roasted Vegetables & Potato Mash is a delicious meal in itself. The chicken is marinated in a lovely marinade that is bursting with flavours that include fresh parsley , lemon, garlic and mixed herbs. All of which add to the yummilicious taste of the chicken.

food.step8: Arrange some French fries and sautéed vegetables on a sizzler plate, place the chicken steak over the vegetables and serve hot with barbeque sauce.

food.recipe: The name says ‘triple’ because it consists of 3 fundamental components, rice, noodles, and chicken gravy. You could take any one component out and it would still taste great, imagine what it would taste like with all three! Well, now you don’t have to imagine.
food.step 1: Heat sufficient oil in a wok.
food.step 2: Take chicken pieces in a bowl, add salt, crushed black peppercorns, 2 tbsps cornflour in a bowl and mix well. Slide the pieces into hot oil and deep-fry on medium heat till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step 3: To make the gravy, heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a non-stick wok, break the red chillies into small pieces and add and saute for 1 minute.
food.step 4: Add 70 grams of the Chinese chutney, mix well and saute till oil separates. Add 2 cups water, mix well and cook till the mixture comes to a boil.
food.step 5: Add salt, crushed black peppercorns and the fried chicken pieces, mix well and allow the mixture to come to a boil.
food.step6: Add a little water to the remaining cornflour and mix well. Add 2 tbsps cornflour slurry into the boiling mixture, mix well and cook till the mixture thickens.
food.step7: To make the fried rice, heat remaining sesame oil in another non-stick wok, add remaining Chinese chutney, mix well and saute till oil separates.
food.step8: Add cooked rice, boiled noodles, tomato ketchup and soy sauce and mix well and saute for 1 minute
food.step9: Add boiled and shredded chicken and a little salt, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes or till the mixture gets heated through. Switch off the heat, add spring onion greens and mix well.
food.step10: To make a fried egg for each portion, break 1 egg in a bowl, add salt and whisk well with a fork.
food.step11: Heat 1 tsp oil in a small non-stick pan, add the whisked egg and cook on medium heat, turning sides, for 1-2 minutes or till done. Fold it in half and take it off the heat.
food.step12: Put some fried rice in each serving bowl, pour the chicken gravy by its side and place the cooked egg on top. Garnish with fried noodles and spring onion greens and serve hot.

food.recipe: This dry chilli mushroom recipe is pretty simple to make and goes well as starter snack or brunch. Usually, when I make such recipes with mushrooms, I serve them with roti. That’s how we prefer relishing these crisp fried mushrooms
food.step 1: Rinse and wipe dry the mushrooms. Trim the stalks.
food.step 2: Halve them if big in size and quarter them if smaller in size.
food.step 3: Make a flowing medium consistency batter with the ingredients listed above "for the batter".
food.step 4: Heat oil for shallow frying in a kadai or wok.
food.step6: Add them to the medium hot oil and fry till they are slight golden and crisp.
food.step7: Stir fry on a high flame till you see the onions getting browned at the edges.        Add the soy sauce, salt, sugar, pepper and stir fry for half a minute.
food.step8: Add the fried batter coated mushrooms and stir on a low to medium flame
food.step9: Sprinkle about 1 to 2 tsp water and 1/2 to 3/4 tsp corn flour on the mushrooms.
food.step10: Saute for a minute or two. Continue to stir. This gives a nice glaze to the mushrooms.
food.ingredients: 200 to 250 grams white button mushrooms or baby portabella mushrooms or about 7 to 8.5 ounces
food.ingredient 2: 1 medium onion or 1 to 2 spring onions whites - halved or quartered and the layers removed, reserve the greens for garnish
food.ingredient 4: 1 small capsicum chopped into squares (optional). you can use red or green or yellow capsicum (bell pepper or shimla mirch)
food.ingredient 7: 1 tablespoon naturally fermented soy sauce or as required
food.ingredient 8: ½ tablespoon sesame oil or any veg oil for the sauce
food.ingredient 9: oil for deep frying the mushrooms
food.ingredient 11: 5 to 6 tablespoon whole wheat flour or all-purpose flour
food.ingredient 13: ¼ teaspoon crushed black pepper or add as required
food.ingredient 15: water as required to make a medium consistency batter

food.recipe: Making this green chilli pickle is very easy. Use less hot or medium hot green chilies to make the pickle. I have use an Indian variety of green chilies which were medium hot. After pickling and maturing the heat does tone down a bit
food.step 1: Rinse and wipe dry the green chilies very well. There should be no trace of moisture in them. You can also let them dry on their own.
food.step 2: Remove the crowns and chop the green chilies in 1 inch pieces.
food.step 3: In a dry grinder or coffee grinder, powder the mustard seeds coarsely. Here I used yellow mustard seeds. But you can also use black mustard seeds.
food.step 4: In a clean glass jar, add the green chilies, ground mustard seeds and salt.
food.step 5: Mix by shaking the jar or use a clean non reactive spoon to mix the contents of the jar. Cover the jar with its lid tightly and keep in the sun for 2 to 3 days. If the sunlight and heat is very intense, then just 1 to 2 days is fine. If you don't have sun and its cloudy all the time, then just keep outside. In the evening, remove the jar from out and keep in a dry place in your kitchen. I kept for 3 days since the sun was playing hide and seek.
food.step6: After 2 to 3 days, add lemon juice and turmeric powder to the pickle..
food.step7: With a clean non reactive spoon, mix everything very well. Close the jar and again keep in the sun for 1 to 2 days.
food.step8: Proceed with the next step after 1 or 2 days.
food.step9: Heat mustard oil till its smoking point. Let the mustard oil cool till it becomes warm or is slightly hot.. About 15 mins. You can use any other oil like sunflower or peanut oil. If using these oils, then just heat them till they are hot. You don't need to heat them till their smoking point.
food.step10: Pour the mustard oil in the pickle jar.
food.step11: Cover the jar with its lid and keep the pickle at room temperature for 4 to 5 days for the pickling process to happen.
food.step12: You can even keep the chilli pickle for 2 to 3 days at room temperature and then in the fridge. Since it was during the winters, I had made the pickle, I kept the jar out for all 5 days. Once we started serving the chilli pickle, then I kept the jar in the fridge.
food.step13: Serve green chili pickle as a side condiment with a simple indian meal like dal-rice or curd-rice. The pickle can also be served with aloo paratha, gobi paratha, mooli paratha or even plain parathas or chapatis.
food.ingredients: 1.25 to 1.5 cups chopped green chilies - less hot or medium hot variety (hari mirch)
food.ingredient 2: 6 tablespoons mustard seeds - yellow or black or split mustard seeds (rai na kuria or rai ki dal)
food.ingredient 5: 1 cup mustard oil or sunflower oil or peanut oil (sarson ka tel ya moongphalli ka tel)
food.ingredient 6: 5 to 6 lemons (nimbu) - yields ⅓ to ½ cup lemon juice
food.description: An easy to prepare green chili pickle with ground mustard, lemon juice and oil.

food.recipe: A simple bread pakoda would have halved bread slices dipped and coated in gram flour batter and deep fried.

food.step 3: To make the batter, take gram flour in a large bowl, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, carom seeds, salt, baking soda and sufficient water and whisk well to make a smooth and semi-thick batter.

food.recipe: Hailing from China, this dish is incredibly easy to prepare, with no special herbs or special techniques other than swirling in of the egg whites to create the egg strands
food.step 1: Heat oil in one non stick wok.Heat 2 cups water in another non stick wok. Add tomato ketchup and tomatoes and bring it to a boil.Add garlic to the first wok and sauté till burnt. Halve boiled eggs and discard yolks.
food.step 2: Add spring onion bulbs to the first wok and toss. Add rice, salt and a little pepper powder, toss again and cook for 1 minute.Roughly chop egg whites and add to rice along with spring onion greens and mix well.
food.step 3: Add little more water to the second wok 2, adjust salt and add soy sauce and ½ tsp pepper powder. Mix well.Mix cornstarch with little water and add to second wok along with 1 tsp vinegar. Mix well and bring to boil.
food.step 4: Add remaining vinegar to the first wok. Mix well and switch off heat.Break eggs into a bowl and discard yolks. Beat well.Add beaten egg whites to the second wok and mix well. Switch off heat.Place rice on serving dish and pour tomato egg drop sauce on top. Garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.

food.recipe: Golda Chingri’r Malaikari is a classic Bengali preparation with Lobster or prawns and coconut milk. This silky smooth creamy yet surprisingly light gravy is perfumed with Bengali gota gorom moshla (whole spices) and flavoured with ginger, fresh green chilli and of course none other than shorsher tel (virgin mustard oil).
food.step 1: For making the Chingri Malaikari, clean the prawns with warm salted water and marinate with 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder and 1/4 pinch of salt along with a pinch of onion, ginger and cumin seeds. Let the prawns marinade.
food.step 2: Prepare an onion-ginger paste in a mixer. Then heat ghee in a kadai or a deep pan and fry the prawns till they turn golden brown, and keep them aside in a bowl
food.step 4: Then add remaining turmeric powder, kashmiri chilli powder, salt and garam masala to the frying onions and saute for a few seconds. Now, add coconut milk and 1/2 cup of water and bring it to boil.
food.step 5: Then cut the green chillies and add them to the gravy along with the fried prawns. Allow it to cook for another 5-6 minutes. Put off the flame, garnish the chingrir malaikari with coriander leaves and add some coconut flakes on top of it. Keep it aside.
food.step6: Now, for the Gondhoraaj rice, soak the basmati rice for half an hour in water in a large vessel, and keep them aside.
food.step7: Put water in a pan as per requirement and bring it to boil. Then add a pinch of salt, one spoon of lime juice, one small piece of lemon rind, two kaffir lime leaves and one spoon of ghee to the boiling water, and add the soaked rice. Serve the cooked Gondhoraaj (lime) rice with malaikari.

food.recipe: These chocolate modaks are prepared mainly from three ingredients chocolate, Mawa/khoya (evaporated milk solids) and sugar. This modak recipe takes less than 30 mins to make and is simple to make during festive seasons
food.step 1: Firstly keep all the ingredients ready for the modak.
food.step 2: Grease the modak moulds with a bit of butter or ghee or oil. Place aside.
food.step 3: Heat a pan. Keep the flame to a low and add grated mawa.
food.step 4: Keep stirring on low flame for a minute. Soon the mawa would start melting.
food.step 5: When the mawa begins melting, add sugar in the mawa mixture and stir for a minute.
food.step6: Quickly add chocolate chips.
food.step7: You would see the chocolate chips melting. Keep stirring on low heat.
food.step8: The mixture will start thickening. Continuously keep stirring.
food.step9: Sprinkle cardamom powder.
food.step10: Keep stirring on low flame until the mixture starts leaving the edges of the pan. Do not overcook as then the modaks will turn out dense.
food.step11: Immediately transfer the mixture in another bowl/dish/thali
food.step12: Allow the mixture to cool.
food.step13: Make small balls from them.
food.ingredients: 1 cup grated or chopped mawa (khoya or evaporated milk solids)
food.ingredient 2: ⅓ cup chocolate chips - milk, sweet or semi sweet
food.ingredient 3: 2 tabespoons sugar or as required. i used organic sugar
food.ingredient 5: oil or butter or ghee for greasing the moulds, as required
food.description: Chocolate modak is an easy and tasty modak variety.

food.recipe: I found that starting to flip the wontons immediately is easier than waiting for one side to brown, because it helps prevent the wonton from getting top heavy on one side. By doing this it will be easier to keep the wonton flipped over to the second side.
food.step 1: Heat cream in a non-stick pan till just warm.
food.step 2: Using a cookie cutter, cut out discs from half the wonton sheets and let the remaining be as it is.
food.step 3: Add chocolate to warm cream, switch off heat and mix well till the chocolate melts completely. Add walnuts and almonds and mix well. Transfer the ganache into a bowl and chill in the refrigerator.
food.step 4: Heat sufficient oil in a wok.
food.step 5: Place round and square wonton sheets on the worktop. Apply flour slurry on the edges and place a spoonful of ganache in the centre. Bring the edges together to seal, fold using flour slurry and give your choice of shape to the wontons.
food.step6: Deep-fry wontons in hot oil till crisp and lightly browned. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step7: Arrange on a serving plate and serve immediately.

food.recipe: Chole Bhature also known as Chana Bhatura is one of the most popular Punjabi dish liked almost all over India. Chole stands for a spiced tangy chickpea curry and Bhatura is a soft and fluffy fried leavened bread.
food.step 1: Rinse the white chickpeas for a couple of times in water. Then soak the chickpeas in enough water overnight or for 7 to 8 hours.
food.step 2: Next day drain all the water and cook the chickpeas with water+salt in a pressure cooker or a pot.
food.step 3: You can also add a pinch or two of baking soda while cooking the chickpeas.
food.step 4: In a grinder or blender take 1 medium sized chopped onion, 2 medium sized chopped tomatoes, 1 inch chopped ginger, 4 to 5 garlic cloves and 1 chopped green chili.
food.step 5: Grind or blend to a fine paste.
food.step6: No need to add water while making the paste as the juice of the tomatoes will help in making the paste.
food.step7: Keep the paste aside.
food.step8: Heat 2 to 3 tablespoons oil in a pan or kadai/wok.
food.step9: Add the whole garam masala (spices) - 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 large tej patta, 2 inch cinnamon, 2 to 3 cloves, 2 green cardamom and 2 to 3 black peppercorns.
food.step10: Fry the whole garam masala mentioned above till the oil become fragrant. But don't burn them.
food.step11: Add the ground paste and saute till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste.
food.step12: Keep stirring often. Sauté for 8 to 10 minutes or more till the oil starts to leave the sides of the masala paste and the paste thickens and becomes glossy. Stir while sautéing so that the paste does not stick to the pan.
food.step13: Next add all the dry spice powders - ½ teaspoon turmeric powder (haldi), ¼ teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon coriander powder (dhania powder), 1 pinch asafoetida (optional) and ½ or 1 teaspoon dry mango powder (amchur).
food.ingredients: 1 cup dried white chickpeas [canned chickpeas can also be used]
food.ingredient 8: ½ or 1 teaspoon dry mango powder (amchur powder)
food.ingredient 9: 1 to 1.5 cups water to be added later
food.ingredient 15: 4 to 5 medium sized garlic cloves - chopped
food.ingredient 17: ⅓ cup fine sooji (rava or fine semolina)
food.ingredient 20: ½ teaspoon salt or as required
food.ingredient 21: ¼ or ½ teaspoon baking soda

food.description: Chole Bhature is a spicy chickpea curry served with leavened fried bread. Popular in Punjab and parts of north India.

food.recipe: In this chole biryani recipe, I have not cooked the chana first. The chickpeas are cooked with gravy itself in the pressure cooker. So saves time and you just need to make the chana gravy and rice before assembling and dum cooking.
food.step 1: Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add bay leaf, cloves, green cardamoms, cinnamon and black peppercorns, mix and saute till fragrant.
food.step 2: Add onion, mix and sauté till translucent. Add green chilli paste and garlic paste, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 3: Add tomato puree, mix well and saute for 2 minutes. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, salt and cumin powder, mix well, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes or till the oil separates. Remove the cover, add mint leaves and coriander leaves and mix well.
food.step 4: Add yogurt, mix well and saute for 2 minutes. Add chickpeas and mix well. Add Punjabi Chole Masala and 3 tbsps fried onion and mix well. Add ½ cup water, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 5: Spread basmati rice evenly on top of the chole. Sprinkle some fried onion, ginger strips, drizzle 3 tbsps saffron milk and screwpine water and sprinkle coriander leaves. Cover the pan with aluminium foil and place the lid on. Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.
food.step6: Remove the lid and the aluminium foil. Transfer the biryani into a serving plate, garnish with fried onion and coriander leaves and serve hot with raita and papads.
food.ingredients: Chickpea (kabuli chana) soaked overnight and boiled 1 cup
food.ingredient 19: Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1/4 cup + for sprinkling
food.ingredient 22: Ginger peeled and cut into thin strips 2 inch
food.restaurants: ["Masala Kitchen","Belly Darbar","91 Rosewood Villa","House Of Biryanis","Oye Pappe!","Chai Pe Charcha","Northern Tadka","Biryani By Kilo","Walia's Kitchen"]
food.description: Chana biryani is an aromatic, spiced and a delicious dum cooked and layered biryani made with white chickpeas.

food.recipe: Chinese dish reflects a balance of taste, texture, aroma and colour. Be it sweet, sour, pungent, hot, salty or spicy – all the six basic flavours are incorporated deftly in all Chinese dishes.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a pan. Add spring onion, carrots and ginger and sauté for a minute
food.step 2: Add capsicum, bean sprouts, soy sauce, sea salt and stir for two minutes.
food.step 3: Add beancurd, spring onion greens, coriander and crushed peppercorns and toss
food.step 4: Serve hot.
food.ingredient 11: Spring onion greens 1 inch pieces 2 stalks
