food.description: This sweet and tangy stir-fry is super simple to prepare. Serve it with rice, noodles or even quinoa to make it a full meal

food.recipe: In a small heavy saucepan, cook 2 tablespoons of the sugar over moderate heat until bubbling and beginning to brown around the edges, 4 minutes. Gradually stir in 1/3 cup of the hot water and simmer for 3 minutes to dissolve the caramel. Remove from the heat
food.step 1: Put the onions into a mixer jar, grind to a fine paste. Put the tomatoes into another mixer jar and grind to a fine puree.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a clay pot, add onion paste and sauté on medium heat for 3-4 minutes. Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté for 1 minute. Cover and cook for 5-6 minutes more.
food.step 3: Add tomato puree, mix well and saute for 2 minutes. Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder and salt and mix well. Cover and cook till oil separates.
food.step 4: Add green chillies and 1 cup water and mix well. Add chicken and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat till the chicken is done.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot
food.ingredients: Chicken cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.restaurants: ["Curry Me Up","Curry Culture","Dum & Curry","Curry Patta","Saoji Express","Saoji Sanskruti","Goa Portuguesa","Captain Curry","Diva Maharashtracha","The Bombay Canteen"]
food.description: Cooked and served in a clay pot, which maintains moistness in the meat during baking and retains heat while serving, this succulent, tender chicken is irresistible.

food.recipe: Coconut ladoo with condensed milk (photo above) –  this is a quick & instant 15-minute recipe of making coconut ladoo with fresh coconut, condensed milk (milkmaid) and cardamom powder. This is an easy recipe, gets done quickly and can be made even by a newbie in cooking.
food.step 1: Heat 1 teaspoon ghee in a frying pan or kadai. Keep flame to a low.
food.step 2: Add 1.5 cups tightly packed coconut.
food.step 3: stir and saute the coconut on a low flame for 3 to 4 minutes. The sauteing is to just get rid of some moisture. Don't brown them. If using desiccated coconut, then no need to saute it in ghee. Just mix the desiccated coconut with condensed milk and heat the mixture.
food.step 4: Now add ¾ cup sweetened condensed milk. Here I used amul mithai mate.
food.step 5: Add ½ tsp cardamom powder.
food.step6: Stir very well and cook this mixture on a low flame.
food.step7: When you see that the mixture has begun to thicken, then keep stirring regularly.
food.step8: When the mixture begins to leave the sides of the pan and when you see some coconut fat from the sides, switch off the flame.
food.step9: Pour the ladoo mixture in another bowl or pan. Allow it to cool.
food.step10: When the mixture has cooled completely, pinch small to medium balls from the mixture and form ladoo
food.step11: Roll the coconut ladoo in desiccated coconut (nariyal ka burada) or in fresh coconut evenly.
food.step12: You can also make all the ladoo at once and then roll in the desiccated coconut
food.step13: Place them in small muffin liners or just place them in a tray.
food.ingredients: 1.5 cups tightly packed fresh grated coconut
food.ingredient 3: ½ teaspoon cardamom powder or 4 to 5 green cardamoms crushed in a mortar-pestle
food.ingredient 4: ¾ cup condensed milk or 220 grams sweetened condensed milk or about ½ tin of sweetened condensed milk
food.ingredient 5: ⅓ cup desiccated or fresh coconut for rolling
food.ingredient 6: chopped dry fruits of your choice (optional)
food.description: Thetcoconut ladoo is a quick 3 ingredient recipe made with fresh coconut, condensed milk and cardamom powder

food.recipe: The ones we had were shaped like balls and deep fried. I have shaped these into tikkis/cutlets and shallow fried. The outer crisp and melt in the mouth mashed potato cover is a contrast both in terms of taste and texture, to the tangy and Chatpata spiced corn stuffing
food.step 1: First steam or cook the corn cob till the kernels are tender and cooked well. Remove the corn kernels with a knife and keep aside.
food.step 2: You can steam or pressure cook both the corn cob and potatoes together.
food.step 3: The potatoes have to be cooked completely till they fall apart.
food.step 4: In a bowl or a small pan, take the corn kernels. Add chopped ginger, chopped green chilies, coriander leaves, chaat masala, red chili powder, lime juice & salt
food.step 5: Mix well and check the taste. Add more of the spices or salt if required.
food.step6: I have not minced the corn. But if you want you can coarsely grind the corn in a mixer-grinder without the spices, coriander leaves etc.
food.step7: In another bowl, peel and then grate the boiled potatoes. Mash them with your hands or a potato masher.
food.step8: Add rice flour, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder and salt. I have used rice flour to bind the patties. You can also use corn starch (called corn flour in india) to bind.
food.step9: Other options to bind are bread pulp (soaked and squeezed bread slices), arrow root flour and even gram flour (besan). Gram flour will give its taste in the patties. You can also add add buckwheat flour (kutttu ka atta), water chestnut flour (singhare ka atta). But remember the taste will change.
food.step10: Mix and then form equal sized balls from the mixture.
food.step11: Take each ball and flatten it on your palm. Place a few teaspoons of the corn stuffing in the center.
food.step12: Bring the edges in the center and cover the stuffing. Shape with your palms into medium or large patties/tikkis.
food.step13: Before stuffing & shaping the patties, apply some oil on your palms. The oil gets rid of the stickiness if any from the potato mixture.
food.ingredient 2: ½ teaspoon red chili powder or 1 to 2 green chilies, chopped (you can also add both, about 1 green chili and ¼ teaspoon red chili powder)
food.ingredient 8: 3 medium potatoes or 2 large potatoes, steamed or boiled
food.ingredient 9: 1 to 1.5 tablespoon rice flour or corn starch or arrow root flour or gram flour or bread pulp
food.ingredient 10: ¼ teaspoon red chili powder (lal mirch powder)
food.restaurants: ["chop cutlet","ufo fries & corn","flea bazar cafe","SodaBottleOpenerWala'","Oh! Calcutta'","Jimmy Boy'","Rajesh Corn Corner'","Cafe Military"]
food.description: Corn cutlet are crisp melt in the mouth corn patties made with mashed potatoes and stuffed with a spicy corn filling.

food.recipe: If you can’t do cream cheese, feel free to replace it with a splash of heavy cream or half-and-half. I’d probably use about 1/4 cup heavy cream, or 1/2 cup of half-and-half. OR, if you don’t want it creamy at all, that works too. This pasta was quite delicious even before I added the cream cheese, but the creaminess does balance the heat and acidity very well
food.step 1: Place chicken strips in a bowl, sprinkle Cajun powder over them and toss to coat. Melt butter in a non-stick pan; add garlic and onions and sauté till lightly browned.
food.step 2: Add seasoned chicken and sauté for five minutes. Add cream, milk, basil leaves, salt and macaroni and mix well. Cook for five minutes. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese and serve hot.

food.description: This One Pot Creamy Cajun Chicken Pasta is incredibly easy to make, so it’s perfect for weeknight dinners.

food.recipe: Heat oil in a wok or large saucepan until sizzling. Dip fish pieces in batter, drain off excess, and cook in batches. Drain on paper towel.
food.step 1: Cut fish fillets into medium cubes and put into a bowl. Add salt, pepper powder, paprika powder and one tablespoon lemon juice and rub well on the fish cubes. Set aside to marinate for ten to fifteen minutes.
food.step 2: Mix refined flour, cornflour, salt, pepper powder and baking soda in another bowl. Add sufficient water gradually and mix well to make a thick and smooth batter.
food.step 3: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Dip marinated fish cubes in the batter, slide into hot oil and deep-fry till golden. Drain on absorbent paper
food.step 4: Grind red chillies with little water to a smooth paste.
food.step 5: Heat half tablespoon oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and ginger and sauté till fragrant.
food.step6: Add soy sauce and red chilli paste and mix well. Add little water and mix well.
food.step7: Add salt and pepper powder and mix well. Add fried fish and toss to mix. Add remaining lemon juice and mix lightly.
food.step8: Add half the spring onion greens and toss well.
food.step9: Serve hot garnished with sesame seeds and remaining spring onion greens.
food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: Chilli Fish is one of amma’s specialty Indo-Chinese Recipes.

food.recipe: This chaat has its name Dahi Sev Batata Puri, Since dahi (yogurt), sev (fried thin gram flour vermicelli), batata (aloo in hindi or potato in english) and puris are used to make this awesome snack.
food.step 1: Firstly prepare all the chutneys and keep aside. i have given links for the recipes in the post.
food.step 2: You can also make the chutneys a day before and refrigerate them.
food.step 3: Boil the potatoes and let them cool.
food.step 4: Once cooled, peel and chop the potatoes.
food.step 5: Chop the onions, tomatoes and coriander leaves finely.
food.step6: Beat the yogurt (curd) with a wired whisk till smooth.
food.step7: In a plate, arrange the puris or golgappas. You decide the number of puris to be served in each plate.
food.step8: Break the puris from the center to create space for the potatoes and chutneys.
food.step9: Stuff the chopped potatoes in the pooris.
food.step10: Now add the chopped onions, tomatoes on top of the potatoes in the puris.
food.step11: At this stage you could sprinkle some chaat masala, jeera powder, red chili powder and black salt on the puris. This step is optional.
food.step12: Top the stuffed puris up with the green chutney, sweet chutney and red chutney. Top the chutneys as per your liking and taste.
food.step13: Add the yogurt in each poori.
food.ingredients: 2 to 3 medium size boiled and peeled potatoes
food.ingredient 4: a few sprigs of coriander leaves, finely chopped (cilantro leaves)
food.ingredient 5: ½ to ¾ cup curd (yogurt) or as required
food.ingredient 6: ½ cup mint coriander chutney or coriander chutney
food.ingredient 7: ½ cup sweet tamarind dates chutney or saunth chutney
food.ingredient 8: ¼ to ½ cup red chili garlic chutney
food.ingredient 10: nylon sev (fried thin gran as required)
food.ingredient 11: red chili powder as required - optional
food.ingredient 14: black salt or rock salt as required

food.description: Dahi puri also known as dahi batata puri is a delicious, yummy, chatpata chaat snack from Mumbai. It is sweet, sour, tangy, spicy and crispy chaat.

food.recipe: The recipe is good and tastes similar to a kadhi. Just that there are potatoes added which makes some difference.
food.step 1: Take potato cubes in a bowl, add salt, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and mix well.
food.step 2: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and saute till their colour changes. Add green chillies and asafoetida and mix well.
food.step 3: Add potatoes and mix well. Add sugar and coriander leaves and mix well. Add 1 cup water and a pinch of salt and mix well. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
food.step 4: Add lemon juice, and mix well. Take the pan off the heat and transfer into a bowl. Add yogurt and mix well.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve.
food.ingredients: Potatoes peeled and cut into 1 inch cubes 3 medium
food.ingredient 9: Green chillies broken into small pieces 1-2

food.description: Dahi ke aloo is an easy and delicious recipe of potatoes simmered in curd sauce.

food.recipe: dal tadka is made with tuvar dal or arhar dal also known as split pigeon pea lentils
food.step 1: Rinse the lentils and add them to the pressure cooker. The below pic shows only tuvar or arhar dal. You can also cook the lentils in a pot. Just soak the lentils for an hour or two before you cook them in a pot. Cooking the lentils in a pot, will take more time than cooking in the pressure cooker. Method on how to cook lentils in a pot is mentioned in the notes section of recipe details below
food.step 2: To the lentils, add chopped onions, tomato, green chilies, ginger.
food.step 3: Pour 2.5 cups water. If cooking in a pot, then about 4 to 4.5 cups water can be added.
food.step 4: Add turmeric powder and asafoetida. Stir well.
food.step 5: Pressure cook the lentils for about 7 to 8 whistles or more till they become soft and creamy. Mash the dal with a wired whisk or with a spoon and keep aside. If the dal looks thick, then add some water to get a medium consistency. Simmer the dal for 3 to 4 minutes. Pic of the consistency of the lentils in step 6
food.step6: Once the desired consistency is reached, add cream (optional), garam masala powder, crushed kasuri methi, chopped coriander leaves and salt. Switch off the fire. Please note crushed kasuri methi can also be added in the tempering later and skipped at this step.
food.step7: Mix well so that everything combines uniformly. Check salt before you add the tempering. If less than add more salt.
food.ingredients: 1 cup arhar dal (tuvar dal or split pigeon pea lentils) or ½ cup arhar dal + ½ cup masoor dal (split pink lentils)
food.ingredient 2: 1 or 2 green chilies - chopped or slit lengthwise
food.ingredient 5: 1 inch ginger - finely chopped or grated or about 1 teaspoon of grated or chopped ginger (optional)
food.ingredient 10: 1 teaspoon crushed kasuri methi (dry fenugreek leaves)
food.ingredient 14: 3 tablespoon oil or 3 tablespoon ghee or butter
food.ingredient 17: 2 to 3 dry red chilies - broken and seeds removed

food.recipe: It was in Chicago that deep dish style pizza was created. The first deep dish pizza is believed to have been created by Ike Sewell and Ric Riccardo in 1943 at their restaurant Pizzeria Uno (but the origin is debated).
food.step 1: Preheat the oven at 200˚C.
food.step 2: Take a deep baking pan and grease it with some oil.
food.step 3: Sprinkle some flour and polenta on the worktop, place the dough over and roll into a disc which is of the size of the deep pan.
food.step 4: Gently lift the rolled out disc on the rolling pin and lower it into the deep pan, and press the sides lightly. . Dork it all over with a fork. Place the pan in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes.
food.step 5: Spread pizza sauce all over and sprinkle mozzarella cheese. Top with button mushrooms, jalapenos, mixed capsicum strips, salami and chicken sausages. Sprinkle salt, crushed black peppercorns and hand torn basil leaves.
food.step6: Keep the pan back in the hot oven and bake for 15 minutes.
food.step7: Bring the pan out of the oven, cut into wedges and serve hot.

With its crispy golden edges, gooey layer of cheese (right to the edge!), and thick yet delicate crust, it has a texture and taste that make you want more. Plus, the crust has just five simple ingredients: it’s easy to pull off in a home kitchen.

food.recipe: Mustard oil is one of the healthy cooking oils and goes remarkably well with Indian cuisine. If you are bored with kababs, mutton biryanis then this receipe will win your heart.
food.step 1: Take mutton pieces in a bowl, add ginger-garlic paste and turmeric powder and mix well. Add salt and mix well.
food.step 2: Heat mustard oil in a pressure cooker till it smokes. Switch the heat off and let the oil cool slightly.
food.step 3: Switch on the heat again, add onions, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add green cardamoms, black cardamoms, cinnamon stick and bay leaves. Break dried red chillies and add to the pan, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 4: Add green chilli paste, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add the mutton pieces, mix well and sauté for 2-3 minutes on high heat.
food.step 5: Add coriander powder, crushed black peppercorns, cumin powder, garam masala powder and salt and mix well.
food.step6: Add yogurt, mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add sufficient water to completely cover the mutton, mix well and put the lid on the cooker. Cook under pressure for 6-8 whistles.
food.step7: Open the lid once the pressure has settled completely. Stir and cook for 5-10 minutes.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot with steamed rice
food.ingredients: Mutton cut into 1 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.restaurants: ["Gallops","Gopals Mutton And Chicken","Gomantak","Craftbar","Masala Library","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Mini Punjab's Lake Side","Persian Darbar","Grandmama's Café","MRP - My Regular Place","Arth","Acharekar's Malvan Katta"]
food.description: Mutton gravy cooked in this oil has a lovely smooky taste.

food.recipe: When I used to make this sabzi earlier at home, I would always boil the potatoes first, crush them slightly and then make the curry.
food.step 1: Heat 3 tbsps mustard oil in a non-stick pan till it begins to smoke. Add potatoes and sauté for 2 minutes.
food.step 2: Add quartered onions and green chillies, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Transfer them into a bowl.
food.step 3: Heat remaining mustard oil in the same non-stick pan till it begins to smoke. Add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, asafoetida, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cloves and dried red chilli, mix and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 4: Add chopped onion and garlic, mix well and saute till golden brown. Add tomato, mix and sauté till pulpy.
food.step 5: Add salt,Turmeric Powder, coriander powder and red chilli powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add ¼ cup water, mix well, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step6: Add the potato-onion mixture, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Cover and cook for 1-2 minutes
food.step7: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Potatoes unpeeled, parboiled and cut into 1 inch pieces 3 medium
food.ingredient 3: Onion quartered and layers separated 3 small

food.description: Aloo ki sabzi (spiced potato curry) is another dhaba favorite. Most the these dhabas have their own way of making it but one this is for sure, they are all delicious and spicy!

food.recipe: This recipe uses lot of spices like coriander, fennel, amchur (dried mango powder), kashmiri red chili powder, kasuri methi and garam masala.
food.step 1: Take cottage cheese cubes in a large bowl, add salt, 1 tsp Kashmiri red chilli powder, ¼ tsp turmeric powder, and a pinch of carom seeds and toss well. Add a few drops of water and toss lightly. Set aside to marinate for 5 minutes.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps oil, add cumin seeds, cinnamon, bay leaf, dried red chilli and green cardamoms, mix and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 3: Add onions and a little salt, mix and sauté till light golden brown.
food.step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes or till the raw smells disappear.
food.step 5: Adjust salt, remaining Kashmiri red chilli powder, remaining turmeric powder and 1 tbsp water, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
food.step6: Add fresh tomato puree and mix well. Add Paneer Masala and mix well. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till oil separates.
food.step7: Add roasted gram flour, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add 1 cup water and mix well. Cover and cook, stirring a few times, for 8-10 minutes
food.step8: Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a shallow non-stick pan, add the cottage cheese cubes and shallow-fry till lightly golden brown on all sides.
food.step9: Add the cottage cheese cubes into the gravy along with the oil in which they were fried. Sprinkle a little kasuri methi powder, coriander leaves and light green chillies and mix lightly. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Take it off the heat.
food.step10: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with kasuri methi powder, coriander leaves and a light green chilli and serve hot with naan.
food.ingredients: Paneer (cottage cheese) cut into 1 inch cubes 300 grams
food.ingredient 19: Dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi) 1/2 teaspoon + for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Angrezi Dhaba","Dhaba Cafe","Apna Dhaba","Pritam Da Dhaba","Food Style","Masala Library","Apna Dhaba","Masala Bay - Taj Lands End"]
food.description: Paneer masala curry is one of the unique curry which gives a delicious taste as well as non-spicy, which can be eaten by any person or children.

food.recipe: A basic dosa recipe will just have the rice, urad dal and salt. The proportions for making dosa vary and by changing the proportions you can alter the texture by having a soft thick dosa to a thin dosa or a crispy dosa.
food.step 1: In a bowl take the idli rice or parboiled rice along with the regular white rice. Instead of adding regular rice, you can also make the dosa with a total of 1 cup idli rice as I have shown in the video. The video has the recipe ingredients doubled in proportion.
food.step 2: To the same bowl, add urad dal and fenugreek seeds.
food.step 3: Rinse the rice, lentils and methi seeds together a couple of times and keep aside.
food.step 4: Rinse it once or twice in water and then add rinsed poha to the bowl containing the rinsed rice+lentils+methi seeds.
food.step 5: Pour 1.5 cups water. Mix. Cover with a lid and soak everything for 5 to 6 hours.
food.step6: Drain all the water and add the soaked ingredients in a wet grinder jar.
food.step7: Add ⅔ to ¾ cup water and grind till you get a fine grainy consistency of rice in the batter. A smooth consistency of batter is also fine.
food.step8: If the mixer gets heated up, then stop and wait for some minutes. When the mixer cools down, grind again. Depending on the jar capacity, you can grind everything once or in two batches. I ground in two batches and added overall ¾ cup water.
food.step9: Now take the batter in a large bowl or pan.
food.step10: Add ½ tsp rock salt. Mix very well. Cover and allow to ferment for 8 to 9 hours or more. Time of fermentation will vary depending on the temperature conditions.
food.step11: A proper fermentation will double or triple up the volume of the batter and you will see tiny air pockets in the batter with a light sour aroma.
food.step12: Now lightly stir the batter, before you begin to make dosa.
food.step13: Heat a cast iron pan. When the pan becomes hot, spread 1/4 to 1/2 tsp oil all over the pan. Do keep the flame on low to low-medium flame, so that you are easily able to spread the batter. If the pan base is very thick, then keep the flame to medium.
food.ingredients: ½ cup idli rice or parboiled rice or 100 grams idli rice
food.ingredient 2: ½ cup regular rice or 100 grams regular rice
food.ingredient 3: ¼ cup urad dal or 50 grams urad dal (husked whole or split black gram)
food.ingredient 4: ⅛ teaspoon methi seeds or 2 pinches methi seeds (fenugreek seeds or methi dana)
food.ingredient 6: 1.5 cups water for soaking both rice and lentils
food.ingredient 7: ¾ cup water for grinding - do add water as required
food.ingredient 8: ½ teaspoon rock salt (sendha namak) or non iodized salt or sea salt crystals or himalayan pink salt
food.restaurants: ["Bhagwati Veg Restaurant","Thambbi","Yummy Foods","K.3 Snacks","Pappilon","Swami","Badshah","Mani's Lunch Home","Dosa Plaza","Swaad","Bombay Dosa Co.","Mawali Bhai Dosa","Shree Sagar Pure Veg","Amba Bhavan'Shiv Sagar"]
food.description: This is a plain dosa or sada dosa recipe which is a famous breakfast or snack both in India as well as outside India. Dosa is basically healthy crepes made from ground rice and lentil batter which has been fermented.

food.recipe: The topping and the spread used in this recipe is very similar to any other pizza, but is filled with molten cheese in it in India, the recipe was introduced and popularised by the dominos.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 180˚C.
food.step 2: Divide the dough into two balls, one lightly bigger than the other.
food.step 3: Dust the worktop with refined flour and polenta and roll out the smaller ball into a thin disc. Place it on a baking tray and dock with a fork. Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes or till it is completely done.
food.step 4: Dust the worktop with some more refined flour and polenta and roll the other ball into a thick disc which is slightly bigger than the first disc.
food.step 5: Roll the disc over a rolling pin and transfer to another baking tray. Set aside to prove for some-time..
food.step6: Once the base of the pizza is done, take it out of the oven and place over the worktop and let it cool slightly. Fill a piping bag with cheese spread. Pipe a thick and even layer of the cheese spread on the backside of the baked pizza base.
food.step7: Lift up the base and place it upside down on the thick disc which has by now proved. Apply a little cheese spread all around the edges and roll up the edges of the thick disc to seal.
food.step8: Spread an even layer of pizza sauce on the top. Sprinkle grated mozzarella on it and top with corn, jalapenos, green olives, black olives and basil leaves.
food.step9: Sprinkle chilli flakes and crushed black pepper. Keep the tray in the hot oven and bake for 15 minutes.
food.step10: Cut into wedges and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["Pizza By The Bay","Jamie's Pizzeria by Jamie Oliver","Mia Cucina","Smoke House Deli","Joey's Pizza","Cafe Monza","Jamjar Diner","PizzaExpress","Quattro Ristorante","Bruciato Food Factory","Mezzo Mezzo - JW Marriott Mumbai Juhu"]
food.description: Cheese Burst Pizza recipe is a unique and popular pizza type which has a thick crust with yummy liquid or molten cheese inside.

food.recipe: Dum Ka Murgh is a gem from the streets of Hyderabad and it is a must try recipe for all the chicken lovers. This rich and hearty dish can be prepared easily at home by marinating chicken leg pieces and cooking them with fried onions, tomato puree, almonds, etc
food.step 1: Take chironji and cashew nuts, put into the blender and add water make a paste.
food.step 2: Take a pan(with lid) add chicken, add the paste of chironji and cashew nuts, ginger garlic paste, fried onions, yogurt, green chilly paste, red chilly powder, whole garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, salt, chopped mint,
food.step 3: Chopped coriander and squezze the lime juice and add oil mix this well rest it for 2 hour, after that take out the chicken,
food.step 4: Add water(optional if required as gravy ), then take the lid and place the edges with dough on the lid and seal it,
food.step 5: Cook this in a medium to flame for 15 minutes and reduce the flame and place back the pan on the iron tawa and cook this in a slow flame for 25 minutes.
food.step6: Then switch off the flame and leave it aside, serve this with roti, or rice.
food.restaurants: ["Gymkhana 91 Bar & Kitchen","Mandarin Oak","Canton House","Yasin's Food Inn","Cantonese","The Peking Tom","Aer - Four Seasons","Singh Saab","Global Culture"]
food.description: A popular dish known as Dum ka chicken, is a very rich, aromatic and flavourful dish, chicken cooked in its own juices combined with lot of spices, almonds and cream in slow cooking method.

food.recipe: Egg bhurji is a dish originating from the Indian subcontinent, a variant of scrambled eggs that is sometimes compared with the Parsi dish akuri. The difference lies in its preparation and addition of sautéed chopped onions, chilies and optional spices.
food.step 1: Crack eggs into a mixing bowl.
food.step 2: Add salt, turmeric and chili powder.
food.step 3: Also add pepper powder, garam masala powder. Beat with a fork or beater for 1-2 mins lightly.
food.step 4: Heat oil plus butter in a pan.
food.step 5: Once pan is hot add onion and saute for a minute.
food.step6: Add ginger and stir nicely.
food.step7: Saute until ginger leaves aroma.
food.step8: Once the onion changes color to light brown.
food.step9: Add the tomatoes.
food.step10: Cover and cook until tomatoes soften. Keep stirring in between
food.step11: Now pour the beaten eggs.
food.step12: Time to add coriander leaves and green chilies.
food.step13: Once the eggs starts thickening keep stirring the spatula all over.
food.ingredient 9: 1 tablespoon black crushed pepper or pepper powder
food.ingredient 12: 1/2 cup grated cheese or as required
food.restaurants: ["The Bombay Canteen","Bademiya","Sarvi","Chinese N Grill","Chinese N Grill","Olympia Coffee House","Ahmed Bhai's Bry & Dry","Ayub's","Cafe Military","Ideal Corner","Delhi Darbar","Lucky Restaurant"]
food.description: Egg Bhurji is a spicy and flavourful Indian style scrambled eggs recipe that is quite famous in the streets of Northern and Western India.

food.recipe: Making egg curry is not really difficult. In fact if you have the eggs boiled and ready to go then it’s just a matter of putting everything together.
food.step 1: Make a coarse paste by grinding onion, green chillies, ginger and garlic
food.step 2: Add oil in a pan and saute the above mentioned ingredients for 2-3 minutes
food.step 3: Whisk the curd and cream together and add it into the pan. Mix well.
food.step 4: Now add kasoori methi, garam masala, red chilli powder and salt. Add 1 cup of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Let it cook for 10 minutes.
food.step 5: Make small slits in the boiled eggs and add them into the pan. Let it cook for 5-6 minutes.
food.step6: Garnish with chaat masala and fresh coriander leaves before serving.
food.restaurants: ["The Bombay Canteen","Bademiya","Sarvi","Chinese N Grill","Chinese N Grill","Olympia Coffee House","Ahmed Bhai's Bry & Dry","Ayub's","Cafe Military","Ideal Corner","Delhi Darbar","Lucky Restaurant"]
food.description: a popular Indian curry which is best enjoyed with plain rice or Indian breads like paratha and roti.

food.recipe: Egg Fried Rice Recipe (Anda Methi Chawal) is a quick to prepare dish when you have plenty of leftover cooked rice in the fridge. With the addition and scrambled eggs the fried rice gets the required protein and iron nutrient benefit as well.
food.step 1: Reserve some spring onion greens for garnish.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a wok, add garlic and spring onions and sauté for one minute.
food.step 3: Add carrot, French beans and capsicum and continue to sauté for another minute.
food.step 4: Add rice and cook on high heat for a minute or until the rice is heated through, tossing continuously.
food.step 5: Add soy sauce, salt and white pepper powder and mix gently. .
food.step6: Transfer into the serving bowl. In the same wok, pour the whisked eggs and lightly scramble
food.step7: Add the fried rice to this and mix.
food.step8: Mix in vinegar and serve hot, garnished with the reserved spring onion greens.
food.ingredient 3: Spring onions with greens finely chopped 2
food.restaurants: ["MRP - My Regular Place","Hardeep Punjab","Gymkhana 91 Bar & Kitchen","Yauatcha","Cafe Trofima","Plum by Bent Chair","Hakkasan"]
food.description: Egg Fried Rice Recipe (Anda Methi Chawal) can make a great weeknight dinner.

food.recipe: It is served both in restaurants and even on the streets in many Indian cities like Delhi, gurgaon, Mumbai or Pune. So you can gauge its popularity in India. It can be made with or without ice cream.
food.step 1: Soak sabja seeds in water for about 20 to 30 mins. Once they swell then drain the extra water and keep aside
food.step 2: Prepare the falooda sev according to package instructions.
food.step 3: Some require just soaking the falooda sev in warm water. I had to cook them in boiling water much like noodles. So I heated up 1.5 cups water and let it come to a boil. You can heat about 1.5 to 2 cups water.
food.step 4: Then added 5 tablespoons sev (roughly ⅓ cup). If the faluda sev are long, then just chop them before cooking.
food.step 5: Boil the faluda sev in the hot water on medium flame till they are softened and cooked well.
food.step6: Once cooked, using strainer or colander, drain the extra water. Then rinse the cooked falooda sev in fresh water. Drain the water again. Keep covered aside till they are cooled completely at room temperature.
food.step7: In 4 tall glasses each, add 1.5 to 2 tablespoons rose syrup. Depending upon your taste you can add less or more of the rose syrup
food.step8: Then add 2 tablespoons soaked sabja seeds.
food.step9: Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of the faluda sev
food.step10: In a slow stream, pour about 1 cup milk.
food.step11: Then top with one scoop of vanilla ice cream.
food.step12: Garnish with a few raisins, sliced pistachios, almonds or cashews. Prepare the remaining falooda drink in the same way.
food.step13: Serve the falooda immediately. while drinking, with a spoon mix the rose syrup settled at the bottom with the milk and then drink.
food.ingredients: ½ tablespoon sabja seeds (sweet basil seeds, tukmaria seeds) - chia seeds can be added as a substitute
food.ingredient 2: 1 to 1.25 cups water or add as required
food.ingredient 3: 5 tablespoons falooda sev - roughly ⅓ cup
food.ingredient 5: 6 tablespoons rose syrup or add as required
food.ingredient 7: 12 tablespoons cooked falooda sev - about ¾ cup cooked falooda sev
food.ingredient 8: 4 cups chilled whole milk or chilled almond milk
food.ingredient 10: 10 to 12 unsalted pistachios - sliced or slivered
food.restaurants: ["Mangoes Mumbai","shahi durbar","baba falooda","badshah cold drinks","haji ali juice centre","fruitozza","blue bunny ice cream"]
food.description: Falooda ice cream is a layered summer dessert drink made with milk, rose syrup, sabja seeds, falooda sev, dry fruits and ice cream. Faluda is a popular Indian summer drink and very easy to make.

food.recipe: this recipe has been adapted to the taste of the locals ever since it was introduced by the Indian migrants when they moved to the region. Thus, it is no surprise that fish head curry is not known in India.
food.step 1: Heat 3 tbsps oil in non-stick kadai till it starts smoking. Meanwhile, take fish heads in a bowl and add salt and ½ tsp turmeric powder, mix well
food.step 2: Add the fish heads to the hot oil and shallow-fry, turning sides, till golden brown on both sides.. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step 3: Carefully transfer the oil remaining in the kadai into a pressure cooker and add remaining oil and heat till it begins to smoke.
food.step 4: Add green chillies, bay leaves and onion, mix and sauté till onion turns light golden brown.
food.step 5: Add cumin paste, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and mix well. Add remaining turmeric powder and red chilli powder and mix well
food.step6: Reduce the heat and add drained rice and mix well. Add fish heads and mix well.
food.step7: Add 1½ cups water and garam masala powder. Mix and cover the pressure cooker and cook for 5-10 minutes or till 2 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to be released completely
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.
food.ingredient 11: Ambe mohor rice soaked for 10-15 minutes 1/2 cup
food.restaurants: ["Hungry Head","Dum & Curry","Curry Culture","Curry Patta","Head Quarter","Captain Curry","Angrezi Dhaba","Gomantak","Dakshin Culture Curry"]
food.description: Fish head curry is immensely popular in Malaysia and Singapore. With South Indian origins, it uses a combination of various spices and ingredients to create its well accepted delectable taste.

food.food_item: Fish in Hot Black Bean Sauce
food.recipe: Here is the detailed explanation on how to prepare steamed fish with black bean sauce.
food.step 1: Diagonally slice spring onions. Halve fresh red chillies.
food.step 2: Cut fish fillet into large pieces and put them into a bowl. Add soup powder and mix well and marinate for 15-20 minutes.
food.step 3: Heat sufficient oil in a pan and deep-fry fish.
food.step 4: Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non-stick wok, add spring onions, ginger, black bean sauce and oyster sauce and mix well. Sauté for 2 minutes.
food.step 5: Add schezwan chutney and red chillies and mix. Drain fish and add to the wok and mix gently.
food.step6: Chop spring onion greens.
food.step7: Put the fish on a serving dish, garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.
food.ingredient 4: Packet of instant hot and sour soup powder 1
food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: After steaming, discard the water release by the fish on the plate, which has a ‘fishy’ smell. Transfer the fish to a serving plate.
food.image: Fish in Hot Black Bean Sauce.jpg

food.recipe: This dish is a delicate blend of flavours & textures that may not appeal to all, but its a "must" for those who like experiment.
food.step 1: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a rice cooker. Add rice, vegetable stock and salt and mix. Cover and cook till ½ done. Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick wok. Slice spring onion bulbs and add and sauté for 1 minute. Chop spring onion greens. Add ginger and garlic to the pan and mix.
food.step 2: Add button mushrooms, toss and sauté for 2 minutes. Roughly chop dried mushrooms. Add salt, pepper powder, soya sauce and chopped dried mushrooms and toss. Add five-spice powder and mix well. Add spring onion greens reserving some for garnishing. Mix well and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 3: Take out some cooked rice in a bowl. Spread cooked mushrooms over the rice in the cooker and spread rice from bowl on top. Drizzle sesame oil, cover and cook till fully done. Garnish with reserved spring onion greens and serve hot.
food.ingredient 4: Basmati rice soaked for 1 hour 1 1/2 cups
food.restaurants: ["MRP - My Regular Place","Hardeep Punjab","Gymkhana 91 Bar & Kitchen","Yauatcha","Cafe Trofima","Plum by Bent Chair","Hakkasan"]
food.description: Aromatic Chinese style spice rice made with mix vegetables and 5 spice powders. A gluten-free and vegan recipe.

food.food_item: Fresh Ravioli With Feta Cheese And Spinach
food.recipe: Our Mediterranean Ravioli with Feta is a budget-friendly way to make delicious Mediterranean food at home! You're going to love this easy shortcut recipe because it saves time, without skimping on flavor, and your family will love you for serving up restaurant quality food at the kitchen table. We're sure you'll agree, there's no downside to this easy pasta recipe
food.step 1: Heat water with 1-2 drops of olive oil in a deep non-stick pan. Roughly chop blanched spinach and finely chop 1 onion. Heat 2 tbsps olive oil in a non stick pan, add garlic and onion and sauté till they sweat.
food.step 2: Add spinach and mix. Add salt and crushed peppercorns and cook till dry. Add oregano leaves and mix. Crumble feta cheese and add. Mix well and switch off heat. Arrange a pasta sheet on the work top.
food.step 3: Place small portions of the spinach mixture keeping a little distance between each portion. With a wet brush dampen the pasta all around the spinach portions. Place another pasta sheet over and press all around each spinach portion.
food.step 4: Cut around each portion with a round cutter or a square cutter and once again press the edges to ensure they are well sealed. Carefully lower them into the hot water and cook for 5 minutes. Drain and place on a flat tray.
food.step 5: Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil over so that they do not stick to each other. Roughly chop pine nuts and finely chop the other onion, red and yellow capsicums. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a non-stick pan, add butter, 1 tsp garlic, onion, capsicums and mix. Add the ravioli, pine nuts, fresh oregano and gently shake the pan to mix. Arrange ravioli on a serving platter, pour extra butter sauce over, garnish with fresh oregano and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Cook tomatoes, onion, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper 8 minutes or until tomatoes start to break down.
food.image: Fresh Ravioli With Feta Cheese And Spinach.jpg

food.recipe: Fried modak as the name suggests is a fried version of the steamed modak and much easier to make than the steamed version
food.step 1: With the ingredients mentioned for the outer covering, make a smooth dough.
food.step 2: Cover and keep the dough aside for 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step 3: Mix all the filling or stuffing ingredients.
food.step 4: Cook and stir on a low or medium flame till the mixture is dry and cooked. If using fresh coconut, then do not add water.
food.step 5: Keep aside to cool.
food.step6: Take a small ball from the dough.
food.step7: Roll thinly in to a circle of about 3 to 4 inches diameter
food.step8: Gently take this circle on your palm.
food.step9: Now add the filling in the center.
food.step10: Pinch the edges one by one.
food.step11: Bring together all the pinched folds in the center.
food.step12: Shallow or deep fry in medium hot oil till golden and crisp.
food.step13: Place on kitchen paper towels.
food.ingredient 4: water as required to knead the dough
food.ingredient 6: 1.5 cups or unsweetened desiccated coconut or fresh grated coconut
food.ingredient 8: 1 or 1.5 teaspoon cardamom powder or crushed cardamom
food.ingredient 10: ½ cup water (do not add if using fresh coconut)
food.description: Fried modak is a traditional Maharashtrian sweet dish offered to Lord Ganesha on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

food.recipe: Fried momos are easy and tasty snack that you can make at home in no time. It is a delicious take on traditional steamed momos. With crispy exterior and spicy vegetable filling, these momos tastes delicious with any dipping sauce.
food.step 1: Take wheat flour, salt and oil in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Add water to it and make a pliable dough. Set aside for 20 minutes.
food.step 2: Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a kadai. Add all the chopped vegetables and saute in high flame for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Mix well and saute for 2 more minutes. Remove from flame and cool completely.
food.step 3: Now to make momos divide the dough into equal sized balls of ping pong size
food.step 4: Take a ball and roll it to a small circle.
food.step 5: Keep 2 teaspoons of prepared filling in it.
food.step6: Pleat and shape to a momo. Repeat the same with remaining dough.
food.step7: Heat oil for deep frying. Once the oil is hot deep fry the momos in batches until golden brown. Serve veg momos hot with dipping sauce.
food.ingredient 6: 2 cups finely chopped or shredded veggies carrots, capsicum. cabbage, bell peppers etc
food.restaurants: ["The Momos Nation","The Momos Machine","Hello Momos","Dumpling Delights","BusaGo","The Fatty Bao","Kepchaki Momos","Ithaka - Veg Lebanese Kitchen","Chinese Wok - Wok Express","Yummy Momos","Relish - International Veg Cuisine","The Appetite Momos"]
food.description: fried momos are fried dumplings stuffed with a lightly spiced vegetable filling. A popular chinees recipe.

food.food_item: Fried Tofu in Chilli Soy Sauce
food.recipe: This pan-fried tofu is a really easy way to make tofu. By pan-frying it, you get a nice, slightly crispy texture on it and then dip it in this awesome sauce. We also add chili sauce to give it some spiciness, but if you prefer your sauce mild, you can leave it out.
food.step 1: Cut red and green capsicum into ½ inch pieces. Crush garlic. Slice shallots.
food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
food.step 3: Roughly chop green chillies and bird’s eye chillies.
food.step 4: To make chilli soy sauce, heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and shallots and sauté till translucent. Add dark soy sauce, palm sugar, salt and mix well. Let the sugar melt.
food.step 5: Cut beancurd into thick slices.
food.step6: Deep-fry beancurd slices in hot oil till crisp and brown on both the sides. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step7: Add green chillies and bird’s eye chillies to the sauce, add 2 tbsps water and mix well. Cook till the sauce thickens.
food.step8: Flash-fry capsicum pieces in the same hot oil. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step9: Cut fried beancurd into small cubes
food.step10: Add vinegar to the sauce and mix well. Simmer for a minute.
food.step11: Pour the prepared sauce over the fried beancurd and capsicum, garnish with bean sprouts and serve immediately.
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: This pan-fried tofu is a really easy way to make tofu. By pan-frying it, you get a nice, slightly crispy texture on it and then dip it in this awesome sauce.
food.image: Fried Tofu in Chilli Soy Sauce.jpg

food.recipe: Red Delhi carrots are in season now and time to make various carrot based recipes like carrot halwa, Gajar ka murabba.
food.step 1: Grease a barfi tray with a little ghee and set aside.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps ghee in a non-stick deep bottom pan, add the carrots and sauté for 1-2 minutes on high heat.
food.step 3: Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes on medium heat, sautéing occasionally. Lower the heat and add condensed milk, sugar and mix well. Add a pinch of green cardamom powder, and mix well.
food.step 4: Cook on medium heat till almost all the moisture is evaporated, stirring continuously. Add mawa and mix well. Stirring occasionally till well combined and the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
food.step 5: Add slivered pistachios and almonds, remaining ghee, and mix well. Transfer the mixture to the greased burfi tray and spread evenly. Tap it so there are no air pockets.
food.step6: Sprinkle slivers of almonds and pistachios, refrigerate until set. Cut into desired shape and serve.
food.ingredient 5: A pinch of green cardamom powder
food.restaurants: ["shree gangour sweets","chandu halwai grant road","m n mithaiwala","punjabi sweet house and restaurants","adarsh mithai mandir","vyanjan","tharu sweets","sindhu sweets","jhama sweets ghatkopar east"]
food.description: Easy, quick and tasty recipe of carrot burfi

food.recipe: Normally, garlic mushrooms are cooked in butter and garlic, hence the name of the recipe. However, you will love the extra ingredients we add even more! Because an extra kick of flavour never hurt anyone!
food.step 1: Remove stems of the mushrooms and halve the larger ones.
food.step 2: Heat extra virgin olive oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic and saute. Add mushrooms, salt and crushed black peppercorns.
food.step 3: Add white wine and mix and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add pinenuts and mix
food.step 4: Divide the mixture equally between 4 flat bottomed bowls. Drizzle 1 tsp extra virgin olive oil over each and cook in the oven at 180° C for 20 minutes
food.step 5: Serve hot.
food.ingredient 3: Extra virgin olive oil 3 tbsps + to drizzle
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: buttery garlic mushrooms with a flavour twist! the herb garlic butter sauce is so good, you’ll be serving these mushrooms with everything!

food.recipe: The Garlic naan was so good. It is exactly the way a naan should be. Not at all chewy & hard the way we get in restaurants.
food.step 1: Proof the yeast in sugar dissolved with 3/4 cup warm water.
food.step 2: After the yeast proofs and rises, add all the flours, garlic paste, lemon juice or yogurt, salt and oil to the yeast mixture.
food.step 3: Knead to a smooth dough. Add water if required while kneading.
food.step 4: Cover with a moist cloth and keep the dough to leaven for 1:30 to 2 hours
food.step 5: When the dough doubles up, then make medium sized balls of the dough.
food.step6: Cover and keep aside for 15-20 mins
food.step7: In a plate or tray take the chopped garlic, celery leaves and nigella seeds. Mix these well.
food.step8: Take each ball on a dusted board and roll into a small disc of 2 inches.
food.step9: Place this disc on the garlic-celery-nigella-seeds mixture.
food.step10: Remove and keep on a dusted board. Now roll to a round of about 5 to 6 inches diameter.
food.step11: Heat a tava or frying pan.
food.step12: Place the garlic and celery side of the naan touching the hot tava.
food.step13: Cook this side till browned and done. Now hold the garlic naan with a tong and place the uncooked side directly on the fire.
food.ingredient 3: 2 teaspoon garlic paste or minced garlic
food.ingredient 6: 1.5 or 2 teaspoon lemon juice or 3 to 4 teaspoon curd (yogurt)
food.ingredient 8: ¾ cup water - add more if required
food.ingredient 10: 1 to 2 tablespoon chopped celery or coriander leaves (optional)
food.ingredient 12: 1 to 1.5 teaspoon salt or as required
food.ingredient 13: extra oil or ghee for frying or smearing on the naan (optional)
food.restaurants: ["Pratap The Dhaba","Dum & Curry","Masala Library","Tanatan","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Butter Chicken Factory","Paratha World","Curry Me Up","90 Ft Above","Chenab","Royale Masterchef Finedine and Bar","Chakh Le The Street Food","Khyber","Biryani Hazir Ho","The Goose & Gridiron"]
food.description: Garlic naan is Indian leavened flatbread made with wheat flours and spiced with garlic.

food.recipe: Gobhi paratha are usually made for breakfast, but I made this for dinner, as was too tired to cook an elaborate meal. Gobi parathas are served with white butter or curd or mango pickle.
food.step 1: In a bowl or vessel take 3 cups whole wheat flour along with salt as required. add 1 tablespoon ghee or oil.
food.step 2: Next add 1 cup water or as required. knead the wheat flour with water to a smooth dough.
food.step 3: Cover and keep aside for 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step 4: Rinse the cauliflower head very well.
food.step 5: Then grate cauliflower with a fine grater.
food.step6: Add some finely chopped green chilies to it.
food.step7: Uniformly mix the green chilies with the gobi. Keep aside.
food.step8: later take 2 small to medium sized balls from the dough. dust them with some flour on the rolling board.
food.step9: With a rolling pin (belan), roll both the dough balls to a size of about 3 to 4 inches in diameter.
food.step10: Now spread some ghee over one of the rolled disc. top it with a few tablespoons of the grated cauliflower mix and keep about 1 inch empty space from the sides.
food.step11: Sprinkle 1 to 2 pinches of salt, red chili powder and garam masala powder all over on the grated gobi.
food.step12: Also sprinkle some wheat flour. As the grated cauliflower tend to be moist, sprinkling little wheat flour helps the parathas not to be moist and sticky when rolling with a pin (belan).
food.step13: Be careful as not to understuff or overstuff the paratha. cover with the other rolled dough (disc).
food.ingredient 2: 1 cup water or add more if required
food.ingredient 4: 1 tablespoon ghee or oil or add as required (optional)
food.ingredient 5: ½ of a cauliflower head, finely grated

food.recipe: Goda masala is a special spice blend unique to Maharashtrian cuisine. the spices used here are aromatic spices and these lend a subtle sweet aroma without hints of pungency & heat. So when you smell goda masala, you won’t sense the heat & pungency which is felt in other spice blends like garam masala and its variations
food.step 1: Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan
food.step 2: Add coriander seeds. Stir often and roast them till they become fragrant and they change color. Remove in a plate.
food.step 3: Then add cumin seeds. Again stir and roast them till they are fragrant and they change color. Remove in the same plate.
food.step 4: Next add caraway seeds and follow the same procedure.
food.step 5: Now add the niger seeds/karale. These are wonderfully fragrant. Just roast them till they become fragrant.
food.step6: Add sesame seeds. Roast till they change color. Keep on stirring so that there is uniform roasting. Takes about 1.5 to 2 minutes on a low flame.
food.step7: Once done, then like all the other roasted ingredients, remove and keep aside in the same plate.
food.step8: Roast the desiccated coconut till they are golden. You will have to continuously stir to get a uniform golden color. To get darker color, you can roast a tad more than what I have done. Remove in the same plate.
food.step9: If adding poppy seeds, add them now and roast till they are fragrant. Remove aside.
food.step10: Add the broken dry red chilies and roast till they have a smoky pungent fragrance. You can deseed the chilies if you prefer.
food.step11: again heat 1 tsp oil in the same pan. Now add all the aromatic spices - cinnamon, bay leaf, black pepper, star anise, cloves, black cardamom seeds, green cardamom, cobra's saffron (nagkesar), stone flower (dagad phool or patthar ke phool). Roast till the spices become aromatic. About a minute.
food.step12: Let all the spices and the rest of the other ingredients cool
food.step13: In a dry grinder, grind everything in batches. I ground in two batches, so that the grinder does not have a overload. If you have a small grinder, then you will have to grind in 4 to 5 batches. While grinding due to the oil, you will have to scrape the sides and then continue to grind.
food.ingredients: 8 tablespoons coriander seeds (sabut dhania), 40 to 45 grams or about ¾ cup
food.ingredient 2: 6 tablespoons desiccated coconut, about 40 grams of desiccated coconut or ½ cup + 1 tablespoon
food.ingredient 3: 7 tablespoons sesame seeds (til), about 55 to 60 grams
food.ingredient 6: 3 tablespoons stone flower (pathar phool, dagad phool)
food.ingredient 7: 4 to 5 dry red chilies, you can use byadagi or bedgi chilies or kashmiri red chilies
food.ingredient 10: ½ teaspoon black pepper (sabut kali mirch)
food.ingredient 11: 25 cloves (lavang) or about ¾ to 1 tablespoon
food.ingredient 12: 4 black cardamoms (badi elachi), seeds removed and kept aside, husks discarded
food.ingredient 13: 5 to 6 green cardamoms (hari elachi, choti elachi)
food.ingredient 14: 7 to 8 small tej patta (tamal patra) or 4 to 5 medium tej patta
food.restaurants: ["masala kitchen","cafe madras","Grandmama's Café","Hotel Ram Ashraya'","Arya Bhavan'","guru kripa'","aaswad"]
food.description: Maharashtrian goda masala recipe - an aromatic spice blend unique to Maharashtrian cuisine.

food.food_item: Golden Chicken And White Wine Risotto
food.step 1: Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add the chicken and sauté till golden brown.
food.step 2: Drain and set aside. Heat olive oil in the same pan.
food.step 3: Add garlic and sauté for thirty seconds.
food.step 4: Add onion and sauté till the onion is light brown.
food.step 5: Add rice, saffron and sauté for two to three minutes.
food.step6: Add chicken stock, little by little, and cook till the rice is three-fourth done.
food.step7: Add wine and cook till the rice is completely cooked.
food.step8: Add salt, crushed peppercorns and one tablespoon Parmesan cheese and mix well.
food.step9: Add chicken pieces and mix well.
food.step10: Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan cheese and serve hot garnished with a parsley sprig.

food.recipe: A summer cooling drink is this gond ka sharbat. The gond used here is katira gond which has cooling properties and is an edible gum. Katira gond is also known as tragacanth in english and badam pisin in south India.
food.step 1: Rinse and then add 2 teaspoons gond katira in a Large bowl. remember that just a few teaspoons of gond katira when soaked in water will give a bowl full of jelly like gond.
food.step 2: Add 2 cups water. Cover and allow gond katira to soak in water overnight or for 8 to 9 hours. If the size of the edible gums are large, then break them in a mortar-pestle to get smaller sizes
food.step 3: The next day you will see the gond katira increases in volume, blooms and become jelly like. After soaking, if it becomes too tightened up then you can add some more water. Strain the extra water from the soaked edible gum in a strainer and keep aside. You can also refrigerate the soaked gond katira. If there are impurities then rinse with water in strainer to get rid of them.
food.step 4: In a serving glass, take 3 to 4 tablespoons of soaked gond.
food.step 5: Add 2 to 3 tablespoon of rooh afza. You can also use rose syrup or khus syrup or sandalwood syrup.
food.step6: Add chilled milk. You can also add water instead of milk or half-half of both. You can even use almond milk instead.
food.step7: Add ice cubes.
food.step8: Serve gond ka sherbet immediately. You can add some chopped dry fruits if you want. The remaining gond can be refrigerated and used as required.
food.ingredients: 2 teaspoons gond katira (also known as tragacanth in english and badam pisin in south india)
food.ingredient 4: 9 to 12 tablespoons rooh afza or rose syrup, add as required
food.restaurants: ["Mangoes Mumbai","shreeji aamrus","pancham puriwala","golden star thali","sheetal diary"]
food.description: Gond ka sharbat recipe - a summer cooling drink. The gond used here is katira gond which has cooling properties.

food.recipe: This stir fry cooks up quickly, with onions, ginger, and garlic, and a sauce of sweetened soy sauce with sesame oil. It couldn’t be easier!

food.step 2: Add water chestnuts and mix well. Add black bean sauce and crushed red chillies. Toss again and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 3: Add chilli sauce and mix. Add bean sprouts and adjust salt. Mix well and cook for 1 minute. Serve hot.

food.food_item: Grilled Polenta With Sundried Tomatoes And Olive S
food.recipe: I’ve been making this appetizer for my holiday parties for eight years now.  It’s never one that I leave off the menu because this is always a very popular appetizer.  For one thing, it’s so darn pretty.  It looks so very festive with the red and the green.  And it’s really a very unique appetizer that tends to catch everyone’s eye.
food.step 1: Pour vegetable stock into medium saucepan and bring it to a boil. Gradually add polenta and stir continuously.
food.step 2: Reduce heat and cook for two to three minutes or until polenta thickens. Stir in cheese, parsley and basil. Pour this mixture into a deep eight-inch square cake tin and spread evenly. Set aside to cool.
food.step 3: Cover and refrigerate for about three hours or until firm. Turn polenta onto a plate and cut into four round pieces using a mould or cup or into any other shape.
food.step 4: Heat a grill pan and lightly grease it. Grill the polenta pieces until evenly browned on both sides.
food.step 5: For salad, mix lettuce, basil leaves, spring onions, black olives and sundried tomatoes and set aside. Whisk mayonnaise, lemon juice and paprika in a bowl and add it to the salad mixture.
food.step6: Place polenta pieces on individual serving plates, top them with salad and drizzle a teaspoon of olive oil on each.
food.step7: Sprinkle with crushed black peppercorns and serve.
food.ingredient 6: Fresh basil leaves finely chopped 1 tablespoon

food.step 2: Add the yellow zucchini, green and red capsicums to the pan and cook till lightly browned all over. Add vinegar and toss.

food.step 5: Place them over the base slice of the bread. Top it with green zucchini and eggplants.
food.step6: Sprinkle some salt. Place another bread slice over the vegetables and top it with the green and red capsicum and yellow zucchini.
food.step7: Tear a few basil leaves and sprinkle over. Sprinkle a little salt and place the top slice over.
food.step8: Place the sandwich on the grill again, drizzle a little oil and close the grill. Cook for a couple of minutes.
food.step9: Cut into smaller pieces, wrap in aluminium foil and pack for lunch.

food.recipe: The tandoor has been long known for the unique smoky flavour and slightly charred texture that it imparts to the food cooked in it. The hot hot earthen oven is popular for firing up a number of delicious and signature North Indian dishes, one of which is the tandoori chicken.

food.step 2: Marinate the chicken for an hour.
food.step 3: Cook the chicken in tandoor until done, about 15-120 minutes.
food.step 4: Add lemon Juice, chaat masala, and butter after cooked.
food.step 5: Serve hot with mint chutney.

food.step 2: Roll the pattis and slice into the shape of flat noodles. Dust some cornstarch on top and mix
food.step 3: Deep-fry sliced pattis in hot oil till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside.

food.recipe: It contains some of my favorite Asian flavor combinations too: soy, garlic and ginger. This magic threesome is a never-fail basis for salad dressings or marinades.

food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a wok or a pan, dust the chicken wings with the remaining cornflour and deep-fry turning frequently, for about four to five minutes.
food.step 3: Drain on absorbent paper. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a wok or a pan, add the garlic and stir-fry for half a minute.
food.step 4: Immediately add the light soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chilli flakes and salt.
food.step 5: Add the fried chicken wings and stir in the cornflour mixture. Cook on medium to high heat for a minute, stirring continuously.
food.step6: Lower the heat and stir in the lemon juice and honey, mix well and cook further on medium heat for a couple of minutes. Sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds and serve hot.

food.recipe: Sweet and spicy wings! You can make two batches of the sauce, use one as a marinade before grilling the chicken, and pour the second batch over the chicken after it is grilled. It is not mandatory to do it this way, just better!

food.step 3: Remove the chicken and coat with cornflour.

food.step 5: Drain on an absorbent paper
food.step6: To make hot and sweet sauce, combine soy sauce, malt vinegar, sugar and ginger juice in a pan. Add water as required and bring the mixture to boil.

food.step8: Continue boiling until the sauce is reduced to half.

food.recipe: Chinese takeout favorite Hunan Chicken is an easy classic Chinese stir-fry dish with garlic, ginger, broccoli, bamboo shoots and mushrooms in a garlic and ginger spicy stir fry sauce.
food.step 1: Marinate the chicken cubes with half teaspoon soy sauce for fifteen minutes. Add one tablespoon cornflour and a little stock and mix well.
food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep-fry the chicken cubes till lightly browned. Drain on absorbent paper.

food.step 4: Add chilli paste and mix well. Add onion, yellow capsicum, red capsicum and green capsicum and mushrooms and mix well and sauté on high heat.
food.step 5: Add most of the remaining stock and remaining soy sauce and mix well. Mix remaining cornflour with a little stock to make slurry. Add salt and mix well.
food.step6: Add the slurry to the wok and mix well. Add chicken, how much bean sprouts, vinegar, roasted cashewnuts after reserving some for garnishing and mix well
food.step7: Add the slurry to the wok and mix well. Add chicken, how much bean sprouts, vinegar, roasted cashewnuts after reserving some for garnishing and mix well

food.step 3: Repeat till dough is used up.

food.step 5: Remove from oven and slice crosswise into three-fourth inch thick biscuits
food.step6: Place on baking tray and bake for additional fifteen minutes.
