food.recipe: It is very cooling and is an ideal drink for hot Indian summers. Apart from cooling properties jal jeera is also used as an appetizer because of its digestive properties.
food.step 1: Soak 1 tablespoon tightly packed tamarind in ¼ cup hot water for about 20 minutes.
food.step 2: Rinse ⅓ cup fresh mint leaves well with water. Drain all the water. Add the mint leaves in a small grinder jar. Only use the mint leaves. Do not add the stems as then the jal jeera can become bitter.
food.step 3: Add the soaked tamarind along with its water. Make sure there are no seeds in the tamarind.
food.step 4: Add 1.5 teaspoons cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon fennel, ½ teaspoon black pepper and seeds removed from 1 black cardamom.
food.step 5: Next add 1 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder), 1 teaspoon chaat masala, 1 pinch asafoetida (hing) and black salt as required.
food.step6: If you do not have dry mango powder, then you can add some lemon juice. Instead of dry mango powder, kachri powder or bel powder can also be used. Instead of black salt, you can use rock salt or sea salt.
food.step7: Grind to a smooth chutney. If you want you can even strain the chutney using a tea strainer.
food.step8: Take the jal jeera chutney in a bowl. Also add 1.5 cups water.
food.step9: Mix very well. Check the taste of jaljeera and add more salt and dry mango powder if required. You can also add some lemon juice if you want.
food.step10: If in case the jaljeera tastes bitter (due to the type and quality of mint leaves), then add some lemon juice to balance the bitterness. Keep jaljeera in the refrigerator.
food.step11: While serving you can add some boondi, a pinch of chaat masala and a few mint leaves in each glass.
food.step12: Boondi can be soaked in water for 20 to 30 minutes. Later squeeze the water and keep them aside. Add boondi while serving jaljeera.
food.ingredient 2: 1 tablespoon tightly packed tamarind - for a more pronounced sourness, you can add ½ tablespoon of more tamarind (imli)
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup mint leaves - loosely packed
food.ingredient 8: 1 black cardamom - seeds removed and kept - optional
food.ingredient 11: black salt or rock salt as required - can also use regular salt
food.ingredient 13: 1 to 2 tablespoons boondi or add as required
food.restaurants: ["Health Juice Centre","soam","oye cake","pratap the dhabha","sher e punjab","govinda's retaurant","urban street cafe"]
food.description: Jaljeera is a spiced Indian cooling drink also had as an appetizer.

food.recipe: The process starts in the food processor blending yoghurt with tomatoes and ginger and then the mixture is transferred into the pan along-with the rest of the ingredients.The Chicken pieces are added in and simmered away gently while developing some outstanding flavors predominantly from the fennel and poppy seeds and the dish is finished off with some cream for that rich creamy texture
food.step 1: Take kabuli chana in a large bowl, add sufficient water and let it soak it for 7-8 hours. Drain and transfer into another bowl.
food.step 2: Take chicken in a large bowl, add salt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, ½ tsp green chilli paste, yogurt, 1 tsp red chilli powder and ¼ tsp turmeric powder and mix well. Set aside to marinate till the kabuli chane are cooked.
food.step 3: Heat a pressure cooker, add 4 tbsps ghee, cumin seeds, green cardamoms, cloves, black peppercorns, cinnamon and bay leaf, mix and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 4: Add onions, mix well and sauté till golden brown.
food.step 5: Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 tsp green chilli paste, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes
food.step6: Add tomato and tomato puree and mix well and saute till the tomatoes are cooked and oil separates.
food.step7: Add 1½ tsps red chilli powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, coriander powder, chole masala and mix well. Reduce heat and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add ½ cup water, mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes or till the mixture is fragrant.
food.step8: Add the soaked chana and mix well. Slit green chillies and add, and. mix well. Add 6 cups water and mix well.
food.step9: Add salt and mix well. Cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 7-8 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to reduce completely.
food.step10: Heat 2 tbsps ghee in a deep pan, add the chicken with the marinade and mix well. Sauté on high heat for 4-5 minutes
food.step11: Add the cooked chole in it and mix well. Cover and cook till chicken is cooked completely. Take it off the heat
food.step12: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with tomato wedges, lemon wedges, green chilli, and coriander sprig. Serve hot.
food.ingredients: Chicken on the bone cut into 2 inch pieces 750 grams
food.restaurants: ["Butter Chicken Factory","Fried Chicken Cuisine","MFC - Mr. Fried Chicken","Chicken On The Run","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Global Fusion","Koliwada Chicken & Fish Fry Corner","Navjeevan","Goila Butter Chicken","Soul Curry"]
food.description: Murgh Kabuli comes from Afghanistan and they’re known for their mild creamy preparations using yoghurt,cream,aromatic spices, nuts and poppy seeds.This recipe does not use onion and that saves a ton of time and effort. Its a great recipe for a crowd and tastes as amazing as it looks

food.recipe: Kadai Chicken is a delicious Indian chicken curry where chicken is cooked with freshly ground spices. This spicy curry goes well with naan or any other Indian bread. Here is how to make it.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a kadai, add cumin seeds and let the seeds change colour. Add chopped onion, mix and sauté till golden brown in colour.
food.step 2: Add ginger-garlic paste, mix well and saute till raw smells disappear. Add chopped tomato and mix well. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute till the mixture is pulpy.
food.step 3: Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt and ½ cup water, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 4: Add chicken cubes and kadai masala powder and mix well. Add ¼ cup water and mix well. Add cashew nut paste, mix well and cook for 8-10 minutes.
food.step 5: Add dried fenugreek leaves powder, diced onion, diced tomato and diced capsicum tomato, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step6: Squeeze the juice of ½ lemon and add coriander leaves, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step7: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Boneless chicken cut into 2 inch cubes 500 grams
food.ingredient 16: Onion diced and layers separated 1 medium
food.ingredient 17: Green capsicum diced and layers separated 1 medium
food.restaurants: ["Pritam Da Dhaba","Gomantak","Angrezi Dhaba","Copper Chimney","Persian Darbar","Lucky Restaurant","Gulshan-e-Iran","Butter Chicken Factory","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Faham Restaurant & Lounge","Khyber","Hitchki","Light Of Bharat"]
food.description: Spicy dish from indian subcontinent

food.recipe: Kadai mushroom is a super simple, easy and delicious dish of sautéed button mushrooms, bell peppers (capsicum) in a spiced, tangy tomato sauce.
food.step 1: First dry roast all the spices mentioned above for the kadai masala, on a low flame in a kadai/wok or a pan till fragrant. Don't burn them.
food.step 2: Once the spices cool down, add them to a grinder jar.
food.step 3: Grind to a semi fine powder. You can also grind to a fine powder. Keep the ground kadai masala aside.
food.step 4: In the same jar, add chopped tomatoes. Blend the tomatoes to a smooth puree. Keep aside
food.step 5: Rinse, wipe and then slice the mushrooms. Also thinly slice the bell pepper & chop the onions etc. Keep the veggies aside.
food.step6: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a kadai or pan. Add the sliced mushrooms.
food.step7: Stir & saute the sliced mushrooms. First you will see the mushrooms releasing a lot of water.
food.step8: Then later the water evaporates. Saute till the mushrooms get browned from the edges.
food.step10: In the same oil, add finely chopped onions. Saute the onions till translucent or light golden
food.step11: Now add the ginger-garlic paste and saute till their raw aroma disappears.
food.step12: Add the tomato puree. Stir and saute till you see some oil releasing from the sides.
food.step13: Then add the sliced capsicum (bell pepper). Stir and saute for 5 to 6 minutes on a low flame
food.ingredient 2: 3 to 4 dry red chilies - broken and deseeded if preferred
food.ingredient 9: 1 medium to large capsicum - thinly sliced or julienned (red or green or yellow - bell pepper)
food.ingredient 10: 2 medium to large tomatoes - pureed or about ¾ cup tomato puree (use tomatoes which are ripe, red and not too tangy)
food.ingredient 13: 1 teaspoon crushed kasuri methi (dry fenugreek leaves)
food.ingredient 15: 1 to 2 tablespoon chopped coriander leaves (cilantro leaves)
food.description: Kadai mushroom is cooked button mushrooms in a semi dry gravy of spiced and tangy tomato sauce along with juliennes of green bell pepper.

food.step 1: Heat a pan or kadai. Take all the whole spices mentioned under the "whole spices for kadai masala' list in the pan.
food.step 2: Dry roast all the whole spices on a low flame till they become aromatic. Stir them often while roasting.
food.step 3: Once the spices cool down, add them to a grinder jar or a spice or coffee grinder. Grind to a fine powder.
food.step 4: Remove in a plate and keep the kadai masala aside.
food.step 5: Switch on the instant pot. Press the sauté button for 15 to 20 minutes on the normal mode. Add oil in the steel insert of the instant pot.
food.step6: When the oil becomes hot, add the chopped onions. Saute stirring often, till the onions soften and become translucent
food.step8: Mix and sauté for 3 to 4 seconds.
food.step9: Mix very well and deglaze the pot. Scrap any stuck bits of ingredients from the bottom of the pot. The moisture from the mushrooms help in deglazing.
food.step10: Sauté for about 3 minutes.
food.step11: Add turmeric powder and salt as required. Mix again well.
food.step12: Add ½ cup water. Deglaze if required.
food.step13: Press cancel and press the pressure cook or manual button. Set the timer to pressure cook for 3 minutes on high pressure.
food.ingredient 3: 1 inch cinnamon - use true cinnamon and not cassia cinnamon
food.ingredient 5: 3 to 4 dry kashmiri red chilies or 2 to 3 dry red chilies - broken and seeds removed
food.ingredient 7: ⅓ cup chopped onions or 1 medium-sized onion or 50 grams onion
food.ingredient 8: ½ teaspoon garlic paste or 4 to 5 medium garlic cloves crushed in mortar pestle
food.ingredient 9: 1 teaspoon finely chopped ginger or 1-inch ginger
food.ingredient 10: 1 green chilli or serrano pepper - slit
food.ingredient 11: 1 cup finely chopped tomatoes or 2 medium to large tomatoes or 150 grams tomatoes
food.ingredient 12: 200 to 250 grams white button mushrooms - sliced or chopped
food.ingredient 15: ½ cup thinly sliced capsicum or 1 small to medium capsicum (green bell pepper)
food.ingredient 17: ½ inch ginger - julienne, for garnish
food.description: In this delicious instant pot kadai mushroom gravy, white button mushrooms & bell peppers are cooked in a spiced onion-tomato based gravy in the instant pot.

food.recipe: Wash arhar dal thoroughly and soak for half an hour prior cooking. Take dal, 2 cup water, salt and turmeric powder in a pressure cooker and place it on flame for cooking. After it simmers once, reduce the flame and cook for 2 minutes. Now turn off the flame and open the lid once all steam escapes.
food.step 1: ake toor dal in a bowl, add sufficient water and soak for 3-4 hours. Drain, boil and transfer into another bowl.
food.step 2: Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, green chillies, asafoetida and ginger, mix well and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step 3: Add raw mango, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add 1 tbsp coriander leaves, turmeric powder and red chilli powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add burnt garlic and fried onions, mix well and saute till oil separates
food.step 4: Add cooked dal and mix well. Add salt and churn with a churner. Add remaining coriander leaves, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with fried onions and coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.
food.ingredients: Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal) 1 cup
food.ingredient 9: Fresh coriander leaves 2 tablespoons chopped + for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Beeji Ki Rasoi","Chaap Ki Chhap","Sukoon Ki Chai","Maa Ki Khichdi","Mummy Ki Rasoi","Ghar Ki Baat","Vishnuji Ki Rasoi"]
food.description: Arhar dal prepared with raw tarty mango is very different and scrumptious in taste. Raw mangoes are available in market before Holi festival. This tarty dal recipe can be prepared during this time.

food.recipe: I made a side carrot- cucumber salad, pomegranate raita, rava kesari and this black peas curry with steamed rice. This curry is made with black peas. These are different from black chickpeas or black gram.
food.step 1: Rinse and soak the dry black peas overnight in enough water.
food.step 2: Pressure cook the peas till they are completely cooked.
food.step 3: Reserve two cups of the peas stock.
food.step 4: Heat oil in a frying pan.
food.step 5: Fry the cloves, black pepper and coriander till they splutter and become aromatic.
food.step6: Add the grated coconut and saute till the coconut gets browned.
food.step7: Take care not to burn the coconut.
food.step8: Keep on stirring while sauting the coconut to ensure even browning.
food.step9: Let this mixture cool. Add this mixture along with 1/2 tbsp of the cooked black peas in a grinder.
food.step10: Add 1/2 or 3/4 cup water and grind to a smooth paste.
food.step11: In the same pressure cooker or in another pan, mix the peas, the coconut paste, the 2 cups of reserved stock, chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt and keep to simmer on a medium to high flame.
food.step12: When the curry comes to a boil, then lower the flame and simmer for 15-18 minutes till all the flavors are well blended in the curry.
food.step13: If the kala vatana curry looks dry then you can add some water while simmering.
food.ingredients: ¾ cup dry black peas (kala vatana)
food.ingredient 4: ½ teaspoon red chili powder (lal mirch powder)
food.ingredient 5: ¾ to 1 teaspoon garam masala powder or goda masala or malvani masala
food.description: Kala vatana amti is a no onion no garlic coconut based black peas curry

food.recipe: Use garam masala powder And add fennel seeds, mace, dagad phool, star anise, nag keshar (optional), poppy seeds, red chillies, trifal (optional) while frying the masala ingredients.
food.step 1: Start the previous night before. Pick and clean the black peas. Wash the peas in running water for 3-4 times. Soak the peas in water for a nice 8-10 hours. You could also use sprouted black peas.
food.step 2: The next day, discard the water from the soaked peas.
food.step 3: And boil them with salt plus 3 cups water in a pressure cooker for 10-12 mins till they are completely cooked. Drain the cooked peas in a strainer and keep the broth.
food.step 4: Now on a griddle or tava heat up 1 tsp oil. Add half of the onion slices and fry till they become a light brown.
food.step 5: Fry the onions till light brown.
food.step6: Add the chopped garlic and ginger and fry for a minute.
food.step7: Add the grated fresh or dessicated coconut and fry for a minute
food.step8: Fry the entire masala till it becomes golden. Fry on a low flame and keep on stirring in between so that the masala does not stick to the tava.
food.step9: Let the masala cool. In a grinder get the fried masala ingredients,
food.step10: Add 2-3 tbsp of the boiled black peas to it.
food.step11: And grind with 1/2 cup of water. Add more water if required. Grind to a smooth paste.
food.step12: In another deep bottomed pan, now heat 2 tbsp oil. Fry the chopped onions till transparent.
food.step13: Add turmeric powder and malvani masala.
food.ingredient 2: 1 large onion (half sliced for the masala paste and half chopped for the sambar)
food.ingredient 3: 2 cups grated coconut or 2 cups dessicated coconut
food.ingredient 4: 2 dry red chillies ( the malvani masala i have does not have red chillies it, hence i added these)
food.ingredient 10: leaves a few coriander for garnishing
food.ingredient 11: 2 tbsp oil + 1 tsp oil for frying the masala
food.description: A traditional Malvani black peas recipe also known as kala vatana rassa or kala vatana sambar

food.recipe: Kanda poha is a popular Maharashtrian breakfast recipe made from red or white flattened rice, onions, herbs and spices
food.step 1: Rinse the poha in water till they soften.
food.step 2: They should loose their crunchiness and when you break them between your finger, they should easily get crushed or mashed.
food.step 3: Now add sugar, salt and turmeric powder to the poha and gently mix.
food.step 4: Dry roast the peanuts in a pan till they become crunchy.
food.step 5: Heat oil in the same pan.
food.step6: Crackle the mustard seeds first.
food.step7: Then add onions and saute them till they become translucent.
food.step8: Add curry leaves and green chilies. Saute for half a minute
food.step9: Add the roasted peanuts and stir.
food.step10: Add the poha and stir.
food.step11: Cover and steam the poha for 2-3 minutes on a low flame.
food.step12: When cooking check after 1 or 1.5 minutes and give a stir again.
food.step13: Switch off the fire and let the kanda poha remain covered for 1-2 minutes.
food.ingredients: 1.5 cups thick poha - red or white beaten rice or flattened rice
food.restaurants: ["Pohewala","hotel shivam swad","aram","girgaon katta","mee marathi","prathna hotel","chai pe charcha"]
food.description: Poha is a popular Maharashtrian breakfast recipe made from red or white flattened rice, herbs and spices. The popular variation of poha recipes are made by including either potato or onion or both potatoes and onion.

food.recipe: Now a days this is made with many a different stuffing. Whatever be the stuffing, follow the light roasting method as described by me for perfectly crisp baida rotis. This way the rotis will be cooked well inside out and tastes much better too.
food.step 1: Knead a smooth dough out of all the ingredients mentioned. Cover and keep aside for 15 minutes. Meanwhile heat oil in a kadai or a wok.
food.step 3: Heat a griddle or a pan. Divide the dough into equal sized balls little bigger than the usual chapatis. Roll them as usual. Now comes the interesting part of roasting it a bit on both the sides just until some brown spots are seen.
food.step 4: Make sure the griddle is hot but on a low heat only when you roast it. Do the same for all and do not over roast them. They should be soft. Now place full of the stuffing on each. Add beaten egg.
food.step 5: Then add chopped raw onions on top followed by finely chopped coriander leaves. Fold as an envelope or a parcel and shallow fry them on both the sides on a low flame until crisp. After folding, just brush a little beaten egg on it to secure it nicely. This will take about 5 minutes for each to get done.
food.step6: Serve them hot with salad alongside.
food.ingredient 12: 3 cups (FOR THE ROTI DOUGH) Wheat flou
food.description: A crispy shallow fried paratha with keema stuffing makes for an excellent breakfast idea and a brunch too

food.recipe: This Keto Lasagna Bake ditches the noodles, and it’s so simple, you’ll wonder why you didn’t try it sooner. Sometimes simple is best, and that’s exactly what this recipe is!
food.step 1: Boil sufficient water in a deep pan, add salt and chicken breasts, cook on medium heat for 5-6 minutes. Remove the chicken and transfer on to a plate.
food.step 2: Shred the chicken breasts with 2 forks. Set aside.
food.step 3: Thinly slice green zucchini and yellow zucchini using a slicer. Sprinkle some salt and black pepper powder and mix gently. Set aside for 5-10 minutes to marinate.
food.step 4: Take tomatoes in a blender jar and blend into a fine puree
food.step 5: Heat butter in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté till golden brown. Add the freshly prepared tomato puree, salt, sugar and mix well. Tear and add fresh basil leaves and paprika powder, mix well, cover and cook for 6-8 minutes. Take the pan off the heat and let it cool slightly.
food.step6: Preheat the oven at 180˚C
food.step7: Spread a little sauce at the bottom of a glass casserole. Arrange a layer of green and yellow zucchini slices and top up with a portion of the shredded chicken.
food.step8: Spread some sauce and repeat these layers till all the zucchini slices, chicken and sauce is used up.
food.step9: Sprinkle mozzarella cheese and processed cheese to cover the entire surface. Keep the casserole in the preheated oven and bake for 6-8 minutes.
food.step10: Garnish with parsley sprig and serve hot.
food.ingredient 14: Fresh curly parsley sprig for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Smoke House Deli","Coffee Culture","All Elements","Bombay Salad Co","Birdsong - The Organic Cafe","3 Wise Monkeys","Farmer's Cafe","Keto Culture","Raasta"]4
food.description: This lasagna uses a simple noodle replacement that once it's covered in meat and cheese, feels just like pasta. It's the comforting dish you no longer have to crave.

food.recipe: Khakhra is a thin whole wheat cracker that is popular in Gujarat and Rajasthan and is popularly eaten as a snack.
food.step 1: Add flour, kasuri methi, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, hing and 2 tbsp oil in a bowl and mix with fingers.
food.step 2: Add water little by little and knead to make a medium soft dough.
food.step 3: Cover the dough and keep aside for 20 minutes.
food.step 4: Divide the dough into 20-22 equal balls.
food.step 5: Dust the balls with dry flour and roll into a thin 5 inch circle.
food.step6: Make the circle as thin as possible without tearing the dough.
food.step7: Heat a griddle.
food.step8: Put the khakra on the griddle.
food.step9: Simmer the heat to low.
food.step10: Press the khakra with a cotton cloth and cook till brown spots appear.
food.step11: Flip on the other side and keep pressing with cloth.
food.step12: Apply 1/2 tsp oil on both the sides and cook till the khakhra is crisp
food.step13: Keep flipping sides while cooking
food.restaurants: ["brijwasi sweets","Neelkanth Sweets & Namkeen","Hasmukh Sweets","Shree Ram","Avarya","Thepla House by Tejal's Kitchen","Tewari Bros. Mithaiwala","Bikaji","Madhuram Sweets and Farsan House","Morbiwala","Purshottam Kandoi Haribhai Damodar Mithaiwala"]
food.description: Crisp and thin, Methi Khakhra is popularly made in Gujarati and rajsthan households. Make it and you will surely get addicted to this snack. Here is how to make it.

food.recipe: It is soft and fluffy, mildly tangy-sweet and a great snack any time of the day. This is also an instant khaman dhokla recipe
food.step 1: Grease a steamer pan with 1/4 to 1/2 tsp oil.
food.step 2: Take 1.5 cups besan or gram flour in a mixing bowl or pan
food.step 3: Add 2 to 3 pinches of turmeric powder, a generous pinch of asafoetida, 1 tsp lime juice and 3 tsp ginger-green chilies paste and salt.
food.step 4: Add 1 cup water or as required to make thick yet flowing water. The amount of water required depends on the quality of flour, so add as required.
food.step 5: Stir and then add 1 tbsp rava or sooji.
food.step6: Stir to a smooth thick batter without any lumps.
food.step7: The batter should be thick yet flowing. A quick tip is that if the batter become thin, then add 1 to 2 tbsp more sooji or rava or besan.
food.step8: Also bring to a boil 2 to 3 cups of water in a steamer pan or electric cooker or pressure cooker.
food.step9: The amount of water to be added depends on the size of the steamer or pressure cooker.
food.step10: Then add 2 tsp eno or fruit salt.
food.step11: Stir briskly and quickly. The fruit salt should be mixed evenly with the batter. Or else you get uneven texture in the dhokla.
food.step12: The batter would froth and become bubbly, so you have to be quick
food.step13: Here's the dhokla batter ready to be steamed.
food.ingredient 3: 3 teaspoon ginger-green chilies paste, 1 inch ginger + 1 or 2 green chilies crushed in a mortar-pestle
food.ingredient 6: 2 teaspoon eno or fruit salt ½ to ¾ teaspoon baking soda
food.ingredient 9: 1 cup water or add as required- the amount of water required depends on the quality of gram flour. so add as required to make a thick yet flowing batter.

food.description: Khaman dhokla or khaman as its called is a savory steamed cake made from gram flour.

food.recipe: he main ingredients for khichda are lentils, mutton and spices. khichda has more cereals ,pulses and spices than haleem.As per delhi based historian Sohail Hashmi, khichda originated in North Indian city of Lucknow,while building the old Imambara of lucknow.
food.step 1: Heat a handi. Finely chop onions. Add ghee to the handi and when it melts, add caraway seeds, green cardamoms, black cardamom, cloves, black peppercorns, bay leaf and cinnamon stick, mix well and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 2: Add onion and sauté till it turns golden brown. Add ginger-garlic-green chilli paste and sauté well.
food.step 3: Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder and coriander powder and mix well. Add 2-3 tbsps water, mix well and sauté for 2 minutes.
food.step 4: Add yogurt, mix well and saute on low heat for 1 minute. Add mutton and mix well.
food.step 5: Add whole wheat, jau, broken wheat, split skinless green gram, split red lentils, split pigeon peas, split Bengal gram and split skinless black gram and mix well.
food.step6: Add salt and crushed fried onions and mix well for 2-3 minutes. Add 5-6 cups water and mix well. cook on low heat for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally.
food.step7: Remove the cooked mutton pieces from the khichda and into a bowl. Blend the mixture with a electric hand blender to a coarse paste.
food.step8: Add the cooked mutton pieces and mix. Add garam masala powder and coriander leaves and mint leaves
food.step9: Transfer into serving bowls, garnish each bowl with fried onions, drizzle chilli oil and garnish with a mint sprig and a lemon wedge. Serve hot.
food.ingredients: Boneless mutton cut into small pieces 500 grams
food.ingredient 17: Whole wheat soaked overnight and drained 1/2 cup
food.ingredient 18: Barley (jau), soaked overnight and drained 1/2 cup
food.ingredient 19: Broken wheat (dalia/lapsi) soaked overnight and drained 1/2 cup
food.ingredient 20: Split skinless green gram (Moong dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 21: Split red lentil (dhuli masoor dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 22: Split pigeon pea (dhuli tuvar dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 23: Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup

food.recipe: Arancini is an Italian dish. This is an easy, quick and delicious appetizer. Arancini is a mixture of rice or say risotto and cheese which are coated with bread crumbs and deep fried. So these are crispy and cheesy.
food.step 1: Place a strainer on a bowl, put the Multigrain Khichdi Mix in it and wash well with water. Place the strainer on another bowl so that excess water drains away.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps ghee in a pressure cooker, add the masala premix that comes with the khichdi mix and sauté for a few seconds or till the cumin seeds turn golden brown.
food.step 3: Add the khichdi mix, mix well and sauté for a few seconds. Add 500 ml water, mix well and allow the mixture to come to a boil. Put the lid on the cooker and cook under pressure till 4-5 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to reduce completely.
food.step 4: Transfer the cooked khichdi onto a plate and allow to cool down. Add coriander leaves and mash the mixture well with your hand.
food.step 5: Divide the mixture into equal portions and stuff each portion with a cheese cube and shape them into balls.
food.step6: Heat sufficient oil in a wok.
food.step7: Take refined slurry in a bowl and spread dried breadcrumbs on a plate. Dip each ball into slurry, coat them with breadcrumbs, slide them into the hot oil and deep-fry till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step8: Put some tomato sauce in each soup spoons, keep one arancini in each spoon. Skew a sprig of fresh parsley on each toothpick and pierce them onto each arancini and serve immediately
food.ingredient 4: Mozzarella cheese cubes cut into ½ inch cubes 50 grams

food.description: It's made from the leftover khichdi... It's healthy and yummy

food.recipe: To prepare kothimbir vadi is very simple. you need to steam the mixture, slice it and then fry the steamed slices. For a low-fat version, you can even skip the frying part and have the steamed vadis. They taste delicious even when not fried. Alternatively you can even temper with some oil, mustard seeds, hing (asafoetida) and curry leaves and then add this tempering on the steamed vadis
food.step 1: Heat 4 cups water in a steamer.
food.step 2: Mix together coriander leaves, green chillies, gram flour, yogurt, salt, turmeric powder and jaggery and ginger-garlic paste in a bowl. Add sufficient water to make a thick batter, ensuring that the consistency is not too thin. Adjust salt.
food.step 3: Grease a thali with little oil. Pour the batter into the greased thali.
food.step 4: Place it in the steamer and steam on high heat for fifteen to twenty minutes or till firm and cooked. Check by inserting a skewer into the wadi and if it comes out clean, then it is cooked. Remove, cool and cut into 1 inch diamonds.
food.step 5: Heat two tablespoons oil in a small non-stick pan and add sesame seeds, asafoetida and mustard seeds and carom seeds. When they splutter add the wadi and two tablespoons scarped coconut. Toss well.
food.step6: For the cheese sauce heat butter in a non-stick pan, add refined flour and sauté for one minute. Add milk and mix well so no lumps are formed.
food.step7: Add cheese and mix well. Add salt, pepper and fresh cream and mix.
food.step8: Transfer kothimbir wadi into a serving plate. Sprinkle some scraped coconut on top and serve immediately with cheese sauce.

food.description: Kothimbir vadi is a delicious savory crisp snack made with gram flour (besan), coriander leaves and spices.

food.recipe: This recipe for kottu roti, a popular Sri Lankan street food, comes from Sanjeewa Gooneratne, who prepares the dish at events around New York on a griddle the size of a sled.
food.step 1: Take refined flour in a large bowl, add salt, 2 tsps oil and sufficient water, mix and knead into a soft dough.
food.step 2: Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Immerse them in a bowl of oil for 5-6 hours.
food.step 3: To make roti, place each dough ball on the worktop and spread the dough with your finger tips to form a thin sheet.
food.step 4: Heat a non-stick tawa, place rotis on it, one at a time, and cook for a few seconds on each side. Stack the rotis one on top of the other, roll and thinly slice them. Cut the slices in half and set aside.
food.step 5: Heat butter and remaining oil in a non-stick pan and let the butter melt. Add onion, leeks and carrot, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step6: Add tomato puree and mix well. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, curry powder, crushed black peppercorns and salt and mix well.
food.step7: Make a well in the centre and break the eggs in it and mix well. Add chicken and gravy and mix well.
food.step8: Add the roti strips and mix well.
food.step9: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and lemon wedge and serve hot.
food.ingredient 8: Carrot medium, cut into thin strips 1
food.restaurants: ["The Bombay Canteen","Hoppumm","Roti Rollers","Roti N","Roti Republiic - Rolling With Love","Roti & Grill","Do Roti Khaatey Raho","Hotel Roti","Khamang - Roti & Paratha"]
food.description: A spicy one-dish vegetarian dinner with curry flavors. Vegetable kottu roti is traditional Sri Lankan street food.

food.recipe: Its also called as Paratwala paratha. in Punjabi “parat” means layer and layers can be seen on the paratha when it gets cooked. Its South Indian counterpart is the Parotta Which is made from all purpose flour and eggs.
food.step 1: In a bowl or vessel take 2 cups whole wheat flour along with salt as per taste.
food.step 2: Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of ghee or oil. next add water as required in parts.
food.step 3: Knead the whole wheat flour with water to a smooth dough. Cover and keep aside for 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step 4: Later make medium sized balls from the dough. Cover the bowl or the pan with a napkin or lid.
food.step 5: Take a dough ball. Roll it into 6 to 7 inches diameter disc on a dusted rolling board.
food.step6: Apply ghee or oil liberally on the paratha disc. Sprinkle some flour on the top.
food.step7: From the edges start to fold & pleat the paratha till the end.
food.step8: Roll the pleated edges tightly. Join the edges.
food.step9: Lightly dust with flour and now roll into round parathas of about 4 to 5 inches in diameter.
food.step10: Heat the tava or griddle. The tava should be hot. Place the paratha on the tava.
food.step11: Turn the paratha when one side is partly cooked. Apply ghee on this side. Cook for a minute.
food.step12: Now turn again and apply ghee on the other side.
food.step13: Flip again for a couple of times, till the parathas are browned evenly and well cooked. Press the sides with the spatula while frying the parathas.
food.ingredient 5: ghee or oil as required for applying on the dough as well as roasting
food.restaurants: ["Pratap The Dhaba","Dum & Curry","Masala Library","Tanatan","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Butter Chicken Factory","Paratha World","Curry Me Up","90 Ft Above","Chenab","Royale Masterchef Finedine and Bar","Chakh Le The Street Food","Khyber","Biryani Hazir Ho","The Goose & Gridiron"]
food.description: Lachha Paratha or Lachedar Paratha is a popular flatbread from all over India, made from whole wheat flour.

food.recipe: The dal amritsari is made from two lentils – whole black gram (sabut urad dal) and spilt bengal gram (chana dal). There are no spice powders or spices added to the dal. A dal bursting with simple rustic flavors and subtle sweetness.
food.step 1: Wash whole black gram and Bengal gram separately 2-3 times and soak with sufficient water for 6-8 hours.
food.step 2: Transfer whole black gram and Bengal gram into a pressure cooker, add ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chilli powder and salt and mix well. Cover with a lid and cook under pressure till 6-7 whistles are given out.
food.step 3: Meanwhile, slice onion. Break and put green chillies in a mortar, add garlic cloves and ginger into a mortar and pound to a coarse paste with the pestle.
food.step 4: Heat ghee in a deep pan, add cumin seeds and let them change colour. Add onions, mix and sauté till golden. Add pounded paste, mix and sauté for 1 minute or till raw smells disappear.
food.step 5: Add tomatoes and mix. Add remaining turmeric powder, remaining red chilli powder, coriander powder and garam masala powder, mix well and sauté for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Add 1½ cups water, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes.
food.step6: Open the cooker once the pressure has reduced completely and transfer the gram mixture into the pan and mix well. Adjust salt and mash the grams with a wooden churner. Add coriander leaves, mix and take the pan off the heat.
food.step7: Transfer the dal into serving bowl and drizzle ghee on top. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
food.description: This dal is called as amritsari dal as its quite a popular dal made and served by a Dhaba (roadside eatery) outside the golden temple in amritsar, Punjab.

food.recipe: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and garlic and season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook until onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in lemon zest and remove from heat.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 180º C.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté for a minute. Add onion and sauté till it turns translucent.
food.step 3: Add tomatoes, mix and sauté till they turn soft and pulpy. Add tomato puree and mix well. Reduce heat and cook for three to four minutes.
food.step 4: Combine three tablespoons of cheddar cheese, three tablespoons of mozzarella cheese and cream cheese in a bowl. Add chicken, salt, half teaspoon of red chilli flakes and half teaspoon oregano and mix well.
food.step 5: Halve the lasagna sheets lengthwise and place them on a plate. Put a portion of the cheese mixture at one end of each sheet and roll tightly.
food.step6: Add tomato ketchup, salt, remaining red chilli flakes, pepper powder and remaining oregano to the pan and mix well. Add little water, mix well and cook for two minutes. Add the parsley and mix well. Switch off heat.
food.step7: Place the lasagna rolls in a baking dish. Pour the sauce over, top with the remaining mozzarella cheese and cheddar cheese and place the dish in the preheated oven. Bake for five to ten minutes or till the cheese melts
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Classic lasagna, as much as we adore it, can be extremely time-consuming. These roll-ups come together in no time and couldn't be more delicious

food.recipe: Sounds Weird, but its true it's a curry served as side dish. You might have heard of garlic chutney many times but not the sabzi
food.step 1: Heat 2 tbsps mustard oil in a non-stick pan until it begins to smoke. Add garlic cloves and sauté till golden brown. Take it off the flame and keep aside.
food.step 2: Heat remaining mustard oil in another non-stick pan until it begins to smoke. Add cumin seeds and let them change colour. Add onion, mix and sauté till translucent. Add tomato, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add green chilli, mix and saute till tomatoes are soft.
food.step 3: Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, mix well and saute for 1 minute. Add ¼ cup water, mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.
food.step 4: Add the sautéed garlic, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
food.ingredient 11: Fresh coriander leaves chopped for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Beeji Ki Rasoi","Chaap Ki Chhap","Sukoon Ki Chai","Neel Ki Biryani","Maa Ki Khichdi"]
food.description: if you are a garlic fan then you will love to eat your roti's with this curry alone.

food.recipe: The taste of this Maharashtrian kadhi is slightly sweet due to the addition of sugar. You can use either fresh or sour yogurt. The tempering of curry leaves, asafoetida/hing, mustard and cumin perk up the kadhi.
food.step 1: Mix together curd, water and gram flour in a bowl.
food.step 2: Using a wired whisk, mix the batter so well so that no lumps are there
food.step 3: Heat ghee or oil in a pan. Add the mustard and let them crackle
food.step 4: Then add the cumin. Stir and add the green chilies, ginger and curry leaves.
food.step 5: Saute for a few seconds. Add the turmeric powder and asafoetida.
food.step6: Stir and then add the yogurt+water+gram flour mixture. Season with salt and sugar. Stir very well.
food.step7: Let the kadhi come to a gentle simmer.
food.step8: Continue to simmer till the kadhi becomes slightly thick. Stir at intervals.
food.step9: If you cook more it will become more thick. So depending on the consistency you prefer, you can simmer the kadhi accordingly.
food.step10: Check the taste and then add more salt or sugar if required.
food.step11: Lastly, garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
food.step12: Serve the maharashtrian kadhi hot with steamed rice or mung dal khichdi topped with a bit of ghee along with papad and pickle.
food.ingredients: 1 cup curd (yogurt) - fresh or sour full-fat curd
food.ingredient 2: 2 to 3 tablespoons besan (gram flour or chickpea flour)
food.ingredient 8: ½ inch ginger, made into a paste or minced or grated
food.ingredient 13: ¼ teaspoon sugar or add as required
food.ingredient 14: 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves (cilantro leaves)
food.description: Maharashtrian kadhi is a quick yogurt and gram flour based sauce or kadhi made without pakoras. Tempered with spices and a bit sweet. It is best served with some steamed rice and makes for a simple summer meal.

food.recipe: It has a rich texture of cream and a finely balanced taste of spices as well as dry fruits. So, here’s how to make this one of its kind Chicken Curry recipe at home
food.step 1: Heat oil and 1 tbsp ghee in a pressure cooker, add 4-5 green cardamoms, broken green chillies, onion, melon seeds, cashewnuts and garlic cloves and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 2: Add 1 cup water and cover the cooker. Cook till 3-4 whistles are released.
food.step 3: Allow the pressure to reduce completely. Open the cooker and blend the mixture with a hand blender till smooth
food.step 4: To make the gravy, heat remaining ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add remaining green cardamoms and sauté for 1 minute. Add chicken and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes
food.step 5: Strain the blended mixture into the pan and mix well. Add yogurt and adjust salt, mix well, cover and cook for 12-15 minutes or till the chicken is cooked completely.
food.step6: Add green cardamom powder and crushed black peppercorns and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes and take the pan off the heat
food.step7: Transfer into a serving bowl and drizzle fresh cream on top. Garnish with micro green and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Chicken leg boneless cut into 1 inch cubes 500 grams
food.restaurants: ["Pritam Da Dhaba","Gomantak","Angrezi Dhaba","Copper Chimney","Persian Darbar","Lucky Restaurant","Gulshan-e-Iran","Butter Chicken Factory","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Faham Restaurant & Lounge","Khyber","Hitchki","Light Of Bharat"]
food.description: Malai Chicken or Murgh Malaiwala is easy to make yet very delicious preparation of chicken

food.recipe: This mango falooda is kind of death by mangoes as one of my friends pointed out, or you can also say mango heaven. Mango puree, chopped mangoes and mango ice cream all go into it. The rose syrup, milk and Sabja seeds give a lovely cooling touch. This is a very simple recipe without the addition of mango custard and mango jelly. Though if you want, you can add both mango custard and jelly.
food.step 1: First soak 2 tsp sabja seeds (sweet basil seeds) in 3/4 cup water for about 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step 2: Later strain them with a tea strainer and keep aside.
food.step 3: Then prepare the falooda sev according to package instructions.
food.step 4: If you need to cook them then do boil them in water till they are cooked completely & softened.
food.step 5: Rinse the cooked falooda sev in water and then drain them. Keep aside covered. allow them to cool completely at room temperature
food.step6: In serving glasses, first add 1 tbsp rose syrup.
food.step7: Then add 2 tsp sabja seeds/sweet basil seeds.
food.step8: Next add 2 to 3 tsp falooda sev.
food.step9: Add 3 tbsp mango puree.
food.step10: Add 1/4 to 1/3 cup milk.
food.step11: Repeat the layers again.
food.step12: Add 1/3 to 1/2 cup milk.
food.step13: Add chopped mangoes.
food.ingredients: 2 teaspoon sabja seeds (sweet basil seeds) - soaked in ¾ cup water
food.ingredient 2: 3 tablespoon falooda sev cooked as per package instructions
food.ingredient 4: ½ to ⅔ cup mango puree or two medium sized mangoes blended to a smooth puree in a blender
food.ingredient 6: 1 tablespoon chopped or sliced pistachios - or a mix of chopped dry fruits
food.ingredient 7: 3 to 4 scoops of mango ice cream or vanilla ice cream (optional)
food.ingredient 8: 1 medium sized mango, peeled and chopped in small cubes
food.restaurants: ["Mangoes Mumbai","shahi durbar","baba falooda","badshah cold drinks","haji ali juice centre","fruitozza","blue bunny ice cream"]
food.description: Mango Faluda is a quick, easy and delicious dessert drink made with fresh mango puree, chopped mangoes and mango ice cream. A tasty summer Indian dessert full of mango flavors

food.recipe: Peel 3 to 4 medium sized mangoes and chop them. About 2 cups chopped mangoes. Add the chopped mangoes in a blender or mixer. Add 4 to 5 tbsp sugar or honey. The addition of sugar and honey can be skipped if you want or you can add as per your taste.
food.step 1: Peel the mangoes and chop them.
food.step 2: In a blender or mixer, puree the mangoes with sugar or honey and cardamom powder or saffron or rose water.
food.step 3: Now add the chilled curd (yogurt) and cream.
food.step 4: Add some ice cubes.
food.step 5: Blend for some seconds till the everything is mixed well and the yogurt has become smooth.
food.step6: Pour in glasses and serve garnished with mint leaves or cubes of mango
food.step7: If you want a slightly thin consistency, then add some milk to the mango lassi while blending.
food.ingredients: 2 cups of fresh chopped mango pieces, about 3 to 4 medium sized mangoes. i used alphonso mangoes, but you could use any good variety of mango. you could also use mango pulp.
food.ingredient 2: 2 cups chilled full fat fresh curd (yogurt)
food.ingredient 3: 2 to 3 tablespoon cream, 25% to 30% fat or malai - optional
food.ingredient 4: ½ teaspoon cardamom powder or ½ tablespoon rose water or a pinch of saffron strands
food.ingredient 5: 4 to 5 tablespoon sugar or honey or add as required. this also can be skipped if the mangoes are very sweet
food.ingredient 6: few mint leaves for garnish or mango cubes or sliced dry fruits
food.restaurants: ["Prithvi Cafe","prithivi cafe","go gully","k rustom ice cream","oye kake'","soam","vinay health home","kailash mandir lassi and sweets"]

food.recipe: I have had mango mastani and sitaphal (custard apple) mastani at one of the outlets of the famous sujata mastani in Pune. Mastani drink is available in a variety of flavors like chocolate mastani, dry fruits mastani, kesar pista, pineapple, vanilla, orange, rose etc.
food.step 1: Slice a few dry fruits like pistachios, almonds and cashews. Keep them aside with 4 to 5 glazed cherries.
food.step 2: Peel, chop 3 large mangoes and add them to the blender.
food.step 3: Reserve a few chopped mangoes aside for topping the mastani drink later.
food.step 4: Add 2 to 3 tbsp sugar. Add 1.5 cups full cream milk.
food.step 5: Blend to a smooth thick milkshake. Taste and if the sugar is less, then you can add more. If the mangoes are very sweet, you can completely skip the sugar.
food.step6: Pour this thick mango milkshake in glasses till you have enough space at top for ice cream scoops.
food.step7: Place one or two vanilla or mango ice cream scoops.
food.step8: Top with the sliced dry fruits and chopped mangoes. Garnish with the glazed cherries.
food.step10: 6 to 7 pistachios sliced or chopped
food.ingredients: 3 large mangoes or 700 to 750 grams alphonso mangoes or kesar mangoes or 3 to 3.5 cups chopped mangoes or 3 to 3.5 cups thick mango puree or pulp
food.ingredient 2: 1.5 cups full cream chilled milk or 375 ml
food.ingredient 3: 2 to 3 tablespoon sugar or add as required
food.ingredient 7: 4 to 8 scoops of vanilla ice cream or mango ice cream
food.restaurants: ["Prithvi Cafe","prithivi cafe","go gully","k rustom ice cream","oye kake'","soam","vinay health home","kailash mandir lassi and sweets"]
food.description: Mango mastani is a popular dessert drink from Pune. Thick mango milkshake topped with vanilla or mango ice cream.

food.recipe: These modaks are prepared with fresh mango pulp, khoya (evaporated milk solids), sugar and flavored with cardamom powder. These modaks are delicious, rich, melt in the mouth and with a lovely taste of mangoes.
food.step 1: Rinse and then peel mangoes. Chop them.
food.step 2: Add the chopped mangoes in a blender jar. Blend to a smooth pulp.
food.step 3: Crumble or grate khoya and place aside.
food.step 4: Grease the modak moulds with little ghee and place aside.
food.step 5: Heat a pan. Keep the flame to low and add 1 cup of grated or crumbled khoya.
food.step6: Keep stirring the khoya on low flame for 1 to 2 minutes, till the khoya melts.
food.step7: At this stage add ¼ cup sugar in the mawa mixture. You can add less or more sugar or as desired.
food.step8: Continuously keep stirring this mixture for a minute or two, till sugar dissolves. The mixture will get a molten consistency.
food.step9: Now add the mango puree. Stir and mix very well.
food.step10: Keep stirring the mixture for 6 to 8 minutes on low to medium flame till it thickens and reduces
food.step11: Add a generous pinch of saffron strands (kesar) along with ¼ teaspoon cardamom powder (choti elaichi)
food.step12: Keep stirring the mixture continuously for another 5 to 6 minutes on low flame
food.step13: Soon the color and texture of the modak mixture will change.
food.ingredients: 1 cup grated or crumbled khoya, mawa or evaporated milk solids
food.ingredient 2: ¼ cup sugar or add as required
food.ingredient 3: ½ cup canned mango pulp or 2 medium sized mangoes, pureed - you can use any sweet and fleshy mangoes
food.ingredient 6: 1 teaspoon ghee or oil, or as required for greasing the moulds
food.description: Mango modak is a delicious modak variety prepared with fresh mango pulp and khoya (mawa or evaporated milk solids).

food.recipe: For the best margherita pizza, you will want to preheat your oven to the highest temperature possible. For my oven, that is 550 degrees Fahrenheit. I allow my baking stone to preheat for at least 30 minutes (regardless of whether my oven is ready as it takes time for your baking stone to come to temperature). The higher the temperature the better.
food.step 1: Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan.
food.step 2: Take fresh yeast and sugar in a bowl, add ¼ cup water, mix well and set aside to activate.
food.step 3: Add garlic to the pan and sauté till fragrant, add tomato puree and mix well. Add salt, mix well and cook till the raw smell of tomatoes disappears and oil separates.
food.step 4: To make the pizza dough, add refined flour and olive oil to the yeast mixture and knead to a soft dough, adding water as required. Cover the bowl with cling wrap and set aside in a warm place till it doubles in size.
food.step 5: Add castor sugar to the pan. Chop the basil leaves and add to the pan. Add tomato ketchup, mix well and cook for 1 minute. Switch off the heat and set aside to cool.
food.step6: Pre-heat the oven to 180˚C
food.step7: Divide the dough into two equal portions and shape them into balls. Dust the worktop with some polenta and some refined flour. Keep one ball on it and roll out into a thick disc.
food.step8: Grease a baking tray with some oil and transfer the rolled out pizza base on it. Dork the pizza dough with a fork. Keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 5-7 minutes.
food.step9: Bring the tray out of the oven and brush the base with a little olive oil. Spread the pizza sauce evenly all over the base.
food.step10: Spread a generous layer of mozzarella cheese. Tear a few basil leaves and sprinkle all over the top. Sprinkle some salt and mixed herbs. Keep the tray back in the hot oven and bake at 180˚C for 15 minutes.
food.step11: Bring the tray out of the oven, cut the pizza into wedges, arrange them on a serving plate and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["Pizza By The Bay","Jamie's Pizzeria by Jamie Oliver","Mia Cucina","Smoke House Deli","Joey's Pizza","Cafe Monza","Jamjar Diner","PizzaExpress","Quattro Ristorante","Bruciato Food Factory","Mezzo Mezzo - JW Marriott Mumbai Juhu"]
food.description: This margherita pizza recipe begins with my homemade pizza dough. Top with fresh mozzarella and tomatoes, then finish it off with garden-fresh basil. This is an easy pizza recipe with unbeatable flavor!

food.recipe: The spices used in a masale bhat is a special blend called goda masala. now this masala gives a unique flavor and aroma to any dish that it is added in…. And so is the case with this masale bhaat.
food.step 1: Rinse and soak the rice for 30 minutes in enough water.
food.step 2: Rinse and chop all the veggies.
food.step 3: Heat oil in pan. add the mustard seeds and bay leaf or curry leaves.
food.step 4: Let the mustard seeds crackle.
food.step 5: Then add the all the chopped veggies - carrots, cauliflower, capsicum, aubergines and tomatoes or yogurt.
food.step6: Saute the veggies for 3 to 4 minutes stirring often.
food.step7: Meanwhile heat 2.5 cups water and bring it to a boil
food.step8: Add the red chili powder, goda masala, asafoetida to the sauteed veggies. Stir and saute for a minute.
food.step9: Then add the rice and saute for a minute.
food.step10: Add the hot water and stir well.
food.step11: Season with salt. check the taste of the water. If required add more salt.
food.step12: Cover the pan and simmer the rice on a low flame till the grains are softened and cooked well.
food.step13: Do check once or twice when the rice is cooking, by opening the lid.
food.ingredients: 1 cup regular rice or long grained rice
food.ingredient 5: 1 small to medium capsicum (green bell pepper
food.ingredient 7: 1 small to medium tomato or 2 tablespoon yogurt (curd)
food.ingredient 8: 1 tej patta (indian bay leaf) or 7 to 8 curry leaves
food.ingredient 9: 3 to 4 teaspoon goda masala (kala masala) - (recipe for a small batch given in the notes section)
food.ingredient 10: ½ teaspoon kashmiri red chili powder
food.description: Masala bhat is a spicy and aromatic one-pot traditional rice recipe with veggies from the Maharashtrian cuisine.

food.recipe: The secret of this pomfret fish fry depends on the marinade.This marinade has coconut, fennel seeds, peppercorns, onion, tomato, garlic, and spice powders.
food.step 1: In a blender mix together ginger, garluic, oil, turmeric, red chilli and lemon juice.
food.step 2: Masala is ready.
food.step 3: Make gashes in the pomfret and apply the masala. Marinate it for 15 minutes.
food.step 4: Coat it in semolina from both sides and shallow fry till golden.
food.step 5: Serve with warm cabbage and kiwi salad.
food.step6: In a pan add oil, mustard seeds, red and green chilli, curry leaves. Let them splutter
food.step7: Add spring onions. Saute.
food.step8: Add cabbage. Saute and add salt and pepper.
food.step9: Turn off the heat.
food.step10: Add diced kiwi, vinegar and sugar. Mix well and let it cook in the pan's residual heat.
food.step11: Garnish with grated coconut.
food.step12: Serve with masala fried fish.
food.restaurants: ["Masala Kitchen","Fish Land","Fried Nation","Garam Masala","Masala Kitchen","Masala Library","Gomantak","Masala Bay - Taj Lands End","Masala Station","The Fish Story","Thangabali","Acharekar's Malvan Katta","Angrezi Dhaba"]
food.description: This Spicy Pomfret masala fry is easy to cook, truly delicious with an amazing marinade that makes it wonderfully lip-smacking! The flavors are not only on the surface it is in-depth!

food.recipe: You just need to saute the onions, tomatoes with the herbs and spices. Then add the rice to this mixture. The result is delicious spiced rice which you can have with a raita and mango pickle or a side salad. Boondi raita or cucumber raita goes very well with this spicy rice.
food.step 1: Heat oil. Fry the mustard seeds till they splutter.
food.step 2: Add the cumin and fry till they get browned.
food.step 3: Now add the onion and saute till the onions get softened and become transparent.
food.step 4: Add the curry leaves, green chili and saute for 30 seconds.
food.step 5: Add the tomatoes and saute till the tomatoes become mushy.
food.step6: Now add all the spice powders and asafoetida along with salt. Saute the masala or spice mixture for a minute.
food.step7: Add the rice and stir well so that the masala coats the rice.
food.step8: Saute for 2-3 minutes more continuously stirring the masala rice.
food.step9: Lastly, add coriander leaves and mix with the masala rice or you can garnish the masala rice with the coriander leaves.
food.step10: Serve hot with raita or with a veg salad, pickle and papad.
food.ingredients: 2 cups leftover rice or steamed rice
food.description: Masala rice is a medium hot spicy rice dish made with leftover rice.

food.recipe: The dish is made with pink lentils which are known as Masoor dal in Hindi. Pink lentils are also known as red lentils and orange lentils. Note that these are not Puy lentils.
food.step 1: Drain and put split red lentils into a pressure cooker, add 3 cups of water, salt, turmeric powder and tomato and let the mixture come to a boil. Cover the cooker with the lid and cook under pressure till 2 whistles are given out.
food.step 2: Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan till it begins to smoke. Add cumin seeds and once they change colour, add dried red chillies, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add cooked split red lentil, mix and cook for 2-3 minutes
food.step 3: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Split red lentil (masoor dal) soaked for 20 minutes 1 cup
food.ingredient 8: Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon + for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Beeji Ki Rasoi","Chaap Ki Chhap","Sukoon Ki Chai","Maa Ki Khichdi","Mummy Ki Rasoi","Ghar Ki Baat","Vishnuji Ki Rasoi"]
food.description: Masoor Dal is a popular lentil based dish from the North Indian Cuisine and is often made in Indian homes.

food.recipe: This is a sure shot winner recipe. Its creamy, smooth, delicious and of course healthy too with the methi (fenugreek) and matar (green peas). This was so good, it will even beat the Matar malai served in restaurants.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds and asafoetida and let the seeds change colour. Add green peas, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 2: Add salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder and red chilli powder and mix well.
food.step 3: Add malai and mix well. Add garam masala powder and mix well.
food.step 4: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish generously with malai and serve hot.
food.description: matar malai is a delicious North Indian curry made with fenugreek leaves, peas and cream

food.recipe: These tasty modaks are made with minimal ingredients which is mawa/khoya (evaporated milk solids), sugar and cardamom powder.
food.step 1: Grease the modak moulds with a bit of butter or ghee or oil. Place aside.
food.step 2: Crumble or grate mawa or khoya.
food.step 3: Heat a pan. Keep the flame to a low and add 1.5 cups grated mawa.
food.step 4: Keep stirring on low flame for a minute. The mawa will start melting.
food.step 5: When the mawa begin to melt, add 1/2 cup sugar in the mawa mixture and stir for a minute.
food.step6: Soon the mawa mixture will start releasing fat.
food.step7: Once the mixture starts bubbling, then sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of cardamom powder.
food.step8: The mixture will start thickening. Continuously keep stirring.
food.step9: Keep stirring on low flame until the mixture starts leaving the edges of the pan.
food.step10: Do not overcook as then the modaks will turn out dense.
food.step11: Immediately transfer the mixture in another bowl/dish/thali.
food.step12: Knead the dough gently while its still warm.
food.step13: Make small balls from them while they are still warm.
food.ingredients: 250 grams mawa or 1.5 cups grated mawa (khoya or evaporated milk solids)
food.ingredient 2: ½ cup sugar or add as per taste
food.ingredient 4: 1 teaspoon ghee/oil for greasing the modak moulds
food.description: Mawa modak are quick and tasty modak variety made from mawa/khoya, sugar and cardamom powder.

food.recipe: These doughnuts shaped fritters are made with black gram, herbs, coconut and spices. Even though the main ingredient is urad dal (black gram) but the herbs and spices can vary. You can also add vegetables like onions or grated carrots or grated beetroot.
food.step 1: Soak the urad dal for 4 hours or overnight.
food.step 2: Grind the soaked dal to a smooth batter with little water if required.
food.step 3: If the batter becomes watery, then the instant relief would be to add some semolina or urad dal flour to it. Otherwise also you could add some semolina to the batter.
food.step 4: Add the spices, herbs, onions and salt. Mix well.
food.step 5: Take a bowl of water. Apply some water from the bowl on both your hands. take some batter in your right hand from the bowl. Give it a round shape.
food.step6: With your thumb make a hole in the center. You can also use banana leaves or zip lock bags to give the medu vada its doughnut shape.
food.step7: In a kadai heat oil. Keep the flame to medium.
food.step8: Once the oil becomes hot, slid the vada into the hot oil.
food.step9: Once the vada is slightly golden then gently turn over with a slotted spoon and continue to fry.
food.step10: Fry them till crisp and golden. The oil should be not very hot, but medium hot. You want the vadas to be cooked from inside. Very hot oil will quickly brown the vadas from outside but they will remain uncooked from inside. Less hot oil will make the medu vada to absorb too much oil. Even if the batter is thin then also the medu vadas will absorb too much oil.
food.step11: Fry all the medu vada this way till they become evenly browned and crisp.
food.step12: Drain them on kitchen tissue to remove excess oil.
food.step13: Serve the medhu vadai, hot or warm with sambar and coconut chutney.
food.ingredients: 2 cups urad dal (husked & split black gram)
food.ingredient 3: 1 teaspoon black peppercorns, whole or crushed (optional)
food.ingredient 8: ⅓ cup chopped coconut pieces, optional
food.ingredient 9: few sprigs of coriander leaves, chopped (optional)
food.ingredient 12: some water if needed to grind the batter

food.description: Medu vada are crisp and fried dough nuts made from black grams, herbs, coconut and spices. These urad dal vada are also known as Garelu in Andhra, Uzhunnu Vada in Kerala and Medhu Vadai in Tamil Nadu.

food.recipe: This Mexican rice comes together so easily and quickly in a single pot, which makes for an easy clean-up. You can also throw in your favorite veggies but I kept it simple with onion, corn kernels, peas and carrots. From there, the rice is simmered in tomato sauce and chicken broth, along with some cumin and chili powder for that extra kick of flavor.
food.step 1: Heat stock in a deep non-stick pan.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add rice, onion, garlic and sauté till lightly browned.
food.step 3: Add chipotle in adobo sauce and tomato puree and mix well.
food.step 4: Add carrot, green peas, salt and boiling vegetable stock.
food.step 5: Place coriander on top and cover and cook till the rice is done
food.step6: Discard coriander leaves and add lemon juice and mix well

food.recipe: these Crispy Sesame Honey Noodles Recipe or Darsaan as called in the local language are a delicious option for you.
food.step 1: Toast white and black sesame seeds in a non-stick pan till fragrant. Add honey and mix well.
food.step 2: Add Milkmaid and mix well. Bring it to a boil.
food.step 3: Take noodles on a plate and sprinkle cornflour on top. Mix.
food.step 4: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep-fry cornflour dusted noodles till golden and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step 5: Break fried noodles a little and place on as serving plate. Drizzle prepared Milkmaid mixture on top and serve immediately.

food.step 1: Preheat oven to 200C.
food.step 2: Grease ten 1/3-cup capacity muffin pans with olive oil.
food.step 3: Use a 9cm-diametre round pastry cutter to cut 10 discs from the pastry and use these cut out discs to line the greased pans
food.step8: Pour the egg mixture among the pans and bake for 12-15 minutes or just until the filling has set.
food.step9: Serve.

food.recipe: here are several ways and variations to this spicy misal pav recipe in marathi cuisine. but the common way is to prepare it with moth beans which contribute to the thick gravy or matki usal and thin gravy which is also known as rassa. before serving, both the gravies are mixed as per the taste and preference and topped with besan farsan as a whole dish
food.step 1: firstly, in a large kadai heat 3 tbsp oil and splutter 1 tsp mustard, 1 tsp jeera and few curry leaves
food.step 2: also add ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp chilli powder, 1 tsp coriander powder and 1 tsp garam masala
food.step 3: saute on low flame till spices turn aromatic.
food.step 4: now add in prepared masala paste and saute well.
food.step 5: cook till the oil is released from masala paste.
food.step6: add in cooked matki, small piece jaggery and ½ tsp salt. give a good mix
food.step7: also add 5 cup water and adjust consistency
food.step8: cover and boil for 10 minutes or till misal is cooked completely
food.step9: once the misal is cooked, oil starts to float indicating misal is ready
food.step10: in a serving plate, take matki usal add some farsan over it
food.step11: top with chopped onions and coriander leaves over it
food.step12: also pour ladleful of kat or gravy from sides
food.step13: finally, serve misal with pav and lemon wedges making a complete misal pav recipe
food.restaurants: ["Mamledar Misal","jagtap muneri misal pav","marutirao missalwale","the house of misal","martand misal"]
food.description: Misal pav can be had as a breakfast, snack or as a brunch. Its a delicious and wholesome meal, especially if the pav (buns) is made from wheat flour or if you could make your own healthy bread.

food.recipe: The best part of this mix vegetable curry recipe is that you can use spare veggies that are in your kitchen and make a one pot tasty mix veg gravy.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add cumin seeds and saute till the seeds change colour. Add onions, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 2: Add garlic paste and ginger paste, mix and saute till onions turn golden brown.
food.step 3: Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, cumin powder and coriander powder, mix well and saute on low heat for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 4: Add tomato puree and increase heat. Add salt, mix well and cook till the mixture thickens and the oil separates.
food.step 5: Add cashew nut-melon seed paste, mix well and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add carrots, cauliflower, French beans, capsicum, green peas and mix gently for 1-2 minutes. Switch the heat off.
food.step6: Add fresh cream and mix well.
food.step7: Heat a shallow non-stick pan, add Kasuri Methi and dry roast till fragrant. Crush between your palms and add it to the vegetable mixture and mix gently.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with ginger strips and coriander leaves and serve hot with rumali roti.
food.ingredients: Carrots cut into 1 inch thick strips and boiled 2 medium
food.ingredient 3: French beans cut into 1 inch pieces and boiled 7-8
food.ingredient 21: Fresh coriander leaves chopped for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Prithvi Cafe","Wok This Way","Pratap The Dhaba","Peco Peco","Singh Saab","Mehman Nawazi","Darjeeling Momos","Khan Uncle","Masala Library","Open China- High Energy Bar","Sammy Sosa"]
food.description: This mixed vegetable curry is a simple, homely and tasty recipe of mix vegetables made in North Indian style.

food.recipe: while preparing the traditional plain steamed ukadiche modak recipe. firstly, use fine store brough rice flour as it helps to make smooth dough. also, adding a tsp of ghee while preparing dough makes dough non sticky and tasty. lastly, vary the stuffing according to your choice, however i like to keep my stuffing simple and delicious.
food.step 1: firstly, prepare the stuffing from jaggery and coconut.
food.step 2: in another kadai boil 1 cup water, ¼ tsp salt and ½ tsp ghee
food.step 3: turn off the flame and add 1 cup fine rice flour.
food.step 4: mix the flour well with water. do not worry if the dough is dry
food.step 5: cover and allow to rest for 3-5 minutes.
food.step6: now transfer the rice flour mixture into large mixing bowl
food.step7: when the flour is still hot, knead with your hand.
food.step8: sprinkle water if required to form a smooth and soft dough
food.step9: furthermore, pinch a small lemon sized ball and flatten it
food.step10: with the help of both thumbs start pressing the edges and create a dent in centre
food.step11: slowly press from edges till it forms a cup
food.step12: start creating pleats with your index finger and thumb.
food.step13: now scoop a tbsp of prepared coconut-jaggery stuffing
food.description: Modak is a traditional indian sweet dumpling, prepared with rice flour dough and coconut – jaggery stuffing is mainly served to lord ganesha during ganapathi chauthi festival. generally the modak’s are steamed with steamer, but it can also be prepared with frying and even baking.

food.food_item: Moong Aur Hare Lasun Ki Dal
food.recipe: Green garlic dal recipe - boiled toor dal is simmered with fresh young garlic, tomatoes and few spices.
food.step 1: Finely chop fresh green garlic.
food.step 2: Mix together green gram, turmeric powder and salt in a pressure cooker and mix well. Cook till 2 whistles are released.
food.step 3: Heat oil in a non-stick deep pan, add cumin seeds and let them change colour. Add asafoetida, green chilli paste and ginger garlic paste and mix well
food.step 4: Add chopped green garlic and sauté for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and mix well. Cook for 2 minutes or till tomatoes turn soft and pulpy.
food.step 5: Open the cooker once the pressure has reduced completely and add gram mixture and mix well. Add ½ cup water and adjust salt and mix, Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step6: Sprinkle chopped coriander and take the pan off the heat. Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with coriander sprig
food.step7: Serve hot with steamed rice.
food.ingredients: Fresh green garlic (hare lasun) 1 small bunch
food.ingredient 2: Whole green gram soaked and drained 3/4 cup

food.recipe: you just need a few ingredients to nail this delicious delight. Here is a simple recipe to prepare this delight at home and the best part is it doesn't take much of your time and effort to prepare this delicacy. So, add sweetness to your festive mood with this fresh homemade delight.
food.step 1: Take motichoor laddoos in a bowl and mash them completely with the back of a fork.
food.step 2: Cut pineapple slices into long strips. Cut a pear into long strips. Squeeze and add lemon juice to the pear strips.
food.step 3: Cut a thin slice of watermelon and cut out the outer edge, and cut the inner round into long strips.
food.step 4: Take a sushi sheet, place a parchment paper over, spread some mashed laddoos on one side of the paper. Add a pear strip, a pineapple strip and a watermelon strip side by side. Follow this sequence 3 times to cover the entire length of the mashed laddoo.
food.step 5: Tightly roll the sushi sheet along with the parchment sheet, pressing slightly from sides and roll the mixture tightly to form a sushi. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours or till set.
food.step6: Place the sushi roll on the worktop, remove the parchment paper and cut the roll into thick slices.
food.step7: Serve immediately, garnished with silver warq and pistachio slivers.
food.ingredient 7: Pistachios blanched, peeled, slivered to garnish

food.description: Laddoo is a sweet, which is often associated with festivals and special occasions. Of all the laddoos, Motichoor Laddoo is the one that you can easily find in all the sweet shops and is loved by everyone.

food.recipe: Tomato, Olive, and Fresh Mozzarella Salad with Basil Vinaigrette has all the flavors of summer and you can make this with cut-up pieces of Mozzarella if you can’t find the Mozzarella Pearls I used!
food.step 1: Arrange alternate slices of tomatoes and mozzarella cheese in a platter. Arrange the basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices. Keep the rest in the centre. Add black and green olives to the platter.
food.step 2: Mix crushed garlic, crushed peppercorns, salt, olive oil and lemon juice to it. Mix well. Pour dressing over the salad and serve cold.

food.step 1: Mix refined flour, cornflour, salt, pepper powder, mixed herbs, paprika and water in a bowl and whisk well to make a thick batter.
food.step 2: Dip the mozzarella strips in the batter and then coat it with the bread crumbs and keep it in the refrigerator of fifteen to twenty minutes.
food.step 3: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Deep fry the mozzarella strips till golden. Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot.

food.recipe: If you want to decode the name of chicken do pyaza, it will literally mean chicken with two onions which may not make much sense. It essentially means chicken made with two types of onions or double the amount of onions than a regular chicken curry.
food.step 1: Put poppy seeds, chironji and almonds in a blender jar and blend to a fine powder.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add sliced onions and sauté till golden brown. Add garlic paste and ginger paste, mix and sauté till the raw smells disappear.
food.step 3: Add chicken, mix well and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, the ground powder, salt and the quartered onion and mix well.
food.step 4: Add saffron and yogurt, mix well and sauté on high heat for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 5: Add chicken stock and mix well. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes or till the chicken is cooked completely.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with onion rings, lemon wedges and paranthe
food.ingredients: Chicken cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.ingredient 16: cupChopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish

food.description: Chicken do pyaza literally means chicken with double onions! This ultimate chicken do pyaza curry with double the onion makes your day doubly happier!

food.recipe: Murghi Aur Masoor Dal Recipe is a Bombay Style Chicken dal, essentially a rich and delicious curry made from a blend of chicken and whole masoor dal. This dish has a whole lot of flavor captured in just one pot. The addition spices has created complex flavors in the dish.
food.step 1: Heat a deep non-stick pan on medium heat, add chicken, onions, yogurt, garlic and ginger. Increase heat to high. Add 1½ tbsps oil, cumin seeds, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder and cumin powder and mix well. .
food.step 2: Add ½ cup water, 3 green chillies and 1½ tbsps oil sauté on high heat for 4-5 minutes.
food.step 3: Reduce heat, cover the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes or till the chicken is almost done. Add boiled whole maoor dal and mix well.
food.step 4: Add coriander leaves, ginger strips and desi ghee. Add about ½ - ¾ cup water to adjust the consistency, mix well. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander, remaining green chillies and ginger strips and serve hot with chapattis or phulkas or steamed rice.
food.ingredients: Chicken cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.ingredient 2: Whole masoor dal soaked for 1 hour and boiled with salt and turmeri 1 cup
food.ingredient 14: Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespo for garnish
food.ingredient 15: Ginger cut into thin strips 1 inch+ for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Tandoor Tawa Aur Karahi","Chaap Ki Chhap","Khana Padhai Aur Masti","Neel Ki Biryani","Maa Ki Khichdi","Vishnuji Ki Rasoi","Ghar Ki Rasoi","Pritam Da Dhaba"]
food.description: Murghi Aur Masoor Dal Recipe is a high protein dish that is a perfect blend of masoor dal and chicken to make a rich and flavourful curry. Serve it along with phulkas and salad for a complete meal.

food.recipe: Murgh musallam is typically marinated in a paste made up of yogurt, spices, nuts, white poppy seeds and caramelized onions. We’re making the marinade much simpler by using my pre-made onion masala.
food.step 1: Soak saffron with kewra water and mix well. Prick the entire chicken with a fork. Apply the saffron mixture on the outside and inside of the chicken. Place it in a big plate and refrigerate to marinate for 30 minutes
food.step 2: Heat a non-stick pan, add desiccated coconut and dry roast till it turns golden in colour, take it off the heat and transfer in a bowl.
food.step 3: Add poppy seeds to the same pan and dry roast it till lightly golden and transfer into the same bowl. Dry roast charoli / chironji till its colour darkens a little and transfer into the same bowl.
food.step 4: Dry roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, cinnamon, black peppercorns, cloves and green cardamoms in the same pan till fragrant and transfer into the same bowl. Mix well and let it cool down slightly
food.step 5: Transfer the roasted ingredients into a blender jar, add ¼ cup water and blend. Add ¼ cup water and blend again into a fine paste.
food.step6: Take yogurt in a big bowl, add the ground paste, browned onion paste, 1 tbsp ginger paste, 1 tbsp garlic paste, 1 tsp red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt and whisk well to make a smooth mixture without any lumps.
food.step7: Bring the chicken out of the refrigerator and place it in another big bowl, and apply the second marinade inside and outside it properly. Keep the bowl in the refrigerator to marinate for 30 minutes.
food.step8: Meanwhile to make the stuffing, take chicken mince in a bowl, add salt, remaining ginger paste, remaining garlic paste and almonds. Chop 4-5 eggs and add to the same bowl.
food.step9: Add remaining red chilli powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, fried onion and hand torn mint leaves and mix well.
food.step10: Coat 2-3 eggs with the stuffing mixture and put them into the cavity of the chicken. Secure the chicken leg by inserting the bone underneath the skin or secure it with thread.
food.step11: Heat ghee in a large handi, place the chicken along with the remaining marinade in it, sear on high heat till light golden brown on all sides. Cover the handi with a lid and seal the edges with dough. Place a tawa under the handi and cook on low heat for 45 minutes.
food.step12: Lift the entire chicken and place it on a serving platter and pour the gravy over it.
food.step13: Garnish with boiled egg slices, fried onion, a few mint leaves and silver warq and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Whole chicken skinned and fat removed 1.75 grams
food.restaurants: ["Zaffran","Persian Darbar","Pritam Da Dhaba","Angrezi Dhaba","Hitchki","Barbeque Nation","Jyran - Sofitel","Veranda","Kasbah Grand","Taftoon Bar & Kitchen","The Big Flip Bar","Murg N More"]
food.description: Murgh musallam, a masala coated whole chicken, is a perfect party dish that takes very little effort to make in an instant pot.

food.recipe: Meaty portobellos are especially good for adding substance and flavor to this soup, but shiitakes or other mushrooms will work well, too. You can also add a ham hock to the pot while the split peas cook, if you like
food.step 1: Mushroom And Pea Soup
food.step 2: Cut boiled chicken into cubes. Boil peas, mushrooms, carrots in chicken broth till done. While it is boiling, add chicken cubes and spring onion greens. Beat egg white lightly and drop into the boiling soup through a sieve. Add Ajinomoto, soya sauce and lastly, salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with bread.
