food.description: Fresh garden peas combine with a hint of basil for a delightfully light spring soup. A unique mushroom drizzle adds extra depth to this beautiful creation.

food.recipe: Sprinkle paper with flour. Roll out dough on lined baking sheet to 15 x 10-inch rectangle. Sprinkle 3 tablespoons Parmesan crosswise over half of crust, leaving 1-inch plain border. Top with 3/4 cup Fontina, then mushroom mixture, distributing evenly. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons Parmesan and 3/4 cup Fontina over mushrooms
food.step 1: Sift refined flour with salt and make a well in the center. Dissolve yeast in 1 tbsp lukewarm water along with sugar and pour into the well. Add ¾ cup chilled water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside at room temperature till it doubles in size. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil and knock back the dough lightly, divide into 4 equal portions and set aside for about 20 minutes in a warm place
food.step 2: To make the stuffing heat olive oil in a non-stick pan. Slice garlic and add. Sauté for ½ minute. Slice mushrooms and add and continue to sauté. Roughly chop spinach and add. Toss and cook till the vegetables are cooked and the moisture has evaporated. Add salt and mix. Chop fresh red chillies and add. Mix and set aside to cool. Preheat oven to 180°C. Keep a silicon sheet on a baking tray.
food.step 3: Grate paneer and add to the spinach mixture and mix well. Divide into 4 equal portions. Roll out each dough portion into a thin round. Place a portion of the stuffing in the centre of each, top with ¼ cup cheese. Fold one side of the dough over to make a crescent. Roll the edges slightly and press to seal. Prick the dough covering lightly with a fork and brush a little olive oil. Keep the calzones on the silicon sheet and keep the tray in the preheated oven. Bake for about 45 minutes or till golden. Serve hot.

food.description: A delicious homemade calzone that's perfect for the ultimate cosy night. This hearty and warming folded pizza will not disappoint; stuffed with an unbeatable combination of mozzarella, mushrooms and spinach.

food.recipe: The traditional cooking method for risotto involves standing at the stove and stirring almost constantly to achieve the signature creamy texture of the dish. The Instant Pot® eliminates that, turning out luscious risotto with the touch of a button.
food.step 1: Peel and chop the onion. Scrape and slice the carrot.
food.step 2: Clean and slice the mushrooms.Roast capsicum and quarter.
food.step 3: Melt butter on a slow fire, add chopped onion and cook until transparent.
food.step 4: Mix sliced mushroom and carrots, cook for few minutes, then add rice and cook for about two minutes stirring constantly.
food.step 5: Add white wine and once the rice has fully absorbed the wine, gradually add hot water or stock (six cups) and stir constantly.
food.step6: After about five minutes add salt, pepper powder, dried basil and the spinach puree.
food.step8: After the rice is almost cooked, add most of the grated parmesan and stir.
food.step9: Add roasted capsicum pieces and serve hot topped with the remaining cheese.

food.recipe: In a large skillet, melt butter. Add mushrooms and onion; saute until tender. Add soy sauce; cook and stir 2 minutes longer. Cool to room temperature.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 200°C.
food.step 2: Cut baguette into half. Further slit each half vertically and toast in the preheated oven till crisp.
food.step 3: Heat oil in a non stick pan, add onion, garlic and mushrooms and sauté till onion is soft.
food.step 4: Cut capsicum into thin strips.
food.step 5: Add salt, pepper powder and tomatoes to pan and mix. Add half the capsicum strips, mix well and add basil leaves and olives. Mix again and cook for 4 minutes.
food.step6: Scoop out toasted baguettes. Fill cavity of one half of bread generously with mushroom mixture and top with grated cheese. Cover with another half and press firmly to flatten.
food.step7: Wrap in a piece of aluminium foil and put in refrigerator for 4-6 hours.
food.step8: Slice and serve chilled.

food.description: The hearty texture, rustic appearance and savory flavor make this yeast bread a winner with dinner guests time and time again. Nothing can compare to the heavenly aroma while it bakes.

food.recipe: The mushroom do pyaza recipe is very simple and does not require any special ingredients. The everyday ingredients that we use in Indian cooking is added in this recipe.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add green chilli, ginger paste and mix well. Add chopped onion, mix and sauté till it turns golden brown.
food.step 2: Add tomato, mix and sauté till pulpy. Add tomato puree, mix and sauté for a minute. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder and salt, mix well and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step 3: Add ½ cup water and mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes. Add cubed onion, capsicum and mushrooms and mix well. Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.
food.step 4: Add fresh cream and coriander leaves and mix well. Cook for a few seconds and take the pan off the heat.
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with coriander sprig and slit green chilli. Serve hot with laccha paranthe.
food.ingredient 12: Green capsicum cut into 1 inch cubes 1 medium
food.description: Mushroom do pyaza is button mushrooms cooked in a semi dry gravy of double the amount of onions.

food.recipe: The mushroom are chopped small and then sautéed till soft and mixed with cheese to keep it soft and gooey. The momo is then rolled to different shapes and then steamed in a bamboo steamer. The momo will easily take 10 to 15 minutes to cook.
food.step 1: Make a dough using all purpose flour and keep it aside for 30 mins
food.step 2: Add a pinch of salt in the dough for better taste.
food.step 3: Take a pan and pour oil into it.
food.step 4: Add garlic and onions and fry them
food.step 5: Sauté the mushrooms on low flame and sprinkle some pepper powder over them.
food.step6: You can also add green chillies and other veggies if you want in the filling
food.step7: Divide the dough into equal parts and start making small circles
food.step8: Now, make small tortillas of the dough balls and put one spoon filling in the centre of it.
food.step9: Try to keep edges thin and centre thick.
food.step10: Now, fold the momo and make pleats.
food.step11: Repeat the process and similarly make other momos.
food.step12: Cover them with a wet kitchen towel until you are ready to steam them.
food.step13: Boil water in cooker or other big vessel with broad mouth.
food.restaurants: ["The Momos Nation","The Momos Machine","Hello Momos","Dumpling Delights","BusaGo","The Fatty Bao","Kepchaki Momos","Ithaka - Veg Lebanese Kitchen","Chinese Wok - Wok Express","Yummy Momos","Relish - International Veg Cuisine","The Appetite Momos"]
food.description: Chilli Cheese Mushroom Momo Recipe is a momo filled with creamy and spicy chilli mushrooms. These momos make a great appetizer for parties.

food.recipe: Dhansak Mutton is a truly delicious dish which is cooked with pumpkin, brinjals, potato, masoor and toor daal along with a melange of spices. Mildly tangy with a bit of sweetness, this mouth-watering mutton recipe is a complete reflection of Parsi culture.
food.step 1: Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add onions, mix and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Add ginger and garlic, mix and sauté till the mixture turns golden brown
food.step 2: Add mutton and black peppercorns and sauté on high heat till the mutton turns a light golden brown.
food.step 3: Add green chillies, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, split pigeon pea, split red lentil, pumpkin, potatoes and brinjals and mix well
food.step 4: Add tomatoes and fenugreek leaves and mix well. Add salt and 3½ cups water and mix well. Cover and cook under pressure till 6-8 whistles are released.
food.step 5: Open the lid of the cooker once the pressure has reduced completely. Take the mutton pieces out and place them in a bowl.
food.step6: Lightly blend the mixture with a hand blender. Place the cooker back on heat and add the mutton pieces and mix well.
food.step7: Add dhansaak masala and tamarind pulp and mix well. Adjust salt and add ½ cup water, mix well and cook till the mixture comes to a boil.
food.step8: Take the cooker off the heat. Transfer the mutton dhansaak in a serving bowland serve hot with with parsi brown rice.
food.ingredients: Mutton cut into 2 inch pieces on the bone 500 grams
food.ingredient 3: Split pigeon pea (toor dal) soaked for 20 minutes and drained 1 cup
food.ingredient 4: Split red lentil (masoor dal) soaked for 20 minutes and drained 1/2 cup
food.ingredient 13: Red pumpkin peeled and cut into 1 inch cubes 150 grams
food.ingredient 14: Potatoes medium, peeled and cut into 2 inch pieces 2
food.restaurants: ["Gallops","Gopals Mutton And Chicken","Gomantak","Craftbar","Masala Library","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Mini Punjab's Lake Side","Persian Darbar","Grandmama's Café","MRP - My Regular Place","Arth","Acharekar's Malvan Katta"]
food.description: Dhansak Mutton is a quintessential Parsi recipe which is cooked on special occasions and festivals.

food.recipe: The mutton pulao is almost same like the pulao recipes where aromatic spices are used to make rice but, meat is added to the rice to lift up the flavors of the pulav and make it as a very special dish.
food.step 1: Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a pressure cooker, add cinnamon, green cardamoms, black peppercorns and cloves and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 2: Add mutton and sauté on high heat till the mutton turns golden brown.
food.step 3: Thinly slice onion and add. Add salt and mix well.
food.step 4: Add turmeric powder and mix well. Add 2 cups water, mix well and let the mixture come to a boil.
food.step 5: Cover the pressure cooker and cook on medium heat under pressure till 6 whistles are released. Allow the pressure to reduce completely.
food.step6: Open the pressure cooker and strain the mixture into a large bowl. Take the mutton pieces out and transfer them into another bowl.
food.step7: Heat remaining ghee in a deep heavy bottom pan, add sliced onion, mix well and saute till golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté for 1 minute. Add rice and mix gently
food.step8: Add the mutton stock and mix well. Add Tata Sampann Meat Masala and mix well.
food.step9: Add ginger strips, green chillies, coriander leaves and the mutton pieces and mix gently. Cover and cook on low heat till the rice is cooked completely. Switch the heat off and let it sit covered for 10 minutes.
food.step10: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with boiled egg and serve hot with salad and papad
food.ingredients: Mutton cut into 1 inch pieces on the bone 500 grams
food.ingredient 2: Basmati rice washed, soaked for 20 minutes and drained 1 1/2 cups
food.ingredient 14: Ginger piece cut into thin strips 1 inch
food.restaurants: ["Gallops","Gopals Mutton And Chicken","Gomantak","Craftbar","Masala Library","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Mini Punjab's Lake Side","Persian Darbar","Grandmama's Café","MRP - My Regular Place","Arth","Acharekar's Malvan Katta"]
food.description: Mutton Pulao Recipe is an amazing pulao recipe made with mutton and rice,This is a variation to the mutton tahari recipe

food.recipe: The spices are first soaked in vinegar and then ground and the mutton pieces are marinated in this ground spice paste and lemon juice which is cooked till it tenderises.
food.step 1: Take dried red chillies, garlic paste, cumin seeds, cinnamon, black peppercorns, cloves and malt vinegar in a blender. Add sufficient water and blend to a fine paste.
food.step 2: Take mutton in a large bowl, add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder and salt and mix well.
food.step 3: Heat oil in a deep non-stick pan, add onions and sauté till onions turn golden brown. Add the blended paste and mix well. Sauté for 1 minute on high heat.
food.step 4: Add tomato puree and sauté for 1 minute on high heat. Add the marinated mutton and sauté on high heat for 1-2 minutes. Adjust salt, add sugar and mix well. Rinse the blender jar with ¾ cup water and add to the mutton mixture. Mix well, cover and cook on medium heat for 20-25 minutes
food.step 5: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with fried potato wedges and serve hot with pavs.
food.ingredients: Mutton cut into 1½ inch pieces on the bone 700 grams
food.ingredient 13: Tomatoes blanched, peeled and pureed 2 medium
food.restaurants: ["Gallops","Gopals Mutton And Chicken","Gomantak","Craftbar","Masala Library","SodaBottleOpenerWala","Mini Punjab's Lake Side","Persian Darbar","Grandmama's Café","MRP - My Regular Place","Arth","Acharekar's Malvan Katta"]
food.description: Mutton Vindaloo is a traditional and tasty Goan recipe made with lamb meat in vinegar and spices.,Serve the vindaloo along with steamed rice or pav to make a perfect dinner.

food.recipe: Nannari sarbath is an ancient cooling drink and is better than consuming cola drinks. It is also used to make the famous cooling drink from madurai known as Jigarthanda.
food.step 1: Firstly take 5 cups water in a pan and add 100 grams nannari powder
food.step 2: Mix very well with a spoon or wired whisk. Cover and soak for 2 to 3 hours.
food.step 3: Then add 5 cups sugar in the same pan.
food.step 4: Keep the pan on stove top and cook on a low flame. Stir so that all the sugar dissolves.
food.step 5: Cook for about 20 to 30 minutes till the syrup reduces by ⅓ and you get a half or one string consistency in it. Cook on a low to medium flame and do use large pan for cooking the syrup.
food.step6: Let the solution cool completely.
food.step7: Then filter the solution in another pan using a fine sieve or muslin.
food.step8: Pour the solution in a clean bottle and then refrigerate. This recipe gives about 1 litre of nannari syrup.
food.step9: Take 3 to 4 tablespoons of nannari syrup in a glass.
food.step10: Squeeze some lemon juice. You can add about ½ to 1 tablespoon of lemon juice.
food.step11: Pour water and mix well.
food.step12: Add some ice cubes and serve nannari sharbat. If using cold water, then you can skip ice cubes.
food.ingredients: 100 grams nannari powder (sarsaparilla, sarasaberilla, haaluballi, karala)
food.description: Nannari is cooling for the body and is excellent during the summers. Its also a blood purifier and one of the remedies for urinary infection. It also improves digestion.

food.recipe: popular deep fried appetizer / snack food or a kind of dim sum from the south east asian cuisine. basically the sauteed vegetables and noodles are sauteed and stuffed inside a rice based spring roll wrapper and deep fried till crisp.
food.step 1: Heat 1 cup water in a non-stick pan.
food.step 2: Remove the veins of cabbage leaves, add the leaves to the pan and blanch till soft. Drain and place them in a bowl.
food.step 3: Spread a large cling film on the worktop and place the blanched cabbage leaves one above the other on it, spread noodles over the leaves and top with red capsicum and carrot strips. Roll the arrangement tightly into a cylinder, halve and wrap them in aluminum foil. Refrigerate till set.
food.step 4: To make dip, roughly chop ginger and green chillies and put into a mixer jar, add soy sauce and vinegar and blend. Transfer this into a bowl.
food.step 5: Remove aluminum foil and cut each into 8 equal portions. Remove cling film.
food.step6: Arrange the noodle rolls on a serving plate and serve with dip.
food.ingredient 3: Red capsicum cut into thin strips 1 medium
food.ingredient 4: Carrot cut into thin strips 1 medium
food.restaurants: ["Yauatcha","Royal China","Raju Sandwich Stall","Pritam Food Corner","Hit & Run","Charcoal Eats","Health Juice & Fast Food","Kathi Kabab Roll"]
food.description: traditionally spring roll recipes are native to chinese cuisine and is mainly prepared with cabbage leaves. these savoury rolls are mainly served as appetizer with along with fried rice or noodles soup recipe.

food.recipe: We like to use rice noodles in this recipe, but you can also use buckwheat noodles (memil gooksu, soba) or even linguine or fettucine.
food.step 1: Boil noodles in six to eight cups of salted water to which one tablespoon of oil has been added and cook till almost done.
food.step 2: Drain, refresh in cold water, drain again and spread on a large plate to cool. Heat two tablespoons oil in a wok.
food.step 3: Heat two tablespoons oil in another wok. Add onion, broccoli, babycorns, carrots and salt to one wok and sauté. Add chopped garlic to the other wok and sauté. Add stock to the vegetables along with fresh red chillies, MSG and soy sauce.
food.step 4: Add boiled noodles to garlic and toss. Add green capsicum to the vegetables and stir. Add cornflour blended in half a cup of water and stir.
food.step 5: Place the noodles in a serving plate. Add bean sprouts to the vegetables and mix.
food.step6: Pour the vegetables over the noodles and serve immediately.
food.ingredient 12: Green capsicums cut into diamonds 2 medium
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: This simple noodle and vegetable dish is an easy way to disguise leftover vegetables (and even leftover chicken or meat) into a tasty meal.

food.food_item: Olive And Sun Dried Tomato Tapenade
food.recipe: Sun-Dried Tomato Tapenade with Crostini takes about 30 minutes to prepare and can be made up to two days in advance. Store the tapenade, covered, in the refrigerator, and garnish with parsley immediately before serving. Store toasted and cooled bread slices in an airtight container
food.step 1: Put both the olives, garlic, almonds, sun dried tomatoes and capers in a food processor and process until well blended.
food.step 2: With the motor running slowly add the olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper powder
food.step 3: Transfer the tapenade into a bowl and chill until required. -
food.step 4: Toast the slices of bread on both the sides until crisp
food.step 5: Brush olive oil on both sides when the toasts are hot so that the oil is absorbed
food.step6: Spread the tapenade on these toasted bread slices, garnish with parsley and serve immediately.
food.ingredient 11: Day old baguette thin slices optional 1

food.recipe: Onion paratha or pyaaz ka paratha is one of the popular and tasty paratha variety made in punjbai homes for breakfast. the translation of onion paratha in english would be  – whole wheat flat bread stuffed with spiced onions
food.step 1: Mix the flour with the salt. Add the ghee and some water.
food.step 2: Begin to knead the dough. Add some more water and knead to a smooth and soft dough.
food.step 3: Punch the dough while kneading.
food.step 4: Cover and keep aside the dough for 15-20 minutes.
food.step 5: As the dough is resting we prepare the filling.
food.step6: Chop the onions & green chilies.
food.step7: Mix them together and keep aside.
food.step8: Make medium sized balls from the dough.
food.step9: Take a ball and roll into 3-4 inch diameter disc on a dusted board.
food.step10: Add the chopped onions-chilies mixture in the center.
food.step11: Sprinkle one or two pinch of garam masala powder, red chili powder and salt
food.step12: Bring together all the edges of the dough.
food.step13: Join them in the center and press downwards.
food.ingredient 6: 1 green chili - finely chopped or minced (optional)
food.ingredient 10: oil or ghee (clarified butter) for frying the parathas

food.description: Onion paratha are delicious whole wheat flatbread stuffed with onions and a few spices.

food.recipe: Place cream, milk, Chelsea Caster Sugar, vanilla and orange rind in a small saucepan and bring to a gentle boil. Keep stirring. Sprinkle the gelatine over the strained orange juice and allow to swell for 5 minutes. Microwave the gelatine mix on high for 10 - 15 seconds, until it liquefies.
food.step 1: Heat cream in a deep non-stick pan. Add 1 tsp orange zest, mix well and cook.
food.step 2: Add sugar, mix well and cook till the sugar dissolves.
food.step 3: Take milk in a bowl. Add orange jelly powder and mix well.
food.step 4: Remove the pan from heat, cool to room temperature and add the milk-jelly mixture. Mix well and strain
food.step 5: Pour strained mixture into individual Martini glasses and refrigerate till set.
food.step6: Top with orange marmalade, garnish with orange zest and serve chilled.
food.ingredients: Orange Jelly Powder 1 teaspoon + for garnishing

food.description: Cool then refrigerate to set (allow 2-4 hours). Gently pull edges away from side of mould and ease out onto a serving plate. Serve with fresh orange slices and threads of orange rind.

food.recipe: We make them in the same way as instant coconut ladoo but we grind some paan leaves with the condensed milk before adding it to the pan with the desiccated coconut. Also these coconut ladoos are filled with gulkand (rose petal preserve) which makes them really flavorful.
food.step 1: Tear the betel leaves and put them in a blender jar, add condensed milk and blend to a fine paste.
food.step 2: Put gulkand in a bowl, add mixed nuts, green cardamom power and betel leaves paste and mix well. Add 1 cup desiccated coconut and mix well.
food.step 3: Spread the remaining desiccated coconut on a plate. Shape the mixture into medium sized laddoos and roll them in the remaining desiccated coconut. Serve immediately.

food.description: Instant Paan Coconut Ladoo, filled with gulkand is an easy Indian sweet for Diwali! You need only 15 minutes to make these!

food.recipe: Palak paratha or spinach paratha Is another excellent variation of paratha where you can include some healthy greens in the paratha.
food.step 1: Rinse the spinach leaves very well in water. Drain them
food.step 2: Heat water and boil the spinach leaves in hot water for 5 to 7 minutes.
food.step 3: Strain and keep some of the stock in which we have boiled the spinach leaves.
food.step 4: Puree the spinach in a blender
food.step 5: In a large bowl mix the whole wheat flour with salt, carom seeds, green chili and asafoetida.
food.step6: Add the spinach puree and 2 tsp oil. Mix well.
food.step7: Add the required amount of stock or water and make a smooth dough.
food.step8: Take a medium size ball from the dough. Roll the dough ball into a small circle.
food.step9: Spread some oil or ghee on the top of the rolled dough. I have used ghee.
food.step10: Fold from both sides. Apply the oil or ghee on the folded side.
food.step11: Again fold from one side. You will get a square shape. roll into a medium-sized paratha.
food.step12: Place the paratha on a hot tava.
food.step13: Once you see some bubbles on the paratha and its 1/4th cooked, then flip it.
food.ingredient 3: 1 or 2 green chilies, finely chopped - optional
food.ingredient 6: 1 or 2 green chilies, finely chopped - optional
food.ingredient 8: 2 teaspoon oil or ghee for kneading dough
food.ingredient 9: 4 teaspoon oil or ghee while folding the parathas
food.ingredient 12: oil or ghee (clarified butter) for frying the paratha

food.description: Palak ka paratha is an unleavened Indian flatbread made with spinach and whole wheat flour.

food.recipe: it’s not just about using a non stick pan. A thin, cheap non stick pan will cause the fish to be in closer and harsher contact with the stove, causing the fish to brown unevenly in the few minutes it’s on the stove. Some crispy patches, some not so crispy ones.
food.step 1: Mix salt, one tablespoon of malt vinegar, one tablespoon of dark soy sauce and three tablespoons of cornflour and apply this on to the pomfret fillets evenly.
food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a wok and deep fry the fillets for about a minute or till well done. Drain and place on an absorbent paper.
food.step 3: Heat two tablespoons of oil in another wok. Add spring onion, ginger, remaining dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, hot black bean sauce and mix. Add crushed black peppercorns, green chillies, sugar and fish or chicken stock.
food.step 4: Add the remaining cornflour mixed in quarter cup of water, remaining malt vinegar and mix and cook till it gets the sauce consistency. Add the fried fish and mix gently.
food.step 5: Take off the heat.
food.step6: Garnish with spring onion greens cut into long pieces and serve hot.
food.ingredient 14: Spring onion greens cut diagonally 2 stalks
food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: Pan Fried Fish is a thing of beauty, with its beautiful crispy golden crust and juicy flesh inside. It’s a super quick dinner because cooking fish fillets on the stove takes less than 5 minutes!

food.recipe: this delicious Rajasthani panchratna dal is a protein packed dish as it contains the goodness and nutritive qualities of 5 different lentils/dals.
food.step 1: Put split skinless green gram, split Bengal gram, moth beans and split pigeon pea and split red lentil in a pressure cooker. Add 3 cups water, green chillies, salt and turmeric powder.Cover the pressure cooker and place it on heat and cook under pressure till 3-4 whistles are released. Let the pressure be released completely.
food.step 2: Open the pressure cooker and add 1 cup water to adjust the consistency and mix well.
food.step 3: For the first tempering, heat 1½ tbsps ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and sauté till their colour changes. Add ¼ tsp asafoetida and crushed ginger and sauté till fragrant. Switch the heat off and add ¾ tsp red chilli powder and kasuri methi and mix well
food.step 4: Add the cooked grams, place the pan back on heat and mix well. Cook on low heat for 1-2 minutes or another till the cooked mixture comes to a boil.
food.step 5: For second tempering, heat remaining ghee in a small non-stick pan, add mustard seeds, remaining cumin seeds, remaining asafoetida, button red chillies and 2 green chillies mix well. Switch the heat off, add remaining red chilli powder and take the pan off the heat.
food.step6: Transfer the dal into a serving bowl, drizzle lemon juice and the tempering. Garnish with coriander leaves and remaining slit green chilli and serve hot
food.ingredients: Moong dal soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 2: Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 3: Moth beans soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 4: Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.ingredient 5: Split red lentil (masoor dal) soaked and drained 1/4 cup
food.restaurants: ["Beeji Ki Rasoi","Chaap Ki Chhap","Sukoon Ki Chai","Maa Ki Khichdi","Mummy Ki Rasoi","Ghar Ki Baat","Vishnuji Ki Rasoi"]
food.description: Famous Rajasthani panchratna dal made from five lentils.

food.recipe: This jalebi recipe is prepared using cottage cheese, all purpose flour, and milk, and then deep-fried. The best thing about this lip-smacking sweet dish is that it has the taste of saffron and cardamom powder, with which you will have a melt-in-mouth experience.
food.step 1: Heat a non-stick pan, add sugar and ½ cup water, mix and bring it to a boil. Add saffron and green cardamom powder and mix. Boil, stirring till all the sugar dissolves and you get a sugar syrup of one string consistency. Keep the syrup warm.
food.step 2: Take cornflour in a large bowl, add refined flour, baking soda, baking powder and ½ cup water and mix to make a smooth batter.
food.step 3: Add cottage cheese and mix well. Grind to a smooth paste and put into a clean bowl.
food.step 4: Heat ghee in a non-stick pan. Transfer the mixture into a piping bag fitted with a nozzle and pipe spirals directly into hot ghee. Deep-fry, turning sides, till both sides are golden brown.
food.step 5: Soak the fried jalebis in the sugar syrup for 5 minutes
food.step6: Lift the jalebis from the syrup, arrange them on a serving platter, garnish with pistachio slivers and serve.
food.restaurants: ["shree gangour sweets","chandu halwai grant road","m n mithaiwala","punjabi sweet house and restaurants","adarsh mithai mandir","vyanjan","tharu sweets","sindhu sweets","jhama sweets ghatkopar east"]
food.description: the paneer jalebi as we all love the sweets but how it sounds when it was made at home and with healthy ingredient paneer so friends trust me it was amazing in taste and healthy for us

food.recipe: the recipe is made with the same set of vegetables and spices as the traditional one but is topped with grated paneer. it is an ideal alternative to the popular pav bhaji and can be served as a party starter or as an appetiser with choice of bread.
food.step 1: Heat butter and oil on a non-stick tawa. Add onions and sauté till light golden brown.
food.step 2: Add ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté till raw smells disappear. Add tomatoes, mix and sauté for 4-5 minutes.
food.step 3: Add red chilli powder, chilli paste and ¼ cup water and mix well. Add salt and mix. Add ¼ cup water, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add pav bhaji masala and mix well. Add ½ cup water and mix well.
food.step 4: Add potatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, green peas, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 5: Add cottage cheese, ½ cup water and salt, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add coriander leaves and mix.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving plate, sprinkle coriander leaves on top and serve hot with toasted pavs and lemon wedges.
food.ingredient 16: Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons + to garnish
food.restaurants: ["Sardar Pav bhaji","Birju's Pav Bhaji","Pav Bhaji King","Balaji Pav Bhaji Centre","Ashok Vada Pav Stall","Mahalaxmi Pav Bhaji","Maruti Pav Bhaji","Lachhu Pav Bhaji","Maa Anjani Pav Bhaji Centre","Cannon Pav Bhaji","Bhagwati Pav Bhaji","Pack-A-Pav"]
food.description: it is not only served and consumed as a savoury snack but also as a complete meal by itself for lunch and dinner. obviously due to the myriad options and to cater to the different taste, there different types to the typical one and paneer pav bhaji recipe is one such option

food.recipe: Paneer paratha is one of the many popular paratha varieties from Punjab. Its an all time favorite paratha at home and is served in most restaurants as well as Punjabi dhabas (road side eateries)
food.step 1: Take 2 to 2.25 cups whole wheat flour, ½ tsp salt, 1 tsp ghee or oil in a mixing bowl.
food.step 2: Pour about ½ cup water first.
food.step 3: Mix and begin to knead. Add more water if required and knead to a smooth soft dough. Overall I added 2/3 cup water.
food.step 4: Cover and allow the dough to rest for 20 to 30 minutes.
food.step 5: Meanwhile while the dough is resting, prepare the stuffing. Grate 200 grams of paneer.
food.step6: Add 1 or 2 finely chopped green chilies, 1/2 tsp dry mango powder, 1/2 tsp punjabi garam masala or garam masala powder, 1/2 tsp red chili powder and 1/2 tsp salt.
food.step7: You can add more of the salt, red chili powder or dry mango powder if you prefer.
food.step8: Mix everything well so that the spice powders are uniformly mixed with the grated paneer.
food.step9: Pinch two small balls from the dough and roll them in your palms to make them even.
food.step10: Dust some flour on the dough balls.
food.step11: With a rolling pin (belan), roll the dough balls to a circle of about 4 to 5 inches in diameter.
food.step12: Place the paneer stuffing on one of the rolled rounds keeping one inch space around the circumference.
food.step13: over with the other rolled dough and press the edges well.
food.ingredient 2: ⅔ cup water or add as required
food.ingredient 4: ½ teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 9: ½ to ¾ teaspoon dry mango powder (amchur powder) or add as per your taste
food.ingredient 10: ½ teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 11: ghee or oil as required for roasting parathas
food.restaurants: ["Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Paratha Saratha - Extra Stuffed","Chai Pe Charcha","Oye Kiddan","Lassi Te Parrontthe","Prithvi Cafe","Times Of Paratha","Guru Kripa","Paratha House","The Food Boxz","Taste Of Punjab","Paratha Express","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Paratha Corner","Chakh Le The Street Food","Bimal Paratha House","Crystal"]
food.description: Paneer paratha is an Indian flatbread made with whole wheat flour and cottage cheese stuffing. It is a popular breakfast recipe in Punjabi homes.

food.recipe: Paneer Tikka is a popular and delicious tandoori snack where paneer (Indian cottage cheese cubes) are marinated in a spiced yogurt-based marinade, arranged on skewers and grilled in the oven.
food.step 1: Chop the paneer in square shaped cubes.
food.step 2: Dice the onions and capsicum in 1 or 1.5 inches square pieces.
food.step 3: In a large bowl, take the hung curd (greek yogurt) and whisk it lightly till it becomes smooth
food.step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste, all the spice powders, carom seeds, black salt, regular salt, lemon juice and mustard oil.
food.step 5: Mix very well. Check the taste and add more seasonings if required.
food.step6: Add the veggies and paneer to the marinade. Slowly and gently mix them with the marinade.
food.step7: Cover the bowl and marinate for at least 2 hours or more in the refrigerator.
food.step8: After 2 hours thread the paneer and veggies alternately on bamboo skewers. Soak or rinse the bamboo skewers before threading.
food.step9: Preheat the oven for 15 to 20 minutes at 230 or 240 degree celsius or 464 degrees Fahrenheit. Use only the top heating element.
food.step10: Line a baking tray with aluminium foil or parchment paper. Arrange the paneer skewers on the tray. Brush some oil on the veggies and paneer cubes all over
food.step11: Place the tray on the top rack. Grill the paneer tikka first for 7 to 10 minutes at 230 or 240 degree celsius or or 464 degrees Fahrenheit. Then remove and turn the skewers.
food.step12: Place back on the top rack in the oven and continue to grill for 3 to 5 minutes more till the edges of the paneer are golden or slightly charred. Do not grill for a long time as then paneer cubes becomes hard.
food.step13: Since temperatures vary from oven to oven do keep a check. You can reduce or increase the time as required. Total grilling time will be 15 to 20 minutes.
food.ingredients: 200 to 250 grams paneer or Indian cottage cheese
food.ingredient 2: ½ cup diced onions or 1 medium sized onion
food.ingredient 3: ½ diced capsicum or 1 small to medium bell pepper - green, yellow or red
food.ingredient 4: 200 grams hung curd or greek yogurt
food.ingredient 5: 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste or 1 tablespoon crushed ginger-garlic
food.ingredient 6: 2 teaspoons kashmiri red chili powder or 2 teaspoons sweet paprika
food.ingredient 14: ½ teaspoon black pepper powder - optional (ground black pepper)
food.ingredient 16: 1 tablespoon mustard oil or any neutral tasting oil

food.description: This Restaurant Style Paneer Tikka is a popular and delicious tandoori snack where paneer (Indian cottage cheese cubes) are marinated in a spiced yogurt-based marinade, arranged on skewers and grilled in the oven.

food.recipe: Tiramisu is one of our favorite desserts. When we go out to dine in Italian restaurants, without fail we have to order tiramisu. Luckily some Italian restaurants here do serve an egg free tiramisu.
food.step 1: To make syrup, mixrum, sugar, coffee powder and forty ml boiling water in a bowl. Keep aside.
food.step 2: Beat the eggs and sugar together with an electric beater in a large bowl till creamy and smooth.
food.step 3: Beat the cottage cheese with the electric beater in another bowl till smooth.Add fresh cream gradually and mix again till smooth.
food.step 4: Add the beaten eggs and the sugar mixture to the cottage cheese mixture and fold into it.
food.step 5: Beat the whipping cream with an electric beater in a separate bowl and fold into the cottage cheese mixture.
food.step6: Fill the paneer mixture into a piping bag.
food.step7: To assemble the tiramisu, place sponge fingers on the bottom of individual serving glasses.Pipe three-fourth of the cottage cheese mixture over it. Sprinkle with some coffee powder.
food.step8: Refrigerate for two-three hours
food.step9: Keep the remaining cottage cheese mixture in the refrigerator. Remove the glasses and pipe out remaining cottage cheese mixture till full.
food.step10: Dust reserved coffee powder over the tiramisu. Garnish with sponge fingers and serve chilled.

food.description: Tiramisu is a famous italian dessert. the Tiramisu recipe shared here is an easy tiramisu recipe made without eggs and alcohol.

food.recipe: This easy mushroom pasta with garlic sauce was first posted just five months into the life of this website, back when I had no idea what I was doing (still don’t, let’s be real) and no inkling that this delightful little corner of the internet would someday be a major piece of my full-time self-employed life.
food.step 1: To make the mushroom sauce, melt butter in a non-stick pan. Add garlic and sauté till light brown. Add onion and sauté till translucent.
food.step 2: Add mushrooms and sauté for three to four minutes. Add three-fourth cup water and cook for two to three minutes. Add white sauce, oregano, cheese and salt and mix well. Add penne pasta and toss till the sauce coats the pasta. Serve hot.

food.description: This easy mushroom pasta with garlic sauce is sure to be a hit. Creamy garlic parmesan sauce and sautéed mushrooms make this a filling and delicious weeknight recipe.

food.recipe: Creamy, velvety, savory, and subtly sweet, it makes the perfect flavor companion to vegan parmesan and fresh herbs in this 10-ingredient vegan and gluten-free pasta.
food.step 1: Wash pepper and carrot. De-seed pepper and cut into one-inch sized pieces. Peel carrot and slice thinly.
food.step 2: Peel and wash onion and slice thinly. Peel and chop garlic.
food.step 3: Place pepper, carrot and onion on a tray and sprinkle one tablespoon of olive oil and cook in the oven at 180 degree C for ten minutes.
food.step 4: Boil sufficient water in a deep pan with salt. Add one tablespoon of oil and cook different coloured fusilli pasta in it till al dente.
food.step 5: Drain and refresh in cold water. Add one tablespoon olive oil and mix.
food.step6: Remove the vegetables from the oven and blend with a little water in a mixer.
food.step7: Heat two tablespoons of olive oil in a pan and add chopped garlic, vegetable puree, tomato puree, salt, pepper powder and simmer for five minutes.
food.step8: Add boiled pasta and mix. Add fresh cream and mix. Add dried basil.
food.step9: Transfer onto a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

food.recipe: it is one of the traditional italian cuisine recipe known for its, taste, flavour and creaminess in each bite. the recipe is very much inspired from the italian cuisine but a tailored and customised recipe for indian taste buds.
food.step 1: To make red sauce, heat 3 tbsps oil in a wide pan, add chopped garlic, onion, mix and sauté till translucent. Add tomatoes and mix well. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 2: Add salt, paprika powder, castor sugar and crushed black peppercorns, mix well, and cook for 10-15 minutes.
food.step 3: Add basil leaves, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step 4: Heat 2 tbsps oil in another non-stick pan, add sliced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds.
food.step 5: Add broccoli, yellow capsicum, cherry tomatoes and green zucchini and toss well.
food.step6: Add boiled pasta and toss well. Add the red sauce and mix well.
food.step7: Adjust salt and crushed black peppercorns. Sprinkle dried red chilli flakes and mix well
food.step8: Grate parmesan cheese into the pan and mix well. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step9: Transfer into a serving plate, drizzle olive oil and garnish with basil sprig and serve hot with garlic toast.
food.ingredient 2: Tomatoes blanched, peeled and finely chopped 2 large
food.ingredient 14: Yellow capsicum cut into triangles 1/2 medium
food.ingredient 16: Green zucchini cut into triangles 1/2 small

food.recipe: White Sauce Pasta is an easy-to-make recipe of cooked pasta in a delicious white sauce. Simply prepare the white sauce – a mixture of butter, milk, flour and spices and pour it over your cooked pasta.
food.step 1: To make white sauce, pour milk into a deep non-stick sauce pan. Stud onion wedge and bay leaf with clove and add to the milk and let the mixture come to a boil. Discard the bay leaf, onion and cloves and take the pan off the heat. .
food.step 2: Heat a wide and deep pan, add butter and when it melts add refined flour, mix and saute for 1 minute. Add the hot milk and mix continuously so that no lumps are formed. Cook till the mixture is smooth and thick.
food.step 3: Add salt and white pepper powder and mix well. Grate processed cheese into the pan, mix well and cook till the cheese melts.
food.step 4: Add nutmeg powder, mix well and take the pan off the heat.
food.step 5: Heat olive oil in non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté till raw smells disappear.
food.step6: Add yellow squash, broccoli florets and cherry tomatoes, mix and sauté for 2-3 minutes
food.step7: Add penne paste and toss well. Add salt and crushed black peppercorns and mix well.
food.step8: Add the white sauce, dried red chilli flakes, thyme and oregano and toss well. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step9: Transfer the paste onto a serving plate, garnish with parsley sprig, drizzle a little olive oil and serve hot with pesto toast.
food.ingredient 14: Yellow squash cut into triangles 1/2 small

food.description: White Sauce Pasta is an easy-to-make recipe of cooked pasta in a delicious white sauce. It is one of the most liked pasta recipes.

food.recipe: Make a cold pasta salad with blanched fresh vegetables and a light vinaigrette, or sauté zucchini, squash, tomatoes, and onions and mix into a pot of hot pasta. Everyone loves a rich cheesy sauce with pasta and, since we replaced the heavy cream with whole buttermilk in this recipe
food.step 1: Heat 2 tbsps olive oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step 2: Add refined flour and sauté, stirring continuously, for 2-3 minutes. Add buttermilk gradually and stir continuously to avoid lumps. Add salt and black pepper powder, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 3: Heat remaining oil in another non-stick pan, add bell pepper and toss. Add salt and black pepper powder, mix well and cook till soft.Add spinach puree to the buttermilk sauce and mix well and adjust seasoning.
food.step 4: Add penne and mix well. Add cheese, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.Transfer into a serving bowl, top with sautéed bell peppers and serve hot.

food.recipe: patrode is a savory vegetarian dish from Malvani and Maharashtrian cuisine. Basic ingredients are the same throughout the entire region—colocasia leaves stuffed (or chopped up) with a mixture of gram flour, rice flour, tamarind, jaggery, and various spices, while patrode variations differ only in shape (sliced rolls or dumplings) and the cooking method (steamed or fried).
food.step 1: To begin making the Pathrode Recipe, wash and soak the rice and dal in water for 3 to 6 hours.
food.step 2: Wash the colocasia leaves, remove the stem & the large veins of the leaves with the help of a knife. This will help them cook fast and make them less itchy.
food.step 3: Drain off the excess water from rice and grind all mentioned masala ingredients (except the leaves) to chutney/spread consistency.
food.step 4: Now first take the largest/biggest leaf. Keep leaf upside down and smear a layer of masala on back side of leaf. Place the second leaf on top of the first leaf & smear masala. Repeat the process for 3 to 5 leaves.
food.step 5: n one pathravadev roll there should be minimum 3 leaves. Now pathravade is ready for rolls.
food.step6: After it is rolled, smear the paste on top of it. Once the rolls are done,steam cook these rolls 15 to 20 minutes.
food.step7: Wait till the pathravade cools down a bit.
food.step8: Once the pathravade is cooled, you can serve them in 2 ways. Just slice them, smear little butter and relish or shallow fry them with coconut oil till they turn crisp. Serve hot.
food.step9: Serve Pathravade as a side dish along with your Konkan meal of Konkani Style Vengaya Sagle and Tawa Parathas during weekday lunch or dinner.
food.restaurants: ["Banjara Dhaba","hakkasan mumbai","bayroute cuffe parade","veranda","pali bahvan","salt water cafe"]
food.description: Pathravade, a masterpiece from the Konkan and Mangalorean cuisine. Pathravade is prepared using colocasia leaves. The leaves are smeared with a spicy, tangy rice and coconut paste.

food.recipe: Pav bhaji is a popular street food from Mumbai consisting of spiced smooth mashed mix vegetables, served with lightly toasted buttered bread.
food.step 1: Heat a pan or kadai. You can also use a large tawa. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons butter. You can use amul butter or any brand of butter. Butter can be salted or unsalted
food.step 2: As soon as the butter melts, add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds.
food.step 3: Let the cumin seeds crackle and change their color.
food.step 4: Then add ½ cup finely chopped onions.
food.step 5: Mix onions with the butter and saute on a low to medium flame till the onions translucent.
food.step6: Then add 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste. You can also crush 1.5 inch ginger and 5 to 6 medium garlic cloves in a mortar-pestle.
food.step7: Mix and saute till the raw aroma of both ginger and garlic goes away
food.step8: Then add chopped green chilies. mix well.
food.step9: Now add 2 cups finely chopped tomatoes. mix very well.
food.step10: Then begin to saute tomatoes on a low to medium flame
food.step11: Saute till the tomatoes become soft and mushy and you see butter releasing from the sides. This takes about 6 to 7 minutes on a low to medium flame. If the tomatoes start sticking to the pan, then sprinkle some water and mix well.
food.step12: When the tomatoes have softened, then add ½ cup finely chopped capsicum (green bell pepper). Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes. If the mixture starts sticking to the pan, then you can sprinkle some water. You don’t need to cook the capsicum till very soft. A little crunch is alright.
food.step13: Add 1 teaspoon turmeric powder and 1 teaspoon kashmiri red chilli powder.
food.ingredients: 3 medium sizes potatoes or 250 grams potatoes, peeled and chopped
food.ingredient 2: 1 to 1.25 cups chopped cauliflower or 120 to 130 grams cauliflower
food.ingredient 4: 1 cup green peas, fresh or frozen
food.ingredient 5: 2.25 to 2.5 cups water for pressure cooking
food.ingredient 6: 3 tablespoons amul butter, butter is also added later while serving, you can add upto 5 to 6 tablespoons of butter too for a richer version
food.ingredient 8: 1 large onion, finely chopped or ½ cup finely chopped onion
food.ingredient 9: 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste or 1.5 inch ginger and 5 to 6 medium garlic cloves crushed in a mortar-pestle.
food.ingredient 11: ½ cup finely chopped capsicum or 1 medium sized capsicum (green bell pepper), finely chopped
food.ingredient 12: 2 cups tightly packed finely chopped tomatoes, or about 2 to 3 large tomatoes, finely chopped
food.ingredient 14: 1 teaspoon kashmiri chilli powder or freshly ground 1 to 2 soaked dry kashmiri red chilies - the latter works much better and imparts a beautiful orange color to the bhaji
food.ingredient 15: 2 to 3 tablespoons pav bhaji masala, add as required
food.ingredient 16: 1.5 to 2 cups water or the stock in which the veggies were cooked or add as required
food.ingredient 18: 12 pavs for serving with the bhaji
food.restaurants: ["Blue Park","sardar pav bhaji","Famous pav bhaji","manohar pav bhaji","cannon pav bhaji","lisha pav bhaji"]
food.description: Pav bhaji is a fast food dish from India. It consists of a thick vegetable curry served with a soft bread roll. Vegetables in the curry may include potatoes, onions, carrots, chillies, peas, bell peppers, beans and tomatoes. Its origins are in the state of Maharashtra.

food.recipe: Peanut rice is a tasty east and south Indian rice variety made with roasted peanut powder, lentils and spices. this groundnut rice is also called as verkadalai sadam and is made in South Indian homes.
food.step 1: Rinse 1 cup rice couple of times in water and then soak in enough water for 20 to 30 minutes. If using brown rice, then for about 30 to 45 minutes.
food.step 2: Later drain all the water and add the rice in a pressure cooker. Also add ½ teaspoon salt or add as required.
food.step 3: Add 1.75 to 2 cups water or add as required for regular white rice. If using hand pounded rice then add 2.25 to 2.5 cups water. If using brown rice, then add 3 cups water.
food.step 4: For white rice, pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium flame. For hand pounded rice, pressure cook for 7 to 8 whistles and for brown rice pressure cook for 10 to 12 whistles on medium flame.
food.step7: Heat a small pan. Keep the flame to a medium-low. Add ½ cup peanuts.
food.step8: Stirring often begin to roast the peanuts.
food.step9: Roast till the peanuts become crunchy and crisp. You will see some blisters and black spots on the peanuts.
food.step10: Remove the roasted peanuts in a plate and keep aside.
food.step12: Stirring continuously roast chana dal on a low flame till they change color and become golden. They will also become aromatic. remove and keep aside.
food.ingredients: 1.75 to 2 cups water or add as required
food.ingredient 2: ½ teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 4: 1 tablespoon chana dal (split and husked bengal gram)
food.ingredient 5: 1 tablespoon urad dal (split and husked black gram)
food.ingredient 6: 3 dry red chilies - broken and seeds removed (can use byadagi or kashmiri red chilies)
food.ingredient 12: salt as required, to be added later

food.description: Peanut rice is a tasty South Indian rice variety made with roasted peanut powder, lentils and spices.

food.recipe: Most of the Chinese chicken dishes call for frying the marinated chicken and then stir frying the chicken in a sauce. So, when it comes to Chinese dishes, I dare to try mixing the fried chicken in different kinds of sauces.
food.step 1: Heat two tablespoons sesame oil in a wok. Add baby corn and sauté. Add chicken and continue to sauté. Add broccoli and orange juice and cook.
food.step 2: Heat the remaining sesame oil in another pan. Roll the wonton strips and further cut them into thin slices. Add it to the pan and fry till crisp. Add salt, soy sauce to the chicken and mix.
food.step 3: Add cornflour mixed in half a cup of water and add to the chicken along with peanuts and sesame seeds. Mix well. Add red capsicum and cook on high heat for two minutes.
food.step 4: Transfer into a serving dish. Top it with fried wonton strips and serve hot.

food.ingredient 12: Red capsicum seeded and sliced 1 small

food.recipe: Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of rapidly boiling salted water until al dente. Drain well. Meanwhile, cook the pumpkin in a saucepan of boiling water for 10-12 minutes, or until just tender, then drain.
food.step 1: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil on a non stick grill pan, place the pumpkin cubes on it, sprinkle a little salt and lemon juice and grill till slightly burnt. Heat the remaining olive oil in another non stick pan, add garlic and saute till lightly burnt.
food.step 2: Add pumpkin and mash them lightly with the back of a fork. Add penne, cream, salt, 1½ tsps crushed red chillies and mix well. Add vegetable stock gradually and cook till thick.
food.step 3: Transfer into a serving plate and place bits of ricotta cheese all over. Garnish with parsley and remaining crushed red chillies and serve hot.

food.recipe: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir mushrooms and shallot in melted butter until the mushrooms are lightly browned and soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside to cool for 10 minutes.
food.step 1: Halve mushrooms. Heat 2 tbsps extra virgin olive oil in a non stick pan, add mushrooms and cook, tossing them occasionally for even cooking.
food.step 2: To make the pesto, grind together basil leaves, garlic, pine nuts, salt, peppercorns, parmesan cheese and 4 tbsps extra virgin olive oil to a smooth paste.
food.step 3: Add fresh cream to the mushrooms and cook. Chop red capsicum into ¼ inch pieces. Add pesto to the mushrooms and mix. Adjust salt. Add red capsicum and mix. Serve hot garnished with a few slices of Parmesan cheese.

food.recipe: Place spinach, basil, pine nuts, garlic, and cheese in a mini food processor; pulse until finely chopped. With processor running, gradually add oil; process until smooth. Spread evenly over bread; cut into quarters
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C. To prepare pesto sauce, grind parmesan cheese and pine nuts to a coarse powder. Add garlic cloves and continue to grind for a few seconds. Add basil leaves, olive oil, salt and peppercorns and grind into a coarse paste.
food.step 2: Cut bread slices into roundels with a round cookie cutter and arrange them on a baking tray. Toast them lightly in the preheated oven.
food.step 3: Apply the pesto sauce on the bread roundels and sprinkle mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven till the cheese melts. Serve hot.

food.description: A rustic stew demands a crusty baguette for sopping up whatever is left in the bowl. A fresh pesto is the ideal spread here. You can use walnuts or almonds in place of pine nuts and spinach or even parsley in place of the basil.

food.recipe: With just 8 simple ingredients and 30 minutes of your time, this is undoubtedly the most popular must-have winter delicacy!!
food.step 1: Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan, add rice flour, mix and sauté on low heat, stirring continuously, till it is aromatic, taking care that the colour doesn’t change much. Switch off heat. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool down.
food.step 2: Heat another non-stick deep pan, add jaggery and add ¼ cup water and cook on medium heat till jaggery melts. Continue cooking for 3-4 minutes more, stirring continuously, till the syrup becomes a little thick. No need for single thread consistency but it should be sticky.
food.step 3: Heat a small non-stick pan, add white sesame seeds and dry roast on low heat till it turns a light brown. Remove from heat, add to the rice flour and mix well.
food.step 4: Add almonds, cashew nuts and coconut slices to rice flour and mix well.
food.step 5: Add melted jaggery, a little at a time, to the rice flour mixture and mix well after each addition. When it cools down a bit, crush the mixture with hands.
food.step6: Sprinkle a little milk over the mixture and mix well. Continue to do this till the mixture holds shape.
food.step7: Divide the mixture into lemon sized portions and shape them into a laddoo, further flatten two ends to shape them like small cigars
food.step8: Garnish each pinni with chopped almonds and cashewnuts. Transfer pinnis on a serving plate and sprinkle some almonds and cashewnuts on the plate. Serve immediately.

food.ingredient 6: Roasted cashewnuts chopped 2 tablespo to garnish

food.recipe: Tear the basil leaves into pieces first, then grind the leaves against the side of a mortar with a pestle to puree them into a silky, creamy sauce. Like its Italian twin, pistou can also be served as an accompaniment to grilled meats, poultry, fish and vegetables.
food.step 1: Place the courgette, potato, shallot, carrot and tomatoes in a large pan.
food.step 2: Add vegetable stock and season with salt and pepper powder. Bring the mixture to boil, reduce heat and simmer Add the French beans, green peas and pasta and cook till the pasta is tender.
food.step 3: Adjust the seasoning. Put the soup into individual bowls.
food.step 4: Mix together pesto sauce and sun dried tomatoes paste and stir into each bowl
food.step 5: Sprinkle grated parmesan cheese on the soup in each bowl and serve hot.

food.description: Pistou is an olive oil—based basil sauce from the south of France that closely resembles Ligurian pesto. There's only one way to make true pistou—by hand

food.recipe: In tradtional pitla recipe, gram flour is cooked like a vegetable in a spicy onion-ginger-garlic-chilli curry base. It is the perfect recipe to make when you don’t have any vegetable at home! In preparation it is slightly similar to that of besan kadhi except that in pitla recipe there is no yogurt and the gram flour is first dry roasted with the onions and then cooked with water.
food.step 1: To make pitle, heat oil in a non-stick pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add green chillies, asafoetida, turmeric powder, onion and sauté till translucent. Add 1½ cups water, salt and mix well. Cook till onions become soft.
food.step 2: Mix gram flour, red chilli powder and salt in a bowl. Add sufficient water and mix well to make a batter.
food.step 3: Add the gram flour batter and mix well. Cover and cook for 5-6 minutes
food.step 4: Add kokum pieces and mix well. Add coriander leaves and mix well.
food.step 5: To make bhakri, mix millet flour and salt in a bowl. Add sufficient lukewarm water gradually and knead into stiff dough.
food.step6: Heat a non-stick tawa.
food.step7: Divide into equal portions and roll into balls. Pat each of them between dampened palms into bhakris. Similarly prepare the rest.
food.step8: Place a bhakri on hot tawa, apply a little water on top. Pat a bit and cook for a minute on each side.
food.step9: Transfer pitlein a serving bowl and serve with onions, green chillies and bhakri.
food.ingredient 10: Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped 2 tablespoons

food.description: Pitla is a traditional Maharashtrian curry made with besan (gram flour) and onions. A spicy base of ginger-garlic-green-chillies and onions is cooked with gram flour and water until thick.

food.recipe: This is a dry potato sabzi served with pooris and sometimes accompanied with onion slices, lemon wedges and coconut chutney. The puri bhaji is also served with dal, rice, raita or salad/Koshimbir in a thali.
food.step 1: Boil the potatoes till they are cooked completely.
food.step 2: Once they are warm, peel them and chop.
food.step 3: In a pan, heat oil. Add cumin, mustard and urad dal
food.step 4: Fry till the mustard crackles and starts making sound and the urad dal begins to turn brown.
food.step 5: Add the chopped onion. Fry till they become soft & transparent.
food.step6: Now add the ginger and green chilies. Fry for a minute.
food.step7: Add the curry leaves. Stir and fry for some seconds.
food.step8: Add the turmeric and asafoetida. Stir and fry for some seconds. Don't burn the turmeric
food.step9: Next, add the chopped potatoes, half of the coriander leaves.
food.step10: Stir. Now add 3/4 water and salt. Stir and cover the pan.
food.step11: Let the bhaji simmer for 5-6 minutes on a low flame.
food.step12: There should be some moisture in the bhaji and it should not be very dry.
food.step13: Add the remaining coriander leaves.

food.step 4: Heat mustard oil in a wok or pan. Temper the oil with 'whole spices' and when they start bristling add finely chopped onion and fry till golden.
food.step 5: Add chopped tomato and fry till the tomato is mushy.
food.step7: Fry the masala till oil starts leaving the sides.
food.step8: Add the marinated chicken pieces and fry them till the raw smell goes off and they loose their pink color and becomes a light yellow.
food.step9: Adjust salt as need and add about 1/2 cup of water or more as needed for the gravy.
food.step10: Cover the lid and cook till the chicken is done. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

food.recipe: So brown them, then remove them, and add some of them back in at the end. This is because the mushrooms that are cooked with the rice lose their caramelisation and we all know what a fan I am of the golden bits. Always the best flavour

food.step 4: Add the cornflour mixture to the mushrooms. Cook for a minute or until the sauce thickens, stirring continuously. Pour the sauce over the rice, add the spring onions, cover with a lid and cook in the preheated oven for twelve to fifteen minutes.
food.step 5: Uncover the pot, stir the contents well, garnish with the spring onion greens and serve hot.

food.recipe: Pulao or pilaf, is comfort food at its best and I make it when I want to cook something quick, easy and satisfying. This one-pot dish made with rice and vegetables has added spices and herbs, giving it a mild aromatic flavor
food.step 1: Rinse rice till the water runs clear of starch and become transparent while rinsing.
food.step 2: Soak the rice in enough water for 30 minutes. Drain all the water and keep the soaked rice aside.
food.step 3: Rinse, peel and chop the vegetables.
food.step 4: Crush chopped ginger, garlic and green chillies to a paste in a mortar-pestle or grind them in a small mixer or grinder with a bit of water.
food.step 5: In a deep thick bottomed pot or pan, heat ghee or oil and fry all the whole spices mentioned above, till the oil becomes fragrant and the spices splutter.
food.step6: Add the onions and saute them till golden. Saute the onions on a low to medium-low flame and stir often for uniform browning.
food.step8: Add the tomatoes and saute for 2 to 3 minutes on a low to medium-low flame
food.step9: Add all the chopped veggies and saute again for 1 to 2 minutes on a low to medium-low flame.
food.step10: Add rice and saute gently for 1 to 2 minutes on a low or medium-low flame, so that the rice gets well coated with the oil.
food.step11: Add water and lemon juice. Mix and stir.
food.step12: Cover tightly and let the rice cook on a low flame, till the water is absorbed and the rice is well cooked.
food.step13: Check in between a few times to check if the water is enough. Depending on the quality of rice, you may need to add less or more water. With a fork too, you can gently stir the rice without breaking the rice grains.

food.recipe: The  method is with roasting mangoes. Usually mangoes are roasted on hot charcoal. They can also be roasted on a fire stove. Roasting mangoes on fire does impart a smoky flavor in the aam panna
food.step 1: Rinse and then wipe dry the mangoes. Keep a roti rack or papad rack on a gas stove top. Place the mangoes on it.
food.step 2: Keep on turning them at intervals so that they are charred and cooked evenly.
food.step 3: The peels should get charred. To check doneness, slid a knife on one of the sides and the knife should slid easily without any resistance.
food.step 4: Keep the roasted mangoes aside and let them cool at room temperature. You can also keep them in water for some minutes and then peel them. Once they cool down, then remove the charred peels.
food.step 5: Remove the peels well. slice the mangoes.
food.step6: Add the sliced mango pulp to a blender or mixer jar. Then add ¼ cup mint leaves.
food.step7: Add 1 teaspoon roasted cumin powder and ½ teaspoon black salt.
food.step8: Next add 1 cup sugar. For aam panna, the sugar is added twice of the mango pulp. I had got slightly more than ½ cup of mango pulp. Hence I added 1 cup sugar. Depending on the type and quality of mangoes the amount of pulp will vary. So do measure the pulp before you add sugar. So if you get lets say, 1 cup mango pulp, then add 2 cups sugar.
food.step9: Without adding any water, blend till smooth.
food.step10: The aam panna concentrate should have a smooth consistency. If there are fibres in the pulp, then do strain it. Remove in a clean small jar or bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
food.step11: Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of the aam panna concentrate in a glass.
food.step12: Then add water and mix very well.
food.step13: Add ice cubes.

food.ingredient 4: 1 teaspoon roasted cumin powder (bhuna jeera powder)

food.description: A cooling traditional summer drink in most parts of India is aam ka panna. Its also called as kairi ka panna.

food.recipe: You can leave the garlic in its peel. I recommend peeling the onion though and cutting that in half. Then drizzle both with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. You can also roast the red peppers (see tips on that below). But I love the convenience (and price) of the jarred roasted red peppers.
food.step 1: Rub bell pepper generously with olive oil and roast on open flame till charred.
food.step 2: Rub red chillies and garlic cloves with olive oil and roast in oven at 180ºC for 5-8 minutes.
food.step 3: Scrape off the charred skin of bell pepper and wash gently. Deseed, roughly tear and place in a blander jar along with roasted chillies and garlic and almonds and blend. Add ¼ cup olive oil and blend into a coarse paste.
food.step 4: Heat a non-stick pan. Add prepared paste and sauté well. Add coconut milk, stir to mix and cook for a minute.
food.step 5: Add spaghetti and toss. Add salt, Parmesan cheese powder and crushed peppercorns and mix.
food.step6: Roughly chop basil leaves and add. Mix well and let it get heated through.
food.ingredient 3: Olive oil ¼ cup + for dusting

food.description: It may sound like a bit of work to roast the onions and garlic and blend it all up with the roasted peppers. But the roasting part is totally inactive cooking time, and the blending only takes a minute. And in the end you get a mouth-watering healthy roasted red pepper sauce that has this unique sweet and savory taste.

food.recipe: Fresh cherry tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, and seasonings are all roasted until deliciously tender and slightly charred.  The mixture is tossed with pasta for a simple and incredibly flavorful meal in just minutes.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 200°C. Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a pan and place tomatoes. Drizzle one tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle salt. Roast in the preheated oven for fifteen to twenty minutes. The skin of the tomatoes should be charred.
food.step 2: Remove skin and roughly chop tomatoes. Boil three cups of water in a deep pan. Add salt, one tablespoon of olive oil and farfalle and boil till al dente. Drain and refresh in cold water to stop the cooking process. Add one tablespoon of olive oil and set aside. Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a pan, add garlic and sauté.
food.step 3: When they turn light brown, add tomatoes and continue to sauté. Add sundried tomatoes and farfalle and cook on high heat. Add salt and mix. Add fresh basil, torn with hand. Add another tablespoon of olive oil and freshly crushed peppercorns. Toss and serve hot garnished with some more basil leaves.
food.ingredient 6: Sundried tomatoes soaked and ground 2 tablespoons

food.description: Fresh cherry tomato pasta is a dish I make all year long.  It’s crazy-easy and so loaded with flavor that everyone raves over it! Sometimes the simplest dishes make the best meals.

food.recipe: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan. Add 2 finely chopped onions, 2 sliced garlic cloves and 1 roughly chopped carrot. Cook for 5-7 mins over a medium heat until softened. Turn up the heat a little and stir in 2 tbsp tomato purée. Cook for 1 min, pour in 200ml white wine, then cook for 5 mins until this has reduced by two-thirds. Pour over 3 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes and add 1 handful of basil leaves.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 200°C. Roughly chop baby corns, button mushrooms, green zucchini, yellow squash and place in a baking tray. Chop 1 onion into large chunks and add.
food.step 2: Chop green, red and yellow capsicums and add. Drizzle 2 tbsps olive oil, salt, 1 tbsp chopped garlic, a little paprika powder, a few thyme sprigs, ¼ tsp crushed black peppercorns and mix.
food.step 3: Roast vegetables in the preheated oven at 200°C for 20 minutes. Set aside. Boil water with 1 tbsp olive oil in a deep non-stick pan.
food.step 4: Put lasagne sheets in the boiling water, reduce heat and cook for about 6-7 minutes. Heat 3 tbsps olive oil in a non-stick pan, add 1 tbsp garlic.
food.step 5: Chop the other onion and add along with tomatoes, paprika powder and salt and mix. Add tomato puree and simmer. Drain lasagne sheets and set aside on a plate to dry.
food.step6: Add roasted vegetables to tomato sauce and mix. Heat another non-stick pan, pour cream, salt, cream cheese spread and mix till well blended. Take a baking bowl, drizzle remaining olive oil.
food.step7: Place a lasagne sheet and spread roasted vegetables. Finely slice mozzarella cheese and place some slices over the vegetables.
food.step8: Place another lasagne sheet and repeat the layers till all the vegetables and lasagne sheets are used up.
food.step9: Pour cream cheese mixture over the top, place remaining mozzarella slices on top and bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes or till the cheese melts. Serve hot.

food.recipe: Rumali roti is one of the unleavened Indian breads that is made traditionally in the Awadhi, Mughlai and Hyderabadi cuisine. Rumali roti is also one of the popular breads that is served in Indian restaurants
food.step 1: In a large bowl or a parat (wide rimmed plate) take 2 cups whole wheat flour (240 grams atta) and ½ cup + 3 tablespoons all purpose flour (80 grams maida).
food.step 2: Also add 1.5 teaspoon salt or add as required.
food.step 3: Add 1.25 to 1.35 cups water in parts or intervals.
food.step 4: Mix and begin to knead. adding water in parts knead to a slightly sticky dough.
food.step 5: Cover the dough with a moist cotton napkin or muslin. Keep aside for 30 minutes.
food.step6: After 30 minutes again knead the dough.
food.step7: Make medium sized balls from the dough. Cover with the moist cotton napkin and keep aside.
food.step8: Take a dough ball and sprinkle some whole wheat flour (chapati atta) all over.
food.step9: With a rolling pin (belan) begin to roll the dough.
food.step10: While rolling sprinkle flour evenly all over if the dough sticks or gets sticky. Roll to thin rotis having 11 to 12 inches diameter
food.step11: Do not add too much flour when rolling. Add only enough flour which will help in rolling. If there is a lot of flour covering the rotis, then the rotis will become hard.
food.step12: Roll to thin and slightly transparent rotis. Also roll evenly and keep edges thin if they become thick.
food.ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour or 240 grams
food.ingredient 2: ½ cup + 3 tablespoons all purpose flour or 80 grams
food.ingredient 3: 1.5 teaspoon salt or add as required
food.restaurants: ["Carter's Blue","Delhi Darbar","Punjab Grill","Curry Me Up","Ahmed Bhai's Bry & Dry","SpiceKlub","Goila Butter Chicken","Shalimar","Pritam Da Dhaba","Pratap The Dhaba","Khyber","Bademiya Fine Dine Restaurant"]
food.description: Rumali roti are thin soft rotis and can be folded like a handkerchief. Hence the name rumali or roomali roti. The word 'rumal' means handkerchief in hindi language.

food.recipe: a light curry dish common in northern Indian cooking, include a light sauce made flavorful with turmeric, cinnamon, garam masala, and fresh spinach with lightly browned pan-fried chicken
food.step 1: Take spinach in a deep non-stick pan, add mustard leaves and ½ cup water and keep the pan on heat. Add 1 tbsp garlic, 1 tbsp ginger and salt, mix well and cook for 10 minutes. Blend with a hand blender into a semi-coarse paste.
food.step 2: Heat ghee and oil in a non-stick pan, add bay leaf, cinnamon, black cardamom, green cardamoms, dried red chillies, mix and sauté till fragrant.
food.step 3: Add onion and a pinch of salt, mix well and sauté till the onion turns golden brown.
food.step 4: Add chicken and salt, mix well, and sauté on high heat for for 5 minutes.
food.step 5: Add remaining ginger, remaining garlic, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and tomato, mix well, cover and cook for 5 minutes.
food.step6: Add ½ cup of water, mix well, cover and let it simmer for5 minutes.
food.step7: Add the ground saag paste maize flour and garam masala powder, mix well, cover and cook on low heat for 10 minutes
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with white butter and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Chicken cut into bite sized pieces on the bone 750 grams
food.restaurants: ["Butter Chicken Factory","Fried Chicken Cuisine","MFC - Mr. Fried Chicken","Chicken On The Run","Papa Pancho Da Dhaba","Global Fusion","Koliwada Chicken & Fish Fry Corner","Navjeevan","Goila Butter Chicken","Soul Curry"]
food.description: This is also a dish that is easily prepared in advance by making the curry sauce recipe ahead of time and then cooking the full recipe with chicken and additional spices in small batches.

food.recipe: When you make the sabudana khichdi, you have to adjust the soaking time as per the type of tapioca pearls. For some pearls 2 to 3 hours is fine. For some you don’t even need to soak them in water. Just cover the pearls with water for some time and you are done. So do soak the sabudana pearls accordingly.
food.step 1: Rinse sabudana very well in water. Then soak sabudana overnight or for 3 to 5 hours.
food.step 2: Next day drain the sabudana very well and keep aside in a bowl.
food.step 3: Boil the potatoes and when warm peel and chop them.
food.step 4: In a pan dry roast the peanuts till browned and when cooled make a coarse powder in a mortar-pestle or in a dry grinder.
food.step 5: Mix the coarsely powdered peanuts, salt and sugar with the drained sabudana.
food.step6: Now heat peanut oil or ghee. Fry the cumin first till they crackle and get browned.
food.step7: Now add the curry leaves and green chillies. Fry for a few seconds and then add the grated ginger. Both curry leaves and ginger are optional and can be skipped.
food.step8: Saute for a couple of seconds till the raw smell of the ginger goes away. Now add chopped boiled potato and saute for a minute
food.step9: Add the sabudana. Keep on stirring often on a low flame for approx 4 to 6 minutes.
food.step10: When the sabudana loses their opaqueness and starts becoming translucent they are cooked.
food.step11: Don't overcook as they might become lumpy and hard.
food.step12: Switch off the flame and add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves. Mix well.
food.step13: While serving garnish with a few coriander leaves and drizzle with some lemon juice. You can even add some grated fresh coconut on top.
food.ingredient 9: ½ to 1 teaspoon sugar or as required
food.ingredient 10: ½ to 1 teaspoon lemon juice or as required (optional)
food.restaurants: ["chai pe charcha","spare & sons","metkut","aaswad","girgaon katta","soam","vinay health home","jivhala","prakash dugdh mandir"]
food.description: Sabudana ki khichdi Is usually made during fasting days like Navratri or mahashivratri or Ekadashi. It is an easy snack and is a good recipe to be made during fasting days but it requires little experience to get the perfect nonsticky texture in the sabudana pearls

food.recipe: Sabudana thalipeeth are crisp and soft pancakes made with tapioca pearls, mashed potatoes, ground peanuts and spices.
food.step 1: Add the mashed potatoes and all the ingredients to the soaked sabudana. Mix well.
food.step 2: Heat a non stick frying pan.
food.step 3: Spread 1 or 2 teaspoon of peanut oil or ghee on the pan.
food.step 4: Apply some oil on your palms.
food.step 5: Take some portion from the mixture and flatten it with your palms.
food.step6: You can also flatten on a ziplock bag. i find it easier to flatten with my palms
food.step7: Place the flattened round (thalipeeth) on the frying pan.
food.step8: Fry till both sides are golden brown and crisp. Repeat.
food.step9: If you have a large pan, you can cook 2-3 thalipeeths at the same time.
food.step10: Serve sabudana thalipeeth with a phalahari chutney or raita.
food.ingredient 2: 2 medium or large potatoes, boiled, peeled and mashed
food.ingredient 4: 4 tablespoon peanuts, roasted and coarsely ground
food.ingredient 5: ½ inch ginger, finely chopped or grated
food.ingredient 8: 1 teaspoon sugar or add as required
food.ingredient 10: peanut oil or ghee as required for frying
food.restaurants: ["hotel ram ashray","arya bhawan","aaswad","craftbar","taj mahal tea house"]
food.description: Serve the Sabudana thalipeeth with any falahari chutney or raita. I served with dahi aloo and tamarind dates chutney. The dahi wale aloo were made with cashew yogurt.

food.recipe: Noteworthy changes in Italian cuisine happened with the discovery of the New World and the introduction of potatoes, tomatoes, bell peppers and maize, which are now an integral part of this cuisine.  Italian cuisine is known for its regional diversity each with a distinct taste.  This cuisine today is probably one of the most popular in the world.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 180º C. Grease a baking tray with oil
food.step 2: Add saffron to three-fourth cup of water and set aside.
food.step 3: Put yeast in a bowl, add one tablespoon warm water and set aside for two minutes to activate.
food.step 4: Put flour in a bowl, add salt, dissolved yeast and water as required and knead into a soft dough. Add one teaspoon oil and knead again. Divide the dough into small equal portions.
food.step 5: Grease your palms with a little oil and roll the portions into thin long sticks. Place them on the baking tray and set aside for ten to fifteen minutes to prove.
food.step6: Place the tray in the preheated oven and bake for twenty minutes or till golden.
food.step7: Remove, cool and serve as an accompaniment with soups

food.description: Italian cuisine has developed through centuries of social and political changes, with roots stretching to antiquity.  Italian cuisine is simple and a number of dishes having only four to eight ingredients.

food.recipe: The food is just awesome and tourists come from far and wide to taste the chicken preparation of this area. Today I am presenting the famous Sangameshwari chicken. This is especially eaten as a Protein and Fats booster in winters.
food.step 1: Put chicken pieces in a bowl, add salt and green paste, mix well and set aside.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cinnamon, peppercorns, black cardamom, cloves, stone flower and poppy seeds and sauté till fragrant. Add dried coconut, mix and sauté for 5 minutes or till the mixture is dark brown. Remove from heat and cool.
food.step 3: Heat ghee in a deep non-stick pan. Add garlic and sauté for 30 seconds. Add onion and sauté till golden. Add marinated chicken, mix and cook for 2 minutes
food.step 4: Add chilli powder and mix well. Add ½ cup water, mix, cover and cook on low heat for 10 minutes.
food.step 5: Grind together the sautéed spice-coconut mixture with some water to a fine paste. Add this to the chicken, mix, cover and cook for 5 minutes.
food.step6: Add lemon juice and mix well. Add coriander leaves, mix and cook on low heat for 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, mix and cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
food.step7: Serve hot garnished with a coriander sprig.
food.ingredients: Chicken on the bone cut into bite sized pieces 750 grams
food.ingredient 2: Green chutney (grind coriander leaves, green chillies, ginger, g 3 tablespoons
food.ingredient 11: Dried coconut ( khopra) grated ½ cup
food.ingredient 17: Fresh coriander leaves chopped + a sprig for garnishing 2 tablespoon
