food.description: Sangameshwar is a taluka in the Konkan region falling in the Ratnagiri district and has a food history when it comes to spicy coastal food, happening on the sangam of the two rivers Sonavi and Shastri.

food.recipe: It was playing on my mind for a while to recreate this dish once again but I was not getting the right composition of the masala used to make this mutton. I chanced to get a ready made pack of Saoji Masala with the key ingredients already fried and packed, I decided to give it a try.
food.step 1: Heat 1tbsps oil in a non stick pan. Add coriander seeds, shahi jeera, black cardamoms, green cardamoms, dried chillies cloves, black peppercorns, cinnamon, bay leaf, poppy seeds,dried coconut slices and stone flower. Mix and sauté till fragrant. Then add jowar flour and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step 2: Heat 1 tablespoons oil pan and cook onion slice on gold brown colour. Transfer the spices and onion in grinder jar add ginger and garlic make smooth paste. Add water if require.
food.step 3: Add 1 tablespoons oil in pressure cooker.Add mutton and turmeric and some salt and sauté for 2 minutes.Cover and cook till 6 - 7whistlesz
food.step 4: In big pan heat 2 tablespoons oil. Add ground paste and mix well and cook for 2 minutes. Red chilli powder and salt.
food.step 5: Open the lid of the cooker when pressure reduces completely.Add the cooked mutton in to in pan mix well cook for another 15-20 minutes. Serve hot with jovar bhakari or wheat chapati.

food.recipe: So, my trick to stuffing sausage is simple. Use kitchen shears to split open the casing along one side. Do not remove the casing. Simple open the sausage down the middle, stuff in the cheese stick, and then reform the sausage around the cheese stick.
food.step 1: Roughly chop sausages and put in a blender jar. Add onion, garlic, 1 teaspoon chilli flakes and salt and blend coarsely. Add cheese and blend again.
food.step 2: Combine cornstarch, rice flour, refined flour, salt and remaining chilli flakes in a bowl and mix well. Add drinking soda and mix well into a smooth batter of coating consistency.
food.step 3: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
food.step 4: Stuff jalapeno chillies with the sausage mixture, dip in the batter and deep-fry in hot oil till golden. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step 5: Serve hot.

food.recipe: A homemade Italian Sausage and Pepperoni Pizza recipe with sweet Italian sausage and real sliced pepperoni plus a recipe for homemade pizza dough and tomato sauce.
food.step 1: Sift refined flour with salt and make a well in the centre. Dissolve yeast in 1 tbsp lukewarm water along with sugar and pour into the well. Add ¾ cup chilled water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside at room temperature till it doubles in size. For the sauce, heat olive oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté. Chop onion and add. Sauté till soft. Add tomato concasse, tomato puree, salt, sugar, oregano and mix
food.step 2: Tear a few fresh basil leaves and add. Let it cook till it reaches a sauce consistency. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil and knock back the dough lightly, divide into 4 equal portions and set aside for about 20 minutes in a warm place. For topping slice onions and crush lightly.
food.step 3: Slice sausages diagonally. Heat a non-stick pan. Spread one portion of the dough on a work top to make a round of the pan size. Put it in the pan. Spread some of the sauce all over. Spread the sausages, onions, mozzarella cheese and sprinkle crushed red chillies and basil leaves.

food.description: I just never really liked the only-meat toppings this style offers.  Funny…since that’s pretty much the main reason why Dustin loves it. Add some breakfast bacon and maybe some salami and he’s in heaven.

food.recipe: This is an easy-to-make stir-fry recipe with vegetables and a type of plain wheat noodles called Hakka noodles For this recipe, everything is cooked quickly on high heat in order to maintain the vegetables' crunchiness.
food.step 1: Heat butter in a non-stick pan. Heat oil in another non-stick pan.
food.step 2: Add garlic to the pan with oil and saute. And beans, carrot and cabbage to the pan with butter and saute
food.step 3: Add noodles to the garlic and mix well. Add salt and crushed black peppercorns and mix well. Transfer into a serving dish.
food.step 4: When the vegetables are half done, add sweet chilli sauce and mix. Put this on top of the noodles.
food.step 5: Serve hot garnished with a few thin strips of green capsicum.

food.recipe: Semiya is whole wheat vermicelli. it is also known as seviyan in North India and vermicelli in english language. It is used in making many recipes like seviyan kheer.
food.step 1: In a muslin or cotton kitchen napkin, take all the spices and herbs mentioned above in the list 'for bouqet garni or spices potli'.
food.step 2: Take the ends of the muslin and secure or tie it like a potli (small bundle). Keep aside.
food.step 3: Rinse, peel and chop the veggies. Then add them in the pressure cooker.
food.step 4: Add 2 cups water. Depending on the type of seviyan used, you can add 2 to 2.25 cups water. If using a pan to make yakhni, then add 2.5 cups water
food.step 5: Place the prepared spice bag (potli).
food.step6: Pressure cook for 1 to 2 whistles or 9 to 10 minutes on medium flame.
food.step7: When the pressure settles down on its own, open the lid and check if the veggies are done. Let the yakhni stock become warm.
food.step8: Squeeze the spice bag to extract more of the spice flavors. Remove it from the yakhni stock. Check taste of stock and add more salt if required. The yakhni should have a slightly salty taste. Then cover and keep the mix vegetable yakhni aside.
food.step10: Keep the flame to low or medium-low. Add broken vermicelli.
food.step11: Mix the vermicelli strands with the ghee and begin to roast them.
food.step12: Roast stirring continuously so that semiya strands get evenly cooked and roasted till light golden or golden. Remove in a pan and keep aside.
food.step13: In the same pan, now heat 1.5 tablespoons ghee. add 1 cup thinly sliced onions.
food.ingredient 11: ⅓ cup green peas, fresh or frozen
food.ingredient 12: 1 teaspoon salt or add as required
food.ingredient 13: 2 cups water or add as required

food.recipe: Take 2 cups of chickpea flour in a bowl and add 2 tablespoons of clarified butter to it. Prepare a soft dough by adding some water. Knead the dough enough to ensure that there are no lumps in it.
food.step 1: Heat a non-stick wok, add sugar and 1½ cups water, mix well and cook till the sugar melts. Add 2 tsps milk and discard the scum that will rise to the top.
food.step 2: Add sev and mix gently. Add khoya, mix well and cook till khoya melts and mixes well with the sev.
food.step 3: Add 1 cup milk and mix well, cook till the mixture thickens
food.step 4: Add pistachios, almonds, cashewnuts, rose essence and green cardamom powder and mix well.
food.step 5: Add ghee, mix and cook for 2 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step6: Transfer the mixture into greased burfi tin. Grease a palate knife, spread and press the mixture evenly to level the top.
food.step7: Sprinkle pistachios, almonds, cashewnuts and dried rose petals, press them gently and set aside to cool down completely. Cut into squares, arrange them in a serving platter and serve.

food.description: A Sindhi favourite, Singhar ji Mithai as it is traditionally known, is popular with just about everyone else as well.

food.recipe: Pour cooking oil into a wok or large skillet. (If necessary, add more oil during cooking.) Cook and stir sweet pepper and beans in hot oil for 5 minutes. Push from center of wok. Add shrimp, garlic, ginger, and black pepper to center of wok. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp are opaque. Stir in sauce and pea pods. Stir in pasta; heat through.
food.step 1: Heat 2 tbsps blended sesame oil in a non-stick pan, add chicken cubes and saute on high heat for 5-6 minutes. Drain onto a plate.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps blended sesame oil in a non-stick pan, add chicken cubes and saute on high heat for 5-6 minutes. Drain onto a plate.
food.step 3: Add shiitake mushrooms and button mushrooms, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes.
food.step 4: Add pok choy, mix and saute doe 1-2 minutes
food.step 5: Add soy sauce, dark soy sauce, cornflour slurry and brown sugar, mix and saute for 2-3 minutes.
food.step6: Add sautéed chicken and boiled macaroni, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.
food.step7: Add spring onion greens, salt and toasted white sesame seeds and mix well.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens and white sesame seeds and serve hot.

food.recipe: Shrikhand is a traditional Indian sweet made with hung curd and flavored with saffron and cardamom.
food.step 1: Boil the potatoes till they are cooked completely.
food.step 2: Pour the fresh curd. I added 4.5 cups of curd (made from 1 litre of full fat milk, about 1.125 kgs). Do use fresh curd and not sour one.
food.step 3: Bring the four edges of the muslin together and tie one edge tightly around the rest.
food.step 4: Gently press and you will see the whey dripping.
food.step 5: Now place a heavy bowl or lid or tray on the tied muslin. If you have a hook, you can also hung the muslin in your refrigerator. Now keep the whole thing in the fridge for 4 to 5 hours or overnight. I kept for 24 hours. Do use a deep bowl below, so that there is some distance between the curd in the strainer and the collected whey. Otherwise the whey will touch the strainer as well as the curd. Thus there will be some whey in the curd.
food.step6: Next day the whey will be drained and the hung curd will be ready. Use the collected nutrient rich greenish whey in your everyday food like preparing chapatis, gravies, rice dishes, dals etc.
food.step7: With a silicon spatula, collect the hung curd in a container or lidded bowl if not using it. Cover with its lid and then refrigerate. With the hung curd you can now proceed to make the shrikhand.
food.step8: Take 1/2 tbsp warm milk in a small bowl. Add 2 pinch of saffron strands. Stir and keep aside
food.step9: In a mortar powder 4 to 5 green cardamoms. Keep aside.
food.step10: Take the chakka or hung curd in a bowl.
food.step11: Add fine sugar. Lightly stir with a spatula or spoon. You can also use powdered sugar.
food.step12: Then add the saffron dissolved milk and powdered saffron.
food.step13: Using an electric beater, begin to whip the hung curd. You can also beat the hung yogurt in a blender.

food.step 1: Heat sufficient water in a wok and place a bamboo steamer inside it.
food.step 2: Take the fish fillet on a plate, add soy sauce, red chillies, oil, ginger juliennes, spring onion greens, salt and black pepper powder and rub it thoroughly.
food.step 3: Place the fish plate in the steamer, cover and steam for 10-15 minutes.
food.step 4: Take the spring bulb with little stalks intact, slit through the stalk and open the curls. Place in a bowl of chilled water to let the curls open completely for the garnish.
food.step 5: In a bowl, grate the lemon to get the zest, halve the lemon into two and cut the remaining into wedges.
food.step6: Open the lid of the steamer, drizzle juice of half lemon on the top.
food.step7: Remove the plate, sprinkle lemon zest, spring onion greens, place the spring onion, garnish with lemon wedges on both sides of the plate and serve immediately.
food.ingredient 6: Spring onion greens 2-3, finely chopped + for garnishing
food.restaurants: ["Quan-Pan Asian","Grandmama's Cafe","Jai Hind Lunch Home","El Mercado","Cafe Moshe's","Indigo Delicatessen","The Finch","Shamiana - The Taj Mahal Palace","Royal China","Cafe Free India","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","The Sassy Spoon"]
food.description: Mild flavored, flaky fish fillets. Any number of different types of fish will work, and you can increase the recipe easily. Try halibut, cod, salmon, red snapper, trout, etc. Serve with a white and wild rice blend.

food.recipe: I keep the vegetable filling balanced in taste and lightly spiced, so that it accompanies the spicy and hot sauce very well. At home we love steamed momos over the fried ones. So this recipe is of steamed momos.
food.step 1: Make a dough using all purpose flour and keep it aside for 30 mins.
food.step 2: Do not forget to add a pinch of salt in the dough for better taste.
food.step 3: Take a pan and pour oil into it so that the vegetables could be fried.
food.step 4: Fry the vegetables on medium flame.
food.step 5: Add onion and semi-fry for better taste.
food.step6: Add pepper powder and salt once the vegetables get cooled.
food.step7: Divide the dough into equal parts and start making small circles
food.step8: Now, make small tortillas of the dough balls and put one spoon filling in the centre of it.
food.step9: Try to keep edges thin and centre thick.
food.step10: Now, fold the momo and make pleats.
food.step11: Repeat the process and similarly make other momos.
food.step12: Cover them with a wet kitchen towel until you are ready to steam them.
food.step13: Boil water in cooker or other big vessel with broad mouth.
food.ingredient 4: Chopped veggies like cabbage, carrots and capsicum – 4 cups
food.restaurants: ["The Momos Nation","The Momos Machine","Hello Momos","Dumpling Delights","BusaGo","The Fatty Bao","Kepchaki Momos","Ithaka - Veg Lebanese Kitchen","Chinese Wok - Wok Express","Yummy Momos","Relish - International Veg Cuisine","The Appetite Momos"]
food.description: Veg momos are steamed dumplings stuffed with a lightly spiced vegetable filling. A popular chinees recipe.

food.recipe: Cooked garlic becomes wonderfully nutty in flavor. Hence what seems to be a huge quantity in this recipe. Just a wonderful dish, this, when the stew is mixed with the noodles and baked!
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick wok, add garlic, ginger, celery and green chillies, toss and sauté high heat for 1-2 minutes.
food.step 2: Add spring onions, mix and sauté for 1 minute. Add carrot and broccoli and toss well.
food.step 3: Add button mushrooms and babycorns and toss.
food.step 4: Add salt and crushed black peppercorns and toss well. Add a dash of soy sauce, and mix well.
food.step 5: Add vegetable stock, mix well and let the mixture come to a boil. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.
food.step6: Add cornflour slurry and mix well and let the mixture come to a boil.
food.step7: Add noodles and mix well. Add bok choi leaves and mix, cook for 1-2 minutes. Add sliced spring onion greens and mix well. Take the pan off the heat.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with spring onion greens curls and slit fresh red chillies and serve hot.
food.ingredient 7: Carrot peeled and cut into diamonds 1 medium
food.ingredient 18: Spring onion green curls for garnish
food.ingredient 19: Fresh red chillies slit 1-2 for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Cooked garlic becomes wonderfully nutty in flavor. Hence what seems to be a huge quantity in this recipe. Just a wonderful dish, this, when the stew is mixed with the noodles and baked!

food.recipe: This chicken stir fry recipe will become a staple in your home. It’s so quick to make and you can use whatever vegetables you have on hand. It tastes wonderful regardless of how you alter the ingredients.
food.step 1: Take chicken pieces in a bowl, add egg yolk, sugar, salt, pepper powder, sesame oil and 1 tablespoon cornflour and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.
food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
food.step 3: Add potato starch and remaining cornflour to marinated chicken and mix till well coated.
food.step 4: Put the chicken pieces into hot oil and deep-fry.
food.step 5: Meanwhile, heat 1½ tablespoons oil in a non-stick pan. Add Kashmiri red chillies and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
food.step6: When the chicken turns a light golden, drain them on absorbent paper.
food.step7: Drain the red chillie into a bowl. Add garlic and ginger to the oil remaining in the pan and sauté for 1 minute. Add Sichuan bean paste, mix and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step8: Add sugar, salt, pepper powder and ¼ cup water, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add rice wine vinegar, Chinese rice wine and sesame oil, mix and cook for 1-2 minutes.
food.step9: Add fried chicken pieces, spring onion and cornflour slurry, mix and cook till the mixture thickens.
food.step10: Add fried dried red chillies and mix. Add cashewnuts and mix well.
food.step11: Lightly crush the fried rice noodles and place on a serving platter making a well in the centre. Put the stir-fried chicken in the middle and serve hot.
food.ingredient 3: Kashmiri dried red chillies cut into smaller pieces 8-10
food.restaurants: ["Hakkasan","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Leopold Cafe & Bar","Gypsy Chinese","Royal China","The Finch","Dilly Dally","Jadhav's- Crazy Asian Food"]
food.description: This Chicken Stir Fry Recipe is so much better than takeout! The chicken and vegetables in a garlic ginger soy sauce with honey is the perfect balance of sweet and savory.

food.recipe: This eggplant string bean stir-fry is one of our must-order dishes when we go out to this particular restaurant, and we discovered it’s a very quick-to-prepare dish for home cooking as well
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick wok.`
food.step 2: Halve onion, slice and add to the wok with eggplant, salt and soy sauce and cook on high heat for 2 minutes.
food.step 3: Slice green chillies diagonally.
food.step 4: Add beans and garlic to the wok, mix and cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 5: Put cornstarch in a bowl, add ½ cup water and mix well to a smooth slurry
food.step6: Add sliced green chillies and sugar to the wok and mix. Cook for 2 minutes.
food.step7: Cut beancurd into fingers and add with slurry and vinegar. Mix and cook for 1 minute.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.
food.ingredients: Eggplants/ brinjals long - cut into fingers 2
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: In a flat bottomed frying pan, heat the oil over medium heat, and shallow fry the green beans. Roll the beans around slowly until they start to look wrinkly and slightly crisp. Use a slotted spoon to remove them to a plate and set aside.

food.recipe: Crisp, fresh, and bursting with loads of unexpected flavor, this Garlic Bok Choy Recipe is guaranteed to be your new favorite side dish.
food.step 1: Separate leaves of pok choy.
food.step 2: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté for ½ minute. Add pok choy leaves and 4-5 tbsps water, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
food.step 3: Add soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce and sweet chilli sauce and mix well. Cook till the pok choy is done.
food.step 4: Transfer into a serving dish and serve immediately.
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Think of mild-flavored, juicy bok choy as an invitation to experiment in the kitchen. It's especially good with earthy mushrooms. Thoroughly drying the bok choy before cooking ensures that you don't end up with a watery sauce.

food.food_item: Stir Fried Spicy Mushroom with Tofu
food.recipe: If you have a bit of extra time before making this stir-fry recipe, press the whole block of tofu between two layers of paper towels, weighted down with a couple of large cans, for 15 minutes. Removing that excess water helps the tofu get extra crispy as it cooks.
food.step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan. Slice almonds, add to the oil and sauté till golden brown and crisp. Drain on absorbent paper.
food.step 2: Heat remaining oil in the same non-stick pan. Add ginger and garlic, mix and sauté for 1 minute.
food.step 3: Drain, discard the stems and slice shitake mushrooms diagonally and reserve its water. Add shitake mushrooms, button mushrooms, salt, pepper powder, dark soy sauce, veg oyster sauce, light soy sauce and 3-4 tablespoons water, mix and cook for 5-6 minutes.
food.step 4: Add Schezwan chilli paste, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add 2-3 tablespoons of reserved shitake mushroom water, mix and cook for 1 minute. Add rice wine vinegar and sesame oil, mix and cook for 1 minute.
food.step 5: Cut tofu into ½ inch cubes, add to the pan, cover and cook for 5 minutes. Add cornflour slurry, mix gently and cook till the mixture thickens slightly.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving bowl, serve hot garnished with spring onion greens and fried almonds.
food.ingredients: Dried shitake mushrooms soaked for 30 minutes in hot water 2-3
food.ingredient 17: Spring onion greens chopped for garnish
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: this super-savory vegetarian tofu and mushroom stir-fry is a flavor-packed meal served with your choice of rice or noodles
food.image: Stir Fried Spicy Mushroom with Tofu.jpg

food.food_item: Stir Fried Vegetables In Sichuan Sauce
food.recipe: The Indo Chinese Mixed Vegetables In Szechuan sauce  is a lip smacking gravy that is made with a simple combination of seasonal vegetables like cauliflower, capsicum, carrots, ginger, garlic, spring onions cooked in a sweet and spicy soya chilli sauce.
food.step 1: Combine refined flour, cornflour, half tablespoon oil and salt in a bowl. Add sufficient water and whisk well to make a smooth and thick batter.
food.step 2: Heat sufficient oil in a deep pan. Dip cauliflower, carrots, baby corns in the batter till they are well coated and deep-fry on medium heat until crisp. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside
food.step 3: Heat two tablespoons oil in a non-stick pan. Add garlic, ginger and green chillies and stir-fry on high heat for a few seconds.
food.step 4: Add spring onion bulbs and sauté on a high heat for a few seconds. Add sichuan sauce, fried vegetables and salt and mix well. Serve immediately, garnished with spring onion greens.
food.ingredient 2: Sichuan Sauce cut into 1 inch pieces 1 medium
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Give this lip smacking spicy indo chinese vegetables in szechuan a try for a weekend lunch or dinner. Serve along with fried rice or hakka noodles to make a complete and satisfying meal.
food.image: Stir Fried Vegetables In Sichuan Sauce.jpg

food.food_item: Stir Fried Vegetables with Fried Basil
food.recipe: I love to use fresh herbs and it cannot be fresher than this as I have plucked basil and spinach from my balcony just a few minutes before cooking.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add garlic and sauté till golden. Add button mushrooms and shimeji mushrooms and toss.
food.step 2: Add baby corn and chanterelle mushrooms and toss. Add salt and pepper powder and mix well.
food.step 3: Add capsicum, both the bell peppers, broccoli and bok choy and toss. Add soy sauce and mix well.
food.step 4: Adjust salt and pepper powder and mix again. Add spring onions and toss on high heat for a minute.
food.step 5: Serve hot.
food.ingredient 5: Green capsicum cut into triangles ½ medium
food.ingredient 6: Yellow bell pepper cut into triangles ½ medium
food.ingredient 7: Red bell pepper cut into triangles ½ medium
food.ingredient 15: Spring onions with greens diagonally sliced 2
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Chilli Basil Vegetables (Gravy) is delicious gravy full of flavors. Fresh basil is the high point of this gravy dish.
food.image: Stir Fried Vegetables with Fried Basil.jpg

food.recipe: Dip the Italian Lady Finger cookies in the strawberry juice (turning to coat all the cookie with juice, but don’t leave them submerged in the juice), arrange the cookies on bottom of baking dish.
food.step 1: Take mascarpone cream cheese in a bowl and whisk it till smooth. Add coffee decoction, 2 tbsps melted chocolate and whisk together. Add the melted gelatin and mix. Fold in whipped cream and keep the bowl in a refrigerator to set.
food.step 2: Boil sufficient water in a deep non-stick pan, place a fitting bowl on it. Put egg yolks in the bowl, add the sugar and whisk for 3-4 minutes or till the sugar melts and the mixture becomes light.
food.step 3: Halve the chocolate sponge horizontally. Cut 4 pieces with a rectangular cutter mould. Keep the pieces at the base of 4 rectangular moulds. Arrange most of the strawberry pieces over the cake and chill for a while.
food.step 4: Cool the egg yolk mixture slightly and fold into the mascarpone cream mixture and chill again. Pour this mixture over the cake pieces and keep them in the refrigerator to set. When completely set unmould them onto a serving plate.
food.step 5: Drizzle the remaining melted chocolate over them and sprinkle cocoa powder through a small sieve.
food.step6: Decorate with the remaining strawberry slices and serve immediately.
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Strawberry Tiramisu, a fast and easy no bake Dessert. Made with fresh strawberries, cream and mascarpone. No coffee or liqueur makes this the perfect dessert for everyone. An Italian Classic!

food.recipe: This recipe couldn’t be easier to make. It comes together in about 10 minutes and only takes 15 minutes to bake! You can always customize the ingredients to your families tastes. But the italian salami, pepperoni and cheese combo was delicious!
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 160°C.Grease the baking sheet.
food.step 2: Beat the egg and mix it with milk to give the bread an egg-milk wash.Punch out the air bubbles in the bread dough.
food.step 3: Roll into a large rectangle on a slightly floured surface.Brush with the egg-milk wash.
food.step 4: Place the cheese slices in the middle one third of the rectangle.Mix the other filling ingredients together and place over the cheese slices.
food.step 5: Fold in the other one thirds of the rectangle over the center.Brush with the remaining egg-milk wash.
food.step6: Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and oregano.Place on the greased baking sheet and place it in the preheated oven
food.step7: Bake for twenty minutes or till the top is slightly browned.Take it out and placed on a rack to cool before slicing.
food.ingredient 5: Bread dough to make one loaf
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Quick and Easy Stromboli gets loaded with Italian salami, pepperoni, pizza sauce and cheese. This is so quick, easy and delicious you will want to make it again and again!

food.food_item: Sweet and Sour Fruits and Vegetables
food.recipe: Combine all ingredients except vegetables in bowl. Mix and set aside. Heat oil in skillet and add frozen vegetables. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add sweet and sour sauce and cook for another 2 minutes or until mixture comes to a boil. Serve.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a non-stick wok.
food.step 2: Halve the spring onion bulbs. Cut red and green capsicums into small pieces.
food.step 3: Add spring onion to the wok. Quarter each pineapple slice.
food.step 4: Add capsicums, broccoli florets and 1 cup vegetable stock to the wok. Add pineapple and lychees.
food.step 5: Add tomato ketchup and mix well. Add salt and mix well.
food.step6: Mix cornstarch with ¼ cup water and add 1 tbsp of this mixture to the wok and mix. Cook till the sauce thickens
food.step7: Add sugar and vinegar and mix well.
food.step8: Transfer into a serving bowl and serve hot.
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Stir in the mango puree and coconut milk and reheat. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve in bowls.
food.image: Sweet and Sour Fruits and Vegetables.jpg

food.recipe: A spicy Kolhapuri dish prepared by using Mutton Stock.Its very very spicy, it could be hair raise for mild eaters
food.step 1: Wash lamb pieces very well and keep them aside.
food.step 2: Heat tsp of oil in a pressure cooker.
food.step 3: After oil is hot add finely chopped onions and cook until onions gets light golden color.
food.step 4: After onions are browned, add ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, mix and cook for a while.
food.step 5: Add lamb pieces, mix well.
food.step6: Add water, salt to taste, mix well and cook until 8 whistles.
food.step7: After the lamb is cooked, take our lamb pieces from the stock and keep it aside.
food.step8: Heat up tsp of oil in separate pan.
food.step9: After oil is hot add cumin seeds, whole garam masala - bay leaf, cinnamon stick, star anise, cloves, black peppercorns.
food.step10: Cook whole masala for a minute.
food.step11: Add sliced onion and cook until onions get light brown color.
food.step12: After onions are browned, add coconut flakes, mix well and cook for 2 mts
food.step13: After 2 mts, turn the heat off and allow the masala to cool down completely.
food.ingredient 6: 1 tbsp Degi Mirch / Kashmiri Chili powder
food.restaurants: ["Kolhapuri Tambada Pandhara Family Restaurant","Diva Maharashtracha","Chaitanya","purepur kolhapur","gaavkari","kath n ghat","rassa","ghati restaurant"]
food.description: A spicy Kolhapuri dish prepared by using Mutton Stock. Very very aromatic with the use of fresh spices. Gets perfect blends of flavors and taste as its being prepared with mutton stock. Its very very spicy, it could be hair raise for mild eaters

food.recipe: The magic marinade adds a burst of flavor and these cook in minutes. They’re spicy, smoky, juicy and all things good, so get ready to fight over the last piece!
food.step 1: Wash the prawns nicely.
food.step 2: Mix all the masalas in a bowl and make a paste.
food.step 3: Coat the prawns with this masala paste.
food.step 4: Keep covered with a cling wrap for 2-3 hours.
food.step 5: Heat a pan.
food.step6: Add a little oil.
food.step7: Put the prawns in skewers.
food.step8: Serve hot.
food.description: They are the best damn tandoori prawns . Spicy, smoky, crunchy outside, juicy inside and that masala has enough pizzazz to make you fight over the last piece.

food.recipe: Goda masala is a special spice blend that has distinct aroma and flavor and is used in many Maharashtrian recipes. If you do not have goda masala, then you can add garam masala, but the taste and flavor will change.
food.step 1: Rinse the rice for a couple of times with water.
food.step 2: Then soak rice in water for 15 to 20 minutes.
food.step 3: Later drain the water from the rice and keep aside.
food.step 4: When the rice is soaking, rinse and then slice the tendli in 2 or 4 vertical slices.
food.step 5: Before slicing them vertically, do thinly slice the top and bottom part of the ivy gourds
food.step6: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pressure cooker.
food.step7: Add 1 tsp mustard seeds and crackle them. Then add 2 small bay leaves. Stir.
food.step8: Now add 1 tsp finely chopped ginger and 1 tsp chopped green chilies. Saute till the raw aroma of ginger goes away.
food.step9: Add the tendli slices and stir very well. Saute for 3 to 4 minutes on a low to medium flame.
food.step10: Now add 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 3 tsp goda masala and a pinch of asafoetida.
food.step11: Stir and saute the rice for a minute.
food.step12: Now add 10 to 12 cashews and 1 tbsp fresh curd. Adding curd is optional and you can skip it. Instead of curd, you can also add 1 small chopped tomato. Mix the curd with the rest of the ingredients.
food.step13: Then add 3 cups water and season with salt as required.
food.ingredients: 200 to 250 grams tendli (tondli or ivy gourd or kovakkai)
food.ingredient 2: 1.5 cups ambe mohur rice or sona masuri or basmati rice
food.ingredient 7: 2 small tej patta or 1 medium to large tej patta (indian bay leaf
food.ingredient 13: 3 teaspoon goda masala or add as required - you can add ½ teaspoon garam masala powder instead of goda masala
food.ingredient 14: 2 to 3 tablespoon chopped coriander leaves (cilantro leaves)
food.restaurants: ["cafe madras","hotel ram ashray","chaitanya","prakash shkahari kendera","banana leaf''","arya bhavan","trupti","A.Rama Nayak's Udipi Shri Krishna Boarding'","Diva Maharashtracha"]
food.description: Kovakkai rice is a spiced and aromatic one pot rice recipe made with tendli or ivy gourds. A delicious rice recipe from the Maharashtrian cuisine.

food.recipe: Each Chinese dish reflects a balance of taste, texture, aroma and colour. Be it sweet, sour, pungent, hot, salty or spicy – all the six basic flavours are incorporated deftly in all Chinese dishes.
food.step 1: Mix cornflour in ¼ cup of water. Cut carrots into diamonds or into petal shape. Quarter spring onion bulbs. Cut bean curd into triangles.
food.step 2: Heat 2 tbsps oil in a non stick wok. Add garlic paste and sauté for a few seconds. Add spring onions and carrots and continue to sauté.
food.step 3: Add 1 cup vegetable stock, salt and sugar and mix. Add bean curd, broccoli, almonds and mix. Add ½ cup vegetable stock and mix.
food.step 4: Add crushed red chillies and cornflour mixture. Mix well and cook till it thickens.Add vinegar and take the wok off the heat. Serve hot immediately.
food.ingredient 4: Tofu cut into 1 inch pieces 150 grams
food.restaurants: ["Khow Chow","Facing East","5 Spice","Peco Peco","China Bistro","Gypsy Chinese","Yauatcha","Mainland China","Ming Yang - Taj Lands End","Stir Fry Grill","Uncle's Kitchen","Hakkasan","Ling's Pavilion"]
food.description: Some other accounts of the history of Chinese cuisine takes the beginning to the Chinese stone age. However today Chinese cuisine enjoys the distinction of being the most popular in the world.

food.recipe: The best homemade tomato basil soup recipe made with roasted fresh tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, caramelized onions and optional add-ins for extra creaminess. This tomato basil soup recipe is full of flavor and the best way to use up fresh tomatoes from your garden!
food.step 1: Heat the oil and Nutralite in a large non-stick pan, add the onion and cook gently for five minutes, stirring frequently, until soft, but not brown.
food.step 2: Add the tomatoes, garlic and vegetable stock. Season with the salt and freshly ground peppercorns. Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer gently, partially covered, for twenty minutes. Set aside to cool.
food.step 3: Add the shredded basil and purée the mixture in a food processor or blender. Strain the purée into a fresh non stick pan.
food.step 4: Add more stock if the purée is too thick and adjust seasoning.
food.step 5: Add the cream and simmer over low heat for two minutes, making sure it does not boil.
food.step6: Serve hot garnished with the reserved fresh basil and sundried tomato strips.
food.ingredient 2: Fresh basil leaves 2 tablespoons shredded + a few leaves for garnish
food.ingredient 11: Sundried tomatoes soaked and cut into strips 3-4
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: it’s finally tomato season, I couldn’t help but present this beautiful bowl of tomato basil soup to you. It’s homemade, made with fresh tomatoes that are roasted to perfection in the oven. Mmmm.

food.recipe: Boil potatoes in a pot of salted water until tender when pierced, 8–10 minutes; drain.
food.step 1: Halve the potatoes and put into a non-stick pan. Drizzle olive oil and toss. Saute till golden.
food.step 2: Cut tomato into pieces the size of potatoes.
food.step 3: Add garlic to the potatoes and mix well. Add salt and toss.
food.step 4: Have onions and thickly slice them horizontally.
food.step 5: Add tomato to the pan. Add pesto sauce and mix well. Add lemon juice and mix. Switch off heat.
food.step6: Transfer the mixture into a large bowl. Tear fresh basil leaves, crush them lightly and add to the bowl. Lightly crush onion slices and add and mix. Add toasted pinenuts and extra virgin olive oil and mix well.
food.step7: Transfer into a serving bowl and serve.
food.ingredient 2: Baby Potatoes scrubbed clean and boiled with skin 20-25
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: Tomato-Potato Salad is super easy to make and very filling as well. The warm potatoes soak up the savory flavors of the vinaigrette making this a delicious side dish.

food.recipe: In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together tomatoes, garlic, salt, lemon zest, and brown sugar. Cook, stirring constantly, until tomatoes release their juices, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low.
food.step 1: Cut Baguette into thick slices.
food.step 2: Place the slices in an air fryer and toast at 200º C for 5-7 minutes.
food.step 3: Halve garlic cloves. Grate tomatoes into a bowl.
food.step 4: Rub halved garlic over the toasted Baguette slices, spread grated tomatoes over them, sprinkle sea salt and drizzle extra-virgin olive oil.
food.step 5: Arrange them on a serving plate and serve immediately.
food.restaurants: ["celini","mezzo mezzo","botticino","prego","mia cucina","gustoso","little italy","cincin mumbai'","quatrro ristorante","olio novotel","romano's","out of the blue"]
food.description: This bread goes great with any Italian or Mediterranean meal. I've also cut the bread into smaller pieces and served it as an appetizer.

food.recipe: Tomatoes and eggs just go together, and many food cultures know it. Just think of Shakshuka in the Middle East, “Eggs in Purgatory” in Southern Italy, and another Chinese classic, stir-fried tomato and eggs.
food.step 1: Heat vegetable stock in a deep non stick pan. Break egg into a bowl, add salt and black pepper powder and whisk lightly.
food.step 2: Heat a non stick frying pan and pour the egg mixture into it. Rotate the pan so that the egg spreads evenly all around.
food.step 3: Halve the tomatoes and remove seeds. Take the pan with the egg off the heat and carefully flip the omelet. Set the pan aside.
food.step 4: Chop tomatoes and add to the stock in the pan. Add spring onion bulbs and mix.Chop bean curd and add. Add salt and soy sauce and mix.
food.step 5: Roll the omelet into a cylinder and cut into thin rings. Put these slices into a serving bowl.Add spring onion greens to the soup and let it simmer for 2-3 minutes. Pour the soup over the omelet rings and serve piping hot.
food.restaurants: ["MRP - My Regular Place","Hardeep Punjab","Gymkhana 91 Bar & Kitchen","Yauatcha","Cafe Trofima","Plum by Bent Chair","Hakkasan"]

food.recipe: Line an 8x11-inch baking dish with plastic wrap, allowing ends to hang over the sides. Place 1 sheet of 8x10 wafer paper in the bottom of the pan. Keep the roasted almonds and pistachios in a warm place until ready to add at the end. This makes it easier to mix them in.
food.step 1: Heat together the sugar, liquid glucose and one cups of water in a non-stick pan. Bring to a boil and cook till it reaches 150º C on a sugar thermometer.
food.step 2: Cook the honey in another non-stick pan till it reaches 120º C on the thermometer.
food.step 3: Beat the egg whites till soft peaks. Add the honey and keep beating. Add the sugar syrup and beat for another five minutes.
food.step 4: Add the almonds, pistachios and cranberries and fold well.
food.step 5: Pour the mixture on a tray and spread evenly. Cover with a baking paper and roll out with a rolling pin to smoothen the top.
food.step6: Place a rectangular tray on top and put a heavy object in it. Leave overnight to set.
food.step7: Melt the chocolate in a microwave. Remove from heat and mix till smooth.
food.step8: Remove the baking paper and spread the melted chocolate over the set nougat. Cover with another baking paper and press. Set aside till chocolate hardens.
food.step9: Cut into bars and serve.

food.recipe: Serve with brown rice or white rice and a simple vegetable stir-fry for a nutritious meal that -- warning -- may lead to everyone licking their plates.
food.step 1: Take Urad Dal in a large bowl, wash it 2-3 times with sufficient water.
food.step 2: Put the dal into a pressure cooker, add sufficient water, cover the cooker and cook under pressure till 3-4 whistles are given out. Allow the pressure to be released completely.
food.step 3: Transfer the cooked dal into a non-stick pan, add ½ cup water, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and salt, mix well and let the mixture come to a boil.
food.step 4: Add lemon juice and coriander leaves and mix well. Take it off the heat.
food.step 5: Heat ghee in a non-stick tempering pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, green chillies, curry leaves and red chilli powder and mix well.Add the tempering to the prepared dal and cover the pan immediately.
food.step6: Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprig and serve hot.

food.recipe: Preparing vangi bath is very easy. All you need is to cook the rice first. Then prepare the brinjal gravy. Then mix the rice with the brinjal gravy. If you have extra cooked rice or leftover rice, then the vangi bath is quicker to prepare.
food.step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons peanut oil (can also use sesame oil or sunflower oil) in a pan or kadai.
food.step 2: Add ½ teaspoon mustard seeds.
food.step 3: Once the mustard seeds begin to crackle, then add ½ teaspoon urad dal.
food.step 4: Next add 2 tablespoons roasted peanuts or cashews
food.step 5: Saute till the urad dal becomes golden.
food.step6: Then add 1 to 2 dry red chilies, 1 sprig curry leaves or 10 to 12 curry leaves and ⅛ teaspoon asafoetida (about 2 pinches of asafoetida).
food.step7: Add the brinjals. Just remove the brinjals from the salted water and add in the pan. Be careful as the mixture splutters when adding brinjals.
food.step8: Mix them with the rest of the tempering mixture.
food.step9: Add ¼ teaspoon turmeric powder. Also add salt as per taste.
food.step10: Cover the pan with a lid and let the brinjals get half-cooked. Do check at intervals. While cooking, if the brinjals start sticking to the pan then add some water. Then cover and cook.
food.step11: Half cook the brinjals.
food.step12: Once they are half done, then add the tamarind pulp.
food.step13: Then add 2 to 2.5 tablespoons vangi bath masala powder.
food.ingredients: 225 grams sona masuri rice or 1 heaped cup of rice
food.ingredient 4: 2 tablespoons peanut oil - can also use sesame oil or sunflower oil
food.ingredient 7: 1 sprig curry leaves or 10 to 12 curry leaves
food.ingredient 10: 200 grams small to medium sized green or purple brinjal (baingan or vangi or egg plant) - cut in long pieces and soaked in salted water for 15 to 20 minutes
food.ingredient 12: 2 to 2.5 tablespoons vangi bath masala powder
food.ingredient 14: ¼ to ½ teaspoon jaggery powder
food.ingredient 15: 2 to 3 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves - optional

food.step 1: Rinse the lentils well in water for a couple of times. Then add them in a 2 litre pressure cooker along with chopped tomatoes and turmeric powder.
food.step 2: Pressure cook the lentils with tomatoes and turmeric powder for 7 to 8 whistles on medium flame.
food.step 3: When the pressure settles down on its own, open the lid and mash the dal with a wired whisk or wooden spoon. Cover and keep aside.
food.step 4: If the dal looks thick, then you can add water as required.
food.step 5: If adding water, then keep to simmer on low flame till you get the desired consistency, which is neither thick nor thin.
food.step6: Switch off flame and keep covered.
food.step7: Heat oil or ghee in a pan.
food.step8: Add the mustard seeds first and let them crackle.
food.step9: Then add the cumin and crackle them.
food.step10: Add the asafoetida, curry leaves and green chilies.
food.step11: Fry for a few seconds till the curry leaves become crisp.
food.step12: Pour the whole tempering in the dal.
food.step13: Cover and let the tempering flavors infuse with the dal for about 5 to 6 minutes.

food.recipe: Gujiya do resemble empanadas and very much popular in north India, especially during Holi festival. Its not they are made only during Holi. They are also made during Diwali.
food.step 1: To make coconut butter, take desiccated coconut in a blender jar. Blend till it turns into a smooth paste, scraping the sides in between
food.step 2: Take whole wheat flour in a parat, add 2 tbsps coconut butter,cashewnut butter, date paste, green cardamom powder and nutmeg powder and mix well. Add sufficient water and knead into soft dough. Set aside for 30 minutes.
food.step 3: To make the stuffing, heat a pan, add cashewnuts, almonds and pistachios. Cool and transfer the roasted nuts into a blender jar and blend to a fine powder. Preheat oven to 180˚C.
food.step 4: Transfer the powder into a bowl, add dried date powder and mix well.
food.step 5: To making gujiyas, divide the dough into equal poritons and shape them into balls. Slightly flatten them and roll into small discs.
food.step6: Place a small portion of the stuffing in the centre of the disc. Apply water on the edges and fold in half, press and pinch the sides to seal.
food.step7: Place the gujiyas on a baking tray, keep the tray in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes. Allow to cool slightly.
food.step8: Arrange them on a serving platter and serve.

food.recipe: a traditional maharashtrian dry sabzi or gravy made with besan or chickpea flour. it is a spicy besan curry which is typically prepared as a side dish for bhakri
food.step 1: firstly, in a large kadai heat 2 tbsp oil and splutter 1 tsp mustard, 1 tsp cumin and pinch hing.
food.step 2: also add 4 clove garlic, 1 chilli and saute well.
food.step 3: now add 1 onion and saute until the change colour slightly.
food.step 4: further add ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp chilli powder and 1 tsp salt.
food.step 5: saute slightly, without burning the spices.
food.step6: now add 1 cup besan and saute on low flame.
food.step7: saute for 5 minutes, or until the besan turns golden and aromatic.
food.step8: further, sprinkle ¼ cup water and mix well.
food.step9: keep sprinkling water in batches until the mixture turns moist.
food.step10: i have sprinkled almost 1 cup water in batches.
food.step11: cover and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the besan is cooked completely.
food.step12: give a good mix making sure there are no lumps.
food.step13: finally, add in coriander leaves and enjoy zunka with bhakri.

food.recipe: Arrange the cake pieces with the pointed ends at the bottom and crust sides next to cut edges until the bowl is lined. Sprinkle with the orange juice. Set aside the remaining cake pieces.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Line a bowl with a completely round base having a capacity of 1 litre with a cling film. Grease a ten inch square tin and another six inch square tin and line both with baking paper. Sift the flour and cocoa powder together.
food.step 2: Melt the butter and set aside to cool. Whisk the eggs and sugar in a large bowl over a pan of steaming water until the mixture is light and frothy.
food.step 3: Remove the bowl from the pan and whisk briskly till the mixture is cold. Fold in the sifted flour with a metal spoon with a light hand.
food.step 4: Pour the cooled, melted butter down the side of the bowl and gently fold in. Pour the mixture into the two cake tins and bake for ten minutes till firm to the touch. Turn out the cakes onto a wire rack and allow to cool.
food.step 5: Cut a ten inch diameter circle from the larger cake and fit it into the prepared bowl. Push it in gently so that the cake lines the bowl entirely. Trim off any portion jutting out.
food.step6: From the second cake, cut a circle the same size as the bowl top. Brush all the sponge with the combined liqueur and brandy. Toast the hazelnuts and almonds in the oven at a moderate 180°C (350°F) for three to five minutes.
food.step7: Cool and finely chop. Chop forty grams of the dark chocolate and the glace cherries. Whisk the cream and icing sugar till soft peaks are formed. Divide the mixture into two bowls.
food.step8: To one bowl add the nuts, chopped chocolate and cherries. Mix and spoon into the sponge-lined bowl. Hollow out the centre with the back of a spoon and even the layer. Refrigerate for half an hour to set.
food.step9: Melt the remaining dark chocolate in a pan kept over another pan half full of steaming water. Whisk till all the chocolate has melted and is smooth. Whisk till it has cooled.
food.step10: Mix a third of this into the second portion of cream and sugar mixture. Spoon this into the hollowed centre of the chilled Zuccotto and level the top using a palette knife.
food.step11: Press the second circle of sponge cake over the top and refrigerate for half an hour. Invert the bowl onto a wire rack and turn out the Zuccotto. Pour the remaining melted dark chocolate over this and tap lightly to make sure the chocolate covers the whole of the sponge.
food.step12: Refrigerate once again till set. Melt the white chocolate the same way as you did the dark chocolate and flick over the Zuccotto with a fork to form like a web.
food.step13: Chill once again to set. Serve chilled.

food.description: This easy chocolate mug cake is made with flaked almonds and no egg. It is ready in a few minutes and perfect if you're dying for something sweet. Serve dusted with confectioners' sugar and topped with ice cream or whipped cream.

food.recipe: In a deep vessel add oil and fry sliced onions till they turn brown. Add chicken and cook for 2-3 mins.
food.step 1: Now add ginger paste & garlic (watery) and cook for a minute. Stir for 2 mins and then add
food.step 2: and then add cinnamon, cardamon, cloves, smashed nutmeg and salt. Now add red chili powder and saute
food.step 3: Add whisked curd and cook till it gets a boil. Add kewra and cook on low flame till chicken is half cooked and oil surfaces.
food.step 4: Turn off the heat and add milk. Remove the chicken using a tong and keep aside.Strain the curry(jhol). Skim off the oil from this jhol and keep it aside.
food.step 5: Add kewra, meetha attar(optional) to jhol along with javitri elichi powder and dissolved saffron
food.step6: In a separate vessel boil water and add salt, cardamom, cloves and green chilli.
food.step7: Add a dash of oil and give a good boil for 5mins. Now skim all the spices and add the rice.
food.step8: Cook rice till ½ done and in a separate handi add the chicken with jhol and add the ¾th cooked rice on top.
food.step9: On top of the rice add skimmed oil that was kept aside and dissolve saffron
food.step10: Cover with a tight fitting lid and seal with with dough from the sides.
food.restaurants: ["Lucknow Zaika Restaurant'","'It's Lucknowi'","'Chakh Le Lucknow'","'Lucknowee Tunday Kebab'","'Lucknowee Tunday Kebab"]
food.description: A perfect dum biryani, the Lucknowi Murgh Biryani Recipe is a classic recipe, influenced by the Mughlai cuisine. Serve it along with some raita and onions, for your house party

food.recipe: This peasant food comes from Roman sheep herders who had little time and money to spend on eating. They used their sheep's cheese and a bit of the water that cooked the pasta to create a cream, then added black pepper to give it some extra flavor
food.step 1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Cook bucatini in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes.
food.step 2: Place grated Pecorino Romano cheese into a large glass bowl and mix with a fork to make sure the cheese contains no lumps.
food.step 3: Once the bucatini are al dente, lift them out with a spaghetti fork or tongs and put them directly into the bowl with the cheese. Do not allow the water to drain too much.
food.step 4: Add one ladle of pasta water to the bowl. Stir the bucatini around until a cream has formed. Add more pasta water, little by little, until a thick cream has formed. Sprinkle freshly ground pepper over the pasta. Toss and serve immediately.
food.ingredient 3: 2 cups finely grated Pecorino Romano cheese
food.ingredient 4: 1 ½ tablespoons freshly ground black pepper, or more to taste

food.recipe: This Italian apple cake recipe is from my mom and reminds me of my childhood. It tastes delicious, and I bake it for my family now.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a pie plate and dust with bread crumbs
food.step 2: Combine melted butter, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla bean seeds in a bowl. Add eggs and stir to combine. Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl and add to butter mixture. Add milk if batter is too thick
food.step 3: Pour batter into the prepared pie plate. Distribute apple slices in a thick layer on top of the batter. Dot with cubed butter and sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar.
food.step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 45 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack. Let cool completely.
food.ingredients: 2 tablespoons unseasoned bread crumbs, or as needed
food.ingredient 10: 2 pounds Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and sliced thin

food.recipe: The secret to making a good seafood risotto is to use a high-quality fish stock and of course the freshest seafood you can find. Cook the shellfish and rice separately, as the rice needs more time. If you cook them together, the shellfish will overcook and get chewy.
food.step 1: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over a medium heat. Add garlic; cook and stir until starting to sizzle, about 2 minutes. Stir in scallops and cook for 1 minute. Add shrimp and season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook over high heat until shrimp are pink, 3 to 5 minutes.
food.step 2: Pour 1/2 cup white wine into the skillet and let the alcohol evaporate. Scrape the bottom of the skillet to deglaze; cook until the liquid is reduced, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat, add lemon juice, and sprinkle with 1/2 of the parsley. Discard garlic. Cover the skillet to keep shellfish warm.
food.step 3: Pour fish stock into a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer.
food.step 4: Melt butter in a skillet over low heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and shallot. Cook until shallot is soft and translucent, but not brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Increase heat and add rice; cook until rice has absorbed the oil and butter and has a nutty aroma, stirring often, 1 to 2 minutes. Make sure not to burn the shallot and reduce heat if skillet gets too hot.
food.step 5: Pour 1/2 cup white wine into the skillet and stir until alcohol has evaporated. Add 1 ladleful of fish stock, stir, and cook until rice has absorbed the stock. Add another ladleful and repeat the process until the rice is tender, 15 to 18 minutes in total.
food.step6: Add shellfish with their juices to the risotto pan 3 minutes before the end of cooking. Stir and finish cooking all together, adding stock if needed. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining parsley and 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil. Let risotto stand for 2 minutes before serving
food.ingredient 4: ½ pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
food.ingredient 5: salt and ground black pepper to taste
food.ingredient 10: 1 quart fish stock, or more as needed
food.description: Made with the readily available long-grain rice instead of Italian short-grain, this seafood risotto does not require constant stirring as does traditional risotto

food.recipe: This classic Roman pasta dish is quick and easy to make with few ingredients. Traditionally, guanciale is used, but I prefer pancetta.
food.step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
food.step 2: Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook onion until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add pancetta and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in passata, water, and sugar; cook until sauce has thickened, 10 to 15 minutes
food.step 3: Drain spaghetti and toss with sauce, remaining olive oil, Parmesan cheese, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper.
food.ingredient 2: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, or more if needed
food.ingredient 6: 1 tablespoon water, or more as needed
food.ingredient 9: 1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste
food.ingredient 10: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

food.recipe: This recipe makes the most tender and tasty meatballs. I also freeze these meatballs and take out how many servings I need for each meal. If cooking in sauce, add baked meatballs 20 minutes before serving time.
food.step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
food.step 2: Mix bread crumbs, Romano cheese, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder together. Combine with water and eggs. Add ground beef and mix well. Roll mixture into balls and place on a nonstick baking sheet.
food.step 3: Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 30 minutes.
food.restaurants: ["Moochie’s Meatballs & More"," Salt Lake City'","'Di Pasquale's Italian Marketplace"," Baltimore"]

food.recipe: So I feel like I am using my Instant Pot® at least 4 times a week. I have been having a great time experimenting and am amazed at the way the flavors are locked in and how quickly the meals are finished... not to say the super easy clean up. The main insert can go in the dishwasher and I hand-clean the top with very sudsy water.
food.step 1: Heat oil in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) on Saute mode. Add beef and onion; cook until beef is no longer pink on the outside, about 4 minutes. Add celery, green beans, carrot, garlic, oregano, dried basil, and pepper. Stir to combine.
food.step 2: Pour broth, diced tomatoes, and crushed tomatoes into the pot with the beef. Stir well. Select Soup setting; close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
food.step 3: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Stir in kidney beans and pasta. Turn on Slow Cook mode and cook until pasta and vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Season with salt. Ladle soup into bowls and top with Parmesan cheese and fresh basil.
food.ingredient 5: ⅓ pound green beans, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
food.ingredient 10: 1 pinch ground black pepper to taste
food.ingredient 11: 6 cups chicken bone broth (such as Kettle and Fire)
food.ingredient 14: 1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
food.ingredient 17: ⅓ cup finely grated Parmesan cheese
food.description: This satisfying soup from David Bull is an excellent source of fiber.

food.recipe: A wonderful tender pork dish with a delicate piccata sauce. Very simple and really delicious.
food.step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
food.step 2: Pound pork chops between 2 sheets waxed paper or plastic wrap until very thin, about 1/8 inch.
food.step 3: Mix flour, salt, and pepper together in a shallow bowl. Dredge both sides of each pork chop through flour mixture, shaking off any excess flour
food.step 4: Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat until butter starts to sizzle. Add shallots and pork chops in 1 layer, working in batches if needed. Cook pork chops until golden brown and almost cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer pork chops to a baking dish and lightly tent with aluminum foil, reserving the shallots and browned bits of food in the skillet.
food.step 5: Bake pork chops in the preheated oven until cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
food.step6: Pour wine and chicken stock into the skillet and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom with a wooden spoon. Reduce heat and simmer until sauce is reduced by half, 2 to 5 minutes. Stir lemon juice into sauce
food.step7: Drizzle sauce over pork chops and top with parsley, lemon zest, and capers.
food.ingredient 3: salt and ground black pepper to taste
food.description: Quickly sautéed pork chops in a lemony sauce flavoured with capers and parsley reward less than 30 minutes of prep and cooking with an elegant main dish. Just a small amount of grated Parmesan in the gremolata‑like topping goes a long way.

food.recipe: My version of chicken parmesan is a little different than what they do in the restaurants, with less sauce and a crispier crust.
food.step 1: My version of chicken parmesan is a little different than what they do in the restaurants, with less sauce and a crispier crust.
food.step 2: Place chicken breasts between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2-inch. Season chicken thoroughly with salt and pepper.
food.step 3: Beat eggs in a shallow bowl and set aside.
food.step 4: Mix bread crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a separate bowl, set aside.
food.step 5: Place flour in a sifter or strainer; sprinkle over chicken breasts, evenly coating both sides.
food.step6: Dip flour coated chicken breast in beaten eggs. Transfer breast to breadcrumb mixture, pressing the crumbs into both sides. Repeat for each breast. Set aside breaded chicken breasts for about 15 minutes.
food.step7: Heat 1 cup olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Cook chicken until golden, about 2 minutes on each side. The chicken will finish cooking in the oven
food.step8: Place chicken in a baking dish and top each breast with about 1/3 cup of tomato sauce. Layer each chicken breast with equal amounts of mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and provolone cheese. Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese on top and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
food.step9: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly, and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
food.ingredients: 4 eaches skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
food.ingredient 2: 4 eaches skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
food.ingredient 3: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
food.ingredient 5: 1 cup panko bread crumbs, or more as needed
food.ingredient 7: 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more if needed
food.ingredient 8: 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more if needed
food.ingredient 10: ¼ cup fresh mozzarella, cut into small cubes
food.description: Chicken parmigiana, or chicken parmesan, is a dish that consists of breaded chicken breast covered in tomato sauce and mozzarella, parmesan, or provolone cheese.

food.recipe: The traditional caprese salad with a delicious twist! Replacing pesto with balsamic makes this great dish even better.
food.step 1: Cut 2 juicy tomatoes in thick rounds and dress them with a little bit of extra virgin olive oil, some salt and pepper.
food.step 2: Break Mozzarella into chunks.
food.step 3: On a serving platter, arrange the tomato slices along with the mozzarella chunks.
food.step 4: Garnish with tulsi and pesto sauce.
food.step 5: Blend the basil with pine nuts, Parmesan cheese with extra virgin olive oil, until it forms a paste.
food.step6: Squeeze in the lemon juice.
food.step7: If the paste is too thick, add in more extra virgin olive oil to reach the desired consistency.
food.description: Juicy tomato and mozzarella cheese salad with pesto sauce. Topped with the freshness of basil

food.recipe: In large shallow skillet over moderately high heat, heat 3 inches of oil until thermometer registers 350°F.
food.step 1: Fit a medium heavy pot with thermometer; pour in oil to measure 4”. Heat over medium-high until thermometer registers 350°.
food.step 2: Fit a medium heavy pot with thermometer; pour in oil to measure 4”. Heat over medium-high until thermometer registers 350°.
food.step 3: Whisk in club soda just to blend (a few lumps are okay; just don’t overmix).
food.step 4: Dip one-fourth of mixed vegetables, citrus, seafood, and herbs into batter, letting excess drip back into bowl.
food.step 5: Fry, turning occasionally to cook evenly and gently, separating as needed, until golden and crisp, 1–3 minutes.
food.step6: Using a spider or slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel–lined wire rack; season with salt
food.step7: Repeat 3 more times with remaining ingredients, returning oil to 350° between batches. Serve with lemon wedges.
food.ingredient 5: ½ teaspoon kosher salt, plus more
food.ingredient 7: ¼ small squash (such as kabocha), scrubbed, very thinly sliced
food.ingredient 8: ½ small fennel bulb, very thinly sliced lengthwise
food.ingredient 9: 1 leek, white and pale-green parts only, halved lengthwise, layers separated
food.ingredient 10: 2 ounces maitake or shiitake mushrooms, trimmed, torn into bite-size pieces
food.ingredient 11: 1 lemon, very thinly sliced into rounds, seeds removed, plus wedges for serving
food.ingredient 12: 4 ounces large shrimp, peeled, deveined, halved lengthwise
food.ingredient 13: 4 ounces squid or baby octopus tentacles
food.ingredient 14: ½ cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves with tender stems
food.description: small morsels of meat, seafood, or vegetables coated with batter and deep fried

food.recipe: This is my family's version of lion's head soup and for me it is the best type of comfort food! It is best served with white sticky rice, and wonderful enjoyed on a cold winter day.
food.step 1: Mix the ground pork, egg, cornstarch, 2 teaspoons of sesame oil, ginger, monosodium glutamate, salt, and half of the chopped green onions together in a bowl. Use your hands to mix until the ingredients are evenly distributed. Set aside.
food.step 2: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. When the oil is hot, fry the napa cabbage, stirring constantly, until cabbage begins to wilt, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in the chicken broth, water, and soy sauce. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to medium.
food.step 3: Use a spoon to form the meat mixture into 1 inch balls. Drop them into the boiling soup. When the last ball has been added, cover with a lid and simmer for 10 minutes. Taste, and adjust salt before serving. Garnish with remaining green onions and a drizzle of sesame oil.
food.ingredient 8: 2 medium (4-1/8" long)s green onions, chopped and divided
food.ingredient 9: 2 medium (4-1/8" long)s green onions, chopped and divided
food.ingredient 10: 2 medium (4-1/8" long)s green onions, chopped and divided
food.ingredient 11: 1 head napa cabbage, cored and cut into chunks
food.description: This is my family's version of lion's head soup and for me it is the best type of comfort food! It is best served with white sticky rice, and wonderful enjoyed on a cold winter day.

food.recipe: A delicious brunch snack that can be found in many Chinese breakfast shops. Its various names include 'cong you bing,' 'jiu cai bing,', 'scallion pancakes,' 'green onion pancakes,' etc. This particular recipe is passed down through my mother's family, and brings back many good, yummy memories! Can serve with hot-sour sauce, or your favorite Chinese sauce
food.step 1: A delicious brunch snack that can be found in many Chinese breakfast shops. Its various names include 'cong you bing,' 'jiu cai bing,', 'scallion pancakes,' 'green onion pancakes,' etc. This particular recipe is passed down through my mother's family, and brings back many good, yummy memories! Can serve with hot-sour sauce, or your favorite Chinese sauce
food.step 2: In a bowl, mix 1/4 cup of flour with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to make a mixture like fine crumbs.
food.step 3: On a floured work surface, roll a piece of dough out into a thin square about 5x7 inches in size, brush the dough with toasted sesame oil, and sprinkle lightly with about 1 1/2 teaspoon of the flour-oil mixture. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of chopped green onion onto the dough, and spread the onion out evenly. Starting with a long end, roll the dough up into a rope shape, and pinch the seam and the ends closed. Roll the rope shape into a flat spiral, and press lightly with your hands to compact the spiral and keep it from unrolling.
food.step 4: On a floured work surface, roll a piece of dough out into a thin square about 5x7 inches in size, brush the dough with toasted sesame oil, and sprinkle lightly with about 1 1/2 teaspoon of the flour-oil mixture. Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of chopped green onion onto the dough, and spread the onion out evenly. Starting with a long end, roll the dough up into a rope shape, and pinch the seam and the ends closed. Roll the rope shape into a flat spiral, and press lightly with your hands to compact the spiral and keep it from unrolling.
food.step 5: Place the spiral down onto the floured work surface, and gently roll it out into a pancake with the onions folded inside, turning the pancake over often as you roll it out. Roll gently and turn often to avoid making holes in the pancakes. Finished pancakes should be about 5 inches in diameter. Repeat with the rest of the dough pieces, making 8 onion pancakes.
food.ingredient 7: 1 tablespoon Asian (toasted) sesame oil, or as needed
food.ingredient 8: ½ cup finely chopped green onion
food.ingredient 9: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed
food.restaurants: ["Xiao Bao Biscuit","Jing Hua Xiao Chi","Kung Fu Little Steamed Buns Ramen"]
food.description: This particular recipe is passed down through my mother's family, and brings back many good, yummy memories! Can serve with hot-sour sauce, or your favorite Chinese sauce.

food.recipe: These tasty treats make a perfect appetizer or you can serve them as a main dish. For a main dish count on about 15 dumplings per person. Serve with hoisin sauce, hot Chinese-style mustard and toasted sesame seeds
food.step 1: In a large bowl, combine the pork, ginger, garlic, green onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg and cabbage. Stir until well mixed.
food.step 2: Place 1 heaping teaspoon of pork filling onto each wonton skin. Moisten edges with water and fold edges over to form a triangle shape. Roll edges slightly to seal in filling. Set dumplings aside on a lightly floured surface until ready to cook
food.step 3: To Cook: Steam dumplings in a covered bamboo or metal steamer for about 15 to 20 minutes. Serve immediately.
food.description: For a main dish count on about 15 dumplings per person. Serve with hoisin sauce, hot Chinese-style mustard and toasted sesame seeds.

food.recipe: After searching the internet for a good Chinese Spareribs recipe and not finding any that caught my eye, I decided to make my own. This recipe is pretty simple, and yields tender, juicy, tangy ribs. In Japan, I cooked this in the fish broiler, but it should be fine on the grill or in the oven
food.step 1: In a shallow glass dish, mix together the hoisin sauce, ketchup, honey, soy sauce, sake, rice vinegar, lemon juice, ginger, garlic and five-spice powder. Place the ribs in the dish, and turn to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours, or as long as overnight.
food.step 2: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Fill a broiler tray with enough water to cover the bottom. Place the grate or rack over the tray. Arrange the ribs on the grate.
food.step 3: Place the broiler rack in the center of the oven. Cook for 40 minutes, turning and brushing with the marinade every 10 minutes. Let the marinade cook on for the final 10 minutes to make a glaze. Finish under the broiler if desired. Discard any remaining marinade.
food.description: This recipe is pretty simple, and yields tender, juicy, tangy ribs. In Japan, I cooked this in the fish broiler, but it should be fine on the grill or in the oven.

food.recipe: Instead of ordering out Chinese food, do it yourself. Great with white rice or sticky rice (jasmine rice). Family recipe! Substitute beef with 1/2-inch pieces chicken breast prepared the same as the beef above or 2 cups cooked shrimp prepared as above.
food.step 1: Place steak in a bowl; top with minced onion, garlic, and 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Stir to coat.
food.step 2: Bring rice and 4 cups water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
food.step 3: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bamboo shoots, mushrooms, 1/4 cup green onion, green bell pepper, red pepper flakes, and 3 tablespoons soy sauce in the hot oil until green bell pepper is slightly tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add steak, broccoli, and sugar snap peas; cook until beef is browned and no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes.
food.step 4: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bamboo shoots, mushrooms, 1/4 cup green onion, green bell pepper, red pepper flakes, and 3 tablespoons soy sauce in the hot oil until green bell pepper is slightly tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add steak, broccoli, and sugar snap peas; cook until beef is browned and no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes.
food.ingredients: 2 steaks 1 1/2-inch-thick New York strip steaks, cut into 1-inch pieces
food.ingredient 8: ½ cup canned sliced bamboo shoots, drained
food.ingredient 9: ½ cup canned sliced mushrooms, drained
food.ingredient 10: ½ cup canned sliced mushrooms, drained
food.ingredient 11: ½ green bell pepper, thinly sliced
food.description: Family recipe! Substitute beef with 1/2-inch pieces chicken breast prepared the same as the beef above or 2 cups cooked shrimp

food.recipe: This recipe is similar to a famous food chain! Serve over thick noodles.
food.step 1: Heat half of the vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Stir in the chicken and shrimp, and cook until the chicken has turned white on the outside and is still a bit pink in the center; about 5 minutes. Remove the chicken and wipe the wok clean
food.step 2: Heat the remaining vegetable oil over high heat. Stir in the garlic, and cook for a few seconds until the garlic begins to turn brown. Stir in the dried chiles and Szechwan peppercorns; cook and stir a few seconds until the peppers begin to darken. Add the red and green bell peppers, dark soy sauce, 2 tablespoons of rice wine, and 2 tablespoons of sugar. Bring to a boil, stir in the chicken, and cook until the peppers are nearly tender, and the chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes more. Stir in the peanuts and green onion until the green onion becomes limp. Stir in a few drops of sesame oil to serve.
food.ingredients: 4 breast half, bone and skin removed (blank)s skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes
food.ingredient 2: 20 eaches peeled and deveined large shrimp (21 to 30 per pound)
food.ingredient 9: 16 peppers dried red chile peppers, cut in half
food.ingredient 10: 16 peppers dried red chile peppers, cut in half
food.restaurants: ["Tang Shi Fu Tu Jia Shi Fu"]
food.description: This recipe is similar to a famous food chain! Serve over thick noodles.

food.recipe: Tsa bi whun literally translates to 'fried rice noodles'. You'll most likely find all the ingredients at your local supermarket except for the five spice powder, dried Chinese black mushrooms and rice vermicelli which can be found at your local Asian food mart. All the measurements here are pretty much to taste, some people like more pork, some less, some more soy sauce, some less, etc.
food.step 1: Place the pork into a mixing bowl and pour in the soy sauce and rice wine. Sprinkle with the white pepper, five-spice powder, and cornstarch. Mix well, then set aside to marinate. Soak the mushrooms in a bowl of cold water for 20 minutes, then pour off the water, cut off and discard the stems of the mushrooms. Slice the mushrooms thinly and reserve. Soak the rice vermicelli in a separate bowl of cold water for 10 minutes, then pour off the water and set the noodles aside.
food.step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Pour in the eggs, and cook until firm, flipping once, to make a pancake. Remove the egg pancake, and allow to cool, then thinly slice and place into a large bowl. Heat 2 more tablespoons of the vegetable oil in the wok over high heat. Stir in the garlic and dried shrimp, and cook until the shrimp become aromatic, about 20 seconds. Next, add the pork along with the marinade, and cook until the pork is no longer pink, about 4 minutes. Stir in the carrots and onion, and cook until the carrots begin to soften, about 3 minutes. Finally, add the bean sprouts, napa cabbage, and sliced mushrooms; cook and stir until the vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes more. Scrape the pork mixture into the bowl along with the eggs, then wipe out the wok and return it to the stove over medium-high heat.
food.step 3: Heat the remaining vegetable oil in the wok, then stir in the drained rice vermicelli noodles. Cook and stir for a few minutes until the noodles soften, then stir in the reserved pork mixture. Scrape the mixture in to a serving bowl and garnish with cilantro to serve
food.ingredients: ½ pound thinly sliced pork loin
food.ingredient 2: ½ pound thinly sliced pork loin
food.ingredient 13: 3 carrot, (7-1/2")s carrots, cut into matchstick strips
food.restaurants: ["Tsao's Cuisine Chinese Restaurant","Mi asian street food"]
food.description: Tsa bi whun literally translates to 'fried rice noodles'. You'll most likely find all the ingredients at your local supermarket except for the five spice powder, dried Chinese black mushrooms and rice vermicelli which can be found at your local Asian food mart.

food.recipe: Rinse the lobster, and hold it belly up. At the bottom of the tail, there is a small opening, stick a long skewer in it to drain any urine left in its' body, then crack the tail off, chop the tail into small pieces, and crack the claws in half as well. If you know how to eat the body of the lobster, cut it up and throw it on the pile too.
food.step 1: Heat half of the peanut oil in a deep heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic, and fry for about 1 minute. Throw in the lobster pieces, and fry until they are cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the lobster and garlic mixture to a dish and keep warm.
